original: de bzhin du 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: So it will be explained below.

original: gang yang chos thams cad dben pa dang / rtags gang dang yang lhan cig tu gang du yang 'brel bar ma grub ste /
analyzed: gang yang chos thams cad dben pa dang / rtags gang dang yang lhan cig tu gang du yang 'brel bar ma grub ste /
translated: Also, it is not reasonable to say that because all phenomena are void and the sign is not established as being related to anything,

original: de ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is extremely hidden.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid kyang grub la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid kyang grub la /
translated: The subject itself that is to be proven is established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang rtags kyang lhan cig tu 'brel nas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i dngos po 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang rtags kyang lhan cig tu 'brel nas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i dngos po 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The sign and the predicate of the probandum are related to each other, but the entity of the probandum and the proof do not engage.

original: de la rtsod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtsod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is impossible to dispute that.

original: 'on kyang spyir chos can 'ga' kho na la de grub la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gzhan la the tshom za na de med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags bstan pas chos can la spyir yang dag par grub pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rab tu grub par byed
analyzed: 'on kyang spyir chos can 'ga' kho na la de grub la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gzhan la the tshom za na de med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags bstan pas chos can la spyir yang dag par grub pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rab tu grub par byed
translated: However, if in general, with respect to a certain subject, that is established, one doubts another predicate of the probandum, then by teaching a sign that is a nonobservation of a related object, the predicate of the probandum that is generally well established with respect to the subject is proven.

original: do zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: do zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù indicates the reason.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i spyir chos can 'ga' kho na la de grub pas don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i chos la khyab par byed pa rab tu grub pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i spyir chos can 'ga' kho na la de grub pas don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i chos la khyab par byed pa rab tu grub pa kho na yin la /
translated: In the same way, here, in general, with respect to any subject, such as an illusion, a mirage, a dream, a city of gandharvas, and so on, it is established that ultimately they lack intrinsic reality, and thus the pervasion of phenomena such as being one or many is fully established.

original: de yang kho bo cag gzhan du gzugs la sogs pa rtsod pa'i gzhir 'gyur ba dag la des khyab pa'i chos nye bar bstan pas rab tu sgrub par byed pas nyes pa med pa nyid do //üîΩgang yang re zhig 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rab tu bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang kho bo cag gzhan du gzugs la sogs pa rtsod pa'i gzhir 'gyur ba dag la des khyab pa'i chos nye bar bstan pas rab tu sgrub par byed pas nyes pa med pa nyid do // gang yang re zhig 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rab tu bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, we establish this by teaching a property that pervades that subject, such as form, which is the basis of the debate, and thus there is no fault.

original: de gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúThe effect and nature reason cannot establish that all phenomena lack intrinsic existence because those two establish things.‚ÄùüîΩThat is illogical.

original: 'di gnyis don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgrub pa nyid du ni gang du yang rab tu ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgrub pa nyid du ni gang du yang rab tu ma grub pa'o //
translated: These two are not established anywhere as establishing the nature of an ultimately real entity.

original: 'on te 'di dag sgrub pa'i ngo bor zhugs pa'i phyir dngos po sgrub pa nyid rjod na ni de'i tshe ngo bo nyid med pa yang gang gi tshe sbyor ba dgod pa'i bye brag 'gas sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe
analyzed: 'on te 'di dag sgrub pa'i ngo bor zhugs pa'i phyir dngos po sgrub pa nyid rjod na ni de'i tshe ngo bo nyid med pa yang gang gi tshe sbyor ba dgod pa'i bye brag 'gas sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe
translated: But if you say that they are described as establishing entities because they are engaged in the nature of establishment, then at that time, when nonentityness is established by a particular formulation of a proof,

original: de gnyis ci ste mi srid rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la sogs par sbyor ba dgod pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang por spros so //
analyzed: de gnyis ci ste mi srid rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la sogs par sbyor ba dgod pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang por spros so //
translated: why is it not possible that those two are also established by the nature of establishment? A reason of nature alone is elaborated into many types by the particular formulations of a proof, such as a reason of effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis mdor na phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni gtan tshigs zhes spyir gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis mdor na phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni gtan tshigs zhes spyir gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: Therefore, in brief, the wise explain the definition of a reason in general as: the property of the subject that is pervaded by that.

original: de'i phyir 'dir yang sbyor ba dgod pa'i bye brag @176b gi sgo nas rang bzhin la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ci rigs pa yin pas 'gal ba med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir yang sbyor ba dgod pa'i bye brag @176b gi sgo nas rang bzhin la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ci rigs pa yin pas 'gal ba med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, here too, since the reasonings of nature and so on are appropriate in terms of the specific presentation of the syllogism, there is no contradiction.

original: de bzhin du 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be shown below.

original: de la don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de la don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: In this regard, although ultimately all phenomena are nonarisen and essenceless,

original: 'on kyang de dag la tha snyad kyi bden pa la brten pa 'di gnyi ga yang yod pa kho na yin pas ji ltar gcig tu de gnyis mi srid pa yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag la tha snyad kyi bden pa la brten pa 'di gnyi ga yang yod pa kho na yin pas ji ltar gcig tu de gnyis mi srid pa yin /
translated: nevertheless, since both of these exist in terms of conventional truth, how could it be impossible for them to exist in one way or the other?

original: yang dag pa'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kho nar 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la ni rgyu ci yang med de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kho nar 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la ni rgyu ci yang med de /
translated: There is no reason at all for saying that the reasonings of nature and effect must be correct.

original: 'di ltar gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu brdzun pa yang rang gi rgyu rjes su dpag par bya ba la gtan tshigs su  dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu brdzun pa yang rang gi rgyu rjes su dpag par bya ba la gtan tshigs su  dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: This is because even a false effect called a reflection is observed as a reason for inferring its cause.

original: me long la sogs pa'i ngos su gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba gzugs gzhan nyid gcig 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me long la sogs pa'i ngos su gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba gzugs gzhan nyid gcig 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that a reflection is a different form that arises in a mirror, etc.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams yul gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams yul gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that things that have resistance have the same object.

original: gzugs de nyid de ltar dmigs so zhes bya bar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs de nyid de ltar dmigs so zhes bya bar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that the form itself is perceived in that way,

original: de ni de lta bu'i yul dang dbyibs la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de lta bu'i yul dang dbyibs la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that form is devoid of the nature that is related to such an object, shape, etc.

original: 'di ltar gzugs brnyan rnams ni me long la sogs pa'i rten la yod pa'i yul dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i bye brag gi rjes su byed par dmigs na gzugs dag ni de ltar gnas pa'i ngo bor yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs brnyan rnams ni me long la sogs pa'i rten la yod pa'i yul dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i bye brag gi rjes su byed par dmigs na gzugs dag ni de ltar gnas pa'i ngo bor yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, reflections are perceived as conforming to the particulars of the object, shape, etc., that exist in the support, such as a mirror, etc., but forms do not exist in that way.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa ni gzhan 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa ni gzhan 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that one form should have the aspect of another.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This would lead to absurd consequences.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par snang ba'i phyir de rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du dngos por yod do zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par snang ba'i phyir de rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du dngos por yod do zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to say that consciousness itself exists as a thing that is the entity of consciousness because it appears in the aspect of a reflection.

original: 'di ltar shes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa lus can gyi bye brag tu ma gyur pa cha shas med pa nyid kyi yul na mi gnas shing sna tshogs kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'o zhes brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa lus can gyi bye brag tu ma gyur pa cha shas med pa nyid kyi yul na mi gnas shing sna tshogs kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'o zhes brjod la /
translated: Thus consciousness is said to be devoid of the attributes of physical things such as blue and so on, it is partless and it does not abide in the object and it is devoid of manifold aspects.

original: gzugs brnyan ni de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir de de'i ngo bo nyid du bden par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir de de'i ngo bo nyid du bden par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: But since a reflection appears as an entity that is incompatible with those attributes, how could it be seen as real and having that nature?

original: ji ltar khyed kyi sum cu pa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyi sum cu pa la sogs pa las /
translated: In your Thirty Verses and so on,

original: gang zag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i phyir gang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ni brdzun pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i phyir gang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ni brdzun pa kho na ste /
translated: you prove that the person and so on do not exist intrinsically by saying that whatever is an imputed entity is only false,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: bdag la sogs pa yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo @177a * //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo @177a * //
translated: and the self, etc. are also imagined natures.

original: yin no zhes sbyor ba dgod pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs smos pa de bzhin du gzhan yang gzhan dag gis brtags pa'i chos mi dmigs so zhes ci ste brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: yin no zhes sbyor ba dgod pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs smos pa de bzhin du gzhan yang gzhan dag gis brtags pa'i chos mi dmigs so zhes ci ste brjod par mi bya /
translated: Just as the reason of essence is stated by way of positing a syllogism, why not state ‚ÄúThe non-observation of the other is not observed‚Äù?

original: ji ltar slob dpon dag gis brjod pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub par khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos ci ste mi brjod de /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dag gis brjod pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub par khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos ci ste mi brjod de /
translated: Just as the masters state it, why not state the non-observation of the object characterized, which is the characteristic of the non-observation of the pervader, as the proof that all phenomena are natureless?

original: de bzhin du 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be shown below.

original: gang yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa mi srid do zhes smras pa de la gong du lan btab pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa mi srid do zhes smras pa de la gong du lan btab pa nyid de /
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúThe non-observation of essence is impossible‚Äù was already answered above.

original: tshul 'di ni gcig gis gcig stong pa nyid yin na 'di yang bsgrub par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni gcig gis gcig stong pa nyid yin na 'di yang bsgrub par mi 'dod do //
translated: This mode is the emptiness of one thing by another, and this is not asserted to be the proof.

original: 'o na ci zhe na mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: What is it? It is the emptiness of the object characterized.

original: gang yang 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa mi srid pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang 'brel pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa mi srid pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang 'brel pa med pa nyid de /
translated: And it is also completely impossible to perceive any contradiction, etc.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad dben pa dang 'ga' yang lhan cig 'gal ba la sogs par ma grub mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad dben pa dang 'ga' yang lhan cig 'gal ba la sogs par ma grub mod kyi /
translated: In this way, although the emptiness of all things is established, and it is not established that anything is contradictory with emptiness, etc.

original: 'on kyang sgyu ma dang nam mkha'i padmo la sogs pa dag la spyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang lhan cig 'gal ba la sogs pa rab tu grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgyu ma dang nam mkha'i padmo la sogs pa dag la spyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang lhan cig 'gal ba la sogs pa rab tu grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Nevertheless, it is certainly established in general that illusions, sky flowers, etc. are essenceless and contradictory with emptiness, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na khyed gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khyed gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could you establish that God, etc., imagined by others, are essenceless?

original: de'i phyir spyir ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyis tha snyad du 'gal ba la sogs pa yang dag par grub na phyis chos thams cad la don dam par bsam par 'gal ba la sogs pa'i chos nye bar bstan pas yang dag pa pa'i ngo bo nyid med
analyzed: de'i phyir spyir ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyis tha snyad du 'gal ba la sogs pa yang dag par grub na phyis chos thams cad la don dam par bsam par 'gal ba la sogs pa'i chos nye bar bstan pas yang dag pa pa'i ngo bo nyid med
translated: Therefore, in general, if conventional phenomena such as contradiction are established as real by the mere absence of intrinsic reality, then later, when the absence of intrinsic reality in the ultimate sense is taught, the phenomena of contradiction and so on are established as real.

original: par bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: par bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: So what contradiction is there in establishing the absence of real intrinsic reality?

original: de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa kho na dngos po nyid du thal bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa kho na dngos po nyid du thal bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to conclude that contradiction and so on are real things.

original: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos kyis yang dag pa'i dngos po gsal ba'i ngo bo dag ni gang du yang yang dag pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos kyis yang dag pa'i dngos po gsal ba'i ngo bo dag ni gang du yang yang dag pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because phenomena that are ultimately unreal do not exist anywhere as real things with a nature of their own.

original: 'on te gnas na ni 'di dag gi de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa nyid rab tu mi 'grub po ;
analyzed: 'on te gnas na ni 'di dag gi de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa nyid rab tu mi 'grub po ;
translated: But if they did exist, then their contradiction and so on would not be established.

original: / de'i phyir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang lhan cig 'gal ba la sogs pa yang dag par grub na de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa kho na dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: / de'i phyir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang lhan cig 'gal ba la sogs pa yang dag par grub na de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa kho na dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if the non-intrinsic reality of all things is established along with the contradiction, etc., then it is not to be said that the contradiction, etc., alone are the reality.

original: 'gal ba la sogs pa tha snyad kho nar grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gal ba la sogs pa tha snyad kho nar grub pa yin gyi /
translated: The contradiction, etc., are established only conventionally,

original: yang dag par ni ma yin @177b no ;
analyzed: yang dag par ni ma yin @177b no ;
translated: not ultimately.

original: /'di ltar skye bo dag mar me la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po brtan pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su gcod pa na brtan pa'i rnam pas dben pa nyid du yongs su gcod par byed de /
analyzed: /'di ltar skye bo dag mar me la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po brtan pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su gcod pa na brtan pa'i rnam pas dben pa nyid du yongs su gcod par byed de /
translated: Thus, when people determine the thing whose characteristic is a lamp, etc., as having an unstable intrinsic reality, they determine it as being devoid of the mode of stability.

original: de rnam par ma bcad na de yongs su gcod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par ma bcad na de yongs su gcod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if that is not excluded, it is not tenable to determine it.

original: gang la gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par gcad pa med na med pa de dag ni de la phan tshun yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang la gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par gcad pa med na med pa de dag ni de la phan tshun yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Those which cannot exist without the mutual exclusion of one another are established as mutually exclusive by the characteristic of their complete rejection of one another.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang / rim dang rim ma yin pa la sogs pa 'gal ba dag la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang / rim dang rim ma yin pa la sogs pa 'gal ba dag la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same method should be seen in the case of existence and non-existence, sequence and non-sequence, etc.

original: grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin pa las me la sogs pa'i dngos po nye ba na yang med par mthong ba'i phyir de gnyis ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin pa las me la sogs pa'i dngos po nye ba na yang med par mthong ba'i phyir de gnyis ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since the absence of cold touch, etc. is seen even when the cause is not deficient, but when the thing, such as fire, is near, these two are established as mutually exclusive by the characteristic of their non-coexistence.

original: 'gal ba de kho na rab tu grub kyang mar me la sogs pa gcig tu dngos po nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'gal ba de kho na rab tu grub kyang mar me la sogs pa gcig tu dngos po nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: Even though that very contradiction is well established, it is not tenable that a lamp, etc. is a real entity in the singular.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa brdzun pa yang skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa brdzun pa yang skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the false, such as an illusion, is seen to have the attributes of arising, ceasing, etc.

original: slob dpon rnams kyis ni don dam pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin du mar me la sogs pa dag la yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa chos rnams kyi 'gal ba ji ltar snang ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: slob dpon rnams kyis ni don dam pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin du mar me la sogs pa dag la yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa chos rnams kyi 'gal ba ji ltar snang ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The masters, in order to introduce [students] to the ultimate, have posited the contradictions of things, such as permanence and impermanence, in relation to such things as a flame, just as they appear.

original: mar me la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo'am shes pa'i ngo bo yang dag par ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo'am shes pa'i ngo bo yang dag par ni ma grub ste /
translated: The nature of external objects such as a flame, or the nature of consciousness, is not established in reality.

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang de dag nyid kyis bsal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gis na 'di dag yang dag pa pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang lhan cig 'gal ba mngon sum du rtogs par 'gyur ba don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ni cung zad kyang pha rol ma yin pa mthong ba rnams kyis mthong ba'i
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang de dag nyid kyis bsal ba'i phyir ro // gang gis na 'di dag yang dag pa pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang lhan cig 'gal ba mngon sum du rtogs par 'gyur ba don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ni cung zad kyang pha rol ma yin pa mthong ba rnams kyis mthong ba'i
translated: The nature of both is excluded by those [two].

original: lam du mi 'jug go //
analyzed: lam du mi 'jug go //
translated: Those who see that the nature of ultimate things is not established in reality do not enter the path.

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba gang yin pa de yang kun rdzob pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba gang yin pa de yang kun rdzob pa kho na yin te /
translated: That which is contradictory in the sense of not coexistent is also only conventional.

original: dngos po rnams ni bdag nyid kho nas 'jig gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //üîΩ'jig pa don gzhan zhig byed na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni bdag nyid kho nas 'jig gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no // 'jig pa don gzhan zhig byed na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Things are destroyed by themselves alone, not by another.üîΩIf destruction were to be produced by another, then the causes of destruction would not do anything at all.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin na yang de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams kyis mi byed de /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin na yang de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams kyis mi byed de /
translated: If it were not to be different, then its causes of destruction would not produce it,

original: de ni dngos po'i rgyu kho na las byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te 'jig pa ni dngos @178a * //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i rgyu kho na las byung ba'i phyir ro // 'on te 'jig pa ni dngos @178a * //
translated: because it would have arisen from the causes of the thing itself.

original: por gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par brtags pa rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: por gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par brtags pa rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that it is not logical to investigate whether or not destruction is the same as or different from the thing itself,

original: de'i tshe 'di shin tu yang 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams kyis mi byed de ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di shin tu yang 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams kyis mi byed de ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because destruction is not a thing, then at that time it is not produced by the causes of destruction, because it would be essenceless.

original: de'i phyir cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i me la sogs pa ji ltar yang dag par na 'gal ba yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i me la sogs pa ji ltar yang dag par na 'gal ba yin par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could fire, etc. that do not perform even the slightest function be contradictory in reality?

original: 'on kyang me 'di ni grang ba la sogs pa gong nas gong du nus pa med pa'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma rab dang mchog skyed par byed pa kho na la me la sogs pa 'gal ba zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang me 'di ni grang ba la sogs pa gong nas gong du nus pa med pa'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma rab dang mchog skyed par byed pa kho na la me la sogs pa 'gal ba zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: However, it is merely said that fire, etc. are contradictory in the sense that fire generates a series of instants that are progressively more powerful, such as heat, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon dag gis 'gal ba'i tshul zhes bshad kyis 'gal ba nyid ces ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon dag gis 'gal ba'i tshul zhes bshad kyis 'gal ba nyid ces ni ma yin no //
translated: For that reason, the masters explain this as the mode of contradiction, but not as contradiction itself.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba 'di yang tha snyad pa'i dngos po kho na la brten nas brjod kyi /üîΩyang dag pa pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba 'di yang tha snyad pa'i dngos po kho na la brten nas brjod kyi / yang dag pa pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this contradiction is expressed in dependence on only conventional things.

original: me dang grang ba la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo yang dag pa ma grub pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: me dang grang ba la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo yang dag pa ma grub pa'i phyir la /
translated: It is not ultimate because the nature of external objects such as fire and cold is not established as real,

original: shes pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo yang brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo yang brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the nature of the aspects of consciousness is also imputed.

original: shes pa gcig la grang ba dang tsha bar snang ba dag srid pa'i phyir yang ji ltar 'gal te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig la grang ba dang tsha bar snang ba dag srid pa'i phyir yang ji ltar 'gal te /
translated: How can there be a contradiction, since it is possible for both cold and heat to appear to a single consciousness?

original: de gnyis ni cig car so sor myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni cig car so sor myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two are experienced separately and simultaneously.

original: rnam par shes pa rigs mthun pa du ma ni cig car mi skye ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rigs mthun pa du ma ni cig car mi skye ba'i phyir ro//
translated: Because many consciousnesses of the same type do not arise simultaneously.

original: de lta bas na grang ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa kho na dag cig snang bas de'i phyir 'di dag la yang dag par na 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na grang ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa kho na dag cig snang bas de'i phyir 'di dag la yang dag par na 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, cold and so on are false things that appear like dreams and so on. Therefore, there is no contradiction in them.

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang shing dang shing sha pa la sogs pa'i dngos po tha snyad pa kho na la brten nas kun brtags pa'i spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pas rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang shing dang shing sha pa la sogs pa'i dngos po tha snyad pa kho na la brten nas kun brtags pa'i spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pas rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: The relationship of the pervader and the pervaded is also established in dependence on the conventional things such as tree and shimshapa, and so on, because the things that are universals and particulars are imputed.

original: dngos su ni gang khyab par byed par 'gyur ba shing nyid la sogs pa spyi dang zhes bya ba ni yang dag par cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: dngos su ni gang khyab par byed par 'gyur ba shing nyid la sogs pa spyi dang zhes bya ba ni yang dag par cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In reality, there is not even the slightest so-called universal, such as tree-ness, that pervades all instances.

original: khyad par gda' ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo yang ma yin la /
analyzed: khyad par gda' ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo yang ma yin la /
translated: The particular instances of trees, such as oak trees, are not the nature of external objects.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa par yang ma grub mod kyi /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa par yang ma grub mod kyi /
translated: They are not established as the nature of the features of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang mkhas pa de kho na nyid kyi don btang snyoms su gzhag pa rnams kyis glang po che'i lta stangs lta bur byas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mkhas pa de kho na nyid kyi don btang snyoms su gzhag pa rnams kyis glang po che'i lta stangs lta bur byas te /
translated: Nevertheless, those who are wise and who rest in equanimity in the meaning of suchness do so with a gaze like that of an elephant.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa na seng ldeng la sogs pa'i @178b khyad par brdzun pa rnam pa sna tshogs nyams su myong ba lta bu'i shing la sogs pa'i dngos po'i brdzun pa kho na la kun du brten nas de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i ched
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa na seng ldeng la sogs pa'i @178b khyad par brdzun pa rnam pa sna tshogs nyams su myong ba lta bu'i shing la sogs pa'i dngos po'i brdzun pa kho na la kun du brten nas de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i ched
translated: In dreams and so on, one experiences various false aspects of trees and so on. In dependence on the falsity of things such as trees, one should enter into suchness.

original: du don dam pa la 'jug pa dang mthun pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: du don dam pa la 'jug pa dang mthun pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: and the pervaded and the pervader are posited only in terms of the conventional.

original: de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa kun rdzob pa kho na la brten nas tha snyad 'dogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa kun rdzob pa kho na la brten nas tha snyad 'dogs par byed kyi /
translated: Similarly, the relation of cause and effect is designated in dependence on the conventional, such as the seed and sprout,

original: yang dag pa pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in reality.

original: sa bon la sogs pa yang dag pa pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rmi lam la sogs pa na de lta bu brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa yang dag pa pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rmi lam la sogs pa na de lta bu brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a real seed and so on are not established and because such an unreal one is seen in dreams and so on.

original: sad pa na yang sgyu ma la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa bden par gyur pa ma yin pa yang dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sad pa na yang sgyu ma la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa bden par gyur pa ma yin pa yang dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when awake, one observes a magic show and so on, which is a cause and effect, but is not real.

original: de bas na tha snyad kyi sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du khyab mod kyi /
analyzed: de bas na tha snyad kyi sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du khyab mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, although things are pervaded by having an essence in terms of the conventional, cause and effect and so on,

original: 'on kyang de las de dag don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de las de dag don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: But they are not established as having an ultimate nature.

original: khyab par byed pa yod pa las khyab par bya ba nges par rab tu grub pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'on kyang dngos po dag la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid la yang dag par khyab par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pa 'di log na sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par kun brtags
analyzed: khyab par byed pa yod pa las khyab par bya ba nges par rab tu grub pa ni ma yin no // 'on kyang dngos po dag la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid la yang dag par khyab par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pa 'di log na sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par kun brtags
translated: It is not the case that the pervaded is ascertained and established from the existence of the pervader.

original: pa ldog par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: pa ldog par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: However, when the real nature of things is refuted, which is the real nature of things that pervades things, such as the nature of cause and effect, then like illusions and so on, the real nature of things that is imagined in them is refuted.

original: de bas na 'gal ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di thams cad de kho na nyid la 'jug par nus pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir dang / mu stegs can gyis kun brtags pa'i tshad ma la sogs pa de kho na nyid kyi rjes su mi mthun pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir de spangs nas yang dag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos mdzad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'gal ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di thams cad de kho na nyid la 'jug par nus pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir dang / mu stegs can gyis kun brtags pa'i tshad ma la sogs pa de kho na nyid kyi rjes su mi mthun pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir de spangs nas yang dag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, since all of these presentations of contradiction and so on are capable of engaging reality, the wise composed treatises on the characteristics of valid knowledge in order to teach reality and to express the non-conformity of the so-called valid knowledge imagined by the tƒ´rthikas with reality.

original: 'di ltar mu stegs can kha cig ni ril gyis bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po de kho na nyid brdzun pa bsgrub par 'dod cing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba la sogs pa kun rdzob pa rnam par gzhag pa sel bar 'dod pas tshad ma'i mtshan nyid phyin ci log kho na byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mu stegs can kha cig ni ril gyis bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po de kho na nyid brdzun pa bsgrub par 'dod cing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba la sogs pa kun rdzob pa rnam par gzhag pa sel bar 'dod pas tshad ma'i mtshan nyid phyin ci log kho na byed de /
translated: Thus, some tƒ´rthikas desire to establish the reality of a completely false entity such as the self and so on and they desire to eliminate the conventional presentations such as omniscience, freedom from attachment, and the connection between actions and effects. Therefore they create only a distorted definition of valid knowledge.

original: @179a * // de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis de bkag nas gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa dang mthun pa /
analyzed: @179a * // de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis de bkag nas gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa dang mthun pa /
translated: Therefore, the wise refute that and enter into the reality of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is in accord with the way things are.üîΩ

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la sogs pa kun rdzob pa rnam par gzhag pa gnas pa'i rgyu mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag pa nyid mdzad do //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la sogs pa kun rdzob pa rnam par gzhag pa gnas pa'i rgyu mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag pa nyid mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the scholars refuted that and composed the pure characteristics of the valid cognitions such as direct perception, which are the causes for positing the conventional, such as the connection between actions and results, and which are compatible with engaging the reality of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su gnang ba kho na yin pas de'i phyir kho bo cag tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rnam par dag cing don dam pa'i rjes su mthun pa khas len pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su gnang ba kho na yin pas de'i phyir kho bo cag tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rnam par dag cing don dam pa'i rjes su mthun pa khas len pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, since that was completely permitted by the Transcendent Conqueror, we accept the pure characteristics of valid cognition and the ultimate in harmony.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad khas blangs pa tsam gyi sgo nas dngos po'i ngo bo khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma nges pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad khas blangs pa tsam gyi sgo nas dngos po'i ngo bo khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma nges pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, the consequence that we accept the nature of things by merely accepting the conventions of contradiction and so on is simply not the case.

original: de khas blangs su zin kyang dngos po'i ngo bo yang dag pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khas blangs su zin kyang dngos po'i ngo bo yang dag pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if you do accept that, the nature of things is not established.

original: 'dis ni gal te rjes su dpag pa'i 'brel pa rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir mngon sum tshad mar khas len na ni de'i tshe dngos por grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te rjes su dpag pa'i 'brel pa rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir mngon sum tshad mar khas len na ni de'i tshe dngos por grub pa nyid de /
translated: If you accept that direct perception is a valid cognition in order to establish the connection of inference, then at that time it is established as a thing.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma nor ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma nor ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is because the definition of direct perception is ‚Äúfree from conceptuality and non-erroneous.‚Äù

original: ma nor ba'i shes pas gtan la phab pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang ji ltar rjes su dpag pas bsal bar bya nus /
analyzed: ma nor ba'i shes pas gtan la phab pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang ji ltar rjes su dpag pas bsal bar bya nus /
translated: How can the nature of things ascertained by non-erroneous consciousness be refuted by inference?

original: de sel na ni mngon sum la gnod pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sel na ni mngon sum la gnod pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it can be refuted, then inference would contradict direct perception.

original: de la gnod na ni rjes su dpag pa yang legs par mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnod na ni rjes su dpag pa yang legs par mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it contradicts direct perception, then inference would not be well-founded.

original: rjes su dpag pas mngon sum de nyid las 'brel pa thob nas yang de nyid la gnod pa byed do zhes bya ba 'di las rigs pa gzhan ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas mngon sum de nyid las 'brel pa thob nas yang de nyid la gnod pa byed do zhes bya ba 'di las rigs pa gzhan ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
translated: What other logic is there than this: ‚ÄúHaving obtained the connection from that very direct perception through inference, it harms that very thing‚Äù?

original: 'on te mngon sum du grub pa'i don la rjes su dpag pas gnod par mi byed na ni de'i tshe thob par bya ba thob pa nyid kyi phyir dngos por smra ba rnams legs par gnas pa kho na yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum du grub pa'i don la rjes su dpag pas gnod par mi byed na ni de'i tshe thob par bya ba thob pa nyid kyi phyir dngos por smra ba rnams legs par gnas pa kho na yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang
translated: But if inference does not harm the object that is established by direct perception, then at that time, because the goal to be attained has been attained, it is only the proponents of real entities who remain well-established.üîΩThat is also

original: bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: bsal ba yin te /
translated: refuted.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum ni slob dpon rnams kyis rnam pa gnyis su rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum ni slob dpon rnams kyis rnam pa gnyis su rnam par phye ste /
translated: In this way, the masters have distinguished two types of direct perception:

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dang phal pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dang phal pa dag gi'o //
translated: that of yogis and that of ordinary beings.

original: de la phal pa dag gi mngon sum gang yin pa de ni don dam pa pa'i dbang du byas nas ma nor ba zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la phal pa dag gi mngon sum gang yin pa de ni don dam pa pa'i dbang du byas nas ma nor ba zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Among those, the direct perception of ordinary beings, from the perspective of the ultimate, is not called ‚Äúnonerroneous.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma yin na thams cad rnal 'byor pa kho nar 'gyur gyi tshu rol mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na thams cad rnal 'byor pa kho nar 'gyur gyi tshu rol mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were not so, then everyone would be a yogi, and not a person who sees only a part.

original: rnal @179b 'byor pa'i mngon sum las phal ba'i mngon sum bye brag yod par yang mi 'gyur bas tha snyad kyi sgo nas rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ji ltar grags pa'i don la mi slu ba tsam las de ma 'khrul pa zhes bya bar zad do
analyzed: rnal @179b 'byor pa'i mngon sum las phal ba'i mngon sum bye brag yod par yang mi 'gyur bas tha snyad kyi sgo nas rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ji ltar grags pa'i don la mi slu ba tsam las de ma 'khrul pa zhes bya bar zad do
translated: And because there would be no difference between the yogi‚Äôs perception and the perception of the ordinary person, then, as in the case of a dream, etc., it would be only by way of convention that one would be non-deceived with regard to the object as it is known.

original: // nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gang yin pa de ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam mngon sum du byed par zhugs pa'i phyir de la mi slu ba nyid kyis mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: // nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gang yin pa de ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam mngon sum du byed par zhugs pa'i phyir de la mi slu ba nyid kyis mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: The yogi‚Äôs perception of the Sravakas, etc., is a valid perception because it is non-deceptive with regard to the selflessness of the person, since it is engaged in the direct realization of just that.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid spyod yul gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid spyod yul gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not because it is the domain of the reality of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na'i mngon sum gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dngos su de mi slu ba kho na yin pas rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi dbang du byas teüîΩma nor ba yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na'i mngon sum gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dngos su de mi slu ba kho na yin pas rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi dbang du byas te ma nor ba yin te /
translated: The object of the Bhagavans' direct perception is the reality of all aspects, and because it is nondeceptive with respect to that, it is nonerroneous in terms of the reality of all aspects.

original: de nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid la mi slu bas dngos su ma nor ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid la mi slu bas dngos su ma nor ba yin te /
translated: It is nonerroneous in terms of the reality of all aspects because it is nondeceptive with respect to the reality of all aspects.

original: des na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Therefore the Bhagavans know that all phenomena are devoid of characteristics.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de dngos po nyid du thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de dngos po nyid du thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It does not follow that the gnosis that knows all aspects is itself an entity,

original: de yang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir de dag gis mtshan nyid med pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir de dag gis mtshan nyid med pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is included among all phenomena and is fully awakened to as devoid of characteristics.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ji skad du mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ji skad du mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin te /
translated: The definition of direct perception is the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And that is the thus-gone ones‚Äô perfect, manifest awakening to what is called the absence of defining characteristics.

original: de la mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi don tha snyad pa rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun par snang ba la yang byis pa rnams kyis dngos su don dam pa pa'i ngo bo la sogs par sgro btags pa gang yin pa de la rjes su dpag
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi don tha snyad pa rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun par snang ba la yang byis pa rnams kyis dngos su don dam pa pa'i ngo bo la sogs par sgro btags pa gang yin pa de la rjes su dpag
translated: In that regard, the conventional object of direct perception, which appears falsely like a dream, is also directly imputed by the childish to be the ultimate nature and so forth.

original: pas gnod par byed kyi /
analyzed: pas gnod par byed kyi /
translated: That is undermined by inference.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa'i don tha snyad la yang gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa'i don tha snyad la yang gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not undermine the conventional object of seeing and so forth.

original: de'i phyir gang la ma 'khrul pa de ni mngon sum yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la ma 'khrul pa de ni mngon sum yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since that which is nonerroneous is direct perception,

original: de la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa med do //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa med do //
translated: it is not undermined by inference.

original: bden pa'i ngo bo la sogs par sgro btags pa gang la gnod pa de ni de la ma 'khrul pa ma yin pas mngon sum la skur ba 'debs par thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'i ngo bo la sogs par sgro btags pa gang la gnod pa de ni de la ma 'khrul pa ma yin pas mngon sum la skur ba 'debs par thal ba ma yin no //
translated: The refutation of the reality of the essence, etc., does not amount to a denial of perception, since it is not a case of non-error with respect to the essence, etc.

original: rjes su @180a * //
analyzed: rjes su @180a * //
translated: Inference

original: dpag pas tshu rol mthong ba'i mngon sum las 'brel pa thob kyang don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid du thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dpag pas tshu rol mthong ba'i mngon sum las 'brel pa thob kyang don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid du thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: does not attain the ultimate essence, even though it does attain a connection with perception, which sees only the near side.

original: 'on kyang kun rdzob pa kho nar yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun rdzob pa kho nar yin te /
translated: It is only on the conventional level,

original: pha rol ma yin pa mthong ba rnams kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa pa mngon sum du so sor mi myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol ma yin pa mthong ba rnams kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa pa mngon sum du so sor mi myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who see the far side do not experience the real essence of things in perception.

original: des na dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kun rdzob pa la yang gnod pa ni mi byed kyi /
analyzed: des na dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kun rdzob pa la yang gnod pa ni mi byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, the refutation does not deny the conventional essence of things.

original: 'on kyang de la bden pa'i rnam pa nyid du sgro btags pa sel ba'i phyir rab tu sgrub par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la bden pa'i rnam pa nyid du sgro btags pa sel ba'i phyir rab tu sgrub par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is only a proof, in order to eliminate the superimposition of the aspect of truth on that conventional essence.

original: de'i phyir dngos por smra ba don med pa la don du gyur par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams ji ltar legs par gnas pa zhes bya bar 'gyur /üîΩrnam pa gcig tu na gal te rjes su dpag pas tha snyad kyi sgo nas mngon sum kho na las 'brel pa thob nas gnas thob pa dang shing gnyis drud pa las me byung ba bzhin du mngon sum de nyid la yang dag par gnod pa byed par
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos por smra ba don med pa la don du gyur par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams ji ltar legs par gnas pa zhes bya bar 'gyur / rnam pa gcig tu na gal te rjes su dpag pas tha snyad kyi sgo nas mngon sum kho na las 'brel pa thob nas gnas thob pa dang shing gnyis drud pa las me byung ba bzhin du mngon sum de nyid la yang dag par gnod pa byed par
translated: Therefore, how could the essentialists, who are conceited about what is meaningless, be said to be ‚Äúwell situated‚Äù?

original: gyur na gnod pa byed du zad de /
analyzed: gyur na gnod pa byed du zad de /
translated: Or, if you infer that the relationship is obtained through convention from direct perception alone, and then obtain a position, and then that direct perception is truly undermined, like the fire produced by rubbing two sticks together, then it is just undermined.

original: kho bo cag la ni de tsam gyis cung zad kyang mi 'dod par bsgrub pa med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni de tsam gyis cung zad kyang mi 'dod par bsgrub pa med do //
translated: But we do not prove anything by just that, so we have no thesis.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba'i chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyi me'i bud shing nyid du gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba'i chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyi me'i bud shing nyid du gyur la /
translated: In this way, the fire of wisdom that properly differentiates all phenomena of the world becomes the fuel of that fire.

original: de brdzun pa'i bud shing 'di thams cad bsregs te /
analyzed: de brdzun pa'i bud shing 'di thams cad bsregs te /
translated: That fire burns all of this false fuel.

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i me rab tu zhi bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchog rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i me rab tu zhi bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchog rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: The pacification of the fire of differentiation is the realization of the supreme nirvƒÅ·πáa, the characteristic of the pacification of conceptuality.üîΩThis is asserted.

original: de skad du /üîΩ'gro ba'i chos kun rnam shes kyi //
analyzed: de skad du / 'gro ba'i chos kun rnam shes kyi //
translated: It is said:üîΩAll phenomena of the world

original: me yi bud shing yin par 'dod //
analyzed: me yi bud shing yin par 'dod //
translated: are the fuel for the fire of consciousness.

original: de dag ji bzhin rnam 'byed pa'i //
analyzed: de dag ji bzhin rnam 'byed pa'i //
translated: The fire that differentiates them

original: me yis bsregs nas nyer zhir 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: me yis bsregs nas nyer zhir 'gyur // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: burns and is pacified.

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi ye shes skyes na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ldog par gyur cing rten med mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi ye shes skyes na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ldog par gyur cing rten med mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, when the wisdom of suchness arises, conceptual thoughts characterized by inference cease and have no basis.

original: 'on kyang mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not that they are not asserted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
translated: For that very reason, the BhagavƒÅn said in the Noble Heap of Jewels:

original: yang dag sar so sor rtog pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin yang 'bras bu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu che ba nyid du shing gnyis drud pa las byung ba'i me'i dpes rab tu ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag sar so sor rtog pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin yang 'bras bu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu che ba nyid du shing gnyis drud pa las byung ba'i me'i dpes rab tu ston par mdzad do //
translated: Moreover, even though the discernment of the perfect is itself discursive, it is taught to be of great result, because the result, nonconceptual intuition, is generated, by the example of the fire produced by rubbing two sticks together.

original: gzhan yang gang 'di skad du gal te @180b chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa grub par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs yod pa'i chos shig ston na ni de'i tshe de las bzlog pa sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang 'di skad du gal te @180b chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa grub par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs yod pa'i chos shig ston na ni de'i tshe de las bzlog pa sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, if a reason is taught to establish that all things are essenceless, then, because it would prove the opposite, the reason would be contradictory.

original: 'on te med pa'i chos shig yin na ni de'i tshe med pa dang dngos po med par phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na sgrub pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te med pa'i chos shig yin na ni de'i tshe med pa dang dngos po med par phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na sgrub pa nyid yin /
translated: But if it is a nonexistent thing, then, because nonexistence and nonentity are not mutually related, how could it be a proof?

original: 'on te gnyi ga'i chos shig yin na ni de yang ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga'i chos shig yin na ni de yang ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it is a thing that is both, then that is inconclusive.

original: gtan tshigs ma yin pa kho na'o zhes brgal ba gang yin pa de yang 'brel pa med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma yin pa kho na'o zhes brgal ba gang yin pa de yang 'brel pa med pa kho na ste /
translated: The objection that it is not a logical reason is also completely irrelevant.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni rigs pa shes pa rnams kyis yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi ga'i chos rnams don dam par yod pa bsgrub pa la gtan tshigs nyid du mi srid do zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni rigs pa shes pa rnams kyis yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi ga'i chos rnams don dam par yod pa bsgrub pa la gtan tshigs nyid du mi srid do zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: For we are saying that for those who know logic, it is impossible for a logical reason to establish the ultimate existence of things that are existent, nonexistent, or both,

original: spyi'i chos ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i chos ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for the establishment of a general property, such as the characteristic of realitylessness.

original: de lta na ni gzhan gyis kun brtags pa dbang phyug la sogs pa'i ngo bo med par sgrub pa la yang klan ka 'di thams cad ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ni gzhan gyis kun brtags pa dbang phyug la sogs pa'i ngo bo med par sgrub pa la yang klan ka 'di thams cad ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, then why would all of these objections not also arise in the establishment of the nonexistence of the nature of ƒ™≈õvara and so on, which are imagined by others?

original: de la ji ltar dbang phyug la sogs pa la dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i chos nus pa la sogs pa bkag pas dngos po'i de kho na nyid du sgro btags pa 'gog par byed pa la yang med pa'i chos 'brel ba med pa ma yin pa
analyzed: de la ji ltar dbang phyug la sogs pa la dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i chos nus pa la sogs pa bkag pas dngos po'i de kho na nyid du sgro btags pa 'gog par byed pa la yang med pa'i chos 'brel ba med pa ma yin pa
translated: In that case, since the pervading attributes of power and so on of ƒ™≈õvara and so on are refuted, the superimposition of the reality of things is refuted, and the attribute of nonexistence is not unrelated.

original: de bzhin du kho bo cag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pa khyab par byed pa bkag pas dngos po'i chos yang dag par sgro btags pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa la yang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag ci'i phyir 'brel pa med /
analyzed: de bzhin du kho bo cag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pa khyab par byed pa bkag pas dngos po'i chos yang dag par sgro btags pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa la yang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag ci'i phyir 'brel pa med /
translated: Similarly, since the pervading attributes of the entity of cause and effect and so on are refuted, the proof that refutes the superimposition of the attributes of things is established, and why are the probandum and the proof unrelated?

original: de lta ma yin na gtso bo la sogs pa gang yang dgag par bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtso bo la sogs pa gang yang dgag par bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then nothing such as the primal matter and so on would be refuted.

original: 'di ltar re zhig dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod pa la ni der bya bar mi nus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod pa la ni der bya bar mi nus pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, first, if the nature of an entity exists, it is simply not possible to make it so.

original: med pa la yang gal te 'brel ba med pa'i phyir 'di mi nus na 'di gang la nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa la yang gal te 'brel ba med pa'i phyir 'di mi nus na 'di gang la nus par 'gyur /
translated: If it is not possible because it is unrelated to a nonexistent, then to what is it possible?

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba gang yang dag pa pa'i 'brel par 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba gang yang dag pa pa'i 'brel par 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is nothing at all that is called ‚Äúnonthing‚Äù that would be related to it.

original: khyab par byed pa bkag pas khyab par bya ba ldog pa tsam ston par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa bkag pas khyab par bya ba ldog pa tsam ston par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is merely shown that the negation of the pervader refutes the pervaded.

original: ji ltar dngos po yod pa la yang chos dang / chos can gyi dngos po 'di thams cad kun brtags pa kho nar rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa la yang ci ste rnam par mi gzhag /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po yod pa la yang chos dang / chos can gyi dngos po 'di thams cad kun brtags pa kho nar rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa la yang ci ste rnam par mi gzhag /
translated: Just as the existence of things is posited as only imputed in terms of the phenomena and the bearers of phenomena, why is nonexistence not posited in the same way?

original: @181a * // gzhan yang gang dag la nam yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid don dam pa pa 'ga' yang rab tu ma grub la /
analyzed: @181a * // gzhan yang gang dag la nam yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid don dam pa pa 'ga' yang rab tu ma grub la /
translated: Moreover, for those who never establish the nature of the entity, the nature of the entity that is the ultimate reality,

original: de ma grub na ni de bzhin du gyur pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang ma grub pa kho na yin te ;
analyzed: de ma grub na ni de bzhin du gyur pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang ma grub pa kho na yin te ;
translated: if that is not established, then just as it is, since it is the characteristic of an entity, nonentity is not established at all.

original: de'i phyir de dag la yang dag par na chos yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs 'ga' yang gang du yang mi srid pa'i phyir ji ltar de dag la des brgal zhing brtag pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la yang dag par na chos yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs 'ga' yang gang du yang mi srid pa'i phyir ji ltar de dag la des brgal zhing brtag pa'i rigs te /
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible for any reason to exist in reality that has the characteristic of the existence, nonexistence, or both of things, how can one dispute and investigate with that?

original: dngos po thams cad ni sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
translated: All things are beyond existence, nonexistence, and both natures, like illusions and so on.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni yod pa dang dgag pa sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs rang dang mthun pa'i phyir ji ltar grags pa rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag la yang dag par grub pa de med na mi 'byung ba kho na smos par byed pa yin no
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni yod pa dang dgag pa sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs rang dang mthun pa'i phyir ji ltar grags pa rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag la yang dag par grub pa de med na mi 'byung ba kho na smos par byed pa yin no
translated: Therefore, since they are established for the proponent and opponent in accordance with what is renowned, one should state only the reason that is not otherwise, in order to prove existence and nonexistence.

original: // de lta bas na 'di la chos dang / chos can dang 'gal ba dang / khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rang bzhin dang 'bras bu la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba bzhin rnam par gzhag pa thams cad mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: // de lta bas na 'di la chos dang / chos can dang 'gal ba dang / khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rang bzhin dang 'bras bu la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba bzhin rnam par gzhag pa thams cad mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, in this [system] all presentations of phenomena, subjects, contradictions, the pervaded, the pervader, nature, effect, and so on are not at all contradictory.

original: de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis lta ba 'di la kha cig chos dang chos can 'gal ba la sogs pas phyir rgol bar byed pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni de dag gi tha snyad dang / don dam pa'i tshul ma rig pa'i phyir brdzi bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis lta ba 'di la kha cig chos dang chos can 'gal ba la sogs pas phyir rgol bar byed pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni de dag gi tha snyad dang / don dam pa'i tshul ma rig pa'i phyir brdzi bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise should understand that when some debate with us about contradictions between phenomena and subjects and so on, all of their arguments are invalid because they do not understand the conventional and ultimate modes.

original: gang yang de ni tshig tsam gyis 'grub par yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang khas mi len pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang de ni tshig tsam gyis 'grub par yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang khas mi len pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Also, the statement, ‚ÄúIt is not established by mere words‚Äù and so on is not a refutation because we do not accept that.

original: kho bo cag kyang tshig tsam gyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par sgrub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang tshig tsam gyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par sgrub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: We do not prove that all phenomena lack entityness by mere words.

original: thal bar sgrub pa tsam gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: thal bar sgrub pa tsam gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor do we prove that by mere reductio arguments.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: yang dag pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis sgrub bo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis sgrub bo //
translated: We prove it by means of valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams la don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yod par gyur na rnam pa gnyis kho nar 'gyur te /üîΩthams cad rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams la don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yod par gyur na rnam pa gnyis kho nar 'gyur te / thams cad rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te /
translated: If things had an ultimate entityness, it would have to be one of two things:

original: skye ba'i phyir mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Either it would be an entityness that is dependent, because all things arise in dependence on causes and conditions,

original: dper na mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams 'dod pa lta bu zhig gam /
analyzed: dper na mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams 'dod pa lta bu zhig gam /
translated: like the entityness that is asserted by the Sautrantikas and Yogacaras.

original: rang bzhin gyis @181b yang dag par grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir brten pa'i khongs su gtogs pa zhig yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis @181b yang dag par grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir brten pa'i khongs su gtogs pa zhig yin te /
translated: Or it would be an entityness that is independent, because it is an intrinsically real nature,

original: dper na mu stegs can la sogs pa dag gis bdag la sogs pa kun brtags pa lta bu zhig yin grang /
analyzed: dper na mu stegs can la sogs pa dag gis bdag la sogs pa kun brtags pa lta bu zhig yin grang /
translated: like the entityness that is imagined by the heterodox, such as the self.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir phung po gsum pa ni med do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir phung po gsum pa ni med do //
translated: because permanence and impermanence are mutually exclusive.

original: ngo bo nyid 'dir rnam pa gnyi ga yang don dam pa par mi rung ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'dir rnam pa gnyi ga yang don dam pa par mi rung ste /
translated: Neither of these two aspects of intrinsic reality is tenable in an ultimate sense,

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / gnod par byed pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar mngon sum mam /
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / gnod par byed pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar mngon sum mam /
translated: because there is no validating cognition to establish them, and because it is possible to invalidate them.

original: rjes su dpag pa zhig sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhig sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: In this regard, a validating cognition is either direct perception orüîΩinference.

original: de la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang po ni gnyi gas kyang yang dag par 'grub pa med do //
analyzed: de la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang po ni gnyi gas kyang yang dag par 'grub pa med do //
translated: Neither of these two can establish the intrinsic reality of an entity in an ultimate sense.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub na /
translated: For, if the intrinsic reality of an entity were established,

original: de 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then it would be established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de yang re zhig mngon sum gyi sgo nas ni don dam par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de yang re zhig mngon sum gyi sgo nas ni don dam par mi 'grub po //
translated: But the intrinsic reality of an entity is not established by direct perception in an ultimate sense.

original: de ni dbang po las byung ba'i mngon sum mam /
analyzed: de ni dbang po las byung ba'i mngon sum mam /
translated: For, direct perception is either direct perception arising from the senses or

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis 'grub grang tshu rol mthong ba rnams rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyis tha snyad mi 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi mngon sum gang la yang ma grags pa'i phyir de dag gis ni de 'grub par ni mi bsam mo //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis 'grub grang tshu rol mthong ba rnams rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyis tha snyad mi 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi mngon sum gang la yang ma grags pa'i phyir de dag gis ni de 'grub par ni mi bsam mo //
translated: If you think that it is established by reflexive awareness, it is not, because those who see this side do not posit reflexive awareness as a valid cognition, and because it is not renowned in any other form of direct perception.

original: de la re zhig dbang po'i mngon sum gyis ni de mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig dbang po'i mngon sum gyis ni de mi 'grub ste /
translated: First, it is not established by sense direct perception,

original: de don gzhan yul nyid du nye bar brjod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de don gzhan yul nyid du nye bar brjod pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is said that the object is another, an object.

original: don gzhan rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa yang don dam par shes pas 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa yang don dam par shes pas 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not suitable for consciousness to apprehend another object that is a cause or result in the ultimate.

original: 'di gang gis na rnam par shes pas rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gzhan yang shes par 'gyur ba gzhan gyis ngo bo ni gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di gang gis na rnam par shes pas rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gzhan yang shes par 'gyur ba gzhan gyis ngo bo ni gzhan ma yin la /
translated: By what means would consciousness know another object, just as it knows its own nature? The nature of another is not another.

original: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And another and not another are mutually exclusive.

original: de'i rnam par skyes pa tsam gyis rnam par shes pas gzhan rig go zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par skyes pa tsam gyis rnam par shes pas gzhan rig go zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that consciousness cognizes another object by merely arising in the aspect of that object.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: / de lta na ni bum pa la sogs pa gang cung zad rnam pa gzhan gyi rjes su byed pa 'byung ba de thams cad kyang phan tshun du ngo bo nyid 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de lta na ni bum pa la sogs pa gang cung zad rnam pa gzhan gyi rjes su byed pa 'byung ba de thams cad kyang phan tshun du ngo bo nyid 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then whatever object, such as a pot, that arises in the aspect of another object would also apprehend the entity of another object.

original: de'i rnam pa can gang yin pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes khyad par brjod kyang rnam par shes pa la ni gang gis na 'dra ba @182a * //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gang yin pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes khyad par brjod kyang rnam par shes pa la ni gang gis na 'dra ba @182a * //
translated: Even if you say that the aspect is the nature of consciousness, consciousness would not be distinguished in any way,

original: can gyi rnam par shes pa kho nas gzhan rig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: can gyi rnam par shes pa kho nas gzhan rig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: so that consciousness that has the same aspect would cognize another object,

original: bum pa la sogs pas ni ma yin no zhes rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pas ni ma yin no zhes rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: but a pot and so on would not.

original: 'di ltar de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang rang gi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir gzhan la cung zad kyang mi byed par 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang rang gi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir gzhan la cung zad kyang mi byed par 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, although they are the nature of consciousness, they are similar in that they do not perform any function for others, because they exist as their own nature.üîΩIf there is no difference, then even though those who seek to perform a function apply things to their specific functions, the specific natures that perform a function for each cannot be established anywhere,

original: khyad par med na don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis dngos po rnams rang dga'i rjes su byed pa'i khyad par tsam gyis rnam par sbyar kyang so sor nges pa'i don byed pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni gang du yang thams cad sgrub par mi nus teüîΩ/ ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med na don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis dngos po rnams rang dga'i rjes su byed pa'i khyad par tsam gyis rnam par sbyar kyang so sor nges pa'i don byed pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni gang du yang thams cad sgrub par mi nus te / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that everything would be able to perform every function.

original: zlos gar mkhan dang / zla ba dang / gyad la lta ba lta bu mang po rnams gcig la lta ba de'i rnam par shes pa dag la yang phan tshun 'dra ba srid pa'i phyir dang / shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir de dag kyang phan tshun mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zlos gar mkhan dang / zla ba dang / gyad la lta ba lta bu mang po rnams gcig la lta ba de'i rnam par shes pa dag la yang phan tshun 'dra ba srid pa'i phyir dang / shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir de dag kyang phan tshun mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as many people, such as actors, the moon, and wrestlers, are seen by one person, it is possible that the consciousnesses of those people would be similar to each other, and because they are similar in being the nature of consciousness, it would follow, absurdly, that they would be directly perceptible to each other.
