original: de las byung ba yin na zhes khyad par gzhan brjod kyang don gzhan mngon sum nyid du gtad par yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba yin na zhes khyad par gzhan brjod kyang don gzhan mngon sum nyid du gtad par yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if you specify ‚Äúarising from that,‚Äù you cannot indicate another object that is directly perceived.

original: khyad par 'dod pa tsam gyis nye bar brtags pa yin pas khyad par rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par 'dod pa tsam gyis nye bar brtags pa yin pas khyad par rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is merely asserted that there is a difference, the difference is not established.

original: gzhan yang gzhan du gyur pa mngon sum nyid du grub na ni shes pa'i khyad par de dang 'dra ba dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan du gyur pa mngon sum nyid du grub na ni shes pa'i khyad par de dang 'dra ba dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Moreover, if the transformation were established as direct perception, then the difference in consciousness and the characteristics of arising from that would be established.

original: gang gi tshe shes pas gzhan ji ltar 'dzin zhes rnam par spyod pa byed pa na don gzhan mngon sum nyid du ma grub pa kho na yin na de'i tshe ji ltar na ma grub pa'i ngo bo'i khyad par gyis grub pa'i lam gyi khyad par dag sgrubüîΩpar 'gyur te zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pas gzhan ji ltar 'dzin zhes rnam par spyod pa byed pa na don gzhan mngon sum nyid du ma grub pa kho na yin na de'i tshe ji ltar na ma grub pa'i ngo bo'i khyad par gyis grub pa'i lam gyi khyad par dag sgrubüîΩpar 'gyur te zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: But when you analyze how consciousness apprehends another object, if the other object is not established as direct perception, then how can you establish the difference in the path that is established by the difference in the object that is not established?

original: rnam par shes pa'i skad cig mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen don mthun pa'i stobs las byung ba las skye ba phyi ma phyi ma rnams kyang shes pa'i skad cig snga ma snga ma la ltos nas de las byung ba dang 'dra bar srid pa'i phyir snga
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i skad cig mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen don mthun pa'i stobs las byung ba las skye ba phyi ma phyi ma rnams kyang shes pa'i skad cig snga ma snga ma la ltos nas de las byung ba dang 'dra bar srid pa'i phyir snga
translated: And because the later moments arise from the power of the immediately preceding condition of the same type of consciousness, it is possible that they are similar to the earlier moments in being arisen from that.

original: ma rnams shes pa phyi ma'i gzung ba nyid du thal ba bzlog dka' ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma rnams shes pa phyi ma'i gzung ba nyid du thal ba bzlog dka' ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore it is difficult to avoid the consequence that the earlier moments would be the object of the later consciousnesses.

original: gzhan yang re zhig gang dag phyi rol gyi don yan lag can la sogs pa'i dngos po mngon sum du 'dod pa de dag gi lta ba la yang de ji ltar rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las nye bar brtags pa de bzhin du mngon @182b sum du snangüîΩba myong ba med de //
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig gang dag phyi rol gyi don yan lag can la sogs pa'i dngos po mngon sum du 'dod pa de dag gi lta ba la yang de ji ltar rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las nye bar brtags pa de bzhin du mngon @182b sum du snang ba myong ba med de //
translated: Moreover, in the case of those who assert that the whole, part-possessor, and so on are directly perceived external objects, the appearance of those objects as they are imagined in their own tenets is not directly perceived.

original: nam yang yan lag can du rtogs pa de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mngon sum du myong ba ni med kyi /
analyzed: nam yang yan lag can du rtogs pa de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mngon sum du myong ba ni med kyi /
translated: That is because there is no direct experience of a consciousness that has the aspect of the realization of a whole.

original: rtag tu lag pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gi tshogs du ma'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa so sor myong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa yan lag can la yod pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba yang med de /
analyzed: rtag tu lag pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gi tshogs du ma'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa so sor myong ba'i phyir ro // sngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa yan lag can la yod pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba yang med de /
translated: because the consciousness that has the aspect of many parts, such as hands, is individually experienced.

original: rten mngon sum nyid ma yin na de la yod pa'i yon tan la sogs pa 'ba' zhig mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten mngon sum nyid ma yin na de la yod pa'i yon tan la sogs pa 'ba' zhig mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is there the experience of consciousness that has the aspect of the whole, such as the quality of blue, etc., because if the basis is not directly perceptible, then the quality that exists in it is not apprehended.

original: 'chi ltas dang / mig sngon dang / mig ser dang / rab rib la sogs pas mig nyams pa rnams dang / yul ring ba dang nye ba la sogs pa na gnas pa rnams dngos po gcig la yang rnam pa phan tshun mi mthun pa du ma can gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir sems dag la phyi rol gyi yan lag can la sogs par gtogs pa'i 'dra
analyzed: 'chi ltas dang / mig sngon dang / mig ser dang / rab rib la sogs pas mig nyams pa rnams dang / yul ring ba dang nye ba la sogs pa na gnas pa rnams dngos po gcig la yang rnam pa phan tshun mi mthun pa du ma can gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir sems dag la phyi rol gyi yan lag can la sogs par gtogs pa'i 'dra
translated: And because the consciousness of those whose eyes are impaired by such things as cataracts, jaundice, and floaters, and of those who are far away or near to the object, arises with many aspects that are mutually incompatible with regard to a single thing, there is no external whole, etc.,

original: ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: in the mind, because the aspects of the whole, etc., are not present in the mind.

original: de tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de snyed kyi 'di'i ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: de tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de snyed kyi 'di'i ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: because it would follow that they would be different.

original: yon tan la sogs pa skyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa skyes pa ni med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no arising of that many natures or qualities, etc.

original: yon tan la sogs pa'i chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa yang gcig pa nyid yin na ni sna tshogs kyang gcig pa nyid du thal la /
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa'i chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa yang gcig pa nyid yin na ni sna tshogs kyang gcig pa nyid du thal la /
translated: If one were to possess the qualities, etc., that are mutually exclusive, then it would follow, absurdly, that the various would be one.

original: gags byed pa med pa'i phyir yon tan la sogs pa'i chos mtha' dag kyang thams cad kyi mngon sum nyid du thal ba yin no //üîΩrmi lam la sogs pa dag na sngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i don gzhan de lta bu med kyang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa de lta bu so sor myong bas 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir yang rnam pa'i dbang gis don
analyzed: gags byed pa med pa'i phyir yon tan la sogs pa'i chos mtha' dag kyang thams cad kyi mngon sum nyid du thal ba yin no // rmi lam la sogs pa dag na sngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i don gzhan de lta bu med kyang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa de lta bu so sor myong bas 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir yang rnam pa'i dbang gis don
translated: And because there would be no obstruction, it would follow, absurdly, that all qualities, etc., would be directly perceptible to all.

original: gzhan 'dzin par rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'dzin par rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though in dreams, etc., there are no such objects that possess the qualities of blue, etc., there are still such experiences of consciousnesses that appear as blue, etc. Therefore, because of error, it is not reasonable to posit that the object is apprehended by way of the aspects.

original: gang dag sngon po la sogs pa'i don rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum du smra ba de la yang nyes pa mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang dag sngon po la sogs pa'i don rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum du smra ba de la yang nyes pa mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: For those who assert that the nature of objects such as blue is directly perceived as an aggregation of subtle particles, the same fault applies.

original: dngos po phra mo yan lag med pa rnam pa du ma can gyi shes pa so sor mi myong ba'i phyir dang / tshogs pa gcig pa rnams yul nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du rags par snang ba'i shes pa so sor myong ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: dngos po phra mo yan lag med pa rnam pa du ma can gyi shes pa so sor mi myong ba'i phyir dang / tshogs pa gcig pa rnams yul nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du rags par snang ba'i shes pa so sor myong ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Because many consciousnesses of subtle things that lack parts are not individually experienced, because an aggregation is accepted as the object, and because consciousness always experiences coarse appearance, like a dream, and so on.

original: 'dus pa can dag las 'dus pa don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa rnam par rtog pas nye bar brtags pa yang dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa can dag las 'dus pa don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa rnam par rtog pas nye bar brtags pa yang dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an aggregation is not a different object from the things that are aggregated and because an aggregation is not a thing imputed by thought.

original: @183a * // rags par 'khrul pa dngos po du ma 'dab chags su gnas pa 'dzin pas nye bar bskyed pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe shes pa yang 'khrul pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par thal te /
analyzed: @183a * // rags par 'khrul pa dngos po du ma 'dab chags su gnas pa 'dzin pas nye bar bskyed pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe shes pa yang 'khrul pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par thal te /
translated: If it is generated by the apprehension of a multiplicity of things that are in contact with each other, then at that time consciousness is mistaken and therefore it is not valid knowledge.

original: 'di ltar gal te rags par 'khrul pa 'di yid kho nas kun brtags pa zhig yin na ni de'i tshe 'di gsal bar mi snang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rags par 'khrul pa 'di yid kho nas kun brtags pa zhig yin na ni de'i tshe 'di gsal bar mi snang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If this error of grossness is imagined by the mental consciousness alone, then it follows that it would not appear clearly.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni dus thams cad du mi gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni dus thams cad du mi gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of conception is always unclear.

original: 'on te dbang po'i shes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa zhig yin na ni de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams rtag tu mi 'dzin pa kho nar thal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po'i shes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa zhig yin na ni de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams rtag tu mi 'dzin pa kho nar thal ba yin te /
translated: But if it is included in the sense consciousness, then it follows that atoms are never apprehended.

original: dus thams cad du de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because at all times consciousness that has their aspect does not arise.

original: rags par 'khrul pa de 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du yang 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rags par 'khrul pa de 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du yang 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And it is not established that the error of the gross is due to the prior apprehension of that,

original: dang po kho nar rags par 'khrul pa skye bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po kho nar rags par 'khrul pa skye bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the error of the gross arises first of all.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyi sgo nas rdul phra rab dag grub na rags par 'khrul pa de 'dzin pas byas pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyi sgo nas rdul phra rab dag grub na rags par 'khrul pa de 'dzin pas byas pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the subtle atoms were established by another valid cognition, then the error of the gross would be established as due to the apprehension of that.

original: de ma grub na rags par 'khrul pa 'di de 'dzin par byas so zhes bya bar lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ma grub na rags par 'khrul pa 'di de 'dzin par byas so zhes bya bar lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: But if that is not established, how could it be said that the error of the gross is due to the apprehension of that?

original: rmi lam la sogs pa na rdul phra rab 'dzin pa med kyang rags par 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir 'di de 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa na rdul phra rab 'dzin pa med kyang rags par 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir 'di de 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the error of the gross is seen in dreams and so on without the apprehension of subtle atoms, it is not logical that the error of the gross is due to the prior apprehension of that.

original: mya ngam dag na dngos po chung ngu yang thag ring po nas chen po nyid dang ldan par snang ba dang / thag ring ba dang nye ba'i bye brag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba'i bye brag tu yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mya ngam dag na dngos po chung ngu yang thag ring po nas chen po nyid dang ldan par snang ba dang / thag ring ba dang nye ba'i bye brag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba'i bye brag tu yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: In a desert, a small object appears to be large from a distance, and it would not appear differently as clear or unclear due to the difference of near and far.

original: dngos po de gcig pa nyid kyis rnam pa de lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang gal te rnam pa rnams yang dag pa nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe ri mo brkyang ba la sogs pa dag la shes pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhin du tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po de gcig pa nyid kyis rnam pa de lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang gal te rnam pa rnams yang dag pa nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe ri mo brkyang ba la sogs pa dag la shes pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhin du tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for a single thing to have such aspects.üîΩMoreover, if the aspects are accepted as real, then in an extended painting and so on, consciousness would be multiple because of the variety of aspects.

original: gang gis na rnam pa sna tshogs nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir shes pa du ma skye bar rtogs pa legs par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa yul la bkram pa lta bur 'dug par yongs su 'dzin par skye ba yang med de /
analyzed: gang gis na rnam pa sna tshogs nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir shes pa du ma skye bar rtogs pa legs par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa yul la bkram pa lta bur 'dug par yongs su 'dzin par skye ba yang med de /
translated: And it is not that consciousness is apprehended as extended like an object, because of which it would be understood that many consciousnesses arise in order to establish the variety of aspects.

original: lus can ma yin pa la yul na gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / yul na mi gnas pa rnams kyang byang dang / shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag tu @183b skye bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa la yul na gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / yul na mi gnas pa rnams kyang byang dang / shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag tu @183b skye bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for that which is not physical to abide in a place, and because it is impossible for that which does not abide in a place to arise in a specific direction, such as north or east.

original: de ltar mi skye na yang yul la bkram pa lta bur snang ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi skye na yang yul la bkram pa lta bur snang ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it did not arise in that way, it would be impossible for it to appear as if it were spread out over a place.

original: shes pa gcig dang ngo bo tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i ngo bo bzhin du rnam pa rnams ngo bo nyid gcig par thal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gcig dang ngo bo tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i ngo bo bzhin du rnam pa rnams ngo bo nyid gcig par thal ba yang yin no //
translated: And because it is not of a different nature from a single consciousness, it follows that, like the nature of consciousness, the aspects would be one.

original: tha dad pa yin na ni de dag kyang don bzhin du shes pas 'dzin par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ni de dag kyang don bzhin du shes pas 'dzin par mi 'thad de /
translated: If they are different, then, like objects, it is not tenable that they are apprehended by consciousness,

original: don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du rtog na yang rnam pa rnams thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro // de 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du rtog na yang rnam pa rnams thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are different objects.

original: rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan myong ba yang nam yang med do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan myong ba yang nam yang med do //
translated: And if you imagine that another aspect is for the sake of apprehending that, then there would be an infinite regress of aspects, but there is never an experience of another aspect.

original: 'on te de dag brdzun pa'i phyir de nyid rang gzhan nyid du bsam par rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag brdzun pa'i phyir de nyid rang gzhan nyid du bsam par rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that because they are false, it is not reasonable to think that they are the same or different,

original: 'o na de'i tshe de'i dbang gis don gzhan rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe de'i dbang gis don gzhan rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then at that time it is not reasonable to posit another object by their power,

original: de dag yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not real.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa yang brtags pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa yang brtags pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: The aspect of the object would also be only imagined.

original: gzhan yang gal te shes pa'i 'dra ba bdag nyid thams cad kyi yin na ni de'i tshe don bzhin du shes pa yang blun po'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te shes pa'i 'dra ba bdag nyid thams cad kyi yin na ni de'i tshe don bzhin du shes pa yang blun po'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the likeness of consciousness were of all of its own nature, then at that time consciousness, like the object, would have the nature of a fool.

original: rnal 'byor pa gzhan gyi sems shes pa rnams kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gzhan gyi sems shes pa rnams kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the consciousness of another‚Äôs mind of a yogin would be the same as that of one with attachment and so on,

original: gzhan gyi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it would apprehend the mind of another as having attachment and so on.

original: / phyogs gcig gis 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: / phyogs gcig gis 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not similar by one part,

original: gcig la cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the one would have parts.

original: ldog pa'i tha dad par nye bar brtags pas byas pa'i phyogs gcig pa nyid yin na ni thams cad la dngos po la sogs pa'i 'dra ba srid pa'i phyir thams cad kyang thams cad rig par byed par 'gyur la 'dra ba yang brtags par 'gyur gyi don damüîΩpa pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tha dad par nye bar brtags pas byas pa'i phyogs gcig pa nyid yin na ni thams cad la dngos po la sogs pa'i 'dra ba srid pa'i phyir thams cad kyang thams cad rig par byed par 'gyur la 'dra ba yang brtags par 'gyur gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is the one-pointedness that is made by the imputation of difference in the negation, then, because the similarity of entity, etc. is possible in everything, everything would be the knower of everything, and the similarity would be imputed, but not ultimately.

original: de'i phyir 'dra ba'i sgo nas shes pa ngo bo gzhan 'dzin par rigs pa pa ma yin te de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dra ba'i sgo nas shes pa ngo bo gzhan 'dzin par rigs pa pa ma yin te de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that consciousness, by way of similarity, apprehends another entity, because that is impossible.

original: 'dra ba yod du zin kyang 'on kyang don gzhan mngon sum nyid du ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba yod du zin kyang 'on kyang don gzhan mngon sum nyid du ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if there were similarity, still it is not reasonable that another object is directly perceived,

original: yul ni rgyu yin pa nyid kyis shes pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir dus de'i tshe na mi nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ni rgyu yin pa nyid kyis shes pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir dus de'i tshe na mi nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object, by being the cause, is experienced by consciousness, but at that time it is not near.

original: nye ba yin na yang de mi 'dzin pa nyid de /
analyzed: nye ba yin na yang de mi 'dzin pa nyid de /
translated: Even if it were near, it would not be apprehended.

original: shes pa bdag nyid la yod pa'i 'dra ba kho na myong ba'i phyir dang / gnyis pa don la yod pa'i rnam pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa bdag nyid la yod pa'i 'dra ba kho na myong ba'i phyir dang / gnyis pa don la yod pa'i rnam pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the mere similarity that exists in the cognition itself that is experienced, and because the form that exists in the object does not appear.

original: snang na yang de la yang brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs @184a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang na yang de la yang brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs @184a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it did appear, the same objection and response would apply.

original: gal te de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa 'di nyid 'di 'dzin pa yin no snyam du sems na brtags pa'i sgo nas yin du zad de /
analyzed: gal te de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa 'di nyid 'di 'dzin pa yin no snyam du sems na brtags pa'i sgo nas yin du zad de /
translated: If you think that the experience of a cognition that has that form is the apprehension of that, then it is merely imputed.

original: 'di tsam gyis dngos po de lta bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ba ni med de /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis dngos po de lta bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ba ni med de /
translated: But it is not the case that a thing becomes that nature merely by that.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that anything could be anything.

original: bram ze'i khye'u la me zhes nye bar brtags kyang sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa la rnam par sbyor ba ni med do //
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u la me zhes nye bar brtags kyang sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa la rnam par sbyor ba ni med do //
translated: Even though a young brahmin is designated as fire, he is not applied to burning, cooking, and so on.

original: rnam pa'i dbang gis don gzhan rnam par 'jog na yang de rjes su dpag pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbang gis don gzhan rnam par 'jog na yang de rjes su dpag pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if another object is posited by the power of the form, it would be inference alone.

original: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not be direct perception.

original: gang gis na de rtogs par 'gyur ba don gzhan nye bas rnam pa la khyab pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis na de rtogs par 'gyur ba don gzhan nye bas rnam pa la khyab pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the form of the object pervaded by the proximity of another object, by virtue of which it would be cognized.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dag na don gzhan med kyang rnam pa de lta bu srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dag na don gzhan med kyang rnam pa de lta bu srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a form is possible even in the absence of another object, as in dreams, etc.

original: don gzhan ni shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i phyir de shes pa de'i rnam pa can no zhes bya bar yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: don gzhan ni shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i phyir de shes pa de'i rnam pa can no zhes bya bar yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: And because the existence of another object is extremely obscure, it cannot be established that the cognition has the form of that object.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rnam pa gtod par 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rnam pa gtod par 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the cause of the form of the object the production of the effect, which is the projection of its own form, because

original: rang gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la mig la sogs pas 'khrul pa'i phyir dang / sgra la sogs pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang sgra la sogs par snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la mig la sogs pas 'khrul pa'i phyir dang / sgra la sogs pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang sgra la sogs par snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the eye, etc. are mistaken with regard to their own form, etc., and because the eye consciousness, etc. would appear as sound, etc., since the eye consciousness, etc. arise immediately after the cognition of sound, etc.

original: de ltar na re zhig snang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pas don gzhan 'dzin par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig snang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pas don gzhan 'dzin par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable that consciousness endowed with appearance apprehends another object.

original: snang ba med pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba med pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that it does not have appearance,

original: de ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not different from all.

original: gal te de'i tshe nye ba'i phyir rnam par shes pas gzhan 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar rtog na /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe nye ba'i phyir rnam par shes pas gzhan 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that at that time consciousness apprehends another object because it is close to it,üîΩthen at that time all consciousnesses would have as their object all objects that are close to it,üîΩbecause there is no difference in the presence of that in all.üîΩTherefore, all would see all.

original: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa thams cad don nye ba ma lus pa'i yul can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa thams cad don nye ba ma lus pa'i yul can du 'gyur te /
translated: Also, consciousnesses such as the ear would have as their object form and so on,üîΩbecause at that time there is no difference in their proximity.üîΩTherefore, this is the consciousness of blue,üîΩthis is the consciousness of yellow,üîΩthis is the consciousness of form,üîΩthis is the consciousness of sound,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the eye,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the ear,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the nose,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the tongue,

original: thams cad la de yod par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la de yod par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this is the consciousness of the body,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the mental faculty,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the eye faculty,

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyis thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyis thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: this is the consciousness of the ear faculty,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the nose faculty,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the tongue faculty,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the body faculty,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the mental faculty,üîΩthis is the consciousness of form,üîΩthis is the consciousness of sound,üîΩthis is the consciousness of smell,üîΩthis is the consciousness of taste,üîΩthis is the consciousness of tactility,üîΩthis is the consciousness of phenomena,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the eye constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the form constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the eye-consciousness constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the ear constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the sound constituent,

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can du 'gyur te /üîΩde'i tshe nye bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can du 'gyur te / de'i tshe nye bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this is the consciousness of the ear-consciousness constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the nose constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the smell constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the nose-consciousness constituent,

original: de'i phyir 'di ni sngon po shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni sngon po shes pa'o //
translated: this is the consciousness of the tongue constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the taste constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the tongue-consciousness constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the body constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the tactility constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the body-consciousness constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the mental constituent,üîΩthis is the consciousness of the phenomena constituent,

original: ser po shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ser po shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor would it be a differentiation in the form ‚Äúit is yellow consciousness,‚Äù

original: rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu khyad par 'ga' yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu khyad par 'ga' yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no cause of differentiation, no distinction, is accepted.

original: de khas len na ni de nyid 'dra ba las khas blangs bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de khas len na ni de nyid 'dra ba las khas blangs bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it were accepted, then it would be accepted as similar to that.

original: @184b rtog pa'i ngo bo tsam du khyad par med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la ni 'dra ba ma gtogs par bye brag tu 'byed pa gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @184b rtog pa'i ngo bo tsam du khyad par med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la ni 'dra ba ma gtogs par bye brag tu 'byed pa gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the nature of consciousness, which is not distinguished in the nature of mere cognition, there is no other distinction apart from similarity.

original: de la yang nyes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la yang nyes pa bshad zin to //
translated: The faults of that have already been explained.

original: 'o na de yang nye ba tsam gyi sgo kho na nas shes pas don gzhan myong bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na de yang nye ba tsam gyi sgo kho na nas shes pas don gzhan myong bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But if it is said that it is not the experience of a different object because it is known merely through proximity,

original: 'o na ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig ce na /
translated: what is it?

original: de las byung ba'i sgo nas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sgo nas yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is through arising from that,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: shes pa'i dus na de'i yul rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / med pa yang 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dus mnyam par mi rung ba'i phyir dang / su yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i dus na de'i yul rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / med pa yang 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dus mnyam par mi rung ba'i phyir dang / su yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when consciousness occurs, its object has no cause, because it is not possible to apprehend what does not exist, because it is not possible for the entity of cause and effect to be simultaneous, and because no one maintains that.

original: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa yang de'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa yang de'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it follows that the eye faculty, etc. would also be its cause, and thus would be its apprehender.

original: yul dang dus mnyam pa tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa kho na rnam par shes pas 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: yul dang dus mnyam pa tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa kho na rnam par shes pas 'dzin gyi /
translated: If you imagine that consciousness apprehends only that which is dependent on a single collection of object and sense faculty that are simultaneous,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtog na yang mig la sogs pa yang 'dzin par thal ba yang bzlog dka' ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtog na yang mig la sogs pa yang 'dzin par thal ba yang bzlog dka' ba nyid do //
translated: then it is difficult to avoid the consequence that the eye faculty, etc. would also be apprehended.

original: gal te dbang po yul ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'dzin to zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po yul ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'dzin to zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sense faculty is not apprehended because it is not an object,

original: de nyid yul ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid yul ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be the case that it is not an object.

original: yul gyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the characteristic of an object.

original: gzung ba nyid kyang yul gyi ngo bo las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba nyid kyang yul gyi ngo bo las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: And being an object of apprehension is not different from the nature of an object.

original: des na gang gi phyir yul ma yin pa de'i phyir yul ma yin no zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir yul ma yin pa de'i phyir yul ma yin no zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that because it is not an object, it is not an object.

original: de ltar na shes pa rnam pa med pas kyang don gzhan 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa rnam pa med pas kyang don gzhan 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, consciousness without an aspect is not reasonable as the apprehender of another object.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it reasonable that it has another aspect,

original: rnam par gzhag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no such thing as a classification of objects.

original: de lta na ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the auditory consciousness would also apprehend form and so on.

original: don gzhan lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan nyid kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gzhan lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan nyid kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the other object is hidden, it is not established that it has another aspect.

original: gang gis na don gzhan 'dzin par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis na don gzhan 'dzin par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since it does not have another aspect, it does not apprehend another object.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa don gzhan 'ga' yang rab tu ma grub pas don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu mngon sum du ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa don gzhan 'ga' yang rab tu ma grub pas don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu mngon sum du ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since no other object is established as cause and effect, ultimately cause and effect are not established as direct perception.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par na /
translated: Therefore, in reality,

original: des dben de yi rnam pa can //
analyzed: des dben de yi rnam pa can //
translated: And that which is devoid of that has the aspect of that.

original: mngon sum rnam pa gnyis kyis ni //
analyzed: mngon sum rnam pa gnyis kyis ni //
translated: By means of the two types of perception,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges //
translated: The fact of cause and effect is ascertained.

original: zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: That which was stated is not established.

original: gal te 'di snyam du /üîΩblo rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / cig shos kyi don gzhan yongs su gcod par mi rung ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras @185a * //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du / blo rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / cig shos kyi don gzhan yongs su gcod par mi rung ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras @185a * //
translated: If you think,

original: bu'i dngos po nges par bya ba'i tshad ma med du zin kyang 'on kyang shes pa gnyis med par smra ba la cung zad kyang gnod pa med de /
analyzed: bu'i dngos po nges par bya ba'i tshad ma med du zin kyang 'on kyang shes pa gnyis med par smra ba la cung zad kyang gnod pa med de /
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough there is no valid knowledge that ascertains the fact of cause and effect because it is not suitable for a cognition that has an aspect and a different object to be a valid knowledge that comprehends a different object, nevertheless there is no harm at all to the assertion that there is no second cognition.

original: rigs pa smra ba de'i ltar na dngos po thams cad sems tsam gyi lus gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa smra ba de'i ltar na dngos po thams cad sems tsam gyi lus gtso bo yin no //
translated: According to the logician, the body of all things is just mind.

original: de la don gzhan mngon sum du rigs pa ma yin du chug kyang ;
analyzed: de la don gzhan mngon sum du rigs pa ma yin du chug kyang ;
translated: Although it is not logical for a different object to be directly perceived,

original: shes pa nyid rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: shes pa nyid rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba yin la /
translated: cognition itself is to be realized by the direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa grub pa yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum du grub pa kho na yin no snyam du sems na de yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa grub pa yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum du grub pa kho na yin no snyam du sems na de yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: If you think that since the cause and effect are established, the entity of cause and effect is only directly perceptible, that is not tenable.

original: de kho na nyid ni ji lta ba bzhin ma myong ba'i phyir dang / ji ltar myong ba'i de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni ji lta ba bzhin ma myong ba'i phyir dang / ji ltar myong ba'i de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you do not experience reality as it is and because you do not experience reality as it is experienced.

original: 'di ltar khyed ni rnam par shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can du ma gyur pa dngos por yod par 'dod na de ni de lta bur myong ba med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed ni rnam par shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can du ma gyur pa dngos por yod par 'dod na de ni de lta bur myong ba med de /
translated: Thus, if you assert that consciousness that is not in the aspect of object and apprehender exists as a thing, it does not experience itself in that way.

original: dus thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i shes pa myong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dus thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i shes pa myong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because at all times consciousness is experienced as possessing the aspect of object and apprehender.

original: / de lta ma yin na thams cad de kho na mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de lta ma yin na thams cad de kho na mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, everyone would see reality.

original: shes pa de ni ji ltar myong ba de ltar gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de ni ji ltar myong ba de ltar gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That consciousness is not experienced in the way it exists.

original: gcig la gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of one is incompatible with the nature of two.

original: gal te de ni 'khrul pas de lta bu shes so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ni 'khrul pas de lta bu shes so zhe na /
translated: If it is known in that way through error,

original: 'khrul pa 'di gang yin /
analyzed: 'khrul pa 'di gang yin /
translated: what is this error?

original: gal te shes pa de nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te shes pa de nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is that very cognition,

original: 'o na de mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: then it is not direct perception,

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni ma 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni ma 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because the definition of direct perception is non-error,

original: de rtag tu bdag nyid la bdag nyid kho nas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyis kyi bdag nyid du yang de'i bdag nyid snang ba'i phyir gnyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid nyams par thal ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: de rtag tu bdag nyid la bdag nyid kho nas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro // gnyis kyi bdag nyid du yang de'i bdag nyid snang ba'i phyir gnyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid nyams par thal ba kho na yin te /
translated: and it is always itself in error with regard to itself.

original: gnyis dang gnyis ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it appears as the nature of two, it follows that the non-dual nature is destroyed, because two and non-two are mutually contradictory.

original: 'khrul pa don gzhan yin yang de dang rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa nyid yin pas des gnyis med pa de ltar shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa don gzhan yin yang de dang rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa nyid yin pas des gnyis med pa de ltar shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if error is a different object, it is ultimately self-awareness, so it does not know non-duality in that way.

original: gal te mngon sum ni rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam zhig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum ni rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam zhig yin no zhe na /
translated: If direct perception is merely the nature of conception,

original: 'o na ni mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin te /
translated: But if that is so, then perception is not a valid cognition that has a specifically characterized object as its object,

original: rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of conception is the object of a universal.

original: gzhan yang rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni rang gis gsal ba'i bdag nyid la bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag kyang rang gis gsal ba'i phyir rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni rang gis gsal ba'i bdag nyid la bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag kyang rang gis gsal ba'i phyir rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin no //
translated: Moreover, the nature of conception is said to be the nature of clarity of itself, but the aspects of the apprehended and apprehender are also the nature of clarity of themselves, so they are only the nature of conception.

original: de dag @185b kyang brdzun pa nyid yin na ni de dang 'dra bar de de dang tha mi dad pa rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang brdzun pa'i ngo bo yin na ji ltar mngon sum gyi tshad mas yang dag par 'grub pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag @185b kyang brdzun pa nyid yin na ni de dang 'dra bar de de dang tha mi dad pa rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang brdzun pa'i ngo bo yin na ji ltar mngon sum gyi tshad mas yang dag par 'grub pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor 'gyur /
translated: If they are false, then like them, the nature of conception, which is not different from them, is also a false nature. How could it be the nature of an entity that is established by the valid knowledge of perception?

original: khyad par rnams brdzun pa nyid yin na ni rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid spyi yang dngos por yod pa mi srid pa nyid de /
analyzed: khyad par rnams brdzun pa nyid yin na ni rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid spyi yang dngos por yod pa mi srid pa nyid de /
translated: If the distinctions are false, then it is impossible for the nature of conception, which is a universal, to be an existent entity.

original: spyi ni khyad par dag kho na la gzhan rnam par bcad nas tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni khyad par dag kho na la gzhan rnam par bcad nas tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal is only a particular, and it is designated by the exclusion of other things.

original: de lta na shes pa'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin mi myong ba'i phyir 'dis rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta na shes pa'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin mi myong ba'i phyir 'dis rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, because it does not experience the reality of consciousness as it is, it is not reasonable that it is the direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: shes pa rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid yin du zin kyang 'on kyang de las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: shes pa rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid yin du zin kyang 'on kyang de las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even if consciousness were the direct perception of reflexive awareness, still, the relation of cause and effect is not established.

original: rang gi bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two natures of cause and effect are contradictory, due to their identity.

original: ltos pa'i bye brag gis gnyi ga'i ngo bo brtags na yang /
analyzed: ltos pa'i bye brag gis gnyi ga'i ngo bo brtags na yang /
translated: Even if the nature of both is imagined due to the distinction of dependence,

original: ltos pa don gzhan yin pa nyid kyis rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: ltos pa don gzhan yin pa nyid kyis rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid ma yin na /
translated: if dependence is not the direct perception of reflexive awareness due to being a different object,

original: de ma grub pa'i phyir de la ltos nas rnam par gzhag pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang mngon sum nyid du rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma grub pa'i phyir de la ltos nas rnam par gzhag pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang mngon sum nyid du rig pa ma yin no //
translated: then, because it is not established, the nature of both, which is posited in dependence on that, is also not known to be direct perception.

original: shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo don gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang dus tha dad pa'i phyir shes pa gcig la myang ba med do //
analyzed: shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo don gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang dus tha dad pa'i phyir shes pa gcig la myang ba med do //
translated: Also, consciousness as cause and consciousness as effect are different things, and because they are different times, there is no experience of one consciousness by the other.

original: bdag nyid kho nar yongs su gtugs pa'i phyir 'di dag phan tshun rang gi ngo bo myong ba yang ma yin na shes pa gang zhig la de gnyis mngon sum du myong ba nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag nyid kho nar yongs su gtugs pa'i phyir 'di dag phan tshun rang gi ngo bo myong ba yang ma yin na shes pa gang zhig la de gnyis mngon sum du myong ba nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Since they are completely restricted to their own nature, they do not experience each other‚Äôs nature. So what consciousness experiences both of them?

original: de gnyis shes pa gcig la mi myong na ni gang gis kyang 'brel pa gzung bar mi nus so //üîΩshes pa gcig la snang ba yin du zin kyang 'di ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de gnyis shes pa gcig la mi myong na ni gang gis kyang 'brel pa gzung bar mi nus so // shes pa gcig la snang ba yin du zin kyang 'di ni rgyu'o //
translated: If they are not experienced by one consciousness, then no one can apprehend their relation.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes mngon sum du de gnyis de yod pa nyid kyi 'brel pa gzung bar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes mngon sum du de gnyis de yod pa nyid kyi 'brel pa gzung bar ni mi nus te /
translated: Even if they appear in one consciousness, one cannot apprehend their relation of existence as cause and effect by directly perceiving, ‚ÄúThis is the cause, that is the effect.‚Äù

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is nonconceptual.

original: kun tu 'brel pa ma bzung bar yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gzung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun tu 'brel pa ma bzung bar yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gzung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: And if the relation is not apprehended, the relation of cause and effect cannot be apprehended.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be the object of anything.

original: don dam par de'i rjes la thob pa gtan la 'bebs pa'i shes pas kyang de gnyis rung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par de'i rjes la thob pa gtan la 'bebs pa'i shes pas kyang de gnyis rung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not correct to say that the postmeditational cognition that ascertains the object of the meditative equipoise is the valid cognition that perceives the two truths,

original: des de dag nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de dag nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that postmeditational cognition does not experience the object of meditative equipoise.

original: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis gtan la 'bebs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis gtan la 'bebs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that one person's experience is ascertained by another,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyud gcig yin pa'i phyir gcig gis nyams su myong bar brtags pa yang @186a * //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // rgyud gcig yin pa'i phyir gcig gis nyams su myong bar brtags pa yang @186a * //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be the object of anything.

original: rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not correct to say that the object of meditative equipoise is experienced by the postmeditational cognition because they are of the same continuum,üîΩbecause

original: rgyud gcig pa nyid du brtags pa dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud gcig pa nyid du brtags pa dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not correct to say that they are of the same continuum.

original: rgyud can tha dad pa rnams kyang phan tshun myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud can tha dad pa rnams kyang phan tshun myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if they were of the same continuum, it would not be correct to say that one experiences the other,

original: gtan la 'bebs pa'i shes pa'i dus na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan la 'bebs pa'i shes pa'i dus na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of the ascertaining cognition, the cause and effect have already passed.

original: de'i phyir rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi sgo nas kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag pa pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi sgo nas kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag pa pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, even by way of reflexive awareness, a real cause and effect is not established.

original: ji ste gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu mngon sum du nyams su ma myong na ji ltar de la dran pa'i ngo bo skye bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ji ste gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu mngon sum du nyams su ma myong na ji ltar de la dran pa'i ngo bo skye bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIf a cause and effect are not experienced in a direct perception, how could a memory of it arise?‚Äù

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also illogical.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dag na don nyams su ma myong yang dran pa srid pa'i phyir dang / de yang rang gi ngo bor mthar thug pas don dam par gzhan nyams su myong bar mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dag na don nyams su ma myong yang dran pa srid pa'i phyir dang / de yang rang gi ngo bor mthar thug pas don dam par gzhan nyams su myong bar mi 'grub ste /
translated: Because even though an object is not experienced in dreams and so on, memory is possible, and because that is ultimately limited to its own nature, ultimately experiencing another is not established.

original: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As it was explained earlier.

original: de ltar na re zhig mngon sum gyi sgo nas ni de 'grub par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig mngon sum gyi sgo nas ni de 'grub par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, in the first place, it is illogical to establish that by way of direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not established by way of inference.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du nyams su myong ba'i chos can 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir gang la de'i dngos po rab tu bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du nyams su myong ba'i chos can 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir gang la de'i dngos po rab tu bsgrub par bya /
translated: Because no phenomenon whatsoever is established by direct perception, as has been explained, what thing would be established?

original: gtan tshigs thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo dang gzhi ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo dang gzhi ma grub pa yin no //
translated: And all reasons are not established with respect to their own nature and basis.

original: dpe'i chos can yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: dpe'i chos can yang ma grub ste /
translated: Also, the example is not established,

original: thams cad du brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in all cases the same objection applies.

original: gzhan yang re zhig 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis ni de'i dngos po bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis ni de'i dngos po bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, a reason of effect cannot establish the thing itself,

original: gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur la /
translated: because the error of mutual dependence would ensue.üîΩIf the nature of cause and effect were established, then a reason of effect would be possible.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yang dag par grub na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pas gcig la gcig brten pa nyid du gsal rab pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yang dag par grub na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pas gcig la gcig brten pa nyid du gsal rab pa nyid do //
translated: But if a reason of effect were established, then the nature of cause and effect would be established. It is clear that there would be mutual dependence.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang chos can ma grub pa'i phyir gang du 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang chos can ma grub pa'i phyir gang du 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Also, with respect to a reason of nature, where would it be applied, because the subject is not established?

original: chos can grub tu bcug na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam pa pa bsgrub par bya ba la gang du yang gtan tshigs la khyab pa ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: chos can grub tu bcug na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam pa pa bsgrub par bya ba la gang du yang gtan tshigs la khyab pa ni ma grub ste /
translated: Even if you allow that the subject is established, the reason is not established in any way with respect to the proof of the ultimate existence of the entity of cause and effect.

original: thams cad du brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the same in all cases to investigate and analyze.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste de yod na yod pa nyid ces bya ba 'di nye bar brjod pa yin na de yang 'khrul ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste de yod na yod pa nyid ces bya ba 'di nye bar brjod pa yin na de yang 'khrul ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, you have stated this, ‚ÄúIf that exists, it exists,‚Äù in order to prove the existence of cause and effect, but that is mistaken.

original: de'i rgyu dang dus mnyam pa na yod pa 'gro ba ma @186b lus pa yod na yod pa nyid yin yang de'i rgyu can nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang dus mnyam pa na yod pa 'gro ba ma @186b lus pa yod na yod pa nyid yin yang de'i rgyu can nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if all transmigrating beings exist at the same time as the cause, they exist, but it is impossible that they are the effect of that cause.

original: 'on te yang rgyun kho na la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis de yod na yod pa nyid du nges pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te yang rgyun kho na la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis de yod na yod pa nyid du nges pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du brjod kyi /
translated: But if you say that the continuum itself is the reason, since it exists when they exist and does not exist when they do not exist,

original: skad cig ma la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and that the reason is not the momentary state,

original: de yang 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu don dam pa pa grub pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu don dam pa pa grub pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not right, because this is the context of establishing ultimate cause and effect.

original: skad cig ma ma gtogs par don dam pa pa'i rgyun ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma gtogs par don dam pa pa'i rgyun ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For apart from the momentary state, the ultimate continuum is not established.üîΩThe momentary state of the effect is conceived to exist when the momentary state of the cause exists.

original: 'bras bu'i skad cig ma gang zhig rgyu'i skad cig ma gang zhig yod na yod par rtog pa de ni de dang dus mnyam pa na yod pa'i thams cad du gtogs pa'i skad cig ma ma lus pa yod na yod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i skad cig ma gang zhig rgyu'i skad cig ma gang zhig yod na yod par rtog pa de ni de dang dus mnyam pa na yod pa'i thams cad du gtogs pa'i skad cig ma ma lus pa yod na yod pa yang yin te /
translated: But it also exists when all the momentary states of the cause that exist at the same time as it exist.

original: ji ltar de rang gi rgyu'i skad cig ma yod na mthong la /
analyzed: ji ltar de rang gi rgyu'i skad cig ma yod na mthong la /
translated: For it is seen that it exists when its own causal state exists.

original: de med na ma mthong ba de bzhin du de'i rgyu'i skad cig ma dang dus mnyam pa na yod pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i skad cig ma ma lus pa yod na yang mthong la /
analyzed: de med na ma mthong ba de bzhin du de'i rgyu'i skad cig ma dang dus mnyam pa na yod pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i skad cig ma ma lus pa yod na yang mthong la /
translated: If it does not exist, then just as it is not seen, in the same way, when the moment that is its cause exists, all that is included in the existence of all moments without exception would be seen.

original: de med par yang ma mthong bas de de'i rgyu can nyid du yang ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de med par yang ma mthong bas de de'i rgyu can nyid du yang ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: But since it is not seen when it does not exist, why would it not be the cause of that?

original: gzhan yang de yod na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos can gzhan rgyur gyur pa la snyegs na de yang re zhig don dam par mngon sum du ma grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de yod na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos can gzhan rgyur gyur pa la snyegs na de yang re zhig don dam par mngon sum du ma grub ste /
translated: Moreover, in the statement ‚Äúbecause it exists when that exists,‚Äù if the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to another phenomenon that is the cause, then that is not established by direct perception in the ultimate sense.

original: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just as was explained earlier.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang chos can yod par grub pa mi srid de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang chos can yod par grub pa mi srid de /
translated: It is also impossible to establish the existence of the subject by inference.

original: yod par sgrub pa la gtan tshigs thams cad nyes pa gsum las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod par sgrub pa la gtan tshigs thams cad nyes pa gsum las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all reasons that prove existence do not escape the three errors.

original: 'di ltar chos can ma grub na re zhig yod pa'i chos ni gtan tshigs su mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos can ma grub na re zhig yod pa'i chos ni gtan tshigs su mi srid do //
translated: Thus, if the subject is not established, then it is impossible for an existent property to be a reason.

original: med pa'i chos kyang 'gal ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i chos kyang 'gal ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical for a nonexistent phenomenon to be contradictory.

original: gnyi ga'i chos ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i chos ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: A phenomenon of both is mistaken,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig gis bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig gis bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because it exists in the discordant side.üîΩThere is no other way to establish it.

original: de ma grub na cig shos kyi de yod na yod pa nyid kyang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de ma grub na cig shos kyi de yod na yod pa nyid kyang ma grub ste /
translated: If that is not established, then the establishment of the existence of the other when it exists is also not established,

original: de ni de la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that depends on it.

original: 'bras bu'i sgrub pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar mi srid pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgrub pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar mi srid pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the effect is also just as impossible.

original: des na 'dir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na 'dir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, here the relation of cause and effect is not established by means of a reason of nature.

original: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by means of nonobservation,

original: de thams cad ni dgag pa sgrub pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thams cad ni dgag pa sgrub pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all of those are only the establishment of a negation.

original: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub pa ni @187a * //
analyzed: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub pa ni @187a * //
translated: Also, the establishment of the relation of cause and effect

original: mngon sum du mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad pa de la yang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de las gzhan pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum kho na yin par dgongs kyi /
analyzed: mngon sum du mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad pa de la yang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de las gzhan pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum kho na yin par dgongs kyi /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not perceived in a direct perception‚Äù means that the word nonperception is intended to refer only to direct perception that has the nature of perceiving something else.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not inference.

original: de yang ji ltar chad ma ma yin pa de ltar sngar bshad zin pa pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar chad ma ma yin pa de ltar sngar bshad zin pa pa nyid do //
translated: And just as it is not direct perception, it is not inference, as was explained earlier.üîΩMoreover, the nonperception of an object that is perceptible is the effect of that object, because it is established as a causal relation through the process of concomitance.

original: gzhan yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa gang zhig gang yod na yang dag par dmigs pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par brjod pa de la yang don dam par
analyzed: gzhan yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa gang zhig gang yod na yang dag par dmigs pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par brjod pa de la yang don dam par
translated: But in reality,

original: the tshom za ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba kho na yin te /
translated: there is only doubt.

original: ci de kho na yod na yod pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci de kho na yod na yod pa zhig yin nam /
translated: Is it that it exists only when that exists?

original: 'on te mi snang ba sha za la sogs pa nye bas sam /
analyzed: 'on te mi snang ba sha za la sogs pa nye bas sam /
translated: Or is it that it does not appear because of the proximity of something else, such as a ghost?

original: 'on te yul thag ring po na gnas pa'i dngos po gzhan zhig nye ba'i stobs kyis zhes the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yul thag ring po na gnas pa'i dngos po gzhan zhig nye ba'i stobs kyis zhes the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Or is it a different thing, located far away, that is the cause of the visual consciousness, by virtue of its proximity?

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni de yul gzhan nas 'ong ba dang snga nas yod pa nyid 'gog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni de yul gzhan nas 'ong ba dang snga nas yod pa nyid 'gog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When a perceptible object is not perceived, it is the coming of the object from another place or its prior existence that is refuted.

original: gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But not the fact that it is the effect of something else.

original: de yod na yod pa nyid ni 'dod rgyal bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid ni 'dod rgyal bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: If it were, then the existence of the effect would be accidental.

original: zla ba la sogs pa yul thag ring po na gnas pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos por khas mi len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba la sogs pa yul thag ring po na gnas pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos por khas mi len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that the moon, etc., located far away, are not accepted as the cause of visual consciousness, etc.

original: gang yang de'i rgyu gzhan dag nus pa yin pa las gang zhig med na gang med pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes ldog pa'i sgo nas de 'grub par bshad pa de la yang don dam par na the tshom za ba las mi ldog pa nyid
analyzed: gang yang de'i rgyu gzhan dag nus pa yin pa las gang zhig med na gang med pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes ldog pa'i sgo nas de 'grub par bshad pa de la yang don dam par na the tshom za ba las mi ldog pa nyid
translated: And as for the explanation that the effect is that of which there is non-existence when there is non-existence of something, and existence when there is existence, of the other, the cause, that is established by implication, but in reality, it is not established by implication.

original: de gzhan sha za la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: de gzhan sha za la sogs pa'am /
translated: It is not the case that the self is the aggregates.üîΩ

original: yul thag ring po na gnas pa 'ga' zhig med na yang de med par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul thag ring po na gnas pa 'ga' zhig med na yang de med par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the case that it is nonexistent, because it is not certain that it does not exist, even though it is not perceived, like a carnivorous spirit or someone living far away.

original: de med na med pa 'dod rgyal ba nyid du yang srid pa'i phyir te /üîΩma chung mar len pa'i lugs can gyi yul nas skye ba'i 'bra  go //
analyzed: de med na med pa 'dod rgyal ba nyid du yang srid pa'i phyir te / ma chung mar len pa'i lugs can gyi yul nas skye ba'i 'bra  go //
translated: If it were nonexistent when not perceived, it would exist at will, because it would not exist when not perceived.

original: ma chung mar len pa med na med pa bzhin no //üîΩ'on te yang gzhan dag de'i rgyur nus pa yin pa las zhes khyad par du byas pa'i phyir the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ma chung mar len pa med na med pa bzhin no // 'on te yang gzhan dag de'i rgyur nus pa yin pa las zhes khyad par du byas pa'i phyir the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: For example, in the custom of taking one‚Äôs mother as a wife, a son would not have intercourse with his mother, because he does not perceive her as a woman.üîΩBut if he perceives her as a woman, he would have intercourse with her, because she would exist at will.

original: gzhan dag de'i rgyu nyid du nus pa'i khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag de'i rgyu nyid du nus pa'i khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that it is not uncertain because it is qualified by the statement, ‚ÄúIt is from the capacity of other things to be its cause,‚Äù that is not logical, because the qualification that other things are capable of being its cause is not established.

original: de ni de nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is to be established, because this is the context for establishing that.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la the tshom za ba yin na de nyid nges par bya ba'i @187b phyir de'i rgyu dag nus pa yin pa las shes rab tu ma grub pa'i khyad par smos pa mkhas pa rnams ji ltar nges par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la the tshom za ba yin na de nyid nges par bya ba'i @187b phyir de'i rgyu dag nus pa yin pa las shes rab tu ma grub pa'i khyad par smos pa mkhas pa rnams ji ltar nges par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If one doubts cause and effect, then in order to ascertain that, how will the experts ascertain the difference that the cause is able to produce, but is not established as wisdom?

original: de la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgom gtogs pa gzhan du gang gis na de'i khyad par 'grub par 'gyur ba de'i rgyu'i dngos por nges pa ni med de /
analyzed: de la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgom gtogs pa gzhan du gang gis na de'i khyad par 'grub par 'gyur ba de'i rgyu'i dngos por nges pa ni med de /
translated: In that regard, there is no ascertainment of the cause as a real entity that would establish its difference, since it is included in the meditation on forward and reverse concomitance.

original: de la yang thug pa med pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang thug pa med pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: In that regard, there is the fault of infinite regress.

original: de yod na yod pa nyid du grub kyang lhan cig byed pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid tha dad pa bzhin du de gzhan las kyang skye bar dogs pa gang gis bzlog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid du grub kyang lhan cig byed pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid tha dad pa bzhin du de gzhan las kyang skye bar dogs pa gang gis bzlog par 'gyur /
translated: Even if it is established that it exists when that exists, what prevents one from suspecting that it arises from something else, like a co-originating entity with a different nature?

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni de med par nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni de med par nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to ascertain its nonexistence merely by not seeing it,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: tshu rol mthong ba rnams la ni gang gis na gzhan las de mi 'byung ba nges par yang 'gyur ba ma lus pa gsal bar mthong ba ni med do //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba rnams la ni gang gis na gzhan las de mi 'byung ba nges par yang 'gyur ba ma lus pa gsal bar mthong ba ni med do //
translated: But for those who see only one side, there is no clear seeing of anything that would determine that it does not arise from something else.

original: gal te gzhan las kyang de 'byung na ni rgyu'i tha dad pa la tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan las kyang de 'byung na ni rgyu'i tha dad pa la tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it arises from something else, then the difference in the cause would not make a difference.

original: ma yin te de'i ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa lhan cig byed pa dag las kyang mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de'i ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa lhan cig byed pa dag las kyang mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it would follow, absurdly, that it would not arise from heterogeneous causes that are different in nature and characteristics.

original: gal te de la yang khyad par tha dad pa dag kho na la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams nye bar sbyor gyi /
analyzed: gal te de la yang khyad par tha dad pa dag kho na la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams nye bar sbyor gyi /
translated: If you say that it is only the different specific features that are the cooperative conditions for the effect,

original: 'bras bu kho na la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu kho na la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and that the effect itself is not,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: khyad par rnams don dam par de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnams don dam par de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately the specific features are not different from it.

original: gal te cha shas kyis kyang bskyed par bya ba nyid yin no snyam na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te cha shas kyis kyang bskyed par bya ba nyid yin no snyam na ma yin te /
translated: If you think that it is produced by parts, then that is not so.

original: gcig la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a single thing has no parts.

original: gal te khyad par rnams ni ldog pa'i bye brag tu nye bar brtags pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid du bsam par rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par rnams ni ldog pa'i bye brag tu nye bar brtags pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid du bsam par rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the differences are merely imputed to the exclusions, and therefore it is not correct to think of them as being the same or different,

original: 'o na ni de dag khyad par rnams la byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de dag khyad par rnams la byed pa ma yin te /
translated: then they do not function with regard to the differences,
