original: 'ga' yang brtags pa dag gis rgyu nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩtshogs pa kho nas skyed pa dang / tha dad par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ga' yang brtags pa dag gis rgyu nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro // tshogs pa kho nas skyed pa dang / tha dad par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: because it is not possible for anything to be a cause of imputations.üîΩIt is not correct to say that the collection itself is the producer and the differentiator,

original: so so re re nas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: so so re re nas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: but that the individual members are not.

original: tshogs pa can las ma gtogs par tshogs pa ma grub pas tshogs pa rnams re re zhing rgyur khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa can las ma gtogs par tshogs pa ma grub pas tshogs pa rnams re re zhing rgyur khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the collection is not established as anything other than the members of the collection, the members of the collection are accepted as the individual causes.

original: de lta bas na don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par bya ba'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par bya ba'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med de /
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest valid cognition that establishes the relation of cause and effect in reality.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa kho na yin pa la slob dpon rnams kyis rjes su 'gro @188a * //üîΩba dang ldog pa'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ji ltar grags pa bzhin du grub pa nye bar brjod kyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa kho na yin pa la slob dpon rnams kyis rjes su 'gro @188a * // ba dang ldog pa'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ji ltar grags pa bzhin du grub pa nye bar brjod kyi /
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gzung bar bya'o //üîΩde ltar na re zhig mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa pa yang dag par grub par bya ba'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gzung bar bya'o // de ltar na re zhig mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa pa yang dag par grub par bya ba'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med de /
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:

original: sgra la sogs pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir la /üîΩtshad ma ma yin pa ni tshad ma 'di gnyis po kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrtag pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par grub par bya ba'i tshad ma yang med de /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir la / tshad ma ma yin pa ni tshad ma 'di gnyis po kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro // rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par grub par bya ba'i tshad ma yang med de /
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:

original: 'di ltar de yang mngon sum gyi sgo nas ni mi 'grub ste ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de yang mngon sum gyi sgo nas ni mi 'grub ste ;
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:üîΩThe master

original: de yang snga ma bzhin du shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa la sogs pas 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang snga ma bzhin du shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa la sogs pas 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, as previously explained, it is not tenable that consciousness and its aspects apprehend it.

original: bdag la sogs pa rtag pa'i dngos po ni gang du yang ji ltar rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las nye bar brtags pa bzhin mngon sum gyi sems la snang bar mngon pa med do //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa rtag pa'i dngos po ni gang du yang ji ltar rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las nye bar brtags pa bzhin mngon sum gyi sems la snang bar mngon pa med do //
translated: Nowhere is a permanent thing such as the self ever directly perceived in a way that accords with the way it is imagined in one‚Äôs philosophical tenets.

original: de mngon sum gyi sems kyi yul nyid yin na ni de yod pa tsam gyis yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dus thams cad du yod par thal ba yin te /
analyzed: de mngon sum gyi sems kyi yul nyid yin na ni de yod pa tsam gyis yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dus thams cad du yod par thal ba yin te /
translated: If it were the object of direct perception, then it would follow that it would exist at all times, because it would exist merely by its existence.

original: gzhan dag gis khyad par du byar med pa ni de la ltos par mi rung ba'i phyir dang / rgyu ma yin pa yang yul nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis khyad par du byar med pa ni de la ltos par mi rung ba'i phyir dang / rgyu ma yin pa yang yul nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were the object of direct perception, then it would not be tenable for it to be independent of other factors, because it would not be tenable for a noncause to be an object.

original: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yul nyid du nye bar brtags na yang de'i rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar rtag pa nyid du thal ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yul nyid du nye bar brtags na yang de'i rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar rtag pa nyid du thal ba yin te /
translated: If you impute the nature of an object to the object of consciousness, then consciousness of that object would also be permanent.üîΩ

original: des rnam par shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid rjes su 'brangs na de yang rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rnam par shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid rjes su 'brangs na de yang rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you imagine that the object is the nature of the object of consciousness, then the consciousness of that object would also be permanent, because the nature of the object of consciousness would follow it.

original: de lta ma yin na des rnam par shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid rjes su 'brang bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na des rnam par shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid rjes su 'brang bar mi rung ste /
translated: If that were not so, then the nature of the object of consciousness would not follow it.

original: des rnam par shes par bya ba nyid ni de la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rnam par shes par bya ba nyid ni de la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the object of consciousness depends on it.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang mi 'grub ste /
translated: It is also not established by inference,

original: de dang rtags 'ga' yang lhan cig 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rtags 'ga' yang lhan cig 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that it is related to any evidence.

original: 'di ltar re zhig 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni mi srid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni mi srid de /
translated: In this way, the inference of an effect is impossible,

original: de las rim dang cig car dag gis 'bras bu 'ga' yang mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las rim dang cig car dag gis 'bras bu 'ga' yang mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because no effect arises from it either gradually or instantaneously.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i don dang ni 'ga' yang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i don dang ni 'ga' yang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to apprehend anything as having the nature of cause and effect with a non-existent object.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas yang dag @188b par rtogs par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas yang dag @188b par rtogs par bya ba yin na /
translated: The nature of cause and effect is to be understood correctly through positive and negative concomitance.

original: bdag la sogs pa ni gang du yang 'bras bu bde ba la sogs pa la rjes su 'gro bar ma grub ste /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa ni gang du yang 'bras bu bde ba la sogs pa la rjes su 'gro bar ma grub ste /
translated: But it is not established anywhere that the self, etc. are positively concomitant with the effect, pleasure, etc.

original: de ma tshang ba med pa yin yang /
analyzed: de ma tshang ba med pa yin yang /
translated: Because even when they are not incomplete,

original: res 'ga' bde ba la sogs pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' bde ba la sogs pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: pleasure, etc. are not sometimes produced.

original: ldog pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they negatively concomitant,

original: de ni rtag pa nyid kyis ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa nyid kyis ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, being permanent, they are not absent.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang de yod pa bsgrub pa mi srid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang de yod pa bsgrub pa mi srid de /
translated: Nor is it possible to prove that it exists through a reason based on the nature of things,

original: gzhi chos can 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir dang / yod pa de bsgrub pa la gtan tshigs thams cad snga ma bzhin du nyes pa gsum las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi chos can 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir dang / yod pa de bsgrub pa la gtan tshigs thams cad snga ma bzhin du nyes pa gsum las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because no basis, i.e. subject, is established at all, and because, in proving that it exists, all reasons are not beyond the three errors, as before.

original: chos can gzugs la sogs pa grag pa gang yin pa de dag kyang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can gzugs la sogs pa grag pa gang yin pa de dag kyang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and whatever is renowned as the subject, form, etc., is not ultimately established.

original: de dag ni res 'ga' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi sgo nas kyang rtag pa nyid dang / de la ltos pa nyid du 'thad par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni res 'ga' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi sgo nas kyang rtag pa nyid dang / de la ltos pa nyid du 'thad par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are occasional, it is difficult to establish their permanence and dependence on that, even conventionally.

original: mi dmigs pas kyang de yod par grub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas kyang de yod par grub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor can their existence be established by the non-apprehension of the object,

original: de ni dgag pa grub par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni dgag pa grub par nus pa yin te /
translated: because that can establish a negation,

original: de ni dgag pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dgag pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the establishment of a negation.

original: gzhan yang re zhig rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni mi srid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni mi srid de /
translated: Moreover, the non-apprehension of an intrinsic reality is impossible,

original: de ni med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa yin no //
translated: because that establishes the convention of non-existence.

original: dbang pos mi sod pa'i don dang 'ga' yang lhan cig 'gal ba dang khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'ang ma grub pa'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa yang mi srid do //
analyzed: dbang pos mi sod pa'i don dang 'ga' yang lhan cig 'gal ba dang khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'ang ma grub pa'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa yang mi srid do //
translated: And the apprehension of a contradictory object, etc., is impossible, because the object not apprehended by the sense faculties, the contradictory object, the pervaded and the pervader, and the relation of cause and effect are not established.

original: tshad ma gnyis las ma gtogs pa tshad ma gzhan yang med do zhes /
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis las ma gtogs pa tshad ma gzhan yang med do zhes /
translated: There is no other valid cognition apart from the two valid cognitions.

original: gzhan du gtan la phab pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gtan la phab pa yin no //
translated: This is established elsewhere.

original: de lta bas na dngos po'i ngo bo nyid brtag pa la yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med pas de'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pas de la yang don dam pa pa'i yod par tha snyad mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po'i ngo bo nyid brtag pa la yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med pas de'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pas de la yang don dam pa pa'i yod par tha snyad mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is not the slightest bit of a proof of the intrinsic reality of things, the one who is rational should not make the convention that anything exists ultimately.

original: sbyor ba dag ni gang zhig gang la don dam par gang yod par grub par bya ba'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pas yang dag par de bzhin du gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba dag ni gang zhig gang la don dam par gang yod par grub par bya ba'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pas yang dag par de bzhin du gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not the slightest bit established by a valid cognition as existing ultimately should not be grasped as really existing in that way by the one who is rational,

original: dper na sngo ba sangs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du mo gsham gyi bu dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sngo ba sangs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du mo gsham gyi bu dag lta bu'o //
translated: like the son of a barren woman as possessing the qualities of being blue and so on.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa pa ji skad bshad pa gnyi ga yang yang dag par grub par bya ba la yang tshad ma cung zad kyang med pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can @189a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa pa ji skad bshad pa gnyi ga yang yang dag par grub par bya ba la yang tshad ma cung zad kyang med pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can @189a * //
translated: Since there is not the slightest valid cognition that establishes either of the two kinds of reality of things, as they have been explained, the non-apprehension of the pervader is present, and it has the effect of refuting the expression ‚Äúexistence.‚Äù

original: yin te / rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi yod pa'i tha snyad ni tshad mas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi yod pa'i tha snyad ni tshad mas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the expression ‚Äúexistence‚Äù for those who have ideas is pervaded by valid cognition.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyas par rab tu bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyas par rab tu bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished, as has been extensively established.

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po mi 'thad pa dang / rtog pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du thal ba dang bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po mi 'thad pa dang / rtog pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du thal ba dang bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Since the relation of the pervaded and the pervader is untenable, and since the absurd consequence of being devoid of ideas follows, and since there is a valid cognition that contradicts the opposite of the reason, therefore the reason is not uncertain.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: And since it is present only in similar instances, it is not contradictory.

original: ji ste gal te yod pa dang med pa'i tha snyad la tshad mas khyab po zhes bya bar khas len par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po grub pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste gal te yod pa dang med pa'i tha snyad la tshad mas khyab po zhes bya bar khas len par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po grub pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that the conventions of existence and nonexistence are pervaded by valid cognition, then at that time things would definitely be established.

original: 'di ltar khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po ni gang du yang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa med par ldog pa tsam gyi sgo nas 'grub par mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po ni gang du yang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa med par ldog pa tsam gyi sgo nas 'grub par mi srid do //
translated: Because the pervaded and the pervader are not ascertained to be concomitant, it is impossible to establish them by means of mere contradistinction.

original: ldog pa nges pa yang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa med par mi srid de /
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa yang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa med par mi srid de /
translated: And the ascertainment of contradistinction is impossible without the ascertainment of concomitance.

original: gang zhig gang yod na yod pa ma yin pa de ni ji ltar de log pa na ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod na yod pa ma yin pa de ni ji ltar de log pa na ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which does not exist when something exists be contradistinct from it when it is contradistinct?

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no relation.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar tshad mas khyab pa'i rjes su 'gro bar 'dod pa dang dngos po yod pa'i tha snyad khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar tshad mas khyab pa'i rjes su 'gro bar 'dod pa dang dngos po yod pa'i tha snyad khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that the conventions of existence and nonexistence are pervaded by valid cognition and that things exist.

original: de khas blangs na ni 'ga' zhig tu gang la 'di yod pa kho na yin no zhes yod pa'i tha snyad tshad ma yod pa'i rjes su byed pa can rab tu grub pa de nyid kho bo cag gi dngos po rab tu grub pa yin no zhe na
analyzed: de khas blangs na ni 'ga' zhig tu gang la 'di yod pa kho na yin no zhes yod pa'i tha snyad tshad ma yod pa'i rjes su byed pa can rab tu grub pa de nyid kho bo cag gi dngos po rab tu grub pa yin no zhe na
translated: If you accept that, then the mere existence of the conventional expression ‚Äúexists‚Äù is the existence of something, and it is established that it is the basis of the conventional expression ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: / de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: 'di ltar yod pa'i tha snyad tshad mas khyab tu zin kyang tshad ma tsam gyi sgo nas ni 'di nges par don dam pa pa'i dngos por yod pa'i yul can du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa'i tha snyad tshad mas khyab tu zin kyang tshad ma tsam gyi sgo nas ni 'di nges par don dam pa pa'i dngos por yod pa'i yul can du mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even though the conventional expression ‚Äúexists‚Äù is pervaded by valid knowledge, it is not established that valid knowledge alone is the subject that ascertains the object that ultimately exists.

original: khyab par byed pa nye ba ni khyab par bya ba'i khyad par nges par gtan la 'bebs par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa nye ba ni khyab par bya ba'i khyad par nges par gtan la 'bebs par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere presence of the pervader is not able to ascertain the particular pervaded.

original: de ni gzhan la yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that the pervaded is not present in the pervader.

original: de lta ma yin na shing nyid kyis kyang shing sha pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams nges par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na shing nyid kyis kyang shing sha pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams nges par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then the mere tree would ascertain the particular trees such as ≈õim≈õapƒÅ and so on.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa nyid ma yin nam //
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa nyid ma yin nam //
translated: Isn‚Äôt this contradictory?

original: 'di ltar shing nyid ni khyad par ma lus pa'i thun mong yin pa'i phyir de ba la sogs pa'i khyad par nges par gtan la 'bebs par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing nyid ni khyad par ma lus pa'i thun mong yin pa'i phyir de ba la sogs pa'i khyad par nges par gtan la 'bebs par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, since wood itself is the common locus of all the distinctions, it is not possible to ascertain the distinctions of tree and so on.

original: tshad ma ni dngos po'i ngo bo 'das nas gzhan gang la yang mi srid do //
analyzed: tshad ma ni dngos po'i ngo bo 'das nas gzhan gang la yang mi srid do //
translated: And since a valid cognition is not possible in regard to anything other than the nature of an entity,

original: de lta na ni de dngos po med pa la yang 'jug @189b pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid nyams pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni de dngos po med pa la yang 'jug @189b pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid nyams pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since it would engage even in the absence of an entity, it would certainly be invalid.

original: de lta bas na tshad ma thams cad ni dngos pos mngon par khyab pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad ma thams cad ni dngos pos mngon par khyab pa kho na yin la /
translated: Thus, all valid cognitions are only directly related to entities.

original: des khyab pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis byung ba'i tha snyad 'jug na yang tshad mas rtogs pa'i dngos po kho na la 'jug pas de'i phyir 'di shing nyid la sogs pa bzhin du thun mong nyid du lta ga la yin zhe na /
analyzed: des khyab pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis byung ba'i tha snyad 'jug na yang tshad mas rtogs pa'i dngos po kho na la 'jug pas de'i phyir 'di shing nyid la sogs pa bzhin du thun mong nyid du lta ga la yin zhe na /
translated: And when a convention is engaged through the power of a valid cognition that relates to that, it is engaged only in regard to an entity that is cognized by the valid cognition. Therefore, how could it be common, like wood and so on?

original: de ni mi rung ste tshad ma 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi don gyi yul can yang yod do zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste tshad ma 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi don gyi yul can yang yod do zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: That is not correct, because it has already been explained that there are valid cognitions that have as their object the conventional truth of the world.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te tshad ma thams cad don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i yul can zhig tu gyur na ni thams cad de kho na nyid mthong ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te tshad ma thams cad don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i yul can zhig tu gyur na ni thams cad de kho na nyid mthong ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, if all valid cognitions had as their object ultimate things, then everyone would be seeing reality alone.

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid mthong bar 'dod pa rnams 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa sgrim pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid mthong bar 'dod pa rnams 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa sgrim pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be pointless for those who desire to see reality to strive to cultivate the noble path.

original: smra ba po rnams de kho na nyid la rtsod par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smra ba po rnams de kho na nyid la rtsod par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And debaters would not debate about reality.

original: thams cad don dam pa rtogs pa nyid kyis yid gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad don dam pa rtogs pa nyid kyis yid gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everyone would be free of doubt, having realized the ultimate.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos byed pa yang don med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos byed pa yang don med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it would follow that the composition of a treatise on the definition of valid knowledge would be pointless.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par rmongs pa zlog pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par rmongs pa zlog pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because its result would be the reversal of confusion.

original: de kho na nyid rtogs par bya ba la yang thams cad kyis rnam par rmongs pa'i go skabs thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshan nyid byed pa rnams kyis de'i mtshan nyid phan tshun 'gal bar byed par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs par bya ba la yang thams cad kyis rnam par rmongs pa'i go skabs thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro // mtshan nyid byed pa rnams kyis de'i mtshan nyid phan tshun 'gal bar byed par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: and it is also the case that the opportunity for complete confusion about the realization of reality is far removed.üîΩAnd the characteristics of the various schools do not contradict each other,

original: grub pa'i mtha' tha dad par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' tha dad par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: nor do the different philosophical systems contradict each other,

original: de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of reality is one.

original: de lta bas na tha snyad pa'i tshad ma don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa yang tha snyad kyi tshad ma srid pa'i phyir tshad ma thams cad don dam pa pa'i dngos pos khyab pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na tha snyad pa'i tshad ma don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa yang tha snyad kyi tshad ma srid pa'i phyir tshad ma thams cad don dam pa pa'i dngos pos khyab pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though conventional valid cognition does not have as its object an ultimate entity, since conventional valid cognition is possible, all valid cognitions are not necessarily pervaded by an ultimate entity.

original: don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i yul can nyid ma yin yang rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ji ltar 'dod pa'i don yang dag par 'thob pa tsam gyi sgo nas tha snyad pa'i mtshan ma rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i yul can nyid ma yin yang rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ji ltar 'dod pa'i don yang dag par 'thob pa tsam gyi sgo nas tha snyad pa'i mtshan ma rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Even though it does not have as its object an ultimate entity, it is like a dream, etc., and it is posited as conventional valid cognition merely from the point of view of the attainment of the desired object.

original: de'i yul la ni don dam pa pa zhes ming du 'dogs kyang brtsad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i yul la ni don dam pa pa zhes ming du 'dogs kyang brtsad pa med do //
translated: Although the object of that is designated by the name ‚Äúultimate,‚Äù there is no dispute.

original: 'on kyang lus can rnams dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas 'khor ba'i btson ra nas thar bar 'gyur ba de nyid de dag gi ma rig pa'i yul las bzlog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyiüîΩspyod yul yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'o @190a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus can rnams dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas 'khor ba'i btson ra nas thar bar 'gyur ba de nyid de dag gi ma rig pa'i yul las bzlog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'o @190a * //
translated: However, it is the ultimate because it is the nature of the object that is the opposite of the ignorance of those who are to be trained, since it is the nature of the object that is the realization of the nature of things just as it is by embodied beings, and it is the object of uncontaminated wisdom.

original: zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as the ultimate because it is the object of uncontaminated wisdom.

original: skye bo rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa sgrub par rung ba'i don thob pa tsam gyi sgo nas ni grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bo rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa sgrub par rung ba'i don thob pa tsam gyi sgo nas ni grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: One is not liberated merely by attaining the object that is suitable to perform the function of the object that is desired by beings.

original: thams cad rnam par grol ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par grol ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow that everyone would be liberated.

original: de lta bas na tshad ma ni mi slu ba'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad ma ni mi slu ba'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du thun mong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore this is the common definition of valid knowledge: Valid knowledge is a nondeceptive consciousness.

original: des ni yod pa'i tha snyad la khyab kyang de nges par yang dag pa pa'i don gyi yul can nyid du rab tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ji ltar de la yang dag pa pa'i dngos po yang dag par 'grub /
analyzed: des ni yod pa'i tha snyad la khyab kyang de nges par yang dag pa pa'i don gyi yul can nyid du rab tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ji ltar de la yang dag pa pa'i dngos po yang dag par 'grub /
translated: Therefore, how could a real thing be established as real in that context?

original: 'di la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa 'di yang yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa 'di yang yod pa nyid de /
translated: The proof of the term ‚Äúexists‚Äù is not undermined by any valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar gang dag don dam par rang dang / gzhan dang / gnyi ga las skye ba dang / rgyu med pa las skye ba dang bral ba de dag ni yang dag par na ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag don dam par rang dang / gzhan dang / gnyi ga las skye ba dang / rgyu med pa las skye ba dang bral ba de dag ni yang dag par na ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, those things that are free from ultimate arising from self, other, both, and causelessly are, in reality, devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: dper na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are just like, for example, a sky flower and so on.

original: rang dang gzhan gyis yang dag par yod par smras pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyis yang dag par yod par smras pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ba kho na yin no //
translated: All things that are said to exist in reality by ourselves and others are just like that.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar re zhig grangs can la sogs pa gang dag rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas so zhes rjod par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig grangs can la sogs pa gang dag rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas so zhes rjod par byed cing /
translated: Translation: ‡Ωë‡Ω∫‡ºã‡Ω£‡æü‡Ω¢‡ºã‡Ω¢‡Ω∫‡ºã‡Ωû‡Ω≤‡ΩÇ‡ºã‡ΩÇ‡æ≤‡ΩÑ‡Ω¶‡ºã‡ΩÖ‡Ωì‡ºã‡Ω£‡ºã‡Ω¶‡Ωº‡ΩÇ‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ωî‡ºã‡ΩÇ‡ΩÑ‡ºã‡Ωë‡ΩÇ‡ºã‡Ω¢‡æí‡æ±‡Ω¥‡ºã‡Ωâ‡Ω≤‡Ωë‡ºã‡Ω†‡Ωñ‡æ≤‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ωñ‡Ω¥‡Ω†‡Ω≤‡ºã‡Ωñ‡Ωë‡ΩÇ‡ºã‡Ωâ‡Ω≤‡Ωë‡ºã‡Ωë‡Ω¥‡ºã‡Ω¢‡æ£‡Ωò‡ºã‡Ωî‡Ω¢‡ºã‡ΩÇ‡Ωì‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ω¶‡Ωº‡ºã‡Ωû‡Ω∫‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ω¢‡æó‡Ωº‡Ωë‡ºã‡Ωî‡Ω¢‡ºã‡Ωñ‡æ±‡Ω∫‡Ωë‡ºã‡ΩÖ‡Ω≤‡ΩÑ‡ºã‡ºç

original: dngos po rnams dang kho na las skye bar nye bar brjod pa de dag ni thang cig rig pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams dang kho na las skye bar nye bar brjod pa de dag ni thang cig rig pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Things that are said to arise from self alone are not at all momentary.üîΩ

original: dngos po yod pa dang med pa ni bdag nyid kyi rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa dang med pa ni bdag nyid kyi rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is untenable that an existent or nonexistent thing is the cause of itself.üîΩ

original: 'di ltar dngos pos bdag nyid skyed na grub pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos pos bdag nyid skyed na grub pa'am /
translated: If an entity generates itself, is it generated when it is already existent or when it is not yet existent?

original: ma grub pa zhig skyed par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ma grub pa zhig skyed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it were, it would be produced without having existed.üîΩ

original: de la re zhig ma grub pa ni mi skyed de ;
analyzed: de la re zhig ma grub pa ni mi skyed de ;
translated: First, that which is not established does not give rise to itself.üîΩ

original: de ni de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ci zhig gang gi skyed pa por 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ci zhig gang gi skyed pa por 'gyur /
translated: Because it does not exist at that time, what would it be that is the producer of what?

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yongs su ma grub pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid skyed par nus pa ma yin no //üîΩgrub pa yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yongs su ma grub pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid skyed par nus pa ma yin no //üîΩgrub pa yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The son of a barren woman and so on, which are not established by way of their own nature, are not able to generate their own nature.üîΩNor does that which is established generate,üîΩ

original: bye brag med pa nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid kyang grub pa'i phyir ci zhig gang gis bskyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: bye brag med pa nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid kyang grub pa'i phyir ci zhig gang gis bskyed par 'gyur /
translated: Because of their non-difference, the nature of the effect is also already established. So what would generate what?

original: gang zhig grub na gang ma grub pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig grub na gang ma grub pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If something is established, it is not logical that something else that is not established is its nature.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid dag yin na bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos por rigs kyi /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid dag yin na bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos por rigs kyi /
translated: If they are the object that is benefited and the benefactor, then it is logical that they are the object that is generated and the generator.

original: ngo bo @190b nyid de grub na phan gdags par bya ba'i ngo bo phra rab kyang cung zad med pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar na bskyed par bya ba nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: ngo bo @190b nyid de grub na phan gdags par bya ba'i ngo bo phra rab kyang cung zad med pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar na bskyed par bya ba nyid du 'gyur /
translated: But if the nature of the effect is already established, then the object that is benefited has no existence whatsoever, so how could it be the object that is generated?

original: 'on te de khyad par du byar med pa yin yang bskyed par bya ba nyid rgyu med pa can kho nar nye bar rtog par byed pa na ni de'i tshe shes pa yod pa la yang ci'i phyir kun tu ma brtags /
analyzed: 'on te de khyad par du byar med pa yin yang bskyed par bya ba nyid rgyu med pa can kho nar nye bar rtog par byed pa na ni de'i tshe shes pa yod pa la yang ci'i phyir kun tu ma brtags /
translated: But if you imagine that the object that is generated has no cause and is not distinguished by anything else, then why do you not imagine that a consciousness that exists has no cause?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba nyid du nang gi skye mched la sogs pa dag la yang der rtog par ma byed cig / de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis nang gi skye mched ni rang las skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba nyid du nang gi skye mched la sogs pa dag la yang der rtog par ma byed cig / de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis nang gi skye mched ni rang las skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: For that reason, the learned do not assert that internal bases such as eyes arise from themselves because they exist, like the existence of consciousness.

original: yod pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa bzhin no zhes thal bar bsgrub pa 'di nye bar brjod pa 'dir thal ba'i don mi shes pa kha cig 'di la dpe ma grub pa nyid dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid rjod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa bzhin no zhes thal bar bsgrub pa 'di nye bar brjod pa 'dir thal ba'i don mi shes pa kha cig 'di la dpe ma grub pa nyid dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid rjod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de
translated: Some who do not understand the meaning of the reductio being urged here say that this reductio commits the fallacy of an unestablished example and that the reason is contradictory.

original: dag gis yongs su ma shes pa'i nyes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dag gis yongs su ma shes pa'i nyes pa kho na yin te /
translated: This is a fault of their not understanding the meaning of the reductio.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag la phan tshun 'gal ba yang dag par brjod par 'dod pas pha rol la grub pa shes pa yod pa la sogs pa kho na rjes su zlos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag la phan tshun 'gal ba yang dag par brjod par 'dod pas pha rol la grub pa shes pa yod pa la sogs pa kho na rjes su zlos pa yin gyi /
translated: For, those who wish to state a contradiction to others repeat the opponent‚Äôs position, such as ‚ÄúConsciousness exists because it exists.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid la yang dag par grub pa'i dngos po la cung zad kyang mi 'dod par thal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid la yang dag par grub pa'i dngos po la cung zad kyang mi 'dod par thal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not follow that we deny the existence of anything that is truly established for ourselves.

original: shes pa yod pa yang gzhan dag la yang dag par ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa yang gzhan dag la yang dag par ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the existence of consciousness not established for others.

original: de'i phyir dpe ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la //
translated: Therefore, the example is not unestablished.

original: gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te /üîΩrang gi rgyud kyis rtag pa dang / gcig pa nyid kyi rnam grangs ngo bo bsgrub pa la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te / rang gi rgyud kyis rtag pa dang / gcig pa nyid kyi rnam grangs ngo bo bsgrub pa la /
translated: Nor is the reason contradictory.

original: de lta bu'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason and example are not unestablished in the proof of the property of the position that the self is permanent and unitary.üîΩThe mere statement of the other‚Äôs position is not a proof.

original: de ni gzhan dag phan tshun ma 'brel ba nyid du brjod pa ni bsnyad pa tsam zhig brjod par 'dod par zad kyi /
analyzed: de ni gzhan dag phan tshun ma 'brel ba nyid du brjod pa ni bsnyad pa tsam zhig brjod par 'dod par zad kyi /
translated: The statement of the other‚Äôs position is merely the expression of what is desired to be said.

original: rang gi rgyud kyis dngos po'i chos rab tu sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyis dngos po'i chos rab tu sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a proof of the property of the position that the self is a thing that is permanent and unitary.

original: de rab tu sgrub na de la 'gal ba nyid brjod par rigs te /
analyzed: de rab tu sgrub na de la 'gal ba nyid brjod par rigs te /
translated: If it were a proof, it would be correct to state a contradiction.

original: de la ni gtan tshigs dang dpe dag rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir de brjod pa 'brel pa med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la ni gtan tshigs dang dpe dag rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir de brjod pa 'brel pa med pa kho na yin no //
translated: In that case, the reason and example are not established at all, and so the statement is completely irrelevant.

original: 'on te dngos po'i bdag nyid yongs su grub kyang phan pa nyid 'ga' zhig khas len na ni de'i tshe de dang phan pa tha dad pa de rang las skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po'i bdag nyid yongs su grub kyang phan pa nyid 'ga' zhig khas len na ni de'i tshe de dang phan pa tha dad pa de rang las skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if you accept that even though the nature of the thing is established, it is still useful, then at that time, that which is useful would not arise from itself, because it is different from that.

original: phan pa don gzhan du gyur pa kho na skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa don gzhan du gyur pa kho na skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is useful would be a different object, and it would arise.

original: ji ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni phan pa yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du grub pa kho na yin pas de ji ltar grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni phan pa yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du grub pa kho na yin pas de ji ltar grub par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is not different, then that which is useful would be just like it, and it would be established. How could it be established?

original: de'i phyir de la yang rgyu mngon par brjod @191a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yang rgyu mngon par brjod @191a * //
translated: Therefore, in that case, you must state the cause.

original: dgos so // gzhan yang rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di shing dang ljon pa bzhin du rnam grangs kyi ngo bor brjod pa ni 'jig rten na de ltar ma grags so //
analyzed: dgos so // gzhan yang rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di shing dang ljon pa bzhin du rnam grangs kyi ngo bor brjod pa ni 'jig rten na de ltar ma grags so //
translated: Moreover, the so-called cause and effect are not known in the world to be synonyms like ‚Äútree‚Äù and ‚Äú≈õirƒ´·π£a.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'di 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i rgyu cung zad cig nye bar bstan dgos na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du khas len na de nye bar bstan par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'di 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i rgyu cung zad cig nye bar bstan dgos na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du khas len na de nye bar bstan par yang mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, if you must definitely indicate some slight cause that is a different object of engagement, then if you accept that cause and effect are the same, you cannot indicate that.

original: 'on te mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs dang yongs su 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs rgyu'i 'og tu 'byung ba 'bras bu yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: 'on te mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs dang yongs su 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs rgyu'i 'og tu 'byung ba 'bras bu yin no zhes ston te /
translated: But if you teach that the state of manifest existence and the state of complete transformation that occur after the cause are the effect,

original: 'di ltar des na de rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa'i rgyu yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar des na de rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa'i rgyu yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then if you think, ‚ÄúIn that case, there is definitely a cause for the establishment of a difference,‚Äù that is also illogical.

original: gal te mngon par gsal ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba snang ba de dag gcig tu de dang tha dad pa nyid gcig yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po gzhan kho na las skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mngon par gsal ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba snang ba de dag gcig tu de dang tha dad pa nyid gcig yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po gzhan kho na las skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the appearance of manifest existence and complete transformation are the same, then at that time you would accept that they arise from another thing.

original: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu dag 'chol pa'i nyes pa de'i so na 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu dag 'chol pa'i nyes pa de'i so na 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: But if they are not different, then the error of the confusion of cause and effect remains.

original: gcig la cig car gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan par yang ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gcig la cig car gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan par yang ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
translated: And how could it be tenable that one thing has contradictory properties, such as being manifest and not being manifest, simultaneously?

original: de bas dang phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyogs kyang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /üîΩphan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos dag ni cig shos dgag pa /
analyzed: de bas dang phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyogs kyang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos dag ni cig shos dgag pa /
translated: Therefore, because of mutual contradiction, the positions of being different and not being different are not tenable.

original: gzhan sgrub pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs su rtog pa yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sgrub pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs su rtog pa yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Because phenomena that have the characteristic of mutually exclusive presence cannot be present in the absence of the negation of one by the other, it is also not tenable to imagine a position that is neither.

original: gzhan yang gal te de'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po sngon gyi ngo bo ma bor ba kho nar de'i 'og tu mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gyur na ni de'i tshe gnas skabs 'chol bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te de'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po sngon gyi ngo bo ma bor ba kho nar de'i 'og tu mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gyur na ni de'i tshe gnas skabs 'chol bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the entity that is asserted to be its cause is only the previous entity that does not discard its former state and then becomes manifest in the subsequent state of existence and so on, then at that time there would be the consequence of a confused state.

original: de'i phyir rtogs par byed pa gcig la ltos nas bum pa la sogs pa snang ba dang mi snang bar yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs par byed pa gcig la ltos nas bum pa la sogs pa snang ba dang mi snang bar yang 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on a single cognition, a vase and so on would appear and not appear.

original: rgan po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gsal rab tu dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgan po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gsal rab tu dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the state of a child and so on would be clearly observed in the state of an old man and so on.

original: 'on te bor pa'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi bdag nyid thams cad zhig na rjes su 'gro ba'i rang gi ngo bo 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir dang / phyis mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs su yang @191b rdzas gzhan skyes pa'i phyir bdag las skye ba ma yin par gyur cing mngon par gsal ba dang 'gyur ba yang 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'on te bor pa'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi bdag nyid thams cad zhig na rjes su 'gro ba'i rang gi ngo bo 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir dang / phyis mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs su yang @191b rdzas gzhan skyes pa'i phyir bdag las skye ba ma yin par gyur cing mngon par gsal ba dang 'gyur ba yang 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But if it is the side that is discarded, then at that time, because it has a partless nature, when all previous natures are destroyed, it has no nature at all that continues. And because a different substance arises at the time of manifest appearance later, it is not born from itself, and there is no manifest appearance or transformation at all.

original: gzhan yang gsal ba yang mi snang ba gzhan du gyur ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par gsal ba dang / yongs su 'gyur ba 'di gnyi ga yang gzhan du gyur pas rab tu phye ba las kun brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gsal ba yang mi snang ba gzhan du gyur ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par gsal ba dang / yongs su 'gyur ba 'di gnyi ga yang gzhan du gyur pas rab tu phye ba las kun brtags pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, because manifest appearance is characterized by transformation, both manifest appearance and transformation are imputed to arise from the distinction of transformation.

original: de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar rung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar rung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not suitable for that very thing to transform into something else.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is contradictory.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i de nyid yongs su gcod pa na gzhan nyid rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i de nyid yongs su gcod pa na gzhan nyid rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod la /
translated: Thus, when the reality of things is determined, otherness is determined by the exclusion of sameness.

original: gzhan nyid kyang de nyid rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod de /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyang de nyid rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod de /
translated: And sameness is determined by the exclusion of otherness.

original: de las bzlog pa rnam par ma bcad na de yongs su gcod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rnam par ma bcad na de yongs su gcod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, if the opposite is not excluded, it cannot be determined.

original: gang la gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par bcad pa med na /
analyzed: gang la gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par bcad pa med na /
translated: That which is determined by the exclusion of something else

original: med pa de dag ni de la phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: med pa de dag ni de la phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: is mutually exclusive with that, because they cannot occur together.

original: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de dag kyang chos can gcig la ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de dag kyang chos can gcig la ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And those that are mutually exclusive cannot be present in the same basis.

original: dper na sems la lus can dang lus can ma yin pa'i bye brag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sems la lus can dang lus can ma yin pa'i bye brag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the mind is distinguished as embodied or disembodied.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyang de dang 'dra bas de'i phyir 'di gnyis gcig la ldan par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyang de dang 'dra bas de'i phyir 'di gnyis gcig la ldan par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since sameness and otherness are also like that, how could they be present in the same basis?

original: chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa yang gcig pa nyid yin na ni thams cad rdzas gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa yang gcig pa nyid yin na ni thams cad rdzas gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it were one thing that possesses contradictory attributes, then everything would be one substantial entity.

original: de'i phyir cig car du bcings pa dang / thar pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir cig car du bcings pa dang / thar pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be simultaneously bound and liberated, it would die and be reborn, and so on.

original: de lta ma yin na gcig ces ming du 'dogs pa tsam kho na byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig ces ming du 'dogs pa tsam kho na byas par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then it would be merely designated by the name ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: 'di la ni brtsad pa med do //üîΩde lta bas na dngos po'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gang sngon gyi gnas skabs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par kun tu rtog pa de ni ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid gzhan yin na gzhan gang yin pa de ji ltar de'i yin /
analyzed: 'di la ni brtsad pa med do // de lta bas na dngos po'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gang sngon gyi gnas skabs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par kun tu rtog pa de ni ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid gzhan yin na gzhan gang yin pa de ji ltar de'i yin /
translated: There is no debate about this.üîΩTherefore, if you imagine that a particular state of an entity is essentially different from its previous state, then how could that which is essentially different from it be it?

original: gzhan yang gal te 'di'i ngo bo nyid gang phyis dmigs pa de sngon yang yang dag par yod na ni de'i tshe de la 'di ji ste dmigs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'di'i ngo bo nyid gang phyis dmigs pa de sngon yang yang dag par yod na ni de'i tshe de la 'di ji ste dmigs par mi 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if the essence of this entity that is observed later existed in reality earlier, then how could it not be observed at that time?

original: 'on te 'di mi snang ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sngon mi dmigs so zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'di mi snang ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sngon mi dmigs so zhe na ni /
translated: But if you say that it is not perceived previously because it is the nature of this to be non-apparent,

original: de'i rgyu'i dngos po yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du thal ba yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i dngos po yang de dang 'dra ba kho nar mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du thal ba yang yin la /
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that the entity which is its cause is also non-apparent by nature.

original: dmigs par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di yang sngon bzhin du phyis kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: dmigs par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di yang sngon bzhin du phyis kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur ro//
translated: And this entity which is asserted to be perceived will not be perceived later on, just as it was not previously.

original: @192a * // ji ste bsgribs pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: @192a * // ji ste bsgribs pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not perceived because it is obscured,

original: de'i tshe phyis kyang sgrib par byed pa de'i son 'dug pa'i phyir rtag tu mi dmigs par thal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe phyis kyang sgrib par byed pa de'i son 'dug pa'i phyir rtag tu mi dmigs par thal ba nyid do //
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that it is never perceived because the obscuring entity remains in place later on as well.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa cha shas rnam pa brgyar gzhigs kyang zho la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la sgrib par byed pa de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de dmigs pa'i gags byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa cha shas rnam pa brgyar gzhigs kyang zho la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la sgrib par byed pa de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de dmigs pa'i gags byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest obscuring entity that can be perceived which would prevent the perception of the entity of milk, etc., even though it has been divided into a hundred parts, and the entity of curd, etc.

original: gzhan yang gal te dngos po'i bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na ni de ji ltar gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dngos po'i bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na ni de ji ltar gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if the nature of a thing is a single essence that is stable by virtue of its intrinsic reality, how could it be experienced as being different?

original: 'on te mi brten pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na ni de'i tshe 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa'i phyir 'di rjes su 'gro ba med par rnam par 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on te mi brten pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na ni de'i tshe 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa'i phyir 'di rjes su 'gro ba med par rnam par 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if it is a single essence that is not stable, then at that time it would be destroyed without any continuation, because it has the nature of destruction.

original: yang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it would not be experienced as being different.

original: de lta bas na mngon par gsal ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba dag rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas rang las skye bar kun brtags pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon par gsal ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba dag rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas rang las skye bar kun brtags pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, because manifestation and transformation are not tenable, it is not reasonable to impute that things arise from themselves.

original: rang las skye ba glo bur ba nyid gcig yin na yang dngos po rnams yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa'i ngo bo nyid la rgyu ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: rang las skye ba glo bur ba nyid gcig yin na yang dngos po rnams yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa'i ngo bo nyid la rgyu ci zhig yod de /
translated: If arising from self were adventitious, then what would be the cause for things having the nature of being restricted to particular places, times, and so on?

original: dngos po yang dag par ltos pa med pa la ni de lta bu'i nges pa srid par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yang dag par ltos pa med pa la ni de lta bu'i nges pa srid par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that a thing that does not depend on another is ascertained in that way.

original: ji ste gzhan la ltos na ni pha rol las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan la ltos na ni pha rol las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it does depend on another, then it would arise from another.

original: phan pa med pa la ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir de yang 'og nas dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa med pa la ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir de yang 'og nas dgag par bya'o //
translated: But it is untenable that it depends on that which is not beneficial, and that will be refuted later.

original: ltos par bya ba yang rtag tu nye ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dus thams cad du skye ba nyid du thal ba yin no //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba yang rtag tu nye ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dus thams cad du skye ba nyid du thal ba yin no //
translated: And because that on which it depends is always of the nature of the near, it follows that it would arise at all times.

original: de ltar na re zhig tha snyad du yang rang las skye ba mi srid do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig tha snyad du yang rang las skye ba mi srid do //
translated: Thus, arising from self is impossible even conventionally.

original: gzhan las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from another.

original: 'di ltar de las dngos po skye bar 'gyur na rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'i ngo bo zhig las 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de las dngos po skye bar 'gyur na rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'i ngo bo zhig las 'gyur grang na /
translated: If a thing arises from another, does it arise from a permanent or impermanent nature?

original: re zhig rtag pa las ni tha snyad du yang da rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rtag pa las ni tha snyad du yang da rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, arising from a permanent thing is not tenable even conventionally.

original: de ni rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that a permanent thing functions sequentially or non-sequentially.

original: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med par yod pa yang 'bras bu res 'ga' mi skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med par yod pa yang 'bras bu res 'ga' mi skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Also, the cause that exists with unobstructed power would not sometimes not give rise to the effect.

original: 'bras bu rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yang res 'ga' mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur na gang gi phyir rim gyis de'i don bya ba byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yang res 'ga' mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur na gang gi phyir rim gyis de'i don bya ba byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the effect that is not incomplete with respect to its cause would not sometimes not occur. Therefore, how could it be that the effect gradually performs the activity of its object?

original: gzhan dag gis khyad par du byar med pa ni de la @192b ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis khyad par du byar med pa ni de la @192b ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that that which cannot be distinguished by others depends on it.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang na ni de dang 'dra ba lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang rtag tu rjes su 'brang bar thal ba yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang na ni de dang 'dra ba lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang rtag tu rjes su 'brang bar thal ba yin no //
translated: If the intrinsic reality that is related to the cooperative causes were to follow, then it follows that the cooperative causes that are similar to it would always follow.

original: ji ste rjes su mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste rjes su mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does not follow, then its permanence would be undermined.

original: de'i phyir 'di yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this also does not rely on the cooperative conditions.

original: rgyu rtag pa la rag las te skye ba'i 'bras bu yang rkyen gzhan las ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rtag pa la rag las te skye ba'i 'bras bu yang rkyen gzhan las ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, the effect that arises in dependence on a permanent cause does not rely on other conditions.

original: de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: med bzhin du yang de dang 'brel ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'thob pa'i phyir blos kun brtags pa'i ltos par rnam par 'jog mod kyi /
analyzed: med bzhin du yang de dang 'brel ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'thob pa'i phyir blos kun brtags pa'i ltos par rnam par 'jog mod kyi /
translated: Even though it does not exist, it is posited as the imputed object of the mind that conceives of it, because it obtains the nature of being related to it.

original: 'on kyang de mngon par 'grub par bya ba la rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid la des phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis ltos par bya'i /
analyzed: 'on kyang de mngon par 'grub par bya ba la rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid la des phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis ltos par bya'i /
translated: However, in order for it to be established, it is the very cause that is unobstructed in its capacity that should be regarded as the object of reliance, because it is that which benefits it.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the other.

original: de'i phyir rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po rtag tu phan 'dogs pa nyid du nye bar mthu thogs pa med pa nyid bor te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po rtag tu phan 'dogs pa nyid du nye bar mthu thogs pa med pa nyid bor te /
translated: Therefore, the thing that is asserted to be permanent should always be regarded as the object of reliance, because it is always unobstructed in its capacity to benefit.

original: de las gzhan pa la ci ste ltos /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la ci ste ltos /
translated: Why would you look to something else?

original: 'bras bu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams la ltos su chug na yang /
analyzed: 'bras bu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams la ltos su chug na yang /
translated: Even though the effect is dependent on the cooperative conditions,

original: 'on kyang de'i rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa gang yin pa de mthu thogs pa med pa yin na go ji ste btang snyoms su 'dug ste gang gis na de skye bar mi 'dod bzhin du yang nan gyis drangs te skye bar mi byed /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa gang yin pa de mthu thogs pa med pa yin na go ji ste btang snyoms su 'dug ste gang gis na de skye bar mi 'dod bzhin du yang nan gyis drangs te skye bar mi byed /
translated: But if the cause of that, such as ƒ™≈õvara, has unimpeded power, then why be indifferent?

original: de lta na des bdag nyid kyi mthu nye bar bstan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na des bdag nyid kyi mthu nye bar bstan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that is so, then it would demonstrate the power of the self,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of others.

original: de lta bas na rim can ma yin pa las dngos po rim gyis skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na rim can ma yin pa las dngos po rim gyis skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, things do not arise sequentially from nonsequential causes.

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed pa nyid ni ma yin te /üîΩde nyid tha dad pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed pa nyid ni ma yin te / de nyid tha dad pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you think that the effect is not a mere transformation of all the attributes of the cause,üîΩthen it follows that they are not different,

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar de gnyis rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad par 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar de gnyis rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad par 'gyur dgos so //
translated: and therefore they must be different in some way.

original: des na rgyu rim can ma yin pa las kyang 'bras bu rim dang ldan pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na rgyu rim can ma yin pa las kyang 'bras bu rim dang ldan pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory for an effect to have a sequence even though its cause is not sequential.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not logical.

original: 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed par ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed par ni mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that an effect is a copy of all the qualities of its cause.

original: 'on kyang re zhig gdon mi za bar 'bras bu rgyu la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed par ni 'gyur dgos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig gdon mi za bar 'bras bu rgyu la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed par ni 'gyur dgos te /
translated: However, it must be the case that an effect is a copy of the presence and absence of something that exists in its cause,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rgyu ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'bras bu 'ga' yang dngos po rtag pa la yod pa'i ldog @193a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rgyu ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro // 'bras bu 'ga' yang dngos po rtag pa la yod pa'i ldog @193a * //
translated: because the cause and effect relationship is limited to this.

original: pa'i rjes su byed pa ni med de /
analyzed: pa'i rjes su byed pa ni med de /
translated: No effect is a copy of the absence of something that exists in a permanent entity.

original: rtag pa la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no absence in a permanent entity.

original: de lta ma yin na ni mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were otherwise, it would not be permanent.

original: rtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not be permanent.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a copy of its presence either.

original: de ma tshang ba med par nye yang res 'ga' 'bras bu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma tshang ba med par nye yang res 'ga' 'bras bu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But even when the conditions are complete, the effect does not always arise.

original: gang zhig gang la yod pa'i rjes su byed pa 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis rjes su mi byed pa de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la yod pa'i rjes su byed pa 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis rjes su mi byed pa de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that something is the effect of something else if it does not follow the pattern of going and coming in accordance with the presence or absence of that other thing.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This would lead to absurd consequences.

original: 'bras bu yod pa ni ltos par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa ni ltos par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it reasonable that an existent effect depends on conditions,

original: de ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis grub zin pas thams cad la re ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis grub zin pas thams cad la re ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it already exists in its entirety and does not need anything else.

original: de ltar na re zhig rtag pa la rim gyis don byed pa'i mthu rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rtag pa la rim gyis don byed pa'i mthu rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable that a permanent thing can gradually produce an effect.

original: cig car yang ma yin te /
analyzed: cig car yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it reasonable that a permanent thing can produce an effect instantaneously.

original: de'i don byed pa'i rang bzhin de lta bu zhig yang rjes su 'brangs na 'bras bu'i skyed pa dang 'bral bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don byed pa'i rang bzhin de lta bu zhig yang rjes su 'brangs na 'bras bu'i skyed pa dang 'bral bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it has the nature of producing an effect, then it is not reasonable that it would be separated from the production of the effect.

original: ji ste mi 'bral na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste mi 'bral na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams pa yin no //
translated: If it is not separated from the production of the effect, then its permanence is undermined.

original: 'on te yang 'di'i nus pa'i rang bzhin dus phyis kyang rjes su 'brang mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'di'i nus pa'i rang bzhin dus phyis kyang rjes su 'brang mod kyi /
translated: But if you think that the nature of its potential continues to exist later,

original: 'on kyang re zhig des 'bras bu thams cad sngar bskyed zin pa gang yin pa de ni yang bskyed par nus pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig des 'bras bu thams cad sngar bskyed zin pa gang yin pa de ni yang bskyed par nus pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: then it is not possible that it generates all its effects at the beginning, because

original: de ni skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it has already arisen.

original: gzhan de dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de ci ste mi skyed ces brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan de dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de ci ste mi skyed ces brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not right to argue that it is possible to generate another effect that is similar to the first,

original: de la des mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la des mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for it to generate that.

original: nus pa yin na ni sngar bskyed zin pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: nus pa yin na ni sngar bskyed zin pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is possible, then it would have already generated it.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not logical.

original: des sngar bskyed zin pa'i 'bras bu mi skyed du chug kyang /
analyzed: des sngar bskyed zin pa'i 'bras bu mi skyed du chug kyang /
translated: Even if you accept that it does not generate the effect that it has already generated,

original: 'on kyang 'di'i skyed par nus pa'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba ni rnam par nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di'i skyed par nus pa'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba ni rnam par nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: nevertheless, the nature of its potential that is capable of generating it would be impaired.

original: gang zhig gang gi tshe gang skyed par mi byed pa ni de'i tshe de la mthu thogs pa med pa yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi tshe gang skyed par mi byed pa ni de'i tshe de la mthu thogs pa med pa yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that when something does not produce something else, at that time it has unimpeded power.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni sngar yang dus phyis bzhin du skyed par byed pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni sngar yang dus phyis bzhin du skyed par byed pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is not a producer even before, just as it is not later.

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the state of being a non-producer and the state of being a producer.

original: 'dis dus phyis kyang sngon bzhin du skyed par byed pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis dus phyis kyang sngon bzhin du skyed par byed pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, it is also not a producer later, just as it was not before.

original: de lta ma yin na chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di'i gcig pa nyid rnam par nyams @193b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di'i gcig pa nyid rnam par nyams @193b par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because it would possess contradictory properties, its oneness would be destroyed.

original: de lta bas na de cig car don byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de cig car don byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a simultaneous producer either.

original: rim dang cig car dag las ma gtogs pa gang gis na don bya ba byed par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag las ma gtogs pa gang gis na don bya ba byed par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te //
translated: Apart from gradual and simultaneous, there is no other way that something could be a producer.

original: de dag ni phan tshun yongs su gcod pa rnam par bcad pa med na med pa nyid kyis phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag gang yang rung ba zhig dgag pa gzhan sgrub pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun yongs su gcod pa rnam par bcad pa med na med pa nyid kyis phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag gang yang rung ba zhig dgag pa gzhan sgrub pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually exclusive, and if one is eliminated the other must be eliminated, and because the negation of one is invariably concomitant with the affirmation of the other.

original: de ltar na re zhig gzhan rtag pa las skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gzhan rtag pa las skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, first, it is not logical that an effect arises from a permanent cause.

original: mi rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from an impermanent cause.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa ni dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can kho na yin par rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa ni dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can kho na yin par rigs te /
translated: In this regard, an impermanent thing is logical only as a momentary phenomenon.

original: bskal par gnas pa ni khyad par med pas sngon bzhin du phyis kyang 'jig par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal par gnas pa ni khyad par med pas sngon bzhin du phyis kyang 'jig par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would remain for an eon without changing, it would not be possible for it to disintegrate later, just as it was before.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba na 'das pa las 'gyur te /
