analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba na 'das pa las 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if an effect arises, it would arise from a past cause.

original: dper na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'das pa las kyang 'bras bu nye bar brjod pa'am /
analyzed: dper na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'das pa las kyang 'bras bu nye bar brjod pa'am /
translated: For example, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that an effect arises from a past cause that has already ripened.

original: ma 'ongs pa las te dper na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa las te dper na /
translated: Or it would arise from a future cause.

original: de dag nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba yang bskyed par bya ba skyed par byed pa yin no zhes nye bar brtags pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba yang bskyed par bya ba skyed par byed pa yin no zhes nye bar brtags pa lta bu'am /
translated: Or, if you imagine that they generate future arising, then they would be the agent of that which is to be generated.

original: da ltar gyi byed pa las kyang yin grang na /
analyzed: da ltar gyi byed pa las kyang yin grang na /
translated: Or, if you imagine that they generate present arising, then they would be the agent of that which is being generated.

original: de la re zhig 'das pa las zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'das pa las zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it is illogical to say that they arise from the past,

original: 'das pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past does not exist.

original: de las skye bar khas len na ni 'di rgyu med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las skye bar khas len na ni 'di rgyu med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that they arise from the past, then they would be causeless.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa zhes bya ba ci la bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa zhes bya ba ci la bya /
translated: In this regard, what is called the past is what?

original: gang rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa yin grang /
analyzed: gang rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa yin grang /
translated: Is it the state of having lost its intrinsic reality?

original: de lta ma yin na de lta bzhin du ma nyams pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'das par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de lta bzhin du ma nyams pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'das par 'gyur /
translated: If it is not that, then it is not the case that it has lost its intrinsic reality. Therefore, how could it be past?

original: nyams pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu nye bar skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyams pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu nye bar skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that which has the intrinsic reality of having been lost does not exist intrinsically. Therefore, how could it generate an effect?

original: don byed pa ni rang gi ngo bo la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa ni rang gi ngo bo la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the performance of an object‚Äôs activity depends on its intrinsic reality.

original: 'on te byed pa la sogs pa zhig pa nyid kyis de 'das pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa la sogs pa zhig pa nyid kyis de 'das pa zhes bya'i /
translated: But if you say that the past is that which has ceased to be a present activity,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyams pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyams pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and that it does not lose its own nature,

original: de lta na ni yang byed pa zhig pa de las 'bras bu skye bar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni yang byed pa zhig pa de las 'bras bu skye bar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not logical that an effect should arise from that which has ceased to be a present activity.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were,

original: 'bras bu nye ba skyed na ji ltar byed pa zhig par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu nye ba skyed na ji ltar byed pa zhig par 'gyur /
translated: then how could the activity be said to have ceased when the effect is about to arise?

original: dngos po'i ngo bo gcig la byed pa dang / byed pa ma yin pa'i bya ba dag kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo gcig la byed pa dang / byed pa ma yin pa'i bya ba dag kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that a single entity should have an activity that is and is not present,

original: tha dad par thal bar 'gyur @194a * //
analyzed: tha dad par thal bar 'gyur @194a * //
translated: because that would entail difference,

original: pa'i phyir dang cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it would have parts.

original: byed pa ni 'phen pa tsam du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byed pa ni 'phen pa tsam du 'gyur gyi /
translated: The activity would be merely the impetus,

original: rab tu 'byin pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu 'byin pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it would not be the instigation,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir 'phen pa'i dus nyid du de rab tu 'byin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir 'phen pa'i dus nyid du de rab tu 'byin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: because there would be no difference. At the very time of the impetus, it would be the instigation.

original: de lta ma yin na sngon bzhin du phyis kyang der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sngon bzhin du phyis kyang der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then later it would not be so, as it was before.

original: gzhan yang byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de gal te nus pa'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de gal te nus pa'i ngo bo'am /
translated: Moreover, if that which is called ‚Äúaction‚Äù is the nature of potency,

original: bya ba'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: bya ba'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or the nature of activity,

original: ngo bo de dag gnyi ga yang gal te dngos po las don gzhan tha dad pa zhig yin na ni de'i tshe de ji ltar zhig ces brjod par bya /
analyzed: ngo bo de dag gnyi ga yang gal te dngos po las don gzhan tha dad pa zhig yin na ni de'i tshe de ji ltar zhig ces brjod par bya /
translated: if both of those natures are different from things, then how could it be said that they disintegrate?

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po thams cad rtag tu yod pa nyid du smra ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po thams cad rtag tu yod pa nyid du smra ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the degeneration of their own nature, then in that case the assertion that all things are permanent would be undermined.

original: don gzhan de zhig kyang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par ma g-yos pa zhig pa nyid du 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gzhan de zhig kyang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par ma g-yos pa zhig pa nyid du 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if another object disintegrates, the nature of the thing itself would not be established as disintegrating without changing.

original: lha sbyin shi yang mchod sbyin rang gi ngo bo las ma nyams pa'i ngo bo yang shi zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin shi yang mchod sbyin rang gi ngo bo las ma nyams pa'i ngo bo yang shi zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though Devadatta dies, it is not said that sacrifice itself dies without the degeneration of its own nature.

original: 'on te byed pa gzhan zhig pa'i phyir de zhig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa gzhan zhig pa'i phyir de zhig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that it disintegrates because another action ceases,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa la byed pa gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa la byed pa gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it would be endless, the activity of the agent does not exist in the agent.

original: de la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the same objection and response would apply to that,

original: de'i phyir gang yang 'jig par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang 'jig par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: therefore, it is not established that anything is destroyed.

original: byed pa don gzhan nyid yin na yang na yang dngos po rgyu ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: byed pa don gzhan nyid yin na yang na yang dngos po rgyu ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the activity is something else, then the thing would not be a cause,

original: byed pa kho na las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa kho na las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect would arise from the activity alone.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid du thal ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid du thal ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it follows that it would be a nonthing,

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of a thing is that it is able to perform a function.

original: byed pa don gzhan du gyur pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo de yang 'bras bu nye bar skyed pa na gal te byed pa rang gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas skyed do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe dngos po yang de bzhin du skyed par 'gyur
analyzed: byed pa don gzhan du gyur pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo de yang 'bras bu nye bar skyed pa na gal te byed pa rang gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas skyed do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe dngos po yang de bzhin du skyed par 'gyur
translated: If the activity that is something else generates the effect when it arises in the nature of both, and if it is asserted that it generates the effect by means of its own nature alone, then at that time the thing would also generate the effect in that way.

original: ba nyid pas don gzhan du rtogs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ba nyid pas don gzhan du rtogs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of conceiving of it as something else?

original: don gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe de las yang byed pa gzhan du rtog na thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gang yang rgyu nyid du grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe de las yang byed pa gzhan du rtog na thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gang yang rgyu nyid du grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a position that it is something else, then when one conceives of another activity on the basis of that, there is an infinite regress, and nothing is established as a cause.

original: dngos po phan dang mi byed pa'i phyir 'di'i byed pa'i phyir 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: dngos po phan dang mi byed pa'i phyir 'di'i byed pa'i phyir 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: And the relation ‚ÄúThis is because of that‚Äù is not established, because the benefit or non-benefit of the thing is not established.

original: 'brel pa ni thams cad du phan 'dogs pa kho nas rab tu bye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni thams cad du phan 'dogs pa kho nas rab tu bye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relation is always established by benefit.

original: 'on te de la dngos @194b po phan pa nyid du khas len na ni de'i tshe gal te dngos po byed pa'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'i dbang gis byed pa la phan 'dogs na de'i tshe 'bras bu la yang ci ste de bzhin du phan 'dogs par mi
analyzed: 'on te de la dngos @194b po phan pa nyid du khas len na ni de'i tshe gal te dngos po byed pa'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'i dbang gis byed pa la phan 'dogs na de'i tshe 'bras bu la yang ci ste de bzhin du phan 'dogs par mi
translated: But if you accept that the thing benefits it, then if the activity benefits it by the power of the thing‚Äôs own activity, then why doesn‚Äôt it also benefit the effect in the same way?

original: 'gyur / gang gis na byed pa don gzhan du byed bar rtog par byed /
analyzed: 'gyur / gang gis na byed pa don gzhan du byed bar rtog par byed /
translated: By what means do you conceive of the activity as something else?

original: byed pa dngos po yod pa tsam la rag las pa yin na ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir rtag tu nye ba yin te /
analyzed: byed pa dngos po yod pa tsam la rag las pa yin na ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir rtag tu nye ba yin te /
translated: If the activity is dependent on the mere existence of the entity, then it is always present, because the cause is not incomplete.

original: 'jig pa yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And destruction is not established.

original: 'on te don gzhan du gyur pa yin na ni de'i tshe 'di dang yang lhan cig 'brel par ma grub po /
analyzed: 'on te don gzhan du gyur pa yin na ni de'i tshe 'di dang yang lhan cig 'brel par ma grub po /
translated: But if it is a different object, then at that time it is not established as connected with this.

original: de'i phyir byed pa rnams kho na phan tshun sbyor ba'i phyir dngos po ni gyi nar 'dug pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa rnams kho na phan tshun sbyor ba'i phyir dngos po ni gyi nar 'dug pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the activities are mutually connected, the entity remains as it is.

original: skad cig ma rnams ni skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i phyir byed par bya ba'i ngo bor yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig ma rnams ni skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i phyir byed par bya ba'i ngo bor yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Since the momentary do not remain immediately after arising, it is not reasonable that they have the nature of activity.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams kyang nam mkha' bzhin du rtag tu gnas pa'i ngo bor gcig pa'i phyir bya ba dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin pa nyid pas gang la yang bya ba zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams kyang nam mkha' bzhin du rtag tu gnas pa'i ngo bor gcig pa'i phyir bya ba dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin pa nyid pas gang la yang bya ba zhes bya ba med do //
translated: And since the non-momentary, like space, always remain as the nature of oneness, it is not reasonable that they possess activity. Therefore, activity does not exist for anything.

original: de lta bas na dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na nus pa dang byed pa la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na nus pa dang byed pa la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, the intrinsic reality of things is described by the terms ‚Äúpotential,‚Äù ‚Äúaction,‚Äù and so on.

original: don gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not have a different meaning.

original: byed pa dngos po las tha mi dad pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo de zhig ste /
analyzed: byed pa dngos po las tha mi dad pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo de zhig ste /
translated: If the cessation of action is the disintegration of the intrinsic reality of both action and the thing,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i mtshan nyid yin na dngos po yang de dang tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yin pas ji ltar 'das pa yod pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i mtshan nyid yin na dngos po yang de dang tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yin pas ji ltar 'das pa yod pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: then since the thing is not different from that, it would also have disintegration of its intrinsic reality. How could the past be established as existent?

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du byed pa yang mi 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa zhig pa nyid du 'grub par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du byed pa yang mi 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa zhig pa nyid du 'grub par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it follows that action would not disintegrate like the intrinsic reality of a thing, the cessation of action would not be established.

original: ji ste yang byed pa de nyid gzhan dag nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o snyam du rtog par byed de /
analyzed: ji ste yang byed pa de nyid gzhan dag nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o snyam du rtog par byed de /
translated: But if you think that action itself is not to be described as either the same as or different from the thing,

original: de'i tshe btags par yod pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang dag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe btags par yod pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang dag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, because of the non-existence of things as entities, the establishment of the three times by the power of that is not tenable.

original: dngos por yod pa ni rnam pa gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos por yod pa ni rnam pa gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that an existent thing is not to be described in any way,

original: thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that everything would be not to be described.

original: de lta bas na 'das pa dngos po med pa'i phyir de las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'das pa dngos po med pa'i phyir de las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the past does not exist as an entity, an effect does not arise from it.

original: ma 'ongs pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from the future,

original: de yang 'das pa bzhin du med pa'i @195a * //
analyzed: de yang 'das pa bzhin du med pa'i @195a * //
translated: because that also does not exist like the past.

original: phyir te 'di ltar bdag nyid du ma red pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba na de lta bu nam mkha'i padma dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de las ni 'bras bu skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir te 'di ltar bdag nyid du ma red pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba na de lta bu nam mkha'i padma dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de las ni 'bras bu skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: As such, that which is called ‚Äúfuture‚Äù does not exist as an entity, and it is not reasonable that an effect arises from that, which is like a sky flower.

original: 'on te byed pa ma thob pa nyid kyis de ma 'ongs pa zhes bya na ni de'i tshe de las shin tu yang 'bras bu skye bar mi rigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa ma thob pa nyid kyis de ma 'ongs pa zhes bya na ni de'i tshe de las shin tu yang 'bras bu skye bar mi rigs pa nyid de /
translated: But if it is said that the future is so called because it has not yet obtained its activity, then at that time it is not tenable that the effect arises from it,

original: byed pa ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has not yet obtained its activity.

original: dngos po thams cad rtag tu yod pa nyid yin na go ji ste 'ga' zhig gis res 'ga' byed pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rtag tu yod pa nyid yin na go ji ste 'ga' zhig gis res 'ga' byed pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If all things always exist, then why would some never obtain activity?

original: de 'thob pa'i rgyu rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i rgyu rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the causes for obtaining it are incomplete.

original: byed pa dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa yang ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: byed pa dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa yang ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: And it has already been demonstrated that activity is not a different object from things.

original: don gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin na ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir byed pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo yang ma thob pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa nyid yod pa nyid du 'grub par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin na ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir byed pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo yang ma thob pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa nyid yod pa nyid du 'grub par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it is not a different object, then because it is not distinct, like activity, its own nature is not obtained, and therefore it is not established that the future exists.

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de dang tha mi dad pa'i byed pa yang rtag tu yod pa'i phyir rtag tu ma thob pa nyid du yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de dang tha mi dad pa'i byed pa yang rtag tu yod pa'i phyir rtag tu ma thob pa nyid du yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the activity that is not different from the entity itself would always exist, just like the entity itself, it would not be established as not obtained.

original: de lta bas na ma 'ongs pa med pa'i phyir de las 'bras bu skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma 'ongs pa med pa'i phyir de las 'bras bu skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the future does not exist, an effect does not arise from it.

original: da ltar gyi las zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi las zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: The position that the effect arises from the present action is also untenable.

original: 'di ltar de las 'bras bu yang dag par skye na dus mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar de las 'bras bu yang dag par skye na dus mnyam pa'am /
translated: If an effect arises from that action, does it arise simultaneously with it or

original: dus tha dad pa zhig tu skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa zhig tu skye bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: does it arise at a different time?

original: re zhig dus mnyam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dus mnyam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it does not arise simultaneously.

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rul na rgyu yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa nyid kyis nus par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rul na rgyu yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa nyid kyis nus par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the effect were to arise prior to the cause, then like the horn of a rabbit, the cause would not exist and it would be untenable for it to be a cause.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu bdag nyid kyi dngos por red pa nyid kyis nus pa yin pa de'i tshe ni 'bras bu yang de dang dus mnyam par yod pa nyid kyis grub pa kho na yin pas de la de cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu bdag nyid kyi dngos por red pa nyid kyis nus pa yin pa de'i tshe ni 'bras bu yang de dang dus mnyam par yod pa nyid kyis grub pa kho na yin pas de la de cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the cause is able by virtue of its own essential nature, then at that time the effect would exist by virtue of its own essential nature at the same time, and thus it would be already established. Therefore, the cause would not do anything to it.

original: rgyur tha snyad gdags pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyur tha snyad gdags pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to designate something as a cause.

original: dper na 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa de nyid rgyu ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa de nyid rgyu ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, that which is asserted to be an effect is not a cause.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag 'chol pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag 'chol pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then the cause and effect would be completely confused.

original: dus tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that they are different in time.

original: 'di ltar gal te 'bras bu sngon gyi dus na yod pa yin na de lta na ni ma 'ongs pa kho na las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'bras bu sngon gyi dus na yod pa yin na de lta na ni ma 'ongs pa kho na las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this regard, if the effect exists in a prior time, then it would arise from the future alone.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin par sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin par sngar bstan zin to //
translated: But that is illogical, as has been previously explained.

original: 'on te skad cig ma gzhan gyis chod pa'i 'og tu yin na ni de'i tshe de 'das pa kho @195b na las 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma gzhan gyis chod pa'i 'og tu yin na ni de'i tshe de 'das pa kho @195b na las 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is the latter, then it is past, because it is separated from the other moment.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: And that is not reasonable, as was previously explained.

original: ji ste mchod pa yin na ni de gnyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod pa'i phyir dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste mchod pa yin na ni de gnyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod pa'i phyir dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is the object, then it follows that they are simultaneous, because both exist in their entirety as objects.

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'bras bu mchod par skye mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'bras bu mchod par skye mod kyi /
translated: If you think that the effect arises as the object of the cause,

original: 'on kyang dus mnyam pa nyid du thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dus mnyam pa nyid du thal ba ma yin te /
translated: then it follows that they are not simultaneous,

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: because the effect exists in the second moment.

original: de'i tshe yang skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu ma gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu ma gnas pa yin no //
translated: And at that time, the cause does not exist, because it is momentary.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ston par mdzad pas rnam par rtog pa gsum bor nas rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa zhal gyis bzhes so //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ston par mdzad pas rnam par rtog pa gsum bor nas rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa zhal gyis bzhes so //
translated: Here the Blessed One, teaching the relation of cause and effect, saying, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be,‚Äù rejects three alternatives and accepts the fourth.

original: 'di ltar yang rnam par rtog pa ni 'bras bu rgyu'i sngon rol na yod par 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rnam par rtog pa ni 'bras bu rgyu'i sngon rol na yod par 'gyur ba'am //
translated: Thus, there would be four alternatives: the effect would exist prior to the cause,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig yod pa'am /üîΩskad cig ma gzhan gyis chod pa'am //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig yod pa'am / skad cig ma gzhan gyis chod pa'am //
translated: the cause and effect would exist simultaneously,üîΩthe effect would be interrupted by the cause,

original: mchod par skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod ces bya ba bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod par skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod ces bya ba bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or the effect would exist in the second moment of the cause.

original: de la sngon gyi dus na yod pa ni rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi dus na yod pa ni rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The effect does not arise when the cause exists, if it existed prior to the cause.

original: de ni dang po nyid nas grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dang po nyid nas grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would already exist from the very beginning.

original: dus mnyam du skyes pa yang rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: dus mnyam du skyes pa yang rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te //
translated: Nor does the effect arise when the cause exists, if it arises simultaneously with the cause.

original: de yang yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it already exists.

original: 'di ltar dus mnyam pa nyid ni 'bras bu med pa'i dus na rgyu yang med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dus mnyam pa nyid ni 'bras bu med pa'i dus na rgyu yang med la /
translated: Thus, if the effect does not exist, the cause does not exist.

original: rgyu yod na 'bras bu yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'bras bu yang yod pa yin no //
translated: If the cause exists, the effect exists.

original: skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa na yod pa yang rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa na yod pa yang rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the effect arise when the cause exists, if it exists in the third moment and so on.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa kho na la rgyu zhig pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa kho na la rgyu zhig pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause ceases to exist at the very moment of the second moment.

original: de lta bas na skad cig ma gnyis pa yod pa'i 'bras bu kho na rgyu yod na 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na skad cig ma gnyis pa yod pa'i 'bras bu kho na rgyu yod na 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the effect that exists at the time of the second moment arises when the cause exists.

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang po la yod pa'i rgyu ni de'i gnas skabs na yod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang po la yod pa'i rgyu ni de'i gnas skabs na yod pa kho na yin la /
translated: In this way, the cause that exists at the time of the first moment exists at that time alone.

original: de dang mchod pa nyid du skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu yod par nyams su myong ba la 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mchod pa nyid du skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu yod par nyams su myong ba la 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya'o //
translated: And the effect that exists at the time of the second moment is experienced as being similar to that cause. This is called ‚Äúwhen this exists, that arises.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu yod par thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu yod par thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that the consequence follows that the cause exists at the time of the effect,

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis de'i tshe de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis de'i tshe de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time, it does not exist due to momentariness.

original: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar yang thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar yang thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that the consequence follows that the effect arises from the cessation of the cause,

original: skad cig ma dang po'i gnas skabs na rgyu ma zhig pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po'i gnas skabs na rgyu ma zhig pa'i phyir la /
translated: because at the time of the first moment, the cause has not ceased.

original: de nyid las mchod par 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid las mchod par 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the effect arises from that cause alone.

original: de lta ma yin na skad cig ma gsum pa la 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skad cig ma gsum pa la 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is not so, but that it becomes the effect in the third moment,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di @196a * //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te / 'di @196a * //
translated: that is not logical.

original: ltar gal te bar na dus gzhan phra rab kyang med pa'i phyir rgyu yod pa dang 'bras bu dus gzhan gyis mchod pa nyid du 'dod na ni de'i tshe bdag nyid mi tshugs la /
analyzed: ltar gal te bar na dus gzhan phra rab kyang med pa'i phyir rgyu yod pa dang 'bras bu dus gzhan gyis mchod pa nyid du 'dod na ni de'i tshe bdag nyid mi tshugs la /
translated: If you assert that the cause exists and the effect is not simultaneous with it because there is no other time in between, then at that time, it is not tenable that they are not simultaneous.

original: ci dus gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci dus gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Do you analyze whether or not it follows that they are simultaneous?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes dpyod cig / dngos po cha shas med pa dus gzhan gyis mchod pa gnyis la ni dus gcig pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes dpyod cig / dngos po cha shas med pa dus gzhan gyis mchod pa gnyis la ni dus gcig pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For two partless things that are not simultaneous, there is no other aspect except being simultaneous,

original: de gnyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are simultaneous in all aspects.

original: bar du 'byung ba'i dus gzhan med na gdon mi za ba skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma dag reg pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar du 'byung ba'i dus gzhan med na gdon mi za ba skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma dag reg pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no other time in between, then the former and latter moments would definitely contact each other.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma thams cad skad cig ma gcig kho na'i nang du 'dus pas rdul phra rab rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor na gong bu rdul phran tsam nyid du thal ba dang 'dra bar ba skal ba yang skad cig ma tsam nyid du thalüîΩba yin no //üîΩde'i phyir ji ltar kha cig dngos po rnams kyi yul gyi rim par snang ba ni tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir kun rdzob pa kho nar 'dod pa ltar dus kyi rim pa yang rmi lam la sogs pa dag ni bskal pa la sogs par snang ba bzhin du
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma thams cad skad cig ma gcig kho na'i nang du 'dus pas rdul phra rab rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor na gong bu rdul phran tsam nyid du thal ba dang 'dra bar ba skal ba yang skad cig ma tsam nyid du thal ba yin no // de'i phyir ji ltar kha cig dngos po rnams kyi yul gyi rim par snang ba ni tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir kun rdzob pa kho nar 'dod pa ltar dus kyi rim pa yang rmi lam la sogs pa dag ni bskal pa la sogs par snang ba bzhin du
translated: Therefore, since all moments are included in just one moment, it follows that just as a composite of atoms is just the size of an atom when all the atoms are combined, so too time would be just a moment.

original: de dag 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as some assert that the sequential appearance of objects is only conventional because it is undermined by valid knowledge, so too the sequence of time would be similar to the appearance of an eon and so on in dreams and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid thams cad mchod pa de dag la sngon gyi dus nyid dang phyi ma'i dus nyid med de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid thams cad mchod pa de dag la sngon gyi dus nyid dang phyi ma'i dus nyid med de /
translated: The syllogism is: Regarding those that are all the nature of another time, the prior time and the later time do not exist,

original: dper na rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, the right and left horns of a cow.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang dus gzhan gyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang dus gzhan gyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Also, cause and effect are simultaneous, because they are not different in time.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gis mchod pa yin gyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma yin no zhes bya bar rtog na /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gis mchod pa yin gyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma yin no zhes bya bar rtog na /
translated: If you think that they are simultaneous, but not in all ways,

original: de'i tshe skad cig ma cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe skad cig ma cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba yin te /
translated: then it follows that the instant is divisible.

original: des na dus kyi mtha'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dus kyi mtha'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the definition of the instant as the ultimate unit of time is undermined.

original: 'on te yang 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu med pa'i phyir med pa dang lhan cig bdag nyid thams cad dam phyogs gcig gis mchod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa mi 'jug pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu med pa'i phyir med pa dang lhan cig bdag nyid thams cad dam phyogs gcig gis mchod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa mi 'jug pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: If you think that the nonexistence of the cause at the time of the arising of the effect is not at all tenable, whether it is simultaneous with the effect or not,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical either.

original: de'i tshe bar na dus gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir rgyu med pa de nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe bar na dus gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir rgyu med pa de nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not possible for there to be another time in between, it is illogical for the cause to be nonexistent.

original: gal te yang 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu med na ni de'i tshe 'bras bu rgyu med pa can kho nar @196b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu med na ni de'i tshe 'bras bu rgyu med pa can kho nar @196b 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the effect does not exist at the time when the cause exists, then the effect would be causeless.

original: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu 'dod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu 'dod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: You assert that the effect arises from the cause that has ceased.

original: da ltar gyi las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi las ni ma yin te /
translated: But the present action does not exist.

original: med na da ltar nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir dang / da ltar nyid yin na ni de'i tshe de med par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na da ltar nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir dang / da ltar nyid yin na ni de'i tshe de med par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does not exist, it is not tenable that it is present, and if it is present, it is contradictory that it does not exist.

original: yod pa nyid du khas len na yang ji ste mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du khas len na yang ji ste mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug par mi 'gyur /
translated: Even if you accept that it exists, why would the thought of worship not arise?

original: ji ste yang 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu yod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: ji ste yang 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na rgyu yod pa kho na yin la /
translated: But if the cause exists only at the time when the effect arises,

original: 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na ni med pa yin te /
translated: and the effect does not exist at the time when the cause exists,

original: de'i phyir mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: then the thought of worship would not arise.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: skye ba ni yod pa las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni yod pa las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because arising is not different from the existent.

original: 'di ltar khyed ni rgyu dang bar med pa kho nar 'bras bu yod pa skye ba yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed ni rgyu dang bar med pa kho nar 'bras bu yod pa skye ba yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus you are saying that the effect exists without a cause in the middle.

original: bar med par yod do zhes smra ba dag gis kyang mchod pa cung zad cig khas blangs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bar med par yod do zhes smra ba dag gis kyang mchod pa cung zad cig khas blangs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Even those who say that the effect exists without a middle must accept that it is slightly obstructed.

original: de lta ma yin na bar med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ci zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bar med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ci zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, what is the meaning of the term ‚Äúwithout a middle‚Äù?

original: bar med pa dang mchod pa dang reg pa zhes bya pa la sogs pa ni don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir de khas blangs na shugs kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus gcig pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar med pa dang mchod pa dang reg pa zhes bya pa la sogs pa ni don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir de khas blangs na shugs kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus gcig pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Because ‚Äúwithout a middle,‚Äù ‚Äúobstructed,‚Äù and ‚Äúcontact‚Äù are not different things, if you accept that, then you implicitly accept that cause and effect are simultaneous.

original: yod pa dus gzhan gyis mchod pa gnyis la gnas skabs gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dus gzhan gyis mchod pa gnyis la gnas skabs gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for an existent to be obstructed by another time.

original: gzhan yang rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar thal na ni mi rung bas khyed kyis de yengs su spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar thal na ni mi rung bas khyed kyis de yengs su spangs te /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that an effect arises from a disintegrated cause, that is unacceptable.

original: de ltar gyi rgyu las mchod par 'bras bu skye bar khas blangs pa yin no //üîΩde la ni ci bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod dam /
analyzed: de ltar gyi rgyu las mchod par 'bras bu skye bar khas blangs pa yin no // de la ni ci bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod dam /
translated: Thus, you accept that the effect arises from the cause at the very time of the cause.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gis zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'di 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gis zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'di 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: In this regard, the thought occurs: does the effect arise from the cause by means of the whole of the cause or by means of a part of the cause?

original: de la rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de la rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro//
translated: This thought occurs because another alternative is impossible.

original: de lta bas na rgyu ni 'bras bu'i skad cig ma dang mchod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu ni 'bras bu'i skad cig ma dang mchod pa kho na yin la /
translated: Thus, the cause is the effect at the very time of the cause,üîΩand the effect is not the cause by means of the whole of the cause,

original: de yang phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de yang phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin /
translated: nor by means of a part of the cause.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin no zhes smra bas ci zhig smras par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩmchod pa zhes yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin no zhes smra bas ci zhig smras par 'gyur zhe na / mchod pa zhes yin la /
translated: What is the point of saying this?

original: mchod pa zhes yin la /
analyzed: mchod pa zhes yin la /
translated: The effect is the cause at the very time of the cause,

original: mchod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: and the effect is not the cause.

original: shin tu legs par smras ba 'di lta bu gzhan su zhig smra bar 'os /
analyzed: shin tu legs par smras ba 'di lta bu gzhan su zhig smra bar 'os /
translated: What other person could say such well-spoken words?

original: gzhan yang gal te 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na rgyu med pa yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu ma zhig pa kho na las 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na rgyu med pa yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu ma zhig pa kho na las 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Moreover, if the effect does not exist at the time when the cause exists, then at that time, one cannot say that the effect arises from the cause that has not disintegrated.

original: de'i tshe rgyu ma zhig pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu ma zhig pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time, the cause that has not disintegrated does not exist at all.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu ma zhig pa de'i tshe 'bras bu med @197a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu ma zhig pa de'i tshe 'bras bu med @197a * //
translated: When the cause has not disintegrated, the effect does not exist.

original: pa'i phyir de ji ltar ma zhig pa las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: pa'i phyir de ji ltar ma zhig pa las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could it arise from that which has not disintegrated?

original: gal te 'di snyam du ji ltar dngos po rang zhig nas med pa lhan cig ma chod pa yin yang dus gcig pa nyid ma yin pa dang / ji ltar grib ma dang / nyi ma dag dang 'bab chu'i rgyun dag la chu'i rgyun snga phyi dag med pa yin yang yul gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yang dag par med pa yin yang dus mnyam pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du ji ltar dngos po rang zhig nas med pa lhan cig ma chod pa yin yang dus gcig pa nyid ma yin pa dang / ji ltar grib ma dang / nyi ma dag dang 'bab chu'i rgyun dag la chu'i rgyun snga phyi dag med pa yin yang yul gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yang dag par med pa yin yang dus mnyam pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam
translated: If you think that just as a thing that has disintegrated and does not exist does not make contact with it, and just as the sun and shade, and the upper and lower parts of a stream do not exist at the same time, and just as the earlier and later parts of a stream do not exist in the same place, in the same way, cause and effect do not exist in the same time,

original: du sems na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: du sems na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable,

original: 'di la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the same objection and analysis apply to that.

original: 'di ltar de la yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag phyogs gcig gis mchod pa yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag phyogs gcig gis mchod pa yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, if things and non-things are partially obstructed, then it follows that they have parts.

original: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin na ni de'i tshe dus gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin na ni de'i tshe dus gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: But if they are completely obstructed, then they are simultaneous.

original: de bzhin du grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / chu'i rgyun dag kyang bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma chod pa yin na ni yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / chu'i rgyun dag kyang bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma chod pa yin na ni yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if shadows, sunlight, and a stream are completely unobstructed, then they are in the same place.

original: phyogs gcig gis mchod na ni cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis mchod na ni cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba yin no //
translated: But if they are partially obstructed, then it follows that they have parts.

original: kho bo cag la ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa 'di thams cad don dam par ma grub ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa 'di thams cad don dam par ma grub ste /
translated: But for us, all of these things and non-things and so on are not established ultimately.

original: de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa spros pa'i dra ba mtha' dag dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa spros pa'i dra ba mtha' dag dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the entire net of conceptual elaborations, such as entity and non-entity.

original: gang la mchod pa la sogs pa yang dag par 'gyur pa dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du yang 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang la mchod pa la sogs pa yang dag par 'gyur pa dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du yang 'ga' yang med do //
translated: And that which is called ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù in which worship, etc. would occur does not exist at all even conventionally.

original: 'on kyang dus phyi mar dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dgag pa tsam la gdags pa de ltar byas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dus phyi mar dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dgag pa tsam la gdags pa de ltar byas te /
translated: However, in the future, it is designated as the mere negation of the intrinsic reality of an entity.

original: de yang bar med par ci yang mi 'byung ste ;
analyzed: de yang bar med par ci yang mi 'byung ste ;
translated: And that does not occur without a break,

original: med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: it is only a mere non-existence.

original: dgag pa tsam ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir de dang lhan cig don dam pa pa'i mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa tsam ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir de dang lhan cig don dam pa pa'i mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a mere negation is nothing at all, the thought of ultimate worship, etc. does not occur in relation to it.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni don dam par dngos po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs gcig gis mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni don dam par dngos po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs gcig gis mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: But the thought of worship, etc. does occur in relation to the Buddha, etc. in one aspect, because cause and effect are accepted as entities in the ultimate.

original: 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the noble SƒÅlu Sprout S≈´tra says,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis srang mda'i mthon dman gyi dpes rgyu dang 'bras bu mchod pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni chad par lta ba spangs pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa kho na yin par lta'i /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis srang mda'i mthon dman gyi dpes rgyu dang 'bras bu mchod pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni chad par lta ba spangs pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa kho na yin par lta'i /
translated: The Lord has said that the offering of cause and effect is like the rising and falling of the two pans of a scale. This is only the conventional reality of cause and effect, in order to abandon the view of annihilation.

original: don dam pa ni ma @197b yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma @197b yin te /
translated: It is not the ultimate,

original: don dam par srang mda' ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par srang mda' ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the scale does not exist ultimately.

original: 'di ltar gal te srang mda' yan lag can gyi ngo bo zhig dpe nyid du ston na ni de ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te srang mda' yan lag can gyi ngo bo zhig dpe nyid du ston na ni de ma grub ste /
translated: If the scale were taught as an example of the nature of the whole, it would not be established,

original: gcig la cig car mthon dman la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i bya ba gnyis dang ldan par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la cig car mthon dman la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i bya ba gnyis dang ldan par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for one thing to have two mutually exclusive actions, such as rising and falling, simultaneously.

original: de ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid du yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid du yang ma grub ste /
translated: It is also not established as having the nature of an aggregation of subtle particles,

original: rdul rnams cha shas med pa nyid kyis bsags pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul rnams cha shas med pa nyid kyis bsags pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aggregation of particles is not possible, since the particles are partless.

original: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it has parts, it follows that it is not a real entity.

original: 'on te srang mda' rnam par shes pa snang ba'i ngo bo zhig sten na ni de yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo kho na yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa nyid yin pas ji ltar dngos po yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te srang mda' rnam par shes pa snang ba'i ngo bo zhig sten na ni de yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo kho na yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa nyid yin pas ji ltar dngos po yod par 'gyur /
translated: If the tip of the scale is consciousness, which is the nature of appearance, then since that is only an imagined nature, it is false. How could it be a real entity?

original: rnam par shes pa yang lus can ma yin pa'i phyir steng dang 'og tu 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang lus can ma yin pa'i phyir steng dang 'og tu 'gro ba med do //
translated: Also, consciousness is not material, so it does not move up and down.

original: 'dis ni grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / chu la sogs pa yang lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / chu la sogs pa yang lan btab pa yin no //
translated: This also answers the examples of shadows, sunlight, and water.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, in the noble La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra S≈´tra and so on,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bkag pa'i phyir srang mda' la sogs pa'i dpe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa kho na la rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bkag pa'i phyir srang mda' la sogs pa'i dpe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa kho na la rtogs par bya'o //
translated: refuted the nature of cause and effect. Therefore, the examples of the tip of the scale and so on should be understood to refer only to the conventional nature of cause and effect.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'dis rnam par rtog pa gsum bor te /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'dis rnam par rtog pa gsum bor te /
translated: But the BhagavƒÅn, having discarded the three alternatives,

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa kho na zhal gyis bzhes so zhes smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa kho na zhal gyis bzhes so zhes smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: accepts only the fourth alternative when he says, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that exists.‚ÄùüîΩWe respond to this statement:

original: ci 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i bka' 'di kho nas phyogs gsum bstsal ba dang / phyogs bzhi pa zhal gyis bzhes pa bstan tam /üîΩ'on te rigs pas yin /
analyzed: ci 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i bka' 'di kho nas phyogs gsum bstsal ba dang / phyogs bzhi pa zhal gyis bzhes pa bstan tam / 'on te rigs pas yin /
translated: Does this statement, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that exists,‚Äù teach that the three alternatives are rejected and the fourth alternative is accepted?

original: gal te bkas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bkas yin no zhe na /
translated: Or does it teach this by means of reasoning?üîΩIf you say it is by means of the Buddha‚Äôs word,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not reasoning.

original: grib ma dang / myu gu dag dang / mar me dang / 'od dus mnyam pa yod pa dag kyang /üîΩmar me la sogs pa 'di yod na /
analyzed: grib ma dang / myu gu dag dang / mar me dang / 'od dus mnyam pa yod pa dag kyang / mar me la sogs pa 'di yod na /
translated: Because shadows and sprouts, and lamps and light, which exist simultaneously,

original: 'od la sogs pa 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od la sogs pa 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: are not contradicted by the convention ‚ÄúWhen this lamp exists, that light exists.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar sgra 'dis ni 'bras bu yod pa rgyu yod pa la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra 'dis ni 'bras bu yod pa rgyu yod pa la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, this statement merely teaches that the existence of the effect is dependent on the existence of the cause.

original: 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na rgyu med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na rgyu med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not teach that at the time the effect exists, the cause does not exist.

original: dngos po rnams tshad ma gzhan gyis don dam par skad cig ma nyid du grub na yongs su rtogs pa de lta bu der 'gyur gyi /üîΩbkas ni ma yin no //üîΩ'jig rten gyi @198a * //
analyzed: dngos po rnams tshad ma gzhan gyis don dam par skad cig ma nyid du grub na yongs su rtogs pa de lta bu der 'gyur gyi / bkas ni ma yin no // 'jig rten gyi @198a * //
translated: If things are established as momentary by another valid cognition in the ultimate sense, then such a realization would be so.üîΩBut not by the word of the Buddha.

original: grags pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: grags pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Not by worldly consensus.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na grib ma dang myu gu la sogs pa dus mnyam pa na yod pa rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na grib ma dang myu gu la sogs pa dus mnyam pa na yod pa rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por shes pa nyid do //
translated: For in the world, even things that exist simultaneously, such as shade and a sprout, are known to be cause and effect.

original: 'on te rigs pas bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rigs pas bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
translated: But if it is a matter of reasoning,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' nye bar dgod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' nye bar dgod par mi bya ste /
translated: then at that time the word of the Buddha should not be cited,

original: de ni don 'di la khungs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don 'di la khungs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not a source for this matter.

original: rigs pa kho na zhig brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur na de yang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: rigs pa kho na zhig brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur na de yang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: If it were necessary to state only a reasoning, that also could not be stated.üîΩJust as the three types of reasoning are impossible, so too the fourth type of reasoning is also impossible in an ultimate sense.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar rigs pas rnam par rtog pa gsum mi srid pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa yang don dam par mi srid do zhes de ni rgyas par bstan zin to //üîΩgang dag grags pa las 'das te //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar rigs pas rnam par rtog pa gsum mi srid pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa yang don dam par mi srid do zhes de ni rgyas par bstan zin to // gang dag grags pa las 'das te //
translated: This has been extensively explained.

original: bdag la sogs pa'i rdzas rtag pa dang / rang dbang la sogs pa'i yon tan can du rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i rdzas rtag pa dang / rang dbang la sogs pa'i yon tan can du rtogs par byed cing /
translated: Those who go beyond what is renowned and who understand that the substance of the self and so on is permanent and possesses the qualities of independence and so on

original: las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa la sogs pa kun rdzob pa yang rnam par sel bar byed pa de dag gi lta ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rkyen nyid 'di btsam sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du gnas pa kun rdzob pa kho na
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa la sogs pa kun rdzob pa yang rnam par sel bar byed pa de dag gi lta ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rkyen nyid 'di btsam sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du gnas pa kun rdzob pa kho na
translated: and who also eliminate the conventional connections between actions and results and so on, in order to completely abandon their views, the Transcendent Conqueror said that this mere conditionality, which is like an illusion and so on, is only conventional.

original: la brten nas 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: la brten nas 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúIf this exists, that arises.‚Äù

original: bka' 'di las rnam par rtog pa gsum bstsal ba dang / rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa la brten par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bka' 'di las rnam par rtog pa gsum bstsal ba dang / rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa la brten par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be understood that the three alternatives of arising are refuted by this passage, and that the fourth alternative is affirmed.

original: de ltar na don dam par gzhan las kyang skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na don dam par gzhan las kyang skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, ultimately, arising from other is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi skye ba 'di thams cad ni sgyu ma 'byung ba bzhin du ma brtags na dga' ba ste brdzun pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi skye ba 'di thams cad ni sgyu ma 'byung ba bzhin du ma brtags na dga' ba ste brdzun pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, all of the arising of things is like the arising of an illusion. It is false and delightful only if not examined.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ma zhig pa las 'bras 'byung du //
analyzed: ma zhig pa las 'bras 'byung du //
translated: If the effect arises from the non-disintegrated

original: de tshe 'bras 'byung ci yang med ;
analyzed: de tshe 'bras 'byung ci yang med ;
translated: Cause, then at that time the effect would not exist.

original: /'on te zhig las 'bras 'byung na //
analyzed: /'on te zhig las 'bras 'byung na //
translated: But if the effect arises from the disintegrated,

original: de tshe 'bras bu gang las 'byung //üîΩsa bon 'gags dang ma 'gags las //
analyzed: de tshe 'bras bu gang las 'byung // sa bon 'gags dang ma 'gags las //
translated: From what does the effect arise at that time?üîΩThe arising of the effect is not possible

original: 'bras bu 'byung bar mi srid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung bar mi srid do //
translated: From the ceased or non-ceased seed.

original: skye ba sgyu ma skye ba bzhin //
analyzed: skye ba sgyu ma skye ba bzhin //
translated: Like the arising of an illusory woman,

original: 'di dag thams cad de yis brjod //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad de yis brjod //
translated: All of this is expressed by that.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon kha cig gis don dam par nang gi skye mched rkyen gzhan dag las mi skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon kha cig gis don dam par nang gi skye mched rkyen gzhan dag las mi skye ste /
translated: Therefore, some masters say, ultimately the internal sense bases do not arise from other conditions.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa'i gtan tshigs de yang ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa'i gtan tshigs de yang ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: The reason that was stated, ‚Äúbecause of being different,‚Äù etc., is not even open to doubt with regard to the counter-example.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ji skad bshad pa'i gnod pa can gyi tshad ma srid pa'i phyir yod pa ni mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa @198b dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ji skad bshad pa'i gnod pa can gyi tshad ma srid pa'i phyir yod pa ni mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa @198b dang 'dra'o //
translated: Because it is possible that there is a valid cognition that contradicts what was stated with regard to the counter-example, it is like the proof that existence is impermanent.

original: blun pa nyid la sogs par sgrub pa la ni gzhan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma cung zad kyang med pas de la ni 'di ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: blun pa nyid la sogs par sgrub pa la ni gzhan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma cung zad kyang med pas de la ni 'di ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: But in the proof of stupidity, etc., there is not the slightest valid cognition that contradicts difference in the counter-example, so it is not ascertained.

original: skye ba dgag pa bsgrub par bya'i /
analyzed: skye ba dgag pa bsgrub par bya'i /
translated: The refutation of arising should be established.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not established by a valid cognition that contradicts the counter-example.

original: tha snyad du ni gzhan nyid tsam grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad du ni gzhan nyid tsam grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Because difference itself is established conventionally, the reason is not unestablished.

original: gtan tshigs la sogs pa yang dag pa'i dngos por gyur pas tha snyad gdags par ni gang du yang ma grub bo zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs pa yang dag pa'i dngos por gyur pas tha snyad gdags par ni gang du yang ma grub bo zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been demonstrated that the reason and so forth are not established as real things, and therefore cannot be designated as anything.

original: de'i phyir kha cig 'di la ma nges pa dang / ma grub pa nyid kyi rjod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'brel pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha cig 'di la ma nges pa dang / ma grub pa nyid kyi rjod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'brel pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the claim by some that this is indeterminate and not established is irrelevant.

original: mu stegs can rnams gzhan la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ni dngos su gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i dngos po de lta bu kho na yin par brjod pa de dag la slob dpon gyis /üîΩdngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams gzhan la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ni dngos su gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i dngos po de lta bu kho na yin par brjod pa de dag la slob dpon gyis / dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The reason why the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna said to the tƒ´rthikas,üîΩThe nature of things

original: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin ;
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin ;
translated: Does not exist in the conditions and so on,

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun dbyung bar bshad de /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun dbyung bar bshad de /
translated: and so forth, is to refute the claim that the cause of the convention of other and so on is just the thing that is other and so on.

original: de'i phyir de gzhung lugs kyis gzhan nyid ma grub pas gzhan las mi skye'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gzhung lugs kyis gzhan nyid ma grub pas gzhan las mi skye'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that because otherness is not established by any system, there is no arising from other.

original: gang dag gzhan la sogs pa'i sgra brtags pa'i spyod yul gyi don can yang brgyud pas dngos po mthar thug pa kho na rjod par byed pa de dag kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin du rkyen la yod na skye ba ma yin no zhes dgongs nas sun dbyung ba
analyzed: gang dag gzhan la sogs pa'i sgra brtags pa'i spyod yul gyi don can yang brgyud pas dngos po mthar thug pa kho na rjod par byed pa de dag kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin du rkyen la yod na skye ba ma yin no zhes dgongs nas sun dbyung ba
translated: But even those who say that the words ‚Äúother‚Äù and so on refer to objects that are imagined, and that they ultimately refer only to real things, are refuted by the intention that if things exist in conditions, they are not essentially arisen.

original: yin te / ji ltar rkyen la sogs pa la yod na don dam par dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa de bzhin du rgyas par bstan ma thag pa yin no //üîΩde'i phyir gang gi tshe dngos po thams cad don dam par gzhan las skye ba mi 'thad pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe rkyen la sogs pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin pas yang dag par na gang la sgra 'di mthar thug par 'gyur
analyzed: yin te / ji ltar rkyen la sogs pa la yod na don dam par dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa de bzhin du rgyas par bstan ma thag pa yin no // de'i phyir gang gi tshe dngos po thams cad don dam par gzhan las skye ba mi 'thad pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe rkyen la sogs pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin pas yang dag par na gang la sgra 'di mthar thug par 'gyur
translated: For just as things do not ultimately arise essentially, since they exist in their conditions, this has been extensively explained.

original: pa gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: pa gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po ni ci yang med do //
translated: Therefore, since when all things are utterly unarisen from other ultimately, conditions and so on are not established because they are not arisen, in reality there is no real thing whatsoever that is the ultimate referent of the words ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir yang dag par de lta bu'i tha snyad ma grub tu zin kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par de lta bu'i tha snyad ma grub tu zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, although such a convention is not established in reality,

original: 'on kyang dngos po la ni gnod pa med pa kho na'o zhes smras pa gang yin pa de'i rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po la ni gnod pa med pa kho na'o zhes smras pa gang yin pa de'i rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: it is not at all undermined in terms of things.

original: grangs can gtso bo dbang phyug dang bcas par smra ba gang dag dngos po rnams gtso bo dbang phyug dang bcas pa las skye bar nye bar brjod pa na rang dang gzhan las de nye bar @199a * //
analyzed: grangs can gtso bo dbang phyug dang bcas par smra ba gang dag dngos po rnams gtso bo dbang phyug dang bcas pa las skye bar nye bar brjod pa na rang dang gzhan las de nye bar @199a * //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya who asserts the primacy of ƒ™≈õvara, when they state that things arise from ƒ™≈õvara and the primal nature, when they state that things arise from self and other,

original: brjod pa de dag gi phyogs ni so sor bshad pa'i nyes pas sun phyung ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: brjod pa de dag gi phyogs ni so sor bshad pa'i nyes pas sun phyung ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: their position is irrational because it is refuted by the faults explained individually.

original: gzhan gang dag res 'ga' rang dga'i dbang gis gnyi ga las skye bar brjod par 'gyur ba de dag kyang nyes pa gnyi gas sun phyung ba'i phyir bstsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag res 'ga' rang dga'i dbang gis gnyi ga las skye bar brjod par 'gyur ba de dag kyang nyes pa gnyi gas sun phyung ba'i phyir bstsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: Others who sometimes state that things arise from both, out of their own volition, are also refuted because they are refuted by both faults.

original: de'i phyir kha cig na re gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po tshad ma dang 'gal ba ni sus kyang cung zad kyang khas ma blangs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kha cig na re gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po tshad ma dang 'gal ba ni sus kyang cung zad kyang khas ma blangs te /
translated: Therefore, some say, ‚ÄúNo one at all accepts that a thing that is the nature of both is contradicted by valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir khyed ni de las skye ba sun 'byin par sems pa de kho nas bdag nyid rmongs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed ni de las skye ba sun 'byin par sems pa de kho nas bdag nyid rmongs te /
translated: Therefore, you think that you are refuting arising from both, but you are only confusing yourself,üîΩand you are just making a lot of noise.‚Äù

original: tshigs su gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni des rang dang gzhung lugs yongs su ma shes pa dang / sgra'i don ma rig pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir tshig de ni mkhas pa rnams kyis khyad du gsad par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni des rang dang gzhung lugs yongs su ma shes pa dang / sgra'i don ma rig pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir tshig de ni mkhas pa rnams kyis khyad du gsad par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: Since they do not understand their own and others‚Äô textual systems and do not understand the meaning of the words, the wise should just ignore those words.

original: gzhan dag ni tsher ma la sogs pa rno ba la sogs pa'i dpes dngos po thams cad yang dag par rgyu med pa kho nar skye bar nye bar brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tsher ma la sogs pa rno ba la sogs pa'i dpes dngos po thams cad yang dag par rgyu med pa kho nar skye bar nye bar brjod de /
translated: Others say that all things arise without a cause, just like the sharpness of thorns and so on, using this as an example.

original: de la de dag gi dngos po rnams rgyu med par skye ba don dam pa par bsgrub par bya ba la dpe ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la de dag gi dngos po rnams rgyu med par skye ba don dam pa par bsgrub par bya ba la dpe ma grub ste /
translated: In that case, the example is not established for them in the proof that things arise without a cause ultimately.

original: don dam pa par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things are unproduced in the ultimate sense.

original: de kun rdzob par bsgrub par bya ba la yang ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de kun rdzob par bsgrub par bya ba la yang ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: Nor is it established in the relative sense,

original: 'di ltar tsher ma la sogs pa rang gi sa bon la sogs pa las 'byung bar mngon sum 'dis rnam par nges la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tsher ma la sogs pa rang gi sa bon la sogs pa las 'byung bar mngon sum 'dis rnam par nges la /
translated: because it is ascertained by direct perception that such things as a thorn come from their own seeds, etc.

original: de nyid kyis de dag gi rno ba la sogs pa yang nges pas gang yang rgyu med par skye ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de dag gi rno ba la sogs pa yang nges pas gang yang rgyu med par skye ba med do //
translated: And it is ascertained by that same direct perception that such things as the sharpness of a thorn come from their own seeds, etc. Therefore, nothing arises without a cause.

original: 'di ltar dngos po 'di thams cad la lar res 'ga' 'byung bas ltos pa dang bcas par yongs su nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po 'di thams cad la lar res 'ga' 'byung bas ltos pa dang bcas par yongs su nges pa nyid de /
translated: Because all these things arise somewhere and at some time, it is ascertained that they are dependent.

original: ltos pa med pa rnams ni rtag tu khyad par med pas res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa rnams ni rtag tu khyad par med pas res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those that are independent are always without distinction, it is not tenable that they are sometimes.

original: de dag gi ltos par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi ltos par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid rgyu yin te /
translated: That which is the basis of their dependence is their cause,

original: phan pa med pa la ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa med pa la ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that they depend on that which is not beneficial.

original: de la phan pa nyid du grags pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de la phan pa nyid du grags pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: That which is renowned as beneficial is established as the cause of those.

original: rgyu med pa nyid yin na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir tsher ma la sogs pa dag la rno ba la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid yin na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir tsher ma la sogs pa dag la rno ba la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no cause, then sharpness, etc., would not be ascertained in thorns, etc., because there would be no distinction.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, everything would be of the nature of everything.

original: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang 'jig @199b rten na mngon sum kho nar grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang 'jig @199b rten na mngon sum kho nar grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, the fact that seed, sprout, etc., are things that are cause and effect is established by direct perception in the world.

original: dam bcas pa la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang yin la /
analyzed: dam bcas pa la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, the thesis is contradicted by direct perception.

original: gzhan dag la gtan tshigs las bsgrub par bya ba la nges par skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la gtan tshigs las bsgrub par bya ba la nges par skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yang yin no //
translated: And because others accept that ascertainment arises from the reason with regard to the probandum, there is also contradiction of your own words.

original: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs sbyor ba don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs sbyor ba don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
