translated: If it were not so, then the application of the reason would be pointless.

original: dam bcas pa tsam gyis ni 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa tsam gyis ni 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: But the desired object is not accomplished merely by a vow.

original: thams cad kyis thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyis thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that everyone would accomplish everything.

original: de lta bas na rgyu med par smra ba 'di ni tha snyad du yang mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis thag bsrings te spang bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu med par smra ba 'di ni tha snyad du yang mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis thag bsrings te spang bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, this theory of causelessness is to be rejected by the wise, for it is to be avoided from afar, because it is undermined by perception and the other means of valid cognition even in terms of the surface level.

original: gtan tshigs la sogs pa sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du gnas pa ma brtags na dga' ba ji ltar grags pa ma bkag pa'i phyir skye ba med par smra ba la ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i gnod pa med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs pa sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du gnas pa ma brtags na dga' ba ji ltar grags pa ma bkag pa'i phyir skye ba med par smra ba la ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i gnod pa med do //
translated: But for the proponents of nonarising, there is no undermining by perception and the other means of valid cognition, because, like a magician's trick, the reason and so on are not refuted if they are not analyzed and are accepted as they are commonly perceived.

original: chos can ma grub pa la sogs ba'i nyes pa ni sngar bsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: chos can ma grub pa la sogs ba'i nyes pa ni sngar bsal ba nyid do //
translated: The faults of the subject not being established and so on have already been cleared away.

original: de ltar na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Thus, because it exists in the similar class, the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory.

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ma skyes pa ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du nyams su myong ba med pas skye bas de dag la khyab pa'i phyir de yang dag par ldog na de yang ldog par 'gyur bsam nges pa nyid kyang ma yin noüîΩ// skye pa 'jug pa ni gcig tu de la yang dag par sgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ma skyes pa ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du nyams su myong ba med pas skye bas de dag la khyab pa'i phyir de yang dag par ldog na de yang ldog par 'gyur bsam nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no // skye pa 'jug pa ni gcig tu de la yang dag par sgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Unarisen things, such as the sky-flower, are not experienced as having an essence, and so arising does not pervade them. Therefore, if arising is refuted, they are not refuted.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa na bu la sogs pa mi bden pa yang skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa na bu la sogs pa mi bden pa yang skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Arising is not established as a real entity, because in dreams and so on, unreal sons and so forth appear to arise.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa de nyid de lta bur snang ngo zhes bya bar rigs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa de nyid de lta bur snang ngo zhes bya bar rigs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that consciousness itself appears in that way,

original: de la yang dag par na de'i rnam pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de la yang dag par na de'i rnam pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: because it has already been demonstrated that it is impossible for it to have such an aspect.

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bor snang bar yang rigs pa ma yin te de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bor snang bar yang rigs pa ma yin te de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable for something else to appear as the essence of something else, because identity and difference are mutually exclusive.

original: skye ba des ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa la khyab kyang skye ba la nges par ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa yang dag par ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: skye ba des ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa la khyab kyang skye ba la nges par ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa yang dag par ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: Although arising does pervade that which has intrinsic reality, it is not established that that which arises is definitely that which has intrinsic reality.

original: khyab par byed pa nye na gdon mi za bar khyab par bya ba thams cad nye ba nyid du nges pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin te /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa nye na gdon mi za bar khyab par bya ba thams cad nye ba nyid du nges pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin te /
translated: It has been previously explained that when the pervader is near, it is not definitely ascertained that the pervaded is necessarily near.

original: de ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang dag par na gang la yang skye ba 'jug @200a * //
analyzed: de ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro // yang dag par na gang la yang skye ba 'jug @200a * //
translated: Because that is common to both.üîΩIt has also been proven that in reality, there is no arising of anything.

original: pa med do zhes kyang rab tu bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: pa med do zhes kyang rab tu bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has also been proven that in reality, there is no arising of anything.

original: gang dag yang dngos po rnams ni rkyen dag las mi skye'i /
analyzed: gang dag yang dngos po rnams ni rkyen dag las mi skye'i /
translated: Those who think that things do not arise from conditions,

original: 'o na zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na zhe na /
translated: but rather

original: de dag gis gsal bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: de dag gis gsal bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: that they are merely clarified by them,

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa de yang sngar bsal ba spyir bstsal ba'i phyir spangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa de yang sngar bsal ba spyir bstsal ba'i phyir spangs pa nyid do //
translated: think that the reason is indeterminate. But that has already been refuted in the general refutation of arising.

original: gal te rkyen dag las dngos po gsal bar 'gyur na rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas pa'i ngo bo 'am /
analyzed: gal te rkyen dag las dngos po gsal bar 'gyur na rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas pa'i ngo bo 'am /
translated: the nature of the manifestation of its own characteristic,

original: de'i sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa'i bdag nyid dam /üîΩdbang po legs par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa'i bdag nyid dam / dbang po legs par byed pa'am /
translated: the nature of the complete exhaustion of its obscurations,üîΩthe nature of the proper functioning of the sense faculty,

original: yul de la rnam par shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid gcig tu 'gyur grang zhes rnam par brtags te /
analyzed: yul de la rnam par shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid gcig tu 'gyur grang zhes rnam par brtags te /
translated: or the nature of the arising of consciousness characterized by the object.

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first position is not tenable,

original: rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te rang gi ngo bo ma rgyas pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig la gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen las so //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gal te rang gi ngo bo ma rgyas pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig la gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen las so //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would not be permanent.üîΩIf the nonmanifestation of its own nature is due to the destruction of its own continuum and the manifestation of its own nature is due to the conditions that manifest it,

original: ngo bo nyid rgyas pa gzhan zhig skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe de las rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rgyas pa gzhan zhig skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe de las rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be another entity that is the manifestation of its own nature that arises.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that it would not be permanent.

original: rang gi ngo bo snga ma ma 'gags na gcig la rgyas pa dang ma rgyas pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis 'chol par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo snga ma ma 'gags na gcig la rgyas pa dang ma rgyas pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis 'chol par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If its own entity has not ceased, then it would be contradictory for the two natures of expansion and non-expansion to be mixed in one.

original: rang gi ngo bo sngon med pa zhig mi skye na yang gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen don med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo sngon med pa zhig mi skye na yang gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen don med par 'gyur la /
translated: If something that did not exist previously is not produced, then the conditions that manifest it would be pointless.

original: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yang sngar rgyas par bstsal ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yang sngar rgyas par bstsal ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: And the production of things has already been extensively refuted above. Therefore it is illogical.

original: sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the nature of the complete exhaustion of obscurations,

original: med pa'i ngo bo de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis gang gis kyang byed par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i ngo bo de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis gang gis kyang byed par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for anything to produce that non-entity which is the nature of non-existence.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo la yang bya ba sngar bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo la yang bya ba sngar bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And with regard to the nature of things, action has already been refuted above.

original: de don gzhan du gyur pa zhig byed pa yin na ni rkyen rnams ji ltar dngos po'i gsal bar byed pa yin na don gzhan du ma gyur pa ni byed bar mi srid pa nyid de /
analyzed: de don gzhan du gyur pa zhig byed pa yin na ni rkyen rnams ji ltar dngos po'i gsal bar byed pa yin na don gzhan du ma gyur pa ni byed bar mi srid pa nyid de /
translated: If it were to make something else its object, then how could conditions clarify an entity? It is not possible for something that does not become something else to be a cause,

original: de ni sngon nyid nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngon nyid nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it already exists.

original: dngos po rtag pa la ni /üîΩrang bzhin gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig ma bshig pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa la ni / rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig ma bshig pa'am /
translated: With regard to a permanent entity,

original: ma bskyed par sgrib par byed pa nam yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma bskyed par sgrib par byed pa nam yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is never logical for something to obscure it without destroying or producing some specific attribute of it,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: yul de la rnam par shes pa skye ba'i gags byed pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul de la rnam par shes pa skye ba'i gags byed pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical that it obscures it by simply preventing the arising of consciousness of that object,

original: de rang gi yul rnam par shes pa skyed @200b par nus pa'am /
analyzed: de rang gi yul rnam par shes pa skyed @200b par nus pa'am /
translated: because if that object is able to produce consciousness of itself,

original: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin na ni shes pa rgyu ma tshang ba med pa la gang gis kyang gags byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin na ni shes pa rgyu ma tshang ba med pa la gang gis kyang gags byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or if it is by nature something that is cognized by consciousness of it, then nothing can obscure it, since consciousness that is not deficient in its causes is able to cognize it.

original: 'on te 'di mi nus pa'am de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni de'i tshe bdag nyid kyis rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir yul de la rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir 'di yul de la rnam par shes
analyzed: 'on te 'di mi nus pa'am de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni de'i tshe bdag nyid kyis rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir yul de la rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir 'di yul de la rnam par shes
translated: But if it is not able to do that or if it is not the nature of that consciousness to cognize it, then at that time consciousness does not arise with respect to that object because its cause is incomplete. Therefore it is not consciousness of that object.

original: pa skye ba'i gags byed pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa skye ba'i gags byed pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is not able to do that, or if it is not the nature of the object to be cognized by that consciousness, then at that time, because its own cause is incomplete, consciousness does not arise with regard to that object. Therefore, it is not reasonable that it obstructs that object by preventing the arising of consciousness with regard to it.

original: sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa bzhin du skye ba la gags byed pa med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang byed par mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa bzhin du skye ba la gags byed pa med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang byed par mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: And it is not reasonable that it has the nature of preventing the arising of consciousness, etc., as if it were the complete exhaustion of obstruction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi nus pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi nus pa'i phyir ram /
translated: For that very reason, because it is not able to do that,

original: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen dag ni de la sgrib par byed pa zlog tu zin kyang /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen dag ni de la sgrib par byed pa zlog tu zin kyang /
translated: or because it is not the nature of the object to be cognized by that consciousness, even if the conditions that make it manifest are removed,

original: yul de la rnam par shes pa skye bar rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yul de la rnam par shes pa skye bar rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: it is not reasonable that consciousness arises with regard to that object.

original: ji ste nus par khas len na ni /
analyzed: ji ste nus par khas len na ni /
translated: If you accept that it is possible,

original: de'i tshe sgrib par byed pa yod kyang de la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rtag tu skye bar 'gyur bas gsal bar byed pa rnams kyi byed pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgrib par byed pa yod kyang de la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rtag tu skye bar 'gyur bas gsal bar byed pa rnams kyi byed pa don med pa yin no //
translated: then consciousness would always arise, because the cause is not incomplete, even when there is something that obstructs it. Therefore, the activity of the illuminating cause would be pointless.

original: de lta bas na rtag pa rnams la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir 'ga' yang sgrib par byed par rigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag pa rnams la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir 'ga' yang sgrib par byed par rigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, because they do not perform any function with regard to permanent things, it is not reasonable that they obstruct anything.

original: mi rtag pa rnams ni rgyu'i khyad par kho na res 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnams ni rgyu'i khyad par kho na res 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But impermanent things obstruct because they generate a different moment that is unable to generate consciousness, due to the specific cause.

original: dbang po legs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po legs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the case that the sense faculty is a good producer.

original: legs par byed pa de'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa zhig byed na ni mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: legs par byed pa de'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa zhig byed na ni mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that good producer is its intrinsic nature, it follows that it is impermanent,

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: as was explained earlier.

original: legs par byed pa don gzhan du gyur pa zhig byed na ni de legs par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: legs par byed pa don gzhan du gyur pa zhig byed na ni de legs par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is a different object that is well-made, then it is not logical that it is well-made,

original: de la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not do anything to it.

original: de lta ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: dngos po gang la gang gis kyang cung zad kyang byed par mi srid ces sngar bstan zin to //üîΩdbang po legs par yin du chug kyang gal te gsal bar bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po de dag nyid kyis /
analyzed: dngos po gang la gang gis kyang cung zad kyang byed par mi srid ces sngar bstan zin to // dbang po legs par yin du chug kyang gal te gsal bar bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po de dag nyid kyis /
translated: It has been previously explained that it is impossible for anything to do anything to anything.

original: dbang po de'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po de'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa'am /
translated: Even if the sense faculty is well-made, if those things that are to be clarified are not able to generate the consciousness of that sense faculty,

original: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin zhig @201a * //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin zhig @201a * //
translated: or if they are not the nature of what is to be cognized by that consciousness,üîΩthen at that time consciousness will not be generated with respect to them.

original: ma yin na ni de'i tshe de la rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid pas legs par byed pa don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yin na ni de'i tshe de la rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid pas legs par byed pa don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is meaningless for them to be well-made.

original: 'on te nus pa'am de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par bya ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin na ni de'i tshe dbang po legs par byed pa'i sngon rol du yang de la rnam par shes pa skye bar thal bas de legs par byed pa don med pa nyid do
analyzed: 'on te nus pa'am de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par bya ba'i rang bzhin zhig yin na ni de'i tshe dbang po legs par byed pa'i sngon rol du yang de la rnam par shes pa skye bar thal bas de legs par byed pa don med pa nyid do
translated: But if it is the nature of the sense faculty to be activated by potential or by consciousness, then it follows that consciousness would arise prior to the sense faculty being activated, and so it would be pointless to activate it.

original: // de nyid kyi phyir yul de la rnam par shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: // de nyid kyi phyir yul de la rnam par shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: For that reason, it is also not the defining characteristic of the arising of consciousness in relation to that object.

original: 'di ltar gal te gsal bar bya ba'i dngos po de bdag nyid kyis mi nus pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te gsal bar bya ba'i dngos po de bdag nyid kyis mi nus pa'am /
translated: In this way, if the thing to be clarified is not able to do so by itself,

original: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa de bskyed kyang /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa de bskyed kyang /
translated: or if it is not the nature of the object to be cognized by consciousness, then even if consciousness is generated,

original: de ni de'i yul nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i yul nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it will not become the object of that consciousness.

original: 'on te nus pa'am de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin na ni de'i tshe de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de yod pa tsam gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir rtag tu nye ba kho na yin pas gsal bar
analyzed: 'on te nus pa'am de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin na ni de'i tshe de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de yod pa tsam gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir rtag tu nye ba kho na yin pas gsal bar
translated: But if it is by nature an object of consciousness, either as a potential or as an aspect of consciousness, then consciousness arises merely through its existence, like its own nature.

original: byed pa rnams rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa rnams rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is always present, the manifestor is not the producer of consciousness.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyi lugs kyis dngos po'i rigs thams cad rtag tu gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gsal ba dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / gsal bar bya ba yang dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir gsal ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyi lugs kyis dngos po'i rigs thams cad rtag tu gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gsal ba dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / gsal bar bya ba yang dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir gsal ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, in your system, since all types of things always exist by way of their own natures, it is illogical to posit manifestor, manifested, and manifestation as existing at all times,

original: gsal bar byed pa rnams cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa rnams cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the manifestor does not perform any function.

original: dngos po thams cad dus thams cad du gsal ba la sogs pa thal ba yang bzlog dka' ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dus thams cad du gsal ba la sogs pa thal ba yang bzlog dka' ste /
translated: It is also difficult to refute the absurd consequence that all things are always manifest and so on,üîΩbecause all things always exist by way of their own natures.

original: rtag tu rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause is always complete and near.

original: gzhan yang gsal ba ni dngos po rtag pa kho na la kun brtags pa yin na rtag pa zhes bya ba yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir dngos por mi 'thad pa nyid pas des gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid lta ga la yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsal ba ni dngos po rtag pa kho na la kun brtags pa yin na rtag pa zhes bya ba yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir dngos por mi 'thad pa nyid pas des gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid lta ga la yin /
translated: Moreover, if manifestation is imputed to a permanent thing, then what is called ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is untenable as a thing because it is empty of all abilities. Therefore, how could your reason be unestablished?

original: 'di ltar gang zhig nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa de ni dngos po med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa de ni dngos po med pa yin te /
translated: In this way, whatever is empty of all abilities does not exist as a thing,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: like, for example, the son of a barren woman.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag par 'dod pa mtha' dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag par 'dod pa mtha' dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: This is also the case with all those who assert ƒ™≈õvara and so on to be permanent.

original: de yang rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa nyid du sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yang rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa nyid du sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Moreover, because it is contradictory for something permanent to be a functioning thing, it has already been demonstrated that it is empty of all abilities.

original: de'i phyir rigs mthun pa la srid @201b pas gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs mthun pa la srid @201b pas gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, because it is possible for things to be of the same type, this reason is not unestablished.

original: 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it indeterminate, because it would follow that the son of a barren woman and so on would be entities.

original: 'di lta ste nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba 'di kho na dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba 'di kho na dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The definition of nonentity is this: it is devoid of all ability.

original: de ni 'dus ma byas la yang yod pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar dngos po nyid yin /
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma byas la yang yod pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar dngos po nyid yin /
translated: Since that exists even in the unconditioned, how can it be an entity?üîΩTherefore, those who imagine that analytical cessations and so on are entities, despite their being empty of all ability and not being different from the son of a barren woman and so on,

original: des na gang dag so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la sogs pa nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa la yang dngos po nyid du yongs su rtog par byed pa de dag gi rtog pa de niüîΩrigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na gang dag so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la sogs pa nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa la yang dngos po nyid du yongs su rtog par byed pa de dag gi rtog pa de ni rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: their imagination

original: de la de'i rgyu 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de'i rgyu 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is illogical, because there is no cause for it.

original: 'di ltar ji ste so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la sogs pa de 'ga' zhig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gdon mi za bar de de'i rgyu'i dngos por khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ste so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la sogs pa de 'ga' zhig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gdon mi za bar de de'i rgyu'i dngos por khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: Thus, if cessation through analysis and so on were the object of some consciousness, then at that time, it would be necessary to accept that it is the cause of that consciousness.

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not a cause is not suitable to be an object.

original: rgyu'i khyad par kho na rang gi rnam par gtod pas rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs pa nyid du 'gyur ba na yul yin no zhes 'dzer te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par kho na rang gi rnam par gtod pas rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs pa nyid du 'gyur ba na yul yin no zhes 'dzer te /
translated: Some say: It is the object because it is the cause of consciousness, since it is the cause that projects its aspect to consciousness.

original: de lta yin na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams par thal ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams par thal ba yin te /
translated: If that were the case, it would follow that its permanence would be undermined.

original: de ni tha snyad du yang rim dang cig shos dag gis don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni tha snyad du yang rim dang cig shos dag gis don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is untenable that it performs a function through a sequence or simultaneously, even conventionally.

original: /'on te de phan pa med bzhin du yang de'i shes pas shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir yul nyid du rtog par byed na ni de'i tshe de'i shes pas shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang na de'i shes pa yang de
analyzed: /'on te de phan pa med bzhin du yang de'i shes pas shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir yul nyid du rtog par byed na ni de'i tshe de'i shes pas shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang na de'i shes pa yang de
translated: But if you imagine that it is an object even though it is not the nature of what is to be known by that cognition, then at that time, if the nature of what is to be known by that cognition is followed, then that cognition

original: 'dra ba nyid du rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid du rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: would also follow it in the same way, and so it would follow that it is permanent.

original: ji ste mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams pa yin no //üîΩ'on te yang de ni tha na thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyang rung /
analyzed: ji ste mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams pa yin no // 'on te yang de ni tha na thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyang rung /
translated: But if it is not followed, then its permanence is undermined.üîΩBut if you imagine that it is not the object of anything at all, not even the mind of an omniscient one,

original: 'ga'i yul gyi dngos por yang nye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes rtog par byed na de'i tshe de la rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams dngos po yod par tha snyad 'dogs par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga'i yul gyi dngos por yang nye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes rtog par byed na de'i tshe de la rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams dngos po yod par tha snyad 'dogs par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then at that time it is not reasonable for those who imagine it to designate it as an existent thing,

original: der tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu de shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu de shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause for designating it as that is not known.

original: gang gis na de las rnam par dbye bar rtogs par 'gyur ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo las kyang de khyad par du brjod dgos te /üîΩdngos po med pa las rab tu rnam par ma phye ba'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po @202a * //
analyzed: gang gis na de las rnam par dbye bar rtogs par 'gyur ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo las kyang de khyad par du brjod dgos te / dngos po med pa las rab tu rnam par ma phye ba'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po @202a * //
translated: But it is not possible to distinguish it from that, because it must be distinguished from all expressions such as ‚Äúrabbit horns,‚Äù etc., which have no entity at all.

original: nyid du rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid du rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And the entity of something that is not distinguished from non-entity cannot be understood as an entity.

original: de la bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par yod do zhes brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par yod do zhes brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable to say that it has a distinguishing characteristic that is the nature of holding its own entity,

original: dngos po med pa la yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even non-entities have the nature of holding their own entity, which is devoid of all abilities.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa de lta bu la yang dngos po dngos po zhes ming du 'dogs na ni brtsad pa med do /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa de lta bu la yang dngos po dngos po zhes ming du 'dogs na ni brtsad pa med do /
translated: If you call something that is not different from a barren woman‚Äôs son, etc. an entity, then there is no debate.

original: 'on kyang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la yang rgyu med par ci ste mi brjod ces ni smra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la yang rgyu med par ci ste mi brjod ces ni smra'o //
translated: But why not say that the son of a barren woman and so on are also without cause?

original: de lta bas na 'di lta ste 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du smra ba 'di ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di lta ste 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du smra ba 'di ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this assertion that the unconditioned exists is not good.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
translated: For this very reason, the noble La·πÖk√¢vatƒÅra declares:

original: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste nam mkha' dang 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa ma byas pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste nam mkha' dang 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa ma byas pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the superimposition of the non-existent is the superimposition of the unfabricated entity that is, space, cessation, and nirvƒÅ·πáa.‚Äù

original: gang gzhan dag rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa gang zag la sogs pas bsgrub pa gnyi yang ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gzhan dag rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa gang zag la sogs pas bsgrub pa gnyi yang ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who say that the person and so on are not to be described as permanent or impermanent and so on, and that both of the two proofs are indeterminate, are not correct.

original: dngos po yod pa la ji ltar yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la ji ltar yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for an existent thing to be indescribable in any way.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni cig sgrub pa dang / dgag pa dang / gzhan dgag pa dang / sgrub pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir cig dgag pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po gzhan sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba nyid yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni cig sgrub pa dang / dgag pa dang / gzhan dgag pa dang / sgrub pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir cig dgag pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po gzhan sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba nyid yin /
translated: Thus, if one of the two mutually exclusive and exhaustive characteristics of permanence and impermanence is established or refuted, or if the other is not established or is not refuted, then the other is established or is refuted. Therefore, how could it be that things are inexpressible?

original: de lta ma yin na khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then because there would be no distinction, everything would be inexpressible.

original: de lta bas na rang dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po'i bye brag ma lus pa dag gzhom pa'i phyir bdag nyid chen po rnams kyis /
analyzed: de lta bas na rang dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po'i bye brag ma lus pa dag gzhom pa'i phyir bdag nyid chen po rnams kyis /
translated: Therefore, in order to destroy all the various things that are spoken of by ourselves and others, the great beings

original: rdo rje'i gzegs ma thogs pa med pa bzhi po 'di dag rab tu gsungs pa'i phyir lam 'di thams cad kyis 'gal bar mi bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: rdo rje'i gzegs ma thogs pa med pa bzhi po 'di dag rab tu gsungs pa'i phyir lam 'di thams cad kyis 'gal bar mi bya ba nyid de /
translated: have spoken these four vajra-precipitates, which are unimpeded. Therefore, one should not contradict any of these paths.

original: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //üîΩdngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Not from both, nor without cause.üîΩIn no place and in no time

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Is there an existent arising.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad yang dag par na bdag med par rab tu bsgrubs pa yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi @202b phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad yang dag par na bdag med par rab tu bsgrubs pa yin no // de nyid kyi @202b phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: Thus, it is well established that all phenomena are ultimately without self.

original: dngos po rnams la rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'dzin pa bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'dzin pa bkag pa yin te /
translated: For this very reason, the Transcendent Conqueror has refuted the apprehension of things as permanent or impermanent in the Perfection of WisdomüîΩsutras.

original: de bzhin du khungs kyi mdo rnams kyang sngar bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khungs kyi mdo rnams kyang sngar bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: The sutras that are the sources for this have been presented above.üîΩSimilarly, the sutras say:

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang gal te gzugs rtag go zhes bya bar brjod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang gal te gzugs rtag go zhes bya bar brjod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúForm is permanent,‚Äù you are not practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs de nyid kyang de ltar yod pa ma yin na rtag par 'gyur ba lta ci zhig smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs de nyid kyang de ltar yod pa ma yin na rtag par 'gyur ba lta ci zhig smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since form does not exist in that way, what need is there to mention that it is permanent?

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, this should be applied up to the end of the exalted wisdom of omniscience.

original: de lta bas na 'dir gang gzhan las 'bras bu skye ba la ga 'gal ba ci zhig yod na /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir gang gzhan las 'bras bu skye ba la ga 'gal ba ci zhig yod na /
translated: Thus, what contradiction is there in the effect arising from something else?

original: gang gis na de las kyang 'bras bu skye ba 'gog par byed /
analyzed: gang gis na de las kyang 'bras bu skye ba 'gog par byed /
translated: By what is the arising of the effect from that also refuted?

original: 'di la ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de thams cad kyang lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de thams cad kyang lan btab pa yin no //
translated: And all of this, such as ‚ÄúHere there is no valid cognition that contradicts it,‚Äù is also answered.

original: gang yang 'bras bu yod pa skye bar dgag par bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang 'bras bu yod pa skye bar dgag par bya ba la /
translated: Also, what was said, ‚ÄúIn the refutation of the arising of an existent effect,

original: khyed la gnyi ga la grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed la gnyi ga la grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: you have no reason or example established for both,‚Äù and so on, is also illogical.

original: 'di ltar yod pa zhes bya ba ci zhes bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa zhes bya ba ci zhes bya /
translated: Because what is called ‚Äúexistent‚Äù is what?

original: cha shas med pa la cha shas kyis 'grub pa mi srid pa'i phyir gang bdag nyid thams cad kyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: cha shas med pa la cha shas kyis 'grub pa mi srid pa'i phyir gang bdag nyid thams cad kyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo zhig yin grang na /
translated: because it is impossible for that which has no parts to be established by parts.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan dag gis sngon med pa'i khyad par byar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan dag gis sngon med pa'i khyad par byar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that which is an established entity cannot be made to have a difference that did not exist before by others.

original: gang zhig gzhan dag gis sngon med pa'i khyad par byar med pa de ni nam yang gang gis kyang mi skyed de /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan dag gis sngon med pa'i khyad par byar med pa de ni nam yang gang gis kyang mi skyed de /
translated: That which cannot be made to have a difference that did not exist before is never produced by anything,

original: dper na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa lta bu'o ;
translated: like the sky-lotus and so on.

original: / yod par mngon par 'dod pa de yang de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ji ltar gtan tshigs la sogs pa mi srid pa yin no //
analyzed: / yod par mngon par 'dod pa de yang de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ji ltar gtan tshigs la sogs pa mi srid pa yin no //
translated: And that which is asserted to exist is like that, so how is it possible that there is no reason and so on?

original: rnam par gcad pa tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs su yang de lta bu ston pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam par gcad pa tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs su yang de lta bu ston pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is only an exclusion that is established, and because such is taught as the reason,

original: de dag kyang chos can dngos por ma gyur pa la yang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dngos por ma gyur pa la yang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because those are not contradictory even with regard to a real subject.

original: de'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the error of the unestablished reason arises.

original: 'di ni sngar bstan zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngar bstan zin pa kho na'o //
translated: This has already been explained above.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dag mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //üîΩtha snyad kyi sgo nas khyad par @203a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dag mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no // tha snyad kyi sgo nas khyad par @203a * //
translated: Nor is the reason contradictory, because the property to be established and the proving property are concomitant with the similar class.

original: du byar yod pa nyid kyis skye ba la khyab pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa log na khyab par bya ba mi srid pas ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: du byar yod pa nyid kyis skye ba la khyab pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa log na khyab par bya ba mi srid pas ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Since arising is pervaded by the existence of a difference that is made conventionally, it is not the case that the reason is indeterminate, because when the pervader is negated, the pervaded is necessarily negated.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gzhan dag gis khyad par du byed pa de ni rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gzhan dag gis khyad par du byed pa de ni rang bzhin yin la /
translated: In this way, that which is made different by others is the essence.

original: gzhan gang yin pa de ji ltar de'i yin /
analyzed: gzhan gang yin pa de ji ltar de'i yin /
translated: How could that which is different from it be it?

original: sngon gnas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rgyu nye ba'i sngon rol nas gnas pa'i phyir de ji ltar rgyu dag las grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sngon gnas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rgyu nye ba'i sngon rol nas gnas pa'i phyir de ji ltar rgyu dag las grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the essence that existed previously exists prior to the proximity of the cause, how could it be said that it is established from causes?

original: de lta bas na ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not indeterminate.

original: ji ste gal te khyad par du byar yod pa nyid kyis skye ba la khyab na 'o na ni med pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na tha snyad kyi sgo nas yin du zad de /
analyzed: ji ste gal te khyad par du byar yod pa nyid kyis skye ba la khyab na 'o na ni med pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na tha snyad kyi sgo nas yin du zad de /
translated: If you say that if arising is pervaded by the quality of being able to be distinguished, then non-existent things would arise, we reply: this is only in terms of conventional expressions,

original: de yang dag par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dag par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in reality.

original: 'di ltar gal te rang bzhin gyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na de ji ltar dus phyis kyang yod pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rang bzhin gyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na de ji ltar dus phyis kyang yod pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if it is essentially non-existent, how could it later become existent?

original: yod pa dang med pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence and non-existence are mutually exclusive.

original: gang zhig gang yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de ji ltar chos de dang ldan pa'i chos can dang nye bar ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de ji ltar chos de dang ldan pa'i chos can dang nye bar ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: How could a phenomenon that is characterized by the abandonment of something else be related to a phenomenon that possesses that phenomenon?

original: dper na lus can ma yin pa'i chos su gtogs pa nam mkha' la lus can nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lus can ma yin pa'i chos su gtogs pa nam mkha' la lus can nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the essential as- pect of being non-physical being related to space.

original: skye ba zhes yang dag par bsgrags pa yod pa'i ngo bo yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de ji ltar don dam par med pa dang nye bar ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba zhes yang dag par bsgrags pa yod pa'i ngo bo yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de ji ltar don dam par med pa dang nye bar ldan par 'gyur /
translated: The entity of what is called ‚Äúarising‚Äù is the characteristic of enduring, having completely abandoned the entity of nonexistence. How could it be that which ultimately lacks arising?üîΩIf you think that which is called ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is not the slightest bit existent, since it is endowed with the activity of arising, and that which is called ‚Äúarising‚Äù is the arising of that,

original: gal te 'di snyam du med pa zhes bya ba gang zhig skye ba'i bya ba dang ldan pas skye bar nye bar brjod pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du med pa zhes bya ba gang zhig skye ba'i bya ba dang ldan pas skye bar nye bar brjod pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: then, although there is nothing at all that is called ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù that is endowed with the activity of arising and is said to arise,

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i bdag nyid nus pa so sor nges pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig gi mjug thogs su 'byung bar yang dag par snang ba gang yin pa 'di sngon byung bar gyur pa ma yin pas de'i rgyus 'di med pa skye'o zhes 'jig rten na skye ba'i khyad
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i bdag nyid nus pa so sor nges pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig gi mjug thogs su 'byung bar yang dag par snang ba gang yin pa 'di sngon byung bar gyur pa ma yin pas de'i rgyus 'di med pa skye'o zhes 'jig rten na skye ba'i khyad
translated: nevertheless, the nature of an entity that is the certain cause of a specific capacity appears to arise after some cause. Since it did not exist previously, because of its cause, it is called ‚Äúarising.‚Äù

original: par dang ldan pa lta bur rnam par rtog pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad 'di rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: par dang ldan pa lta bur rnam par rtog pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad 'di rab tu 'jug go //
translated: In the world, it is conceived of as having the attribute of arising, and this conventional term is applied to it.

original: tha snyad kyi zur tsam gyis dngos po la gnod pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi zur tsam gyis dngos po la gnod pa ci yang med de /
translated: But the mere expression of a convention does not in the least undermine the thing itself.

original: kho bo cag kyang med pa zhes bya ba gang zhig yod pa dang ldan par brjod pa'i chos gzhan ni cung zad kyang yod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang med pa zhes bya ba gang zhig yod pa dang ldan par brjod pa'i chos gzhan ni cung zad kyang yod par mi 'dod do //
translated: We do not accept that there is any other phenomenon whatsoever that is said to exist and that is called ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: gal te yod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba gang zhig phyis 'byung ba'i rang bzhin de ni gzhan kho na yin na gzhan gang @203b yin pa de ji ltar de'i yin /
analyzed: gal te yod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba gang zhig phyis 'byung ba'i rang bzhin de ni gzhan kho na yin na gzhan gang @203b yin pa de ji ltar de'i yin /
translated: If it did exist, then it would not be nonexistent. That which arises later is just another thing, but how could that be it?

original: de lta bas na med pa skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po rnams ma byung ba las byung ba tsam kho na zhig sgrub pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta bas na med pa skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po rnams ma byung ba las byung ba tsam kho na zhig sgrub pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do snyam du sems na /
translated: Thus, if you think that the statement ‚Äúthe nonexistent arises‚Äù and so on merely establishes that things arise from what did not previously exist,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: 'dir ni dngos po'i rang bzhin dpyad pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos po'i rang bzhin dpyad pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because this is the context of the analysis of the nature of things.

original: byed pa dgag pa tsam brjod par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa dgag pa tsam brjod par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not assert that the mere negation of activity is the meaning of nonarising.

original: de la gal te dngos po 'di rgyu nye ba'i sngon rol du byung bar gyur pa ma yin na de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin gang zhig yin par brjod par bya /
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po 'di rgyu nye ba'i sngon rol du byung bar gyur pa ma yin na de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin gang zhig yin par brjod par bya /
translated: If this thing did not arise prior to the cause, then at that time what would its nature be?

original: ji ste de'i tshe de 'ga' yang med pa nyid yin na gang gi tshe rang bzhin du mngon par brjod par bya'o snyam du sems na ;
analyzed: ji ste de'i tshe de 'ga' yang med pa nyid yin na gang gi tshe rang bzhin du mngon par brjod par bya'o snyam du sems na ;
translated: But if at that time it does not exist at all, then when would its nature be expressed?

original: de ni rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rung ba ma yin te /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: gal te dngos po'i bdag nyid 'ga' yang med na de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin med pa kho na yin no zhes gsal rab tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i bdag nyid 'ga' yang med na de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin med pa kho na yin no zhes gsal rab tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the entity does not exist at all, then it is clearly expressed that it has no nature.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di med pa nyid du zhes bya bas ci zhig smras par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di med pa nyid du zhes bya bas ci zhig smras par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, what would be said by ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù?

original: 'di ltar sngon med do zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni dngos po'i bdag nyid gang phyis 'byung ba de kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon med do zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni dngos po'i bdag nyid gang phyis 'byung ba de kho na yin la /
translated: In this way, this negation ‚Äúit did not exist previously‚Äù is just the nature of the entity that arises later.

original: de yang sngon med pa'i ngo bo 'di'i rang bzhin ma gtogs par ji ltar nye bar brtags /
analyzed: de yang sngon med pa'i ngo bo 'di'i rang bzhin ma gtogs par ji ltar nye bar brtags /
translated: And how could that be ascertained as the nature of this nonexistence that did not exist previously?

original: 'di sngon byung bar gyur pa ma yin no zhes med pa skye ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyu rkyen brdzun pa 'di yang ji ltar yang dag par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di sngon byung bar gyur pa ma yin no zhes med pa skye ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyu rkyen brdzun pa 'di yang ji ltar yang dag par brjod do //
translated: How could you correctly say that this false cause and condition for the convention of the arising of what did not exist previously is not something that has occurred before?

original: de ltar na ma byung ba la 'byung bar sgrub pa yang med pa yod pa dang ldan pa kho nar bsgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ma byung ba la 'byung bar sgrub pa yang med pa yod pa dang ldan pa kho nar bsgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the establishment of the arising of what did not previously exist would be the establishment of the existence of what does not exist.

original: gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not something else.

original: gzhan ma byung ba las byung ngo zhes brjod na 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma byung ba las byung ngo zhes brjod na 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: If you say that it is not something else, but that what did not previously exist has arisen, then that is not related.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams sngon med pa la phyis yod par brjod pa dag gi de dang 'gal ba'i chos yang dag pa pa dang ldan par khas blangs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams sngon med pa la phyis yod par brjod pa dag gi de dang 'gal ba'i chos yang dag pa pa dang ldan par khas blangs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, those who say that things that did not exist previously exist later would only be accepting that they possess a real quality that is incompatible with that.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin yang yang dag par 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin yang yang dag par 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that a nature possesses a quality that is incompatible with it.

original: thams cad kyang thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that everything would be the nature of everything else.

original: gal te gcig la rim gyis yod pa dang med pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig la rim gyis yod pa dang med pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is only in one thing that existence and nonexistence are not contradictory,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical,

original: dus mnyam pa la yang de mi 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa la yang de mi 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that they are not contradictory even in things that are simultaneous.

original: 'on te 'di dag dus mnyam par 'gal ba nyid yin na ni de'i tshe rim gyis kyang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di dag dus mnyam par 'gal ba nyid yin na ni de'i tshe rim gyis kyang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is contradictory for them to be simultaneous, then why would it not be contradictory for them to be sequential?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: chos can tha dad pa la ni mtshan nyid 'gal ba dag mi 'gal ba nyid kyis /üîΩchos can @204a * //
analyzed: chos can tha dad pa la ni mtshan nyid 'gal ba dag mi 'gal ba nyid kyis / chos can @204a * //
translated: In the case of different subjects, contradictory attributes are not contradictory.üîΩBut in the case of one subject,

original: gcig la ni rim gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la ni rim gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: they are not even sequential.

original: 'di ltar cig car chos 'gal ba du ma dang ldan na gcig pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'jug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rim gyis kyang do dang ldan na de 'jug par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar cig car chos 'gal ba du ma dang ldan na gcig pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'jug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rim gyis kyang do dang ldan na de 'jug par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Just as it is the case that if many contradictory attributes are attributed to a single thing, it follows that the thing itself is destroyed, in the same way, if it is attributed sequentially, it follows that it is destroyed.

original: da lta ma yin na gzhan dag gis gtso bo la sogs pa rim gyis chen po la sogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs kyi ngo bor yongs su 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: da lta ma yin na gzhan dag gis gtso bo la sogs pa rim gyis chen po la sogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs kyi ngo bor yongs su 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it is not now, then it is imputed that the collection of the great and so on, such as the principal and so on, transform into the nature of the great and so on.

original: mngon par gsal bar nye bar brtags pa la yang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa chos 'gal ba dang ldan par ji ste brjod /
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar nye bar brtags pa la yang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa chos 'gal ba dang ldan par ji ste brjod /
translated: Or, if it is imputed that they manifest, then how could it be said that they possess contradictory attributes such as clarity and nonclarity?

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa rim gyis dngos po nye bar skyed par byed pa la yang nus pa dang mi nus pa la sogs pa 'gal bar brjod par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa rim gyis dngos po nye bar skyed par byed pa la yang nus pa dang mi nus pa la sogs pa 'gal bar brjod par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: And how could it be said that they are contradictory, such as powerful and powerless, in the gradual generation of things by ƒ™≈õvara and so on?

original: gang dag gis ri dang lus dang rdo rje la sogs pa brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid du kun brtags nas 'di dag gi gnas skabs tha dad pa'i sgo nas grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rim gyis 'byung ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa
analyzed: gang dag gis ri dang lus dang rdo rje la sogs pa brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid du kun brtags nas 'di dag gi gnas skabs tha dad pa'i sgo nas grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rim gyis 'byung ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa
translated: Those who impute the nature of stability to mountains, bodies, vajras and so on and who posit the gradual occurrence of differences such as cold and hot through the different states of those things

original: de dag la yang 'di dag skad cig ma nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa rnams kyis ji ltar grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyang 'gal bar rjod par byed /
analyzed: de dag la yang 'di dag skad cig ma nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa rnams kyis ji ltar grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyang 'gal bar rjod par byed /
translated: Also, those who assert that these are momentary, how do you describe the contradiction of the phenomena that arise in sequence, such as cold and heat?

original: gal te 'di snyam du dngos po rnams ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med par snang ba nyid de /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du dngos po rnams ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med par snang ba nyid de /
translated: If you think that things arise from what has not occurred and that having arisen, they appear to be nonexistent,

original: de'i phyir gcig la rim gyis yod pa dang med pa dag mi 'gal ba nyid du rnam par gzhag go snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig la rim gyis yod pa dang med pa dag mi 'gal ba nyid du rnam par gzhag go snyam du sems na /
translated: and therefore you posit that it is not contradictory for something to exist and not exist in sequence,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: 'di ltar zangs la sogs pa la yang sra ba dang / snyi ba dang / grang ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa rim gyis snang ba'i phyir de la yang de mi 'gal ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zangs la sogs pa la yang sra ba dang / snyi ba dang / grang ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa rim gyis snang ba'i phyir de la yang de mi 'gal ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because copper and so on also appear in sequence as hard and soft, cold and hot, and so on, it follows that it is not contradictory for them to exist and not exist.

original: de'i phyir de'i sgo nas 'di dag brtan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid du sgrub pa gang yin pa de yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sgo nas 'di dag brtan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid du sgrub pa gang yin pa de yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since they are not stable in that way, it is not tenable that they are established as intrinsically existent.

original: gzhan yang kho bo cag kyang lta ba de lta bu ni spong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang kho bo cag kyang lta ba de lta bu ni spong bar mi byed de /
translated: Moreover, we do not refute such a view.

original: sgyu ma dang rmi lam la sogs pa brdzun pa yang ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang rmi lam la sogs pa brdzun pa yang ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even false things such as illusions and dreams appear to arise from what was previously nonexistent and to cease and become nonexistent.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin gyis yod pa dang med pa la ni rim gyis kyang yod pa dang med pa 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin gyis yod pa dang med pa la ni rim gyis kyang yod pa dang med pa 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: However, it is contradictory for something that intrinsically exists or does not exist to exist or not exist sequentially.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na //
translated: If something intrinsically exists,

original: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: it cannot become nonexistent.üîΩIt is never tenable

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar ni //üîΩnam @204b yang 'thad pa ma yin no //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar ni // nam @204b yang 'thad pa ma yin no // zhes bshad do //
translated: for an intrinsic nature to change.

original: de bzhin du gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: And in the same way, a treatise on logic says:

original: gang la ngo bo nyid ni yod min pa //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid ni yod min pa //
translated: That which does not intrinsically exist

original: dngos po med de ji ltar gzhan rkyen can //
analyzed: dngos po med de ji ltar gzhan rkyen can //
translated: How could a non-thing be a condition of another?

original: ngo bo nyid med gzhan gyis ci zhig skyed //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med gzhan gyis ci zhig skyed //
translated: How could a non-entity be produced by another?

original: gtan tshigs de ni bde bar gshegs pas bstan //üîΩces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ni bde bar gshegs pas bstan // ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The Sugata taught this reason.üîΩAnd in the noble Descent into La·πÖkƒÅ,

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa sngar yod par khas blangs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang / 'dod chags la sogs pa sngar yod par khas blangs te /
translated: it says:

original: yang med par khas len pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang med par khas len pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one asserts that desire and so on exist prior and then asserts that they do not exist, one would be a nihilist.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang dag pa pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe der smra ba rnams yang dag pa'i lam gyi rjes su song ba'i phyir lta ba de thar ba'i lam dang mthun pa kho nar 'gyur gyi mi mthun pa ni ma yin
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang dag pa pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe der smra ba rnams yang dag pa'i lam gyi rjes su song ba'i phyir lta ba de thar ba'i lam dang mthun pa kho nar 'gyur gyi mi mthun pa ni ma yin
translated: If the relation of cause and effect were real, then those who propound it would be following the correct path, and so that view would be entirely compatible with the path to liberation, and not incompatible.

original: no // de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las gsungs pa gang yin pa de dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: no // de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las gsungs pa gang yin pa de dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could it not contradict what is said in the noble Descent into La·πÖkƒÅ?

original: rgyu 'bras lta ba ngan pa yis //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras lta ba ngan pa yis //
translated: The view of cause and effect is a bad view.

original: mu stegs thams cad rnam par rmongs //
analyzed: mu stegs thams cad rnam par rmongs //
translated: All tƒ´rthikas are confused.

original: de phyir yod med phyogs smras pa //
analyzed: de phyir yod med phyogs smras pa //
translated: Therefore, those who speak of the positions of existence and nonexistence

original: de dag la ni thar pa med //
analyzed: de dag la ni thar pa med //
translated: Do not have liberation.

original: cis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: cis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: What is it?

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: Also, that same text says:

original: ma byung ba las gang byung zhing //
analyzed: ma byung ba las gang byung zhing //
translated: What arises from what is nonarisen

original: byung nas kyang ni rnam 'jig pa //
analyzed: byung nas kyang ni rnam 'jig pa //
translated: And having arisen, is destroyed

original: rkyen las yod dang med pa yang //üîΩnga yi bstan la de mi gnas //
analyzed: rkyen las yod dang med pa yang // nga yi bstan la de mi gnas //
translated: Is neither existent nor nonexistent due to conditions.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: In my teaching, that does not exist.

original: de la rgyu dang rkyen gyi nus pa nges pa'i sgo nas kyang yang dag par na med pa skye bar nges par rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang rkyen gyi nus pa nges pa'i sgo nas kyang yang dag par na med pa skye bar nges par rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: From the perspective of the definite power of causes and conditions, it is not reasonable for what is utterly nonexistent to arise,

original: rang bzhin ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to make an essence into something else.

original: nus pa so sor nges pas ni rang bzhin 'gal ba nyid du bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa so sor nges pas ni rang bzhin 'gal ba nyid du bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Due to the individual certainty of power, it is not possible to make an essence that is contradictory.

original: de byed na ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes mkhas pa rnams brjod de /
analyzed: de byed na ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes mkhas pa rnams brjod de /
translated: If it were possible, it would follow that even the horns of a rabbit and so on would arise.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i nus pa nges pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa nges par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de 'brel pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i nus pa nges pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa nges par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de 'brel pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the power of the cause is ascertained, the presentation is ascertained.

original: gal te 'di dag med pa skye ba kun rdzob pa la yang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag med pa skye ba kun rdzob pa la yang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that it is not contradictory for these to arise without existing even conventionally,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: dngos po kho na la 'gal ba rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir brdzun pa la de rnam par 'jog pa 'brel pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po kho na la 'gal ba rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir brdzun pa la de rnam par 'jog pa 'brel pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Because contradiction is posited only in relation to things, it is illogical to posit it in relation to what is false.

original: de lta ma yin na rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir skye ba de don dam pa pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /üîΩkun rdzob pa ni @205a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir skye ba de don dam pa pa kho nar 'gyur gyi / kun rdzob pa ni @205a * //
translated: If that were not so, then since it would be logical, arising would be only ultimate,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: not conventional.

original: gzhan yang kho bo cag gi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba kun rdzob pa sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa de kho na la sgro btags pa'i rnam par 'gog pas 'gal ba brjod pa'i sgo nas brdzun pa nyid du bsgrubs kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang kho bo cag gi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba kun rdzob pa sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa de kho na la sgro btags pa'i rnam par 'gog pas 'gal ba brjod pa'i sgo nas brdzun pa nyid du bsgrubs kyi /
translated: Moreover, we refute the reification of the mere relative arising of things, which is like an illusion, and so on, by means of a refutation that is a consequence of the opponent‚Äôs logic.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin te ;
translated: We do not refute the other.

original: de ni rgyas par 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyas par 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained extensively later.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams yod pa yang yang dag pa pa'i skye bar mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams yod pa yang yang dag pa pa'i skye bar mi 'thad la /
translated: Therefore, the arising of things is not tenable as real.

original: med pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Nor is it unreal.

original: 'di dag gi skye ba sgyu ma bzhin du brdzun pa kho na rab tu ston par zad de /
analyzed: 'di dag gi skye ba sgyu ma bzhin du brdzun pa kho na rab tu ston par zad de /
translated: We simply demonstrate that their arising is false, like an illusion.

original: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bu kho nar rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bu kho nar rnam par gnas so //
translated: Therefore, all things exist only as illusions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po yod pa dang med pa ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa'o zhes rnam pa du mar yod pa dang / med pa skye ba bkag pas ma skyes pa nyid du gsungs so //üîΩgang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na las dgongs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po yod pa dang med pa ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa'o zhes rnam pa du mar yod pa dang / med pa skye ba bkag pas ma skyes pa nyid du gsungs so // gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na las dgongs te /
translated: Therefore, the Lord has said in many ways that all phenomena are not produced, because of the non-production of existence and non-existence, and he has said that they are not produced because of the negation of the production of existence and non-existence.üîΩMoreover, the Lord has declared that the production of existence and non-existence is contradictory, intending only the imagined nature.

original: yod pa dang med pa skye ba 'gal bar rnam par gzhag gi de kho na nyid las ni ma yin no zhes smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa skye ba 'gal bar rnam par gzhag gi de kho na nyid las ni ma yin no zhes smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: But if you say that it is not in reality, then we must say this:

original: gal te dngos po'i bdag nyid don dam par ma skyes pa la yang de kho na nyid du skyes so zhes kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod na ni de'i tshe 'di rigs pa ma yin no
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i bdag nyid don dam par ma skyes pa la yang de kho na nyid du skyes so zhes kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod na ni de'i tshe 'di rigs pa ma yin no
translated: If you accept that the imagined nature is the imagined nature of the ultimate non-production of the entity of things, which is imagined to be produced in reality, then this is not reasonable.

original: // 'on te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di ni yang dag par skyes pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: // 'on te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di ni yang dag par skyes pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: But if you think that the nature of things is only truly produced,

original: 'on kyang de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bor ma skyes pa'i phyir de nyid de'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bor ma skyes pa'i phyir de nyid de'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: but that because it is not produced in the form of grasped and grasper, that is its imagined nature,

original: gal te de lta na go ji ltar kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa dang med pa yang skye bar 'gal ba de bzhin du don dam pa pa'i bdag nyid du skye ba de la yang 'di ci ste 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de lta na go ji ltar kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa dang med pa yang skye bar 'gal ba de bzhin du don dam pa pa'i bdag nyid du skye ba de la yang 'di ci ste 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: then just as it is contradictory for something to be both existent and nonexistent in terms of its imagined nature, why is it not contradictory for it to be produced in terms of its ultimate nature?

original: de kho na nyid du skye ba la yang yod pa dang med pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas skye ba med pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du skye ba la yang yod pa dang med pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas skye ba med pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Because production in reality is not production in any other way apart from the aspects of existence and nonexistence, this is nonsense.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
translated: For this very reason, whatever is dependently arisen is ultimately empty of intrinsic nature.

original: dper na sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like an illusion and so on.
