original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang ma @205b yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang ma @205b yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the reason is indeterminate.

original: bzlog na ji skad bshad pa'i gnod pa can gyi tshad ma srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog na ji skad bshad pa'i gnod pa can gyi tshad ma srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when reversed, the valid cognition that is the fault explained previously is possible.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la ltos te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la ltos te /
translated: In dependence on causes and conditions,

original: skye ba nyid yin na ni rang bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skye ba nyid yin na ni rang bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: if there were arising, then it would be a nature that is created.

original: yang dag pa pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not real.

original: ma byas pa ni gzhan la ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa ni gzhan la ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that what is not created depends on another.

original: byas pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byas pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is created does not have an essence by nature.

original: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis sus kyang gzhan du byar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis sus kyang gzhan du byar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a nature cannot be made different by anyone, since it is unchanging.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa pa nyid yin na ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir 'brel pa med do zhes sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa pa nyid yin na ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir 'brel pa med do zhes sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if it were real, it would be contradictory for it to arise from what did not exist before and to become nonexistent after having existed, because they are mutually exclusive. Thus it was previously explained that there is no connection.

original: de bas na ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not indeterminate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩrang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
translated: For this very reason,üîΩIt is not tenable that nature

original: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: Arises from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung na ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung na ni //
translated: If it arose from causes and conditions,

original: rang bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur //üîΩrang bzhin dag ni ji lta bur //
analyzed: rang bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur // rang bzhin dag ni ji lta bur //
translated: Nature would be a product.üîΩHow could that which is called

original: byas pa can zhes bya bar 'gyur //
analyzed: byas pa can zhes bya bar 'gyur //
translated: Nature be a product?

original: rang bzhin byas pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin byas pa ma yin pa //
translated: Nature is not a product

original: pha rol la yang ltos pa med //
analyzed: pha rol la yang ltos pa med //
translated: And does not depend on another.

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: mdo las / dngos po rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bor nye bar rtog pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis su lta bar thal bar 'gyur bar bstan te /üîΩdpal phreng seng ge'i nga ro'i mdo las /
analyzed: mdo las / dngos po rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bor nye bar rtog pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis su lta bar thal bar 'gyur bar bstan te / dpal phreng seng ge'i nga ro'i mdo las /
translated: in a sutra it is said that because of conceiving of nature as permanent or impermanent, the two extremes of reification and nihilism follow.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: In the Lion‚Äôs Roar of Queen ≈örƒ´mƒÅlƒÅ Sutra it says:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di gnyis ni mtha' gnyis su lta ba bzhes bgyi ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di gnyis ni mtha' gnyis su lta ba bzhes bgyi ste /
translated: BhagavƒÅn, these two are called the two extremes of view:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: the view of annihilation and the view of permanence.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag go zhes bgyi bar lta na de ni 'di'i chad par lta bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag go zhes bgyi bar lta na de ni 'di'i chad par lta bar 'gyur //
translated: Blessed One, if one were to view all conditioned things as impermanent, that would be a view of annihilation.

original: de ni 'di'i yang dag pa ma lags pa'i lta bar 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i yang dag pa ma lags pa'i lta bar 'gyur lags so //
translated: That would be a wrong view.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa rtag go zhes bgyi bar lta na de ni 'di'i rtag par lta bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa rtag go zhes bgyi bar lta na de ni 'di'i rtag par lta bar 'gyur /
translated: Blessed One, if one were to view nirvana as permanent, that would be a view of permanence.

original: de ni 'di'i yang dag pa ma lags pa'i lta bar 'gyur lags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i yang dag pa ma lags pa'i lta bar 'gyur lags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: That would be a wrong view.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang /
translated: The Master also said:

original: dngos po yod par khas len pa //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas len pa //
translated: If one accepts that things exist,üîΩone would be committed to the views

original: rtag pa dang ni chad pa yi //üîΩlta bar rab tu thal 'gyur te //
analyzed: rtag pa dang ni chad pa yi // lta bar rab tu thal 'gyur te //
translated: of eternalism and nihilism.

original: rang bzhin rtag pa'am mi rtag 'gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin rtag pa'am mi rtag 'gyur //
translated: If things exist, their intrinsic reality would be either permanent or impermanent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: And so on.

original: de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la srid pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la srid pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is possible in a concordant case, the reason is not contradictory.

original: gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la srid pa de ni 'gal bar 'gyur @206a * //
analyzed: gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la srid pa de ni 'gal bar 'gyur @206a * //
translated: That which is possible only in a discordant case is contradictory.

original: gyi ; mthun pa'i phyogs la srid pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gyi ; mthun pa'i phyogs la srid pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the case of the existence of the agreeable side.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa dngos por 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa dngos por 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it tenable that illusion, etc. are real entities,

original: de ni shes pa dang / shes bya dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ni shes pa dang / shes bya dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: because they have been shown previously to be of a nature discordant with cognition, the cognized, and the characteristic.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag las dngos po'i ngo bo gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag las dngos po'i ngo bo gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And apart from cognition and the cognized, there is no other nature of a real entity.

original: de la nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bcas par ma mthong du zin kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'brel pa med pa'i
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bcas par ma mthong du zin kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'brel pa med pa'i
translated: Now, even if one does not see the non-production of such things as sky-lotuses as having an intrinsic reality, still, it is not related to the idea that dependent origination has a real intrinsic nature.

original: phyir de'i sgo nas 'di 'gal ba nyid du bsgrub par mi nus te /
analyzed: phyir de'i sgo nas 'di 'gal ba nyid du bsgrub par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, it cannot be established as contradictory by means of that.

original: khyab par byed pa 'jug pa ni khyab par bya ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'jug pa ni khyab par bya ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The pervasion is not established by the occurrence of the pervader.

original: gang yang sgyu ma la sogs pa brdzun pa la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ma grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang yang sgyu ma la sogs pa brdzun pa la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ma grub pa kho na ste /
translated: But in regard to false things such as illusions, it is not at all established that they are dependently arisen.

original: de'i phyir dpe sgrub pa ma tshang ba yin no zhes smras pa de yang 'brel ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe sgrub pa ma tshang ba yin no zhes smras pa de yang 'brel ba med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, you say that the example lacks the property of the probandum. But that is irrelevant.

original: gal te don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid las bsams te /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid las bsams te /
translated: If you think in terms of an ultimate essence,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa ma skyes pa nyid du brjod na ni de ni 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa ma skyes pa nyid du brjod na ni de ni 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: and you say that illusions and so on are not produced, then that is precisely what we maintain.

original: kho bo cag kyang don dam pa pa'i skye ba las bsams te /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang don dam pa pa'i skye ba las bsams te /
translated: We also think in terms of ultimate production.

original: gtan tshigs su ston pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su ston pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: We do not teach that as a reason,

original: 'on kyang gnyi ga la grub pa ji ltar snang ba kho na las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyi ga la grub pa ji ltar snang ba kho na las yin no //
translated: but rather we do so only in terms of what is established for both parties.

original: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas gtan tshigs dang chos can la sogs pa ston par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas gtan tshigs dang chos can la sogs pa ston par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Thus we have already explained that we do not teach reasons and subjects based on philosophical tenets.

original: 'on te sgyu ma la sogs pa tha snyad du yang ma skyes so zhes bya bar 'dod na de skad du smra ba de ni 'jig rten kho na zlog par byed pa yin pas kho bo cag ni 'di bzlog par 'bad pa med do //
analyzed: 'on te sgyu ma la sogs pa tha snyad du yang ma skyes so zhes bya bar 'dod na de skad du smra ba de ni 'jig rten kho na zlog par byed pa yin pas kho bo cag ni 'di bzlog par 'bad pa med do //
translated: But if you maintain that such things as illusions are not produced even conventionally, then you are only refuting the world, and we do not need to refute you!

original: yid rnal du gnas pa su zhig sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rkyen gsang sngags dang sman la sogs pa mthong bzhin du yang skye ba ma mthong ngo zhes smras te /
analyzed: yid rnal du gnas pa su zhig sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rkyen gsang sngags dang sman la sogs pa mthong bzhin du yang skye ba ma mthong ngo zhes smras te /
translated: What sane person, seeing such things as the conditions for illusions, such as mantras and medicinal substances, would say, ‚ÄúI do not see that they are produced‚Äù?

original: 'di ni mkhas pa rnams kyi bzhad gad kho nar 'gyur bas de'i phyir khyad du gsad pa ni 'os so //
analyzed: 'di ni mkhas pa rnams kyi bzhad gad kho nar 'gyur bas de'i phyir khyad du gsad pa ni 'os so //
translated: Since this would be only a laughing matter for the wise, it is fitting that you be ridiculed.

original: de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason is not unestablished.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Lord Buddha has also said:

original: rkyen las skyes pa gang yin de ma skyes //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes pa gang yin de ma skyes //
translated: Whatever is produced from conditions is not produced;

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba'ang med //üîΩrkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba'ang med // rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
translated: It does not have the nature of production.üîΩWhatever depends on the aggregation of conditions is explained to be empty.

original: gang zhig stong nyid shes te bag yod yin//
analyzed: gang zhig stong nyid shes te bag yod yin//
translated: Those who know emptiness are conscientious.

original: @206b zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @206b zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos bstan pa las kyang /
translated: And in the teaching of the noble Sagaramati S≈´tra,üîΩit says:üîΩWhatever arises dependently

original: gang dag rten nas byung de dag / ngo bo nyid kyis ci yang med //
analyzed: gang dag rten nas byung de dag / ngo bo nyid kyis ci yang med //
translated: has no intrinsic reality.

original: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa //
analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa //
translated: Whatever has no intrinsic reality

original: de dag gang du'ang 'byung ba med //
analyzed: de dag gang du'ang 'byung ba med //
translated: does not arise in any way.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang /
translated: And the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna also explains:

original: gang zhig rten nas byung ba der //
analyzed: gang zhig rten nas byung ba der //
translated: Whatever arises dependently

original: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi //
translated: is at peace with respect to intrinsic reality.

original: de lta bas na bskyed bya dang // skye ba nyid kyang zhi ba yin //
analyzed: de lta bas na bskyed bya dang // skye ba nyid kyang zhi ba yin //
translated: Therefore the produced and production itself are also at peace.üîΩThus it is explained.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: And it also says:

original: yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gang //
translated: Whatever arises dependently

original: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: is explained to be emptiness.

original: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //
translated: That itself is the middle way.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: gang yang gal te zhig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa don dam pa pa'i skye ba la gnod par 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang gal te zhig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa don dam pa pa'i skye ba la gnod par 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, whatever is said, such as ‚ÄúIf the conception of cessation and so on were to undermine ultimate production,‚Äù is not correct.

original: 'di ltar gnod pa zhes bya ba ci zhes bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnod pa zhes bya ba ci zhes bya /
translated: What is called ‚Äúharm‚Äù here?

original: gal te brdzun pa nyid du bsgrub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te brdzun pa nyid du bsgrub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is established as false,

original: de ni kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ni kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin no //
translated: then that is just what we maintain.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di kun rdzob pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di kun rdzob pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Therefore, this is called ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: rigs pas grags pa nyid yin na ni don dam pa pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rigs pas grags pa nyid yin na ni don dam pa pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were renowned through reasoning, then it would be ultimate,

original: kun rdzob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it would not be conventional.

original: 'on te gnod pa grags pa ni sel ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnod pa grags pa ni sel ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that ‚Äúharm‚Äù is renowned as ‚Äúexclusion,‚Äù

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩsgyu ma la sogs pa tshad mas gnod pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo yang 'jig rten na ma grags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te / sgyu ma la sogs pa tshad mas gnod pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo yang 'jig rten na ma grags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: that is also unreasonable.üîΩEven though a magical creation, etc. is false in nature and harmed by valid knowledge, it is not unknown in the world.

original: des na rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa dngos por yod pa kho na de ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'jig rten na grags so zhes brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa dngos por yod pa kho na de ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'jig rten na grags so zhes brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is also unreasonable to say that only mistaken consciousness that exists as a thing is renowned in the world as having the nature of a magical creation, etc.

original: gcig la rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid 'gal bar shes pa la sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo de lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir la ;
analyzed: gcig la rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid 'gal bar shes pa la sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo de lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir la ;
translated: because it is known that a single thing cannot have various aspects, and because such an entity as an illusion is impossible;

original: 'jig rten na yang de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because in the world, those are not known to be of the nature of consciousness.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin du chug na yang /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin du chug na yang /
translated: Even if illusions, etc., were of the nature of consciousness,

original: 'on kyang shes pa nyid de dang tha mi dad par de ltar brdzun pa'i rnam pa nye bar 'dzin par snang ba'i phyir de dang 'dra bar de yang brdzun pa kho na yin no//
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa nyid de dang tha mi dad par de ltar brdzun pa'i rnam pa nye bar 'dzin par snang ba'i phyir de dang 'dra bar de yang brdzun pa kho na yin no//
translated: nevertheless, consciousness itself is not different from them, because it appears to apprehend the aspect of falsity in that way. Therefore, it is also false, just like them.

original: de lta ma yin na bden pa dang mi bden pa'i ngo bo dang 'brel ba dag ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bden pa dang mi bden pa'i ngo bo dang 'brel ba dag ci zhig yod /
translated: Otherwise, what connection could there be between the nature of truth and falsity?

original: de'i phyir 'di la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no error here.

original: ji ste gnod pa 'gal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste gnod pa 'gal ba yin zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the harm is contradictory,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: gal te de la bdag nyid kyis 'gal ba med na ni de ji ltar tshad mas bya bar nus /
analyzed: gal te de la bdag nyid kyis 'gal ba med na ni de ji ltar tshad mas bya bar nus /
translated: If there is no contradiction in itself, then how can it be possible for it to be invalidated by a valid cognition?

original: 'on te rang @207a * //
analyzed: 'on te rang @207a * //
translated: But if it is contradictory,

original: gi 'gal ba nyid yod pa yin la /üîΩgal te de yang tshad mas sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gi 'gal ba nyid yod pa yin la / gal te de yang tshad mas sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the contradiction itself exists,üîΩthen you must prove that by a valid cognition.

original: sgrub la rag las te /
analyzed: sgrub la rag las te /
translated: But if you say that it is established in dependence on a proof,

original: ci zhig mi 'dod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci zhig mi 'dod par 'gyur /
translated: then what is there to disagree with?

original: gal te 'gal ba rnams snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba rnams snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that contradictions do not appear,

original: 'di ni lan btab zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni lan btab zin to //
translated: we have already answered this.

original: gzhan yang shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba rnams kyi ltar na shes pa gnyis med pa la gnyis kyi rnam pa rgya mtsho dang / ri dang / sa dang chu bo la sogs pa de'i tshe yin pa nyid du nye bar brjod na ji ltar gcig la 'gal ba dag snang ba rjes su byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba rnams kyi ltar na shes pa gnyis med pa la gnyis kyi rnam pa rgya mtsho dang / ri dang / sa dang chu bo la sogs pa de'i tshe yin pa nyid du nye bar brjod na ji ltar gcig la 'gal ba dag snang ba rjes su byed par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, according to those who maintain that objects of knowledge are internal, when two consciousnesses are nondual, the aspect of duality is said to be the ocean, the mountains, the earth, the rivers, and so on. At that time, how could the appearance of contradictions in one thing be followed?

original: gang dag shes bya nang gi la yin par smra ba de dag gis kyang gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa 'khrul par cung zad cig kyang khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: gang dag shes bya nang gi la yin par smra ba de dag gis kyang gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa 'khrul par cung zad cig kyang khas blang dgos so //
translated: Those who maintain that objects of knowledge are internal must certainly accept that consciousness is mistaken in some way.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad kyang de kho na nyid mthong ba kho nar 'gyur la phyir rgol ba rnams dang rtsod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad kyang de kho na nyid mthong ba kho nar 'gyur la phyir rgol ba rnams dang rtsod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then everyone would only see reality, and there would be no debate with opponents.

original: de'i phyir 'chi ltas dang / mig sngon dang / mig ser la sogs pas mig nyams pa rnams la lus la sogs pa 'gal ba gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bor ji ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ltas dang / mig sngon dang / mig ser la sogs pas mig nyams pa rnams la lus la sogs pa 'gal ba gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bor ji ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could the body and so on appear to have two contradictory natures to those whose eyes are impaired by jaundice, cataracts, and so on?

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid bden pa'i ngo bo la ni gang gis na 'di dag de la snang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa brdzun pa de dag 'brel pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid bden pa'i ngo bo la ni gang gis na 'di dag de la snang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa brdzun pa de dag 'brel pa ci yang med de /
translated: In the nature of a real consciousness, those false aspects with which they appear have no connection whatsoever.

original: bden pa dang mi bden pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: bden pa dang mi bden pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir la /
translated: This is because the real and the unreal are contradictory,

original: 'gal ba yang khyed kyi gzhung lugs kyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang khyed kyi gzhung lugs kyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and contradiction does not appear in your system.

original: de'i phyir thams cad de kho na nyid mngon sum du mthong ba kho nar 'gyur bas thar par 'dod pa rnams de kho na nyid sgom par 'bad pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad de kho na nyid mngon sum du mthong ba kho nar 'gyur bas thar par 'dod pa rnams de kho na nyid sgom par 'bad pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since everyone would see reality directly, the effort of those who desire liberation to meditate on reality would be pointless.

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba la 'gal ba nyid du snang mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba la 'gal ba nyid du snang mod kyi /
translated: If you think that although there is a contradiction in the appearance of the various aspects of mistaken consciousness,

original: 'gal bar rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'gal bar rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: there is no contradiction in positing them,

original: de'i yul ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that is not so, because their objects are things.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pas dngos po nyid du khas len pa kho na la 'gal ba rjod par byed kyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pas dngos po nyid du khas len pa kho na la 'gal ba rjod par byed kyi /
translated: We say that there is a contradiction only in accepting that things exist by the power of the object,

original: brdzun par 'dod pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brdzun par 'dod pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in accepting that they are false.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa de dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa de dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then that inference would not be one that engages by the power of the object.

original: des na rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa brdzun pa rnams kyang snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa brdzun pa rnams kyang snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even the false aspects of mistaken consciousness would appear.

original: de la de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa 'gal ba brjod par yang mi byed do snyam du sems @207b na ;
analyzed: de la de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa 'gal ba brjod par yang mi byed do snyam du sems @207b na ;
translated: You may think that you should not state contradictions such as identity and difference.

original: gal te de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa la yang ci'i phyir 'gal brjod par byed de /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa la yang ci'i phyir 'gal brjod par byed de /
translated: If that is so, then why do you state contradictions in regard to the conventional entities of cause and effect?

original: brdzun pa de la yang dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid mi srid pas 'di la yang 'gal ba rjod par ma byed cig / de brjod na yang gdon mi za bar kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na grub kyi /üîΩkhyed kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brdzun pa de la yang dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid mi srid pas 'di la yang 'gal ba rjod par ma byed cig / de brjod na yang gdon mi za bar kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na grub kyi / khyed kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Since it is impossible for a false object to be the object of an inference that engages its object through the power of the thing itself, do not state contradictions in regard to that.üîΩEven if you do state contradictions, you will not be able to refute us, because

original: 'di ltar de la 'gal bar brjod pa khyed kyis de brdzun pa nyid kho nar bsgrub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la 'gal bar brjod pa khyed kyis de brdzun pa nyid kho nar bsgrub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: you will only be proving that it is false.

original: snang ba sel ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba sel ba ni ma yin te /
translated: You will not be able to eliminate its appearance,

original: brdzun pa yang grags pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa yang grags pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not contradictory for a false object to be renowned.

original: de brdzun pa nyid du sgrub na yang kho bo cag gi phyogs kho nar gzhung btsugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de brdzun pa nyid du sgrub na yang kho bo cag gi phyogs kho nar gzhung btsugs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you prove that to be false, then you are simply establishing our own position.üîΩFor we also posit that causes and effects, though they depend on the distinctions of place, time, cause, and conditions, are false because they are undermined by valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag kyang rgyu dang / 'bras bu rnams yul dang / dus dang / rgyu dang / rkyen gyi khyad par la ltos pa nyid yin yang tshad mas gnod par brdzun pa nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob pa nyid du rnam par 'jog la /üîΩde la khyad kyang de bzhin du 'gal ba brjod pa nyid kyis gzhan dag dngos por 'dzin pa zlog par byed pa nyid kyis ci zhig mi 'dod par byas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag kyang rgyu dang / 'bras bu rnams yul dang / dus dang / rgyu dang / rkyen gyi khyad par la ltos pa nyid yin yang tshad mas gnod par brdzun pa nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob pa nyid du rnam par 'jog la / de la khyad kyang de bzhin du 'gal ba brjod pa nyid kyis gzhan dag dngos por 'dzin pa zlog par byed pa nyid kyis ci zhig mi 'dod par byas te /
translated: Therefore, we posit them as conventional truths.üîΩWhat is there to dislike about this?

original: 'on kyang nyes pa ma yin pa brjod pa nyid kyis khyed kho na la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyes pa ma yin pa brjod pa nyid kyis khyed kho na la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: You are the one who is harmed by your own words, for you claim that things exist and also that they are undermined by valid cognition.

original: kho bo cag ni 'di la tshad ma 'jug par mi byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'di la tshad ma 'jug par mi byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: We are not the ones who do not engage valid cognition in this matter.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di ji ltar kun rdzob pa nyid bsgrub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di ji ltar kun rdzob pa nyid bsgrub par 'gyur /
translated: If we did not, then how could we prove that things are conventional?

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag ni gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ji ltar grags pa kho na la yang dag par khas blangs pa de dag gi log par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir 'di kho na la tshad mas rab tu sbyar gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag ni gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ji ltar grags pa kho na la yang dag par khas blangs pa de dag gi log par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir 'di kho na la tshad mas rab tu sbyar gyi /
translated: Thus, we apply a valid cognition only to this, in order to reverse the misconceptions of those who accept only what is renowned as the entities of cause and effect.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not apply it to anything else.

original: de la ni tshad ma sbyar kyang mngon sum gyis gnod pa mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la ni tshad ma sbyar kyang mngon sum gyis gnod pa mi 'jug ste /
translated: Even if a valid cognition were applied to that, it would not be engaged by direct perception.

original: tshad mas dngos po'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa sgrub pa kho nar byed kyi /
analyzed: tshad mas dngos po'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa sgrub pa kho nar byed kyi /
translated: A valid cognition only establishes the mode of being of the suchness of entities as it is.

original: grags pa sel ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grags pa sel ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not eliminate what is renowned.

original: de lta ma yin na de tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, it would not be a valid cognition.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid don dam pa par brtags pa gang yin pa de la tshad mas gnod la /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid don dam pa par brtags pa gang yin pa de la tshad mas gnod la /
translated: The ultimate nature of entities is undermined by valid cognition.

original: de ni mngon sum du grub pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum du grub pa yang ma yin na /
translated: If it were not established by direct perception,

original: de ji ltar de la gnod na mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar de la gnod na mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin /
translated: how could it be undermined by direct perception?

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni ma nor ba yin na ma nor ba ni tshad mas gnod pa'i yul du yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni ma nor ba yin na ma nor ba ni tshad mas gnod pa'i yul du yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the definition of perception is nonerroneous, then it is not correct to say that the object is undermined by a valid cognition.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: des na dam bcas pa 'di la @208a * //
analyzed: des na dam bcas pa 'di la @208a * //
translated: Therefore, this thesis

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang med do //
translated: is not undermined by perception.

original: de lta ma yin na phyi rol gyi don gsal bar snang yang mngon sum du grub pa'i phyir mngon sum dang 'gal bas de gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrub par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na phyi rol gyi don gsal bar snang yang mngon sum du grub pa'i phyir mngon sum dang 'gal bas de gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrub par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because external objects appear clearly, they would be established by perception. Therefore, because it contradicts perception, it would not be the case that the thesis ‚ÄúIt is devoid of the nature of singularity and multiplicity‚Äù would establish the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: rab rib can la sogs pa la skra dang / sha sbrang la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa snang ba yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir brdzun pa nyid du sus kyang khas mi blang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab rib can la sogs pa la skra dang / sha sbrang la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa snang ba yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir brdzun pa nyid du sus kyang khas mi blang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the appearance of nonexistent things such as hair nets to those with eye disease would not be accepted by anyone as false, because it contradicts perception.

original: de lta bas na rang dang 'tsham pa'i rgyu dang rkyen thog ma med pa nas brgyud de 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'di thams cad ni yul dang dus dang rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa yin yang sgyu ma 'byung ba bzhin du kun rdzob pa kho nar rnam parüîΩgzhag go // gang zhig ji ltar grags pa bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa ni gal te dus mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na rang dang 'tsham pa'i rgyu dang rkyen thog ma med pa nas brgyud de 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'di thams cad ni yul dang dus dang rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa yin yang sgyu ma 'byung ba bzhin du kun rdzob pa kho nar rnam par gzhag go // gang zhig ji ltar grags pa bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa ni gal te dus mnyam pa'am /
translated: Thus, all of these births that have come to us through a beginningless succession of causes and conditions appropriate to ourselves are posited as conventional only, like the arising of an illusion, in dependence on the distinctions of place, time, and cause.

original: dus tha dad pa rnam par 'jog kyang 'on kyang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa rnam par 'jog kyang 'on kyang 'gal ba med de /
translated: If something is posited in accordance with what is commonly recognized, then even if it is posited as simultaneous or as different, there is no contradiction.

original: de la skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'jug par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'jug par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And in that case, the faults of nonmomentariness and so on do not apply,

original: brdzun pa la 'gal ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa la 'gal ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction in a lie.

original: sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams la yang dag par na skad cig ma nyid dang / skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams la yang dag par na skad cig ma nyid dang / skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: And in the case of phenomena that are like an illusion or a dream, momentariness and nonmomentariness and so on are not possible in reality.

original: de skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /üîΩgal te gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las / gal te gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: Thus, the noble Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: mi rtag ces bya bar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: If one engages in the view that form is permanent or impermanent, one does not engage in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgzugs de nyid do ltar yod pa ma yin na de rtag pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / gzugs de nyid do ltar yod pa ma yin na de rtag pa'am /
translated: Why is this?

original: mi rtag par ltag la zhig tu 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi rtag par ltag la zhig tu 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
translated: If form itself does not exist in this way, how could it be viewed as permanent or impermanent?

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rgyas par bsgro'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rgyas par bsgro'o //
translated: This is stated extensively up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gang yang gzhan 'ga' las 'du byed rnams skad cig ma nyid du gsungs pa de ni bag med pa dag 'du byed dag las yang dag par yid 'byung bar byas nas rim gyis bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la gzud pa'i ched yin te ;
analyzed: gang yang gzhan 'ga' las 'du byed rnams skad cig ma nyid du gsungs pa de ni bag med pa dag 'du byed dag las yang dag par yid 'byung bar byas nas rim gyis bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la gzud pa'i ched yin te ;
translated: Also, any statement that compounded phenomena are momentary is for the purpose of causing the careless to become disgusted with compounded phenomena and gradually enter into the reality of selflessness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: de ltar cung zad skye ba med //
analyzed: de ltar cung zad skye ba med //
translated: there is not the slightest arising here.

original: 'di la cung zad 'gag pa'am med //
analyzed: 'di la cung zad 'gag pa'am med //
translated: There is not the slightest ceasing here.

original: skye ba dang ni 'jig pa'i lam //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'jig pa'i lam //
translated: The path of arising and ceasing

original: dgos pa'i don du nye bar ston //üîΩskye ba shes pas 'jig pa shes //üîΩ'jig pa shes pas mi rtag shes //
analyzed: dgos pa'i don du nye bar ston // skye ba shes pas 'jig pa shes // 'jig pa shes pas mi rtag shes //
translated: It is taught for the sake of a purpose.üîΩThrough knowing arising, one knows cessation.

original: mi rtag nyid la 'jug shes pas //
analyzed: mi rtag nyid la 'jug shes pas //
translated: Through knowing cessation, one knows impermanence.üîΩThrough knowing engagement in impermanence,

original: dam pa'i chos la @208b 'jug pa yin /üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la @208b 'jug pa yin / zhes bshad do //
translated: one engages in the sublime Dharma.

original: 'on te 'di snyam du sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa'i nus pa khas blangs na de'i tshe dngos po khas blangs pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di snyam du sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa'i nus pa khas blangs na de'i tshe dngos po khas blangs pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that seeds and so on have the ability to produce sprouts and so on, like illusions and so on, then you are accepting that things exist.

original: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs pa kun rdzob ces bya ba de ni gdon mi za bar nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las rnam par log par nye bar brjod dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs pa kun rdzob ces bya ba de ni gdon mi za bar nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las rnam par log par nye bar brjod dgos so //
translated: In this way, the so-called conventional must be expressed as being the opposite of such things as the rabbit‚Äôs horns, which are said to be devoid of all expression.

original: de lta ma yin na khyed kyis ji ltar 'jig rten dang lung la sogs pa dang 'gal ba spang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khyed kyis ji ltar 'jig rten dang lung la sogs pa dang 'gal ba spang bar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could you avoid contradicting the world and scripture?

original: kho bo cag ni nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las rnam par log pa gang yin pa de nyid la dngos po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las rnam par log pa gang yin pa de nyid la dngos po zhes brjod do //
translated: We call that which is the opposite of the nonexistence characterized by the absence of all capacity, such as the horns of a rabbit, an entity.

original: gal te khyed de la yang kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes ming du 'dogs par byed na ni 'ga' ma gur 'dogs la rag ste /
analyzed: gal te khyed de la yang kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes ming du 'dogs par byed na ni 'ga' ma gur 'dogs la rag ste /
translated: If you call that also ‚Äúexistence in the conventional sense,‚Äù then you must designate something as ‚Äúnonexistent in the conventional sense.‚Äù

original: dngos po rnams ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgra dag tu brjod kyang don byed nus pa tha dad pa nyid du 'brang ba ni med do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgra dag tu brjod kyang don byed nus pa tha dad pa nyid du 'brang ba ni med do snyam du sems na /
translated: You may think that although entities are described by the terms ‚Äúconventional‚Äù and ‚Äúultimate,‚Äù there is no difference in their capacity to perform a function.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This also is not correct.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa na glang po dang / rta dang / me dang / sa dang / khyu mchog la sogs pa don bya ba sna tshogs byed pa nyid du snang ba brdzun pa'i dngos po gang dag lus phan tshun tha dad pa'i rjes su song zhing yul dang dus kyi gnas skabs tha dad pa lta bur yang dag par mngon pa de dag kyang
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa na glang po dang / rta dang / me dang / sa dang / khyu mchog la sogs pa don bya ba sna tshogs byed pa nyid du snang ba brdzun pa'i dngos po gang dag lus phan tshun tha dad pa'i rjes su song zhing yul dang dus kyi gnas skabs tha dad pa lta bur yang dag par mngon pa de dag kyang
translated: Thus, in dreams and so on, elephants, horses, fire, earth, bulls, and so on appear to perform various functions. Those false things are not real in the way they appear to be different bodies, places, and times.

original: ci nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las rnam par log pa'i lus shig yin nam /
analyzed: ci nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las rnam par log pa'i lus shig yin nam /
translated: Do they have a body that is the opposite of a rabbit‚Äôs horns and so on, which are devoid of all expression?

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: Or do they not?

original: de la gal te rnam par log pa'i lus shig yin na ni 'o na ni de dag kyang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te rnam par log pa'i lus shig yin na ni 'o na ni de dag kyang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they have a body that is the opposite of those, then it follows that they are things.

original: 'on te rnam par ma log pa'i lus shig yin no zhe na ni de'i tshe khyed kyi grags pa dang 'gal ba ji ltar spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'on te rnam par ma log pa'i lus shig yin no zhe na ni de'i tshe khyed kyi grags pa dang 'gal ba ji ltar spong bar 'gyur //
translated: But if they have a body that is not the opposite of those, then how could you avoid contradicting your own position?

original: ji ste 'di skad du de dag ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin mod kyi //
analyzed: ji ste 'di skad du de dag ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin mod kyi //
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúThey do not exist in the way they appear,

original: 'on kyang de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir dngos por yod pa kho na'o zhes brjod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir dngos por yod pa kho na'o zhes brjod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: but they do exist as things because they arise dependently as the nature of consciousness,‚Äù that is also illogical.

original: gal te de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin na ni de'i tshe ci ste lus la sogs pa'i bye brag gi rjes su song ba yod pa ma yin pa shin tu 'gal ba'i rang gi ngo bor snang bar 'gyur /üîΩgzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bor snang @209a * //
analyzed: gal te de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin na ni de'i tshe ci ste lus la sogs pa'i bye brag gi rjes su song ba yod pa ma yin pa shin tu 'gal ba'i rang gi ngo bor snang bar 'gyur / gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bor snang @209a * //
translated: If they are only the nature of consciousness, then why do they appear as a different nature, as a body, etc., that is utterly inconsistent with consciousness?

original: par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is illogical for one thing to appear as the nature of another.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This is because sameness and difference are contradictory, as has been explained.

original: 'di ltar shes pa'i ngo bo ni shel dag pa lta bu cha shas med pa yul na mi gnas po sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs su snang bar ma gyur pa yin par 'dod na rmi lam la sogs pa na ni rta dang glang po
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa'i ngo bo ni shel dag pa lta bu cha shas med pa yul na mi gnas po sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs su snang bar ma gyur pa yin par 'dod na rmi lam la sogs pa na ni rta dang glang po
translated: Thus, if you maintain that the nature of consciousness is like a pure crystal, partless, not located in any place, and not appearing as the various aspects of blue and so on, then in dreams and so on, things such as horses, elephants,

original: che la sogs pa'i dngos po dag de'i ngo bor yang dag par ma byung ste /
analyzed: che la sogs pa'i dngos po dag de'i ngo bor yang dag par ma byung ste /
translated: and humans do not appear in the nature of consciousness,

original: de dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they possess aspects that are incompatible with it.

original: de lta ma yin na de ltar snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir kho bo cag ni gang dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'das te log pa'i rnam par snang ba brdzun pa nyid kyis 'jig rten par 'dod cing kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang brjod par de dag kho na dngos po'i mtshan nyid du 'khrul
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de ltar snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro // de'i phyir kho bo cag ni gang dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'das te log pa'i rnam par snang ba brdzun pa nyid kyis 'jig rten par 'dod cing kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang brjod par de dag kho na dngos po'i mtshan nyid du 'khrul
translated: If that were not so, they would not appear in that way.üîΩTherefore, we assert that those things that are beyond the nature of consciousness, that appear in a form that is false, and that are mistaken are worldly.üîΩWe also call them imagined natures.

original: pa'i yul nyid du rjod par byed kyi /
analyzed: pa'i yul nyid du rjod par byed kyi /
translated: We say that they are the objects of error with regard to the characteristics of things,

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with regard to the nature of consciousness.

original: de yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i phyir bden pa'i ngo bor ma grub bo ;
analyzed: de yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i phyir bden pa'i ngo bor ma grub bo ;
translated: Since it appears as an identity that is not different from that, it is not established as a real entity.

original: / ji ste 'di skad du dngos po'i bag tu grags pa de dag kyang tshad mas ji lta ba de bzhin du gsal ba'i phyir yang dag par dngos po'i ngo bor rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: / ji ste 'di skad du dngos po'i bag tu grags pa de dag kyang tshad mas ji lta ba de bzhin du gsal ba'i phyir yang dag par dngos po'i ngo bor rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: If one says this, since those things that are renowned as entities are clear just as they are by valid knowledge, they are not posited as real entities.

original: dper na g-yor mo'i mi la mi nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na g-yor mo'i mi la mi nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a human being in a mirage.

original: nges na yang dag pa po'i dngos po'i lus su ma gyur pa brdzun pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par na nyes par brjod pa ma lus pa dang bral ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las log pa dang ma log pa la sogs pa'i
analyzed: nges na yang dag pa po'i dngos po'i lus su ma gyur pa brdzun pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par na nyes par brjod pa ma lus pa dang bral ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las log pa dang ma log pa la sogs pa'i
translated: If so, that which is not a body of real entities, that is, a falsity, is in reality free from all faults, such as being the opposite of a rabbit‚Äôs horns and so on.

original: bsam pa mi 'jug pa kho na'o zhes brjod na gal te de lta na kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo nyid ji skad du nye bar brjod pa ji skad bshad pa'i tshad mas brdzun par yang dag par grub pa'i ngo bo la yang de bzhin du de lta bu'i
analyzed: bsam pa mi 'jug pa kho na'o zhes brjod na gal te de lta na kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo nyid ji skad du nye bar brjod pa ji skad bshad pa'i tshad mas brdzun par yang dag par grub pa'i ngo bo la yang de bzhin du de lta bu'i
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe mind does not engage at all,‚Äù then, in that case, the nature of the conventional is just as you describe it.üîΩYou should not think about it in any other way.

original: bsam pa ma byed cig / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa tshad mas dngos po'i ngo bo gsal rab tu gsal ba de lta bu la yang don dam par brjod do zhes ming du 'dogs par byed na ni dga' mgur thogs la dga' ston yang byed la rag go //
analyzed: bsam pa ma byed cig / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa tshad mas dngos po'i ngo bo gsal rab tu gsal ba de lta bu la yang don dam par brjod do zhes ming du 'dogs par byed na ni dga' mgur thogs la dga' ston yang byed la rag go //
translated: If you designate the nature of things that is clearly illuminated by valid knowledge as ‚Äúultimate‚Äù and give it the name ‚Äúultimate,‚Äù then you may do so to your heart‚Äôs content.

original: 'on kyang ming du 'dogs par byed pa tsam gyi sgo nas ni dngos po rnams ngo bo gzhan du nye bar len pa med pas na yang 'or cig ces smras pa gang yin pa de dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ming du 'dogs par byed pa tsam gyi sgo nas ni dngos po rnams ngo bo gzhan du nye bar len pa med pas na yang 'or cig ces smras pa gang yin pa de dang mtshungs so //
translated: However, since things do not take on another nature through mere designation, you should let go of it.

original: slob dpon rnams kyis ni gang dag don dam pa'i tshul gyis rgya mtsho shin tu zab mo la 'jug par mi @209b nus pa de dag la rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs par lta ba dam pa ma yin pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir byis pa'i skye
analyzed: slob dpon rnams kyis ni gang dag don dam pa'i tshul gyis rgya mtsho shin tu zab mo la 'jug par mi @209b nus pa de dag la rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs par lta ba dam pa ma yin pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir byis pa'i skye
translated: The masters of the past, for the sake of those who are unable to enter the extremely profound ocean of the ultimate, washed away the stains of inferior views such as eternalism and nihilism with the water of the scriptures of the Great Vehicle.üîΩ

original: bo gzud pa'i don du don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang mthun pa ji ltar grags pa don bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir don dam par yod pa'o zhes bya ba 'di bshad kyi /
analyzed: bo gzud pa'i don du don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang mthun pa ji ltar grags pa don bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir don dam par yod pa'o zhes bya ba 'di bshad kyi /
translated: The masters explain that for those who are unable to enter the very deep ocean of the ultimate, in order to introduce childish beings and to wash away the stains of non-substantiality such as eternalism and nihilism, they explain that whatever is renowned as the ultimate, which is consistent with the accumulations of merit and wisdom, and which performs its function, exists ultimately.

original: gcig tu nges pa'i don dam pa yang dag par shes par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa'i don dam pa yang dag par shes par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: But it should be understood that this is not for the sake of knowing the ultimate that is ascertained as one.

original: de ni don dam par med pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni don dam par med pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Because that does not exist ultimately, it is as explained earlier.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam 'grel las /
translated: Therefore the Thorough Exposition of Valid Cognition says:

original: ji lta ba de lta yin du zad do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji lta ba de lta yin du zad do zhes bshad do //
translated: It is just as it is.

original: 'phags pa dpal phreng seng ge'i nga ro'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dpal phreng seng ge'i nga ro'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Lion‚Äôs Roar of Queen ≈örƒ´mƒÅlƒÅ S≈´tra says:

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no //
translated: That which is impermanent is false and deceptive.

original: gang brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can de ni mi bden pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can de ni mi bden pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That which is false and deceptive is not true.

original: lung las kyang dge slong dag 'di tsam zhig ni bden pa yin te /
analyzed: lung las kyang dge slong dag 'di tsam zhig ni bden pa yin te /
translated: Also, a scripture says, ‚ÄúMonks, this much is true:

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Monks, it is like this:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa slu ba'i chos med pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa slu ba'i chos med pa'o //
translated: NirvƒÅ·πáa is not a deceptive phenomenon.

original: dge slong dag 'du byed thams cad ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'du byed thams cad ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Monks, all compounded phenomena are false and deceptive.‚Äù

original: ji ste gal te dngos po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par snang na ni /
analyzed: ji ste gal te dngos po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par snang na ni /
translated: If, although things do not ultimately exist essentially, it is still the case that they appear as objects and times that are ascertained,

original: de'i tshe 'o na ni de'i tshe ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ji ltar snang bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'o na ni de'i tshe ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ji ltar snang bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then why do things such as the horns of a rabbit not appear?

original: de'i phyir 'di'i lan ni khyed kyis kyang brjod dgos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i lan ni khyed kyis kyang brjod dgos te /
translated: Therefore, you must respond to this question:

original: rab rib can la sogs pa la skra la sogs pa brdzun pa snang ba dang mtshungs pa la ci ste skra la sogs pa brdzun pa kho na snang gi ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni ma yin /
analyzed: rab rib can la sogs pa la skra la sogs pa brdzun pa snang ba dang mtshungs pa la ci ste skra la sogs pa brdzun pa kho na snang gi ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni ma yin /
translated: It is similar to the appearance of false things such as hair and so on to those with eye disease. Why do only false things such as hair and so on appear and not the horns of a rabbit and so on?

original: 'on te rab rib la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir de ltar so sor nges par brjod na ni de'i tshe dngos po med pa yin na yang ji ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par 'gyur
analyzed: 'on te rab rib la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir de ltar so sor nges par brjod na ni de'i tshe dngos po med pa yin na yang ji ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par 'gyur
translated: But if you say that the individual certainty of the power of the causes and conditions of eye disease and so on is like that, then at that time, even though it is a nonthing, how could the individual certainty of the power of the causes and conditions come to be?

original: zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus you would say that.

original: 'on te mthong ba'i phyir de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes brjod na ni de bzhin du gzhan la yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi nus pa so sor nges pa las ji ste de ltar rnam par gzhag pa las nges par mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba'i phyir de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes brjod na ni de bzhin du gzhan la yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi nus pa so sor nges pa las ji ste de ltar rnam par gzhag pa las nges par mi 'dod /
translated: But if you say that it is like that because it is seen, then why do you not assert that it is like that in other cases, because the individual certainty of the power of the causes and conditions is like that?

original: 'di tsam gyis ni dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it does not follow that it is a thing merely because of that.

original: rab rib can dag gis mthong ba'i skra la sogs pa la yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //üîΩde @210a * //
analyzed: rab rib can dag gis mthong ba'i skra la sogs pa la yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to // de @210a * //
translated: It was explained earlier that it would follow, absurdly, that even the hairs and so forth that are seen by those with myodesopsia are real things.

original: lta ma yin na rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra la sogs pa brdzun pa la yang ji ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: lta ma yin na rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra la sogs pa brdzun pa la yang ji ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par 'gyur //
translated: If that were not so, then how could the power of the causes and conditions be individually ascertained even in regard to the false hairs and so forth perceived by those with myodesopsia?

original: rab rib can gyis skra la sogs pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang bden par rigs pa ma yin no zhes sngar bshad pa nyid do ;
analyzed: rab rib can gyis skra la sogs pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang bden par rigs pa ma yin no zhes sngar bshad pa nyid do ;
translated: It was explained earlier that it is not correct to say that the hairs and so forth perceived by those with myodesopsia are real in being of the nature of consciousness.

original: / gzhan yang shes pa'i ngo bo bden pa nyid du grub pa yin na ni skra la sogs pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir bden pa nyid du rtogs par nus par gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: / gzhan yang shes pa'i ngo bo bden pa nyid du grub pa yin na ni skra la sogs pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir bden pa nyid du rtogs par nus par gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Moreover, if the nature of consciousness were established as real, then it would be possible to understand that even the hairs and so forth are real, for they are not different from it.

original: de nyid ma grub ste ji ltar sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid ma grub ste ji ltar sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: But that is not established, as was explained earlier.

original: skra la sogs pa ni brdzun pa nyid du 'jig rten pa dang tshad mas rab tu grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa ni brdzun pa nyid du 'jig rten pa dang tshad mas rab tu grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Hair and so on are only established by the world and valid cognition as false.

original: de'i phyir shes pa yang skra la sogs pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba nyid du brdzun pa kho na yin pas ji ltar skra la sogs pa de'i ngo bor bden pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa yang skra la sogs pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba nyid du brdzun pa kho na yin pas ji ltar skra la sogs pa de'i ngo bor bden pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since consciousness is not different from the false entity of hair and so on, it is also false in the same way. So how could hair and so on be true in the nature of that consciousness?

original: gang dag gal te dngos po thams cad don dam par ma skyes pa yin na de bzhin du kun rdzob tu yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag gal te dngos po thams cad don dam par ma skyes pa yin na de bzhin du kun rdzob tu yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Some say: If all things are ultimately unarisen, they would also be unarisen conventionally.üîΩThose that are ultimately unarisen are also unarisen conventionally, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: gang dag don dam par ma skyes pa de dag la kun rdzob tu yang skye ba med de dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ba de dag gi yang sgyu ma la sogs pas ma nges pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gang dag don dam par ma skyes pa de dag la kun rdzob tu yang skye ba med de dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ba de dag gi yang sgyu ma la sogs pas ma nges pa yang yin la /
translated: This is uncertain because of illusions and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar ma bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yang yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar ma bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yang yin no //
translated: because it does not show a valid cognition that contradicts the probandum, the reason is also doubtful in regard to the reversal of the discordant side.

original: dpe tsam gyis ni 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe tsam gyis ni 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The desired object is not established by mere example,

original: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa gnyi ga'i phyogs la khyab pa nyid kyang srid pa'i phyir don dam par med pa kun rdzob tu yang med pa nyid yin na ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa rab tu 'jig par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa gnyi ga'i phyogs la khyab pa nyid kyang srid pa'i phyir don dam par med pa kun rdzob tu yang med pa nyid yin na ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa rab tu 'jig par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: because pervasion by the object of comprehension itself is possible in both sides. If it is non-existent ultimately and also non-existent conventionally, then the conventional truth would be utterly destroyed.

original: de'i phyir su yang phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir su yang phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, no one would be mistaken.

original: thal bar sgrub pa nyid yin na yang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thal bar sgrub pa nyid yin na yang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Even if it is an argument by reductio, the reason is still uncertain because the pervasion is not established.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang skye bar mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni de lta bu'i las la sogs pa'i tshogs pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang skye bar mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni de lta bu'i las la sogs pa'i tshogs pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: The horn of a rabbit, etc., which do not appear to be produced even conventionally, are not such collections of actions, etc.

original: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that they are devoid of an ultimate reality.

original: gang gis na nges pa med par 'gyur ba dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo kun rdzob pa yang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa la mi ltos pa nyid du khas len par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na nges pa med par 'gyur ba dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo kun rdzob pa yang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa la mi ltos pa nyid du khas len par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For, one does not accept that the superficial reality of things is not dependent on the aggregation of causes and conditions, by which one would be without certainty.

original: rgyu dang rkyen @210b la rag las pa tsam gyi sgo nas dngos po nyid du thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen @210b la rag las pa tsam gyi sgo nas dngos po nyid du thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that the consequence of their being things is due merely to their dependence on causes and conditions,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa brdzun pa yang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa yod pa dang / med pa las 'jug pa dang / ldog pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa brdzun pa yang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa yod pa dang / med pa las 'jug pa dang / ldog pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even such false things as illusions are seen to engage and disengage in dependence on the aggregation and non-aggregation of causes and conditions.

original: mthong ba tsam gyi sgo nas ni dngos po de bzhin du 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyi sgo nas ni dngos po de bzhin du 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: And it has already been demonstrated that things do not become real just because they are seen.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyi mu bzhi pa'i skye ba dang bral ba nyid kyis dngos po rnams de kho na nyid du skye ba med par bsgrubs pas ngo bo nyid med par gsal rab tu bsgrubs kyang kha cig tshad ma'i lam ma rtogs pa nyid kyis gzhan du sun
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyi mu bzhi pa'i skye ba dang bral ba nyid kyis dngos po rnams de kho na nyid du skye ba med par bsgrubs pas ngo bo nyid med par gsal rab tu bsgrubs kyang kha cig tshad ma'i lam ma rtogs pa nyid kyis gzhan du sun
translated: Some, not understanding the path of valid knowledge, refute this in other texts.

original: 'byin pa gang yin pa de gsal bar 'dod na re zhig tshad ma'i de kho na nye bar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byin pa gang yin pa de gsal bar 'dod na re zhig tshad ma'i de kho na nye bar bstan par bya ste /
translated: If you wish to clarify this, then first I will teach the reality of valid knowledge.

original: gang dag don dam par mu bzhi pa'i skye ba dang bral ba de ni de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin te dper na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang dag don dam par mu bzhi pa'i skye ba dang bral ba de ni de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin te dper na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which is free of the four possibilities of ultimate arising is just essenceless in reality, like the sky flower and so on.üîΩAll things that are the basis of dispute are just like that in reality.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang yang dag par na de dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang kha cig na re gcig las gcig mi skye'o zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang yang dag par na de dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang kha cig na re gcig las gcig mi skye'o zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs /
translated: Some say, ‚ÄúHow can you know that one thing does not arise from another?‚Äù

original: tshad ma log pa tsam gyis ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ldog pa med de /
analyzed: tshad ma log pa tsam gyis ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ldog pa med de /
translated: The mere cessation of valid knowledge does not reverse the reality of things,

original: de ni de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the cause of that, and because it is not the nature of that.

original: 'on te su yang khas mi len pa'i phyir de dgag par mdzad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te su yang khas mi len pa'i phyir de dgag par mdzad do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that he refutes them because no one accepts them,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: kha cig dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig kho na las 'gro ba skye bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: kha cig dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig kho na las 'gro ba skye bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that because some assert that the world arises from one thing alone, such as God,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gcig las gcig kho na skye na rtag pa'i ngo bo las sam /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te / 'di ltar gcig las gcig kho na skye na rtag pa'i ngo bo las sam /
translated: that is not logical.

original: mi rtag pa'i ngo bo las skye bas 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i ngo bo las skye bas 'gyur grang na /
translated: If one thing arises from one thing alone, it would arise from a permanent entity or from an impermanent entity.

original: re zhig rtag pa'i ngo bo las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rtag pa'i ngo bo las ni ma yin te /
translated: But first, it does not arise from a permanent entity,

original: de ni de mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa nyid kyis sngon dang phyi ma'i dus bzhin du bar du yang skyed par byed pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa nyid kyis sngon dang phyi ma'i dus bzhin du bar du yang skyed par byed pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory that it generates in the middle, like the earlier and later times, because it is not different from the state of not generating it.

original: 'on te skyed na ni de bzhin du sngon dang phyi ma'i dus su yang skyed par thal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te skyed na ni de bzhin du sngon dang phyi ma'i dus su yang skyed par thal ba yin te /
translated: But if it does generate, then it follows that it generates in the same way in the past and future,

original: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the generator would be continuous.

original: rjes su mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams pa yin pas rim dang cig shes dag gis 'di'i skyed par byed pa nyid rgyas par bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams pa yin pas rim dang cig shes dag gis 'di'i skyed par byed pa nyid rgyas par bsal ba yin no //
translated: If it is not continuous, then its permanence is undermined. Thus its generation in sequence and simultaneously is extensively refuted.

original: de'i phyir re zhig rtag pa las skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig rtag pa las skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that it arises from a permanent cause.

original: mi rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: It also does not arise from an impermanent cause,

original: de las kyang @211a * //
analyzed: de las kyang @211a * //
translated: because it is also refuted

original: sngar dus mnyam pa dang / cig shos dag tu skye ba spyir bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar dus mnyam pa dang / cig shos dag tu skye ba spyir bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in general that it arises from that in the past and in the present.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ma gtogs pa gang las de skye bar 'gyur ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ma gtogs pa gang las de skye bar 'gyur ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no other cause from which it arises apart from permanent and impermanent causes.

original: gzhan dag gis 'gro ba'i rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa'i ngo bo cig kho nar khas blangs pa gang yin pa de las kyang de dag gi so bo bo gcig las 'bras bu gcig kho na skye bar khas blangs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'gro ba'i rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa'i ngo bo cig kho nar khas blangs pa gang yin pa de las kyang de dag gi so bo bo gcig las 'bras bu gcig kho na skye bar khas blangs pa ma yin te /
translated: Others accept that the cause of the world is a single entity, such as God. But even they do not accept that a single effect arises from that single cause.

original: 'gro ba ngo bo du ma de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba ngo bo du ma de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they assert that the world is the effect of that, which has many natures.üîΩTherefore, it is not the case that only a single effect arises from a single cause.

original: de'i phyir gcig las gcig kho na skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs su dbang phyug la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'das skabs kyi don mngon par mi shes pa kho na sgrogs par byed pa yin no
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig las gcig kho na skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs su dbang phyug la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'das skabs kyi don mngon par mi shes pa kho na sgrogs par byed pa yin no
translated: The statement that God and so on are the confused objects of the world is a mere proclamation by those who do not understand the meaning of the context.

original: // dbang phyug la sogs pa ni rgyu'i dngos por yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: // dbang phyug la sogs pa ni rgyu'i dngos por yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: God and so on do not exist as causes.

original: de ni gzhan dag gis rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du nye bar brtags pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni gzhan dag gis rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du nye bar brtags pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because others impute them to be permanent entities.

original: rtag pa yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid du sngar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid du sngar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: And it has been proven earlier that the permanent is devoid of all ability.

original: 'on te yang gzhan dag gis de mi rtag pa kho nar kun tu rtog par byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe de las kyang 'bras bu gcig kho na skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te yang gzhan dag gis de mi rtag pa kho nar kun tu rtog par byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe de las kyang 'bras bu gcig kho na skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if others imagine that it is only impermanent, then at that time it is also illogical that only one effect arises from it.üîΩIn that case, how could any effect that exists in a different type arise from it?

original: 'di ltar de las ji ltar rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig cung zad skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe de'i rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma gzhan gyi nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa kho na laüîΩyang dag par chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de las ji ltar rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig cung zad skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe de'i rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma gzhan gyi nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa kho na la yang dag par chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, because the second moment does not link with another moment of a similar type, it would be completely destroyed.

original: de lta na rtag tu de'i rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu nye bar bskyed pa'i dus na skad cig ma snga ma snga ma thams cad rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma la nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug ces bya ba mi
analyzed: de lta na rtag tu de'i rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu nye bar bskyed pa'i dus na skad cig ma snga ma snga ma thams cad rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma la nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug ces bya ba mi
translated: In that case, at the time of generating an effect of a dissimilar type, all prior moments would not link with a subsequent moment of a similar type.üîΩTherefore the so-called ƒ™≈õvara would not exist.

original: rtag pa'i phyir ngo bo yang 'gro ba'i rgyur nye bar rtog par 'gyur ba de gang gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir ngo bo yang 'gro ba'i rgyur nye bar rtog par 'gyur ba de gang gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: And if you imagine that the nature of the self is the cause of the world, what is that nature?
