original: ji ste yang de ni skad cig ma dang po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma gcig gi rang gi ngo bo kho nar nye bar brjod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ste yang de ni skad cig ma dang po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma gcig gi rang gi ngo bo kho nar nye bar brjod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is the nature of the first moment, that is not reasonable,

original: rgyu med pa de skye bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa de skye bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for that which has no cause to arise.

original: yang na de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gro ba thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gro ba thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, the entire world would be without a cause, just like that.

original: de lta bas na de rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa ni sngon nam /
analyzed: de lta bas na de rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa ni sngon nam /
translated: Therefore, that which is the cause of that is not at all prior to it,

original: phyis kyang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: phyis kyang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: nor is it subsequent to it.

original: yod na ni @211b de'i skad cig ma gcig tsam gyis ngo bo nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod na ni @211b de'i skad cig ma gcig tsam gyis ngo bo nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, it would lose its nature in just one moment.

original: 'di'i thog ma med pa nyid kyang sngar bsal zin to //
analyzed: 'di'i thog ma med pa nyid kyang sngar bsal zin to //
translated: And its beginninglessness has already been refuted.

original: 'on te de'i rgyu gzhan kho na zhig nya bar rtog na de'i tshe de nyid des bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu yang yin par ci ste mi brtag / de med na 'grub par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'on te de'i rgyu gzhan kho na zhig nya bar rtog na de'i tshe de nyid des bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu yang yin par ci ste mi brtag / de med na 'grub par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: If it does not exist, would it not be established?

original: ci nas gang gi phyir 'di rtog par byed /üîΩ'on te yang 'di ni rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa la yod pa'i rgyu thog ma med pa nas rgyud de zhugs pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: ci nas gang gi phyir 'di rtog par byed / 'on te yang 'di ni rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa la yod pa'i rgyu thog ma med pa nas rgyud de zhugs pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Why would you imagine it?üîΩBut if you imagine that it is not a different continuum, and that it is only the cause that has existed since beginningless time that has entered that continuum,

original: gzhan gang yang rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes nye bar rtog par byed na de la yang yang dag par na dus ma mnyam pa dang / cig shos dag tu de las rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma yang skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: gzhan gang yang rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes nye bar rtog par byed na de la yang yang dag par na dus ma mnyam pa dang / cig shos dag tu de las rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma yang skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: and that nothing else that exists in another continuum is a generator, then it has been previously explained that it is not logical that a homogeneous instant arises from that at different times.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dang / rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyir de las 'bras bu du ma skye ba yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dang / rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyir de las 'bras bu du ma skye ba yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, and because it would follow that the difference of causes would not make a difference, it should be understood that many effects do not arise from one cause.

original: mig la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang gal te 'bras bu gcig skyed par nges par khas len no /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang gal te 'bras bu gcig skyed par nges par khas len no /
translated: If it is accepted that other things such as the eye faculty definitely produce one effect,

original: de'i tshe long ba dang / 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar bzlog dka' ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe long ba dang / 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar bzlog dka' ste /
translated: then it is difficult to avoid the consequence that the blind and the deaf, etc., would exist.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa'i dbang pos rang gi rnam par shes pa nye bar skyed par byed pa de'i tshe de las rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma gzhan mi skye ba'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa la thams cad long ba la sogs pa'iüîΩdngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa'i dbang pos rang gi rnam par shes pa nye bar skyed par byed pa de'i tshe de las rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma gzhan mi skye ba'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa la thams cad long ba la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when the sense faculties such as the eye faculty generate their respective consciousnesses, then because another moment of consciousness of the same type does not arise from that, in the second moment, the consequence would be that all would be blind, deaf, etc.

original: ji ste yang tshogs pa kho na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste yang tshogs pa kho na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: If the collection itself generates the effect, consciousness,

original: de'i phyir gcig las 'bras bu gcig kho na mi skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig las 'bras bu gcig kho na mi skye ste /
translated: Therefore, one effect does not arise from one cause alone.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / yid la byed pa dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba yang mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / yid la byed pa dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba yang mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: It is seen that eye consciousness and so on arise from the eyes, ears, and mental activity.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: de lta na ni rgyu tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa las rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu'i tha dad pas byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni rgyu tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro // 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa las rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu'i tha dad pas byas pa yin gyi /
translated: If that were so, then a different cause would not make a difference.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, whatever is different in intrinsic nature from cloth and so on is made by a difference in cause, but not by intrinsic nature.

original: de lta ma yin na dngos po rnams rgyu med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dngos po rnams rgyu med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then things would be causeless.

original: de la gal te rgyu'i tha dad pa yod kyang 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i @212a * //
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu'i tha dad pa yod kyang 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i @212a * //
translated: In that regard, if a difference in cause exists but a difference in effect does not occur, then at that time error

original: phyir 'bras bu tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa rgyu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pas byas pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir 'bras bu tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa rgyu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pas byas pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The effect would not be produced by the difference or non-difference of the cause, because the effect is neither different nor non-different from the cause.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag las gzhan pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir thams cad rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag las gzhan pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir thams cad rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no entity whatsoever that is different or non-different from something else, it follows that everything would be uncaused.

original: 'di ltar tshogs pa rnams ni tshogs pa can dag las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshogs pa rnams ni tshogs pa can dag las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the collection is not different from the members of the collection.

original: de dag tshogs pa las logs shig tu bya bar mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag tshogs pa las logs shig tu bya bar mi nus mod kyi /
translated: Although it is not possible to make them different from the collection,

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin phan tshun tha dad cing re res skyed par nus pa de dag las 'bras bu 'byung na ci ste tha mi dad pa kho na 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin phan tshun tha dad cing re res skyed par nus pa de dag las 'bras bu 'byung na ci ste tha mi dad pa kho na 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: if the effect arises from those that are different from each other in nature and each is able to produce it, why would it arise only as non-different?

original: gal te thams cad 'bras bu gcig kho na la nus kyi du ma la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad 'bras bu gcig kho na la nus kyi du ma la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that all are able to produce only one effect, not many,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is unreasonable.

original: de ltar na ni skad cig ma rigs mthun pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa la mig la sogs pa'i rgyud rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ni skad cig ma rigs mthun pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa la mig la sogs pa'i rgyud rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because of the linking of homogeneous moments, the continuum of the eye, etc., would be interrupted in the second moment.

original: gal te de dag skad cig ma rigs mthun pa'i bskyed par bya ba la yang nus pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag skad cig ma rigs mthun pa'i bskyed par bya ba la yang nus pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If they have the power to generate homogeneous moments,

original: gal te don gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin na ni de'i phyir de'i tshe nus pa kho na rgyur 'gyur gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te don gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin na ni de'i phyir de'i tshe nus pa kho na rgyur 'gyur gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: if they are different objects, then at that time only the power would be the cause, not the entity.

original: 'brel pa yang 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And the relation would not be established,

original: de dag nus pa la phan pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nus pa la phan pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not benefit the power.

original: de la phan pa byed na ni nus pa tha dad pa gzhan dang gzhan la ltos na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phan pa byed na ni nus pa tha dad pa gzhan dang gzhan la ltos na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they benefit it, then it would be necessary to rely on other and other different powers, and that would be infinite regress.

original: 'on te de dag rang gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas nus pa la phan pa byed na ni de'i tshe 'bras bu la yang de bzhin du ji ste mi byed /
analyzed: 'on te de dag rang gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas nus pa la phan pa byed na ni de'i tshe 'bras bu la yang de bzhin du ji ste mi byed /
translated: But if they benefit the power just by becoming its own nature, then why do they not do the same for the effect?

original: de lta bas na nus pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nus pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the potency is not different from the nature of the thing itself.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag nus pa gang kho nas rigs mthun pa'i 'bras bu nye bar skyed pa de kho nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa thun mong ba yang skyed pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu 'di dag tha dad par 'gyur /üîΩ'on te 'bras bu gcig ni tshogs pa la rag las pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag nus pa gang kho nas rigs mthun pa'i 'bras bu nye bar skyed pa de kho nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa thun mong ba yang skyed pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu 'di dag tha dad par 'gyur / 'on te 'bras bu gcig ni tshogs pa la rag las pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, since the eye consciousness and so on are produced by the same potency that produces the homogeneous result, how could these results be different?

original: gzhan ni re re la rag las pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni re re la rag las pa yin te /
translated: But if one result depends on the collection and the other depends on each individual factor,

original: de'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam na /
translated: then they would be different.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: That is not logical either,

original: tshogs pa can rnams re re zhing rgyur gyur pa'i phyir tshogs pa la rag las pa yang re re la rag las pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa can rnams re re zhing rgyur gyur pa'i phyir tshogs pa la rag las pa yang re re la rag las pa kho na yin no //
translated: because each member of the collection is a cause, so the result that depends on the collection depends on each individual member of the collection.

original: de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pas 'bras bu rigs @212b mthun pa dang mi mthun pa tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pas 'bras bu rigs @212b mthun pa dang mi mthun pa tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the cause is not different, the effect would not be different, either similar or dissimilar.

original: gang dag rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thal ba'i don gang yin /
analyzed: gang dag rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thal ba'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the consequence that ‚Äúthe difference of the cause would not make a difference‚Äù?

original: gal te dum bur skyed par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po'i ngo bo la cha shas med pa'i phyir cha shas su skye bar mi 'dod pa nyid pas ji ltar thal ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te dum bur skyed par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po'i ngo bo la cha shas med pa'i phyir cha shas su skye bar mi 'dod pa nyid pas ji ltar thal ba yin te /
translated: If the meaning is that ‚Äúit would not generate in parts,‚Äù then since one does not assert that an entity generates in parts because it is partless, how could that be a consequence?

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni mi 'dod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni mi 'dod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its definition is that it is not to be accepted.

original: 'on te khyad par du byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par du byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the meaning is that ‚Äúit would not make a difference,‚Äù

original: de ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: de ni ma grub ste /
translated: that is not established.

original: rgyu dag gis 'bras bu'i dngos po rigs mi mthun pa du ma las log pa dang ldan pa skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dag gis 'bras bu'i dngos po rigs mi mthun pa du ma las log pa dang ldan pa skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because causes generate effects that are the opposite of many dissimilar things.üîΩBut that is not logical, because it would not be the generator of a part of a single thing.

original: gcig la cha shas su skyed par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes thal bar brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la cha shas su skyed par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes thal bar brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not say that it follows that it would not be the generator of a single thing.

original: 'on kyang khyed dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun ldog pas byas pa'i khyad par du 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu sna tshogs pa nyid kyis byas la /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyed dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun ldog pas byas pa'i khyad par du 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu sna tshogs pa nyid kyis byas la /
translated: However, you assert that the difference created by the mutual exclusion of things is created by the diversity of causes.

original: gal te 'dir rgyu sna tshogs par khas blangs te 'bras bu sna tshogs ma yin par khas len par byed na de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa rgyu'i sna tshogs pa nyid kyis byas par mi 'gyur ro zhes thal pa brjod do //
analyzed: gal te 'dir rgyu sna tshogs par khas blangs te 'bras bu sna tshogs ma yin par khas len par byed na de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa rgyu'i sna tshogs pa nyid kyis byas par mi 'gyur ro zhes thal pa brjod do //
translated: If you accept that the diversity of causes is accepted here, but the diversity of effects is not accepted, then because of error, it follows that the difference of things is not created by the diversity of causes.

original: gang yang de dag gi dngos po rigs mi mthun pa du ma las ldog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid du nye bar brjod pa de yang 'brel pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang de dag gi dngos po rigs mi mthun pa du ma las ldog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid du nye bar brjod pa de yang 'brel pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Also, the characteristics that cause the reversal from many heterogeneous things are said to be the specific effects, but they are not related.

original: 'di ltar gal te de dag bdag nyid khyad par du gyur pa gang kho nas 'bras bu khyad par can nye bar skyed pa na de ni rigs mi mthun pa dag las ldog par byed pa de nyid kyis rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma yang nye bar bskyed
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te de dag bdag nyid khyad par du gyur pa gang kho nas 'bras bu khyad par can nye bar skyed pa na de ni rigs mi mthun pa dag las ldog par byed pa de nyid kyis rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma yang nye bar bskyed
translated: If those specific things that generate specific effects cause the reversal from heterogeneous things, then they would also generate homogeneous moments and cause their reversal.

original: nas ldog par byed par 'gyur na de'i tshe des bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dag phan tshun ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nas ldog par byed par 'gyur na de'i tshe des bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dag phan tshun ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the effects that they generate, both homogeneous and heterogeneous, would not mutually reverse.

original: ldog par byed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog par byed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of reversal would not be different.

original: 'on te rgyu de dag so so rang nyid ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rigs mthun pa'i 'bras bu la tha dad par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu de dag so so rang nyid ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rigs mthun pa'i 'bras bu la tha dad par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that each cause has a nature that is a negation, then it would be the cause of a homogeneous effect.

original: de'i tshe de dang 'dra par thun mong gi 'bras bu la yang de dag ci ste tha dad par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dang 'dra par thun mong gi 'bras bu la yang de dag ci ste tha dad par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In that case, why wouldn‚Äôt they be causes of a common effect, just as they are causes of a homogeneous effect?

original: de la yang thams cad re re zhing rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang thams cad re re zhing rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each of them is a cause.

original: gcig skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de las ldog pa gzhan dag ni gcig skyed /
analyzed: gcig skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de las ldog pa gzhan dag ni gcig skyed /
translated: Whatever nature produces one thing is not the nature of another, because it is a different thing.üîΩIt is not the nature of another, because it is a different thing.

original: @213a * // par byed par mi 'gyur te /üîΩde ni skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa'i phyir don gzhan bzhin no //üîΩgzhan nyid ni de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @213a * // par byed par mi 'gyur te / de ni skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa'i phyir don gzhan bzhin no // gzhan nyid ni de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were, it would not be different from that.üîΩBut if you say that they are different, because they have different natures, then they would not be causes of a common effect.

original: ji ste yang de dag phan tshun ldog pa'i ngo bo yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ste yang de dag phan tshun ldog pa'i ngo bo yin mod kyi /
translated: But if you say that they are different, because they have different natures, then they would not be causes of a common effect.

original: 'on kyang de dag la skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo las ldog pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag la skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo las ldog pa ni med do //
translated: But it is not the case that they are devoid of the nature of producing their own effect.

original: gzhan la de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo med do zhes ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: gzhan la de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo med do zhes ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that the other does not have the nature of producing it.

original: 'on kyang gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: But we do say that the nature of producing it by one is not that of the other.

original: gzhan yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is produced by its own nature,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: but not by the nature of another,

original: de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not that.

original: de dag bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du tha dad pa yang yin la rang gi ngo bos skyed par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du tha dad pa yang yin la rang gi ngo bos skyed par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What contradiction is there in saying that they are different according to their own natures and that they are produced by their own natures?

original: ngo bo cig med pa ni de'i ngo bor mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ngo bo cig med pa ni de'i ngo bor mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: That which does not have the same nature as that does not become that.

original: de mi bya ba ni ma yin na /
analyzed: de mi bya ba ni ma yin na /
translated: But it is not that it does not perform that action.

original: de kho nas 'bras bu 'di bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de kho nas 'bras bu 'di bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod snyam du sems na /
translated: What logic is there in thinking that it must perform this effect just because it is that?

original: lan 'di ni grangs can kho na la brjod na mdzes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan 'di ni grangs can kho na la brjod na mdzes par 'gyur ro //
translated: This answer would be beautiful if it were addressed to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya alone.

original: de dag ni 'gro ba tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho na nye bar brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gro ba tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho na nye bar brjod do //
translated: They themselves declare that the nature of the world is neither different nor non-different.

original: de'i phyir der 'dzin pa rnam par bzlog pa'i ched du slob dpon gyi dngos po rnams tha snyad kyi sgo nas tha dad par ston par mdzad pa rnams kyis thams cad nye bar brjod pa yin gyi /üîΩ'di gang dag yang dag par na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba don gcig pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir der 'dzin pa rnam par bzlog pa'i ched du slob dpon gyi dngos po rnams tha snyad kyi sgo nas tha dad par ston par mdzad pa rnams kyis thams cad nye bar brjod pa yin gyi / 'di gang dag yang dag par na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba don gcig pa yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate their grasping of that, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna taught that things are different conventionally.

original: don tha dad pa yang ma yin par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir bshad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don tha dad pa yang ma yin par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir bshad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But this is not an explanation for those who assert that dependently arisen things are neither the same nor different in reality.

original: de dag gi ltar na sgyu ma dang mtshungs pas yang dag par na dngos po thams cad la tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na sgyu ma dang mtshungs pas yang dag par na dngos po thams cad la tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, according to them, since they are like illusions, in reality all things are not established as either different or non-different.

original: gzhan yang gal te dngos po rnams la yang dag pa'i ngo bo gnyis te gcig ni skyed par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin la cig shos ni rang gi ngo bo'i bdag nyid yin par gyur na de'i tshe 'di gzhan rang gi ngo bo las log kyang skyed par
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dngos po rnams la yang dag pa'i ngo bo gnyis te gcig ni skyed par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin la cig shos ni rang gi ngo bo'i bdag nyid yin par gyur na de'i tshe 'di gzhan rang gi ngo bo las log kyang skyed par
translated: Moreover, if things have two real natures‚Äîone is the characteristic of the producer and the other is the nature of its own entity‚Äîthen at that time, although it is different from its own entity, it is produced.üîΩ

original: byed pa'i ngo bo las log pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lan 'di mdzes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: byed pa'i ngo bo las log pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lan 'di mdzes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Moreover, if things have two natures that are real, one that is the characteristic of the producer and the other that is the nature of its own entity, then it would be correct to respond, ‚ÄúIn that case, although it is different from its own entity, it is not different from the nature of the producer.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe thams cad skyed par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho na yin pa de'i tshe phan tshun log na de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid las log pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gcig skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe thams cad skyed par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho na yin pa de'i tshe phan tshun log na de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid las log pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gcig skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: But when everything is the nature of the producer itself, then if they are mutually different, because they are different from the nature of the producer itself, how could they be the producer?

original: 'on te de dag gi @213b rang bzhin 'di 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'on te de dag gi @213b rang bzhin 'di 'dra ste /
translated: Or if their nature is like this:

original: tha dad kyang gang gcig skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad kyang gang gcig skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Although different, one is the producer.

original: rang bzhin la ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not right to investigate or analyze nature.

original: rkang pa brkyang ste 'dug na de kho na nyid dpyod pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i blo can tha snyad tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams dga' mgur 'dug la rag ste /
analyzed: rkang pa brkyang ste 'dug na de kho na nyid dpyod pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i blo can tha snyad tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams dga' mgur 'dug la rag ste /
translated: If one sits with one‚Äôs legs outstretched, one is turned away from the analysis of reality, and those who follow mere convention will be pleased.

original: gang dag de kho na nyid dpyod pa la zhugs pa'i blo gros can de dag ni de ltar 'dug par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag de kho na nyid dpyod pa la zhugs pa'i blo gros can de dag ni de ltar 'dug par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not right for those who are wise in the analysis of reality to sit like that.

original: de lta ma yin na dbang phyug la sogs pa yang gcig yin yang rang bzhin gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi rgyur rim dang cig car du mi 'gal ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dbang phyug la sogs pa yang gcig yin yang rang bzhin gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi rgyur rim dang cig car du mi 'gal ba kho na ste /
translated: Otherwise, even though God and so on are one, because he possesses a special nature, it would not be contradictory for him to be the cause of the variety of the world, either sequentially or simultaneously.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid de lta bur rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid de lta bur rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin no //
translated: His nature would be established by his own nature in that way.

original: rang bzhin la ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no zhes der smra ba rnams de skad du smra ba la lan ci zhig brjod par bya /
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no zhes der smra ba rnams de skad du smra ba la lan ci zhig brjod par bya /
translated: How could one respond to those who say that it is not right to investigate the nature of God?

original: gang yang de kho nas 'bras bu de bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod ces zer ba de la yang ji ltar me la rag las te skye pa'i du ba brgya byin gyi spyi bo las kyang 'byung na rgyu med pa nyid du
analyzed: gang yang de kho nas 'bras bu de bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod ces zer ba de la yang ji ltar me la rag las te skye pa'i du ba brgya byin gyi spyi bo las kyang 'byung na rgyu med pa nyid du
translated: why is the logic of the consequence of causelessness not stated here?

original: thal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang de nyid ci ste nye bar mi brjod de /
analyzed: thal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang de nyid ci ste nye bar mi brjod de /
translated: Also, there is no difference between the conventional and the ultimate in this regard.

original: tha snyad kyang tshogs pa gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa ni 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed par mi 'gal la /
analyzed: tha snyad kyang tshogs pa gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa ni 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed par mi 'gal la /
translated: There is no contradiction in saying that those that belong to the same collection produce the same effect.

original: tshogs pa gzhan du gtogs pa rnams ni 'gal lo zhes bya ba 'di dang khyad par ci yang med do //
analyzed: tshogs pa gzhan du gtogs pa rnams ni 'gal lo zhes bya ba 'di dang khyad par ci yang med do //
translated: But those that belong to different collections are contradictory.

original: 'di la yang 'di skad du me la sogs pa de kho nas 'bras bu de bya dgos kyi //
analyzed: 'di la yang 'di skad du me la sogs pa de kho nas 'bras bu de bya dgos kyi //
translated: In response to this, one might say, ‚ÄúThe effect must be produced by that very fire and so on.

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
translated: It cannot be produced by other things, such as the head of Indra.‚Äù What is the logic of saying this?

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa yang yin la rang gi ngo bos skyed par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ces rjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa yang yin la rang gi ngo bos skyed par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ces rjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: What contradiction is there in saying that the effect is different from the assemblage and is also produced by it essentially?

original: de la ji ltar tshogs pa gcig la rag las te skye ba'i 'bras bu tshogs pa gzhan las kyang skye ba yin na des bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du brjod pa de bzhin du tshogs pa gcig la yang
analyzed: de la ji ltar tshogs pa gcig la rag las te skye ba'i 'bras bu tshogs pa gzhan las kyang skye ba yin na des bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du brjod pa de bzhin du tshogs pa gcig la yang
translated: In that case, if the effect that arises in dependence on one assemblage arises from another assemblage, then it is not ascertained to be produced by that, and therefore it is said to be without cause.

original: de nyid kyi tshe rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rgyu gcig la rag las te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rgyu gcig la rag las te /
translated: In the same way, consciousness and so on, which arise in dependence on a single cause,

original: skye ba yang de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu gzhan las skye ba yin na ci ste rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar mi brjod de /
analyzed: skye ba yang de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu gzhan las skye ba yin na ci ste rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar mi brjod de /
translated: if they arise from another cause that is not similar to it, why is it not said that they are without cause?

original: 'on te yang rgyu rnams bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar sbyor bas byas pa'i rang @214a * //
analyzed: 'on te yang rgyu rnams bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar sbyor bas byas pa'i rang @214a * //
translated: If the cause is applied in the same way as it is, then the effect is produced by the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: bzhin gyi khyad par ma 'chol pa'i phyir rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa 'gal ba nyid de /üîΩ'di ltar mig la sogs pa rang bzhin tha dad pa dag las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba na dngos su tha dad pa ma yin yang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor nges pa dang /
analyzed: bzhin gyi khyad par ma 'chol pa'i phyir rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa 'gal ba nyid de / 'di ltar mig la sogs pa rang bzhin tha dad pa dag las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba na dngos su tha dad pa ma yin yang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor nges pa dang /
translated: Because the specific features of the face are not confused, it is contradictory that the different causes would produce different effects.

original: de'i rnam par gyur par skye ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par gyur par skye ste /
translated: Thus, when effects such as eye consciousness arise from eyes and so on that are different in nature, they are not directly different, but they arise as the nature of cognition, as the object of form and so on is ascertained individually, and as the transformation of that.

original: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, through the process of agreement and difference, the nature of cognition arises from the similar and immediately antecedent condition,üîΩbut not from the eyes and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: That is ascertained.

original: de bzhin du yul las ni de dang 'dra ba nyid do ;
analyzed: de bzhin du yul las ni de dang 'dra ba nyid do ;
translated: Similarly, from the object, it is just that.

original: / dbang po las ni yul 'dzin pa so sor nges pa'o //
analyzed: / dbang po las ni yul 'dzin pa so sor nges pa'o //
translated: From the sense faculty, the object is ascertained individually.

original: de ltar na dbang po dang yul dag las ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la dbang po dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dag las kyang yul gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin yul dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dag las kyang yul
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po dang yul dag las ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la dbang po dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dag las kyang yul gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin yul dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dag las kyang yul
translated: The object does not arise from the object and the immediately preceding condition that is similar to the object.üîΩThe object is not ascertained as the apprehender.

original: 'dzin pa so sor nges pa ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa nges pa rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa so sor nges pa ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa nges pa rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: This is the definitive presentation of the cause of the difference in the effect.

original: rgyu tha dad pa dag las khyad par tha dad pa dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa dag las khyad par tha dad pa dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the difference in the effect arises from the difference in the cause,

original: de tha snyad kyi sgo nas byis pa'i skye bo thams cad gzud ba'i phyir brjod na ni rigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de tha snyad kyi sgo nas byis pa'i skye bo thams cad gzud ba'i phyir brjod na ni rigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: that is reasonable only if you say that this is stated conventionally in order to guide all immature, ordinary beings.

original: don dam par ni ma yin /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin /
translated: It is not in terms of the ultimate.

original: 'di ltar khyad par gang yin pa de dag gal te brtags pa ma yin pa kho na'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par gang yin pa de dag gal te brtags pa ma yin pa kho na'am /
translated: In this way, if the differences are not just imputed,

original: ldog pa'i bye brag gis brtags pa'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: ldog pa'i bye brag gis brtags pa'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur grang /
translated: If it is the essence that is imputed by the specific reversal,

original: gal te phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa dag las ngo bo tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba kho nar du ma nyid du thal ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa dag las ngo bo tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba kho nar du ma nyid du thal ba yin la /
translated: then at that time, because it is not a different entity from the nature of the object of observation and so on, it follows that it is just as many as those.

original: dmigs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa nyid bzhin du gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzlog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa nyid bzhin du gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzlog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the nature of the object of observation and so on would not be averted from being just one, like consciousness itself.

original: rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba nyid du gzugs las mi skye ba nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba nyid du gzugs las mi skye ba nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not different from the nature of the realization of consciousness, it follows that it is not produced from form, just like consciousness.

original: de dang 'dra ba nyid las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang gzugs las skye bar smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba nyid las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang gzugs las skye bar smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not different from that which is similar, it would be said that it is produced from form.

original: de'i phyir gcig la dus gcig tu phan tshun 'gal ba skye ba dang mi skye ba dag ji ltar mi 'gal /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig la dus gcig tu phan tshun 'gal ba skye ba dang mi skye ba dag ji ltar mi 'gal /
translated: Therefore, how could it be non-contradictory for arising and non-arising, which are mutually exclusive, to occur simultaneously in one thing?

original: ji ste nyes pa 'dir gyur na mi rung zhes khyad par 'di dag rnam par shes pa las @214b don tha dad par gyur pa yin pa kho nar rtog na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste nyes pa 'dir gyur na mi rung zhes khyad par 'di dag rnam par shes pa las @214b don tha dad par gyur pa yin pa kho nar rtog na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if you think that it is not suitable for this fault to occur, and you conceive that these differences are definitely different from consciousness, then consciousness would be without a cause.

original: gzhan kho na la mig la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan kho na la mig la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye and so on would be applied to something else.

original: de'i phyir rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore it follows that consciousness would always exist and so on.

original: ji ste brtags pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste brtags pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that this is the position of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas,

original: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then consciousness would be without a cause.

original: brtags pa'i bdag nyid dag kho na la mig la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i bdag nyid dag kho na la mig la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye and so on would be applied to only the nature of the imputed.

original: brtags pa'i bdag nyid dag la yang 'ga' yang nye bar sbyor ba med pas thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i bdag nyid dag la yang 'ga' yang nye bar sbyor ba med pas thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And since there is no connection whatsoever between the imagined natures, it follows that everything would be causeless.

original: de lta bas na don dam par du ma las 'bras bu gcig skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na don dam par du ma las 'bras bu gcig skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, it is not reasonable for a single effect to arise from many causes.

original: gcig las du ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig las du ma yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that many effects arise from a single cause.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, as before, it follows that the difference of the cause does not make a difference,

original: 'di ltar gal te mig bdag nyid kyi khyad par gang kho nas rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma skyed pa de nyid kyis rang gi rnam par shes pa nye bar skye na ni de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa ma yin yang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ji
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te mig bdag nyid kyi khyad par gang kho nas rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma skyed pa de nyid kyis rang gi rnam par shes pa nye bar skye na ni de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa ma yin yang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ji
translated: because if the eye, by virtue of its own particular nature, generates only a moment of a homogeneous type, and by that very fact its own consciousness arises, then at that time, even though the cause is not different, the effect is different.

original: ltar 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag rgyu med par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ltar 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag rgyu med par mi 'gyur /
translated: How could the difference and non-difference of the effect not be causeless?

original: de la ni gang gis na 'bras bu gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba bdag nyid kyi khyad par gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni gang gis na 'bras bu gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba bdag nyid kyi khyad par gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But it does not have another specific nature by which it could generate another effect.

original: dngos po thams cad ni cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all things are partless.

original: de'i phyir rgyus rang gi ngo bo 'phos nas 'bras bu nye bar mi skye mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyus rang gi ngo bo 'phos nas 'bras bu nye bar mi skye mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, although the effect does not arise by the transformation of the nature of the cause,

original: 'on kyang rgyu'i bdag nyid de la khyad par med pa'i phyir des byas pa'i 'bras bu la khyad par med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu'i bdag nyid de la khyad par med pa'i phyir des byas pa'i 'bras bu la khyad par med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nevertheless, because there is no difference in the nature of the cause, there is no difference in the effect that is produced by it.

original: gcig las du ma skye ba dang / du ma las gcig skye zhes bya ba mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gcig las du ma skye ba dang / du ma las gcig skye zhes bya ba mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it seen that many effects arise from one cause and that one effect arises from many causes?

original: de'i phyir de ji ltar spang bar nus she na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ji ltar spang bar nus she na /
translated: How can that be refuted?

original: 'di ni rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rung ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not possible.

original: kho bo cag kyang 'di ma mthong ngo zhes ni mi sgrub po //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang 'di ma mthong ngo zhes ni mi sgrub po //
translated: We do not prove that we do not see it.

original: mthong ba tsam ni tshad ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba tsam ni tshad ma yang ma yin te /
translated: Mere seeing is not a valid means of cognition,

original: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa 'di thams cad kyang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa 'di thams cad kyang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all of this, which is false like a dream, is seen.

original: 'on kyang gang dag ji ltar mthong ba de kho na nyid du khas len pa de dag gi log par sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu nyid du sgrub pas 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang dag ji ltar mthong ba de kho na nyid du khas len pa de dag gi log par sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu nyid du sgrub pas 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: However, in order to dispel the false superimposition of those who accept that what is seen in dreams is real, we prove that all phenomena are like dreams.

original: gzhan yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang du ma las skye ba mthong bar 'gyur ba don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ni gcig tu cung zad kyang ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang du ma las skye ba mthong bar 'gyur ba don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ni gcig tu cung zad kyang ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, the essence of an ultimately existent thing is not established in the least as something that arises from any cause, such as the eye consciousness and so on.

original: @215a * // 'di ni dus thams cad du sna tshogs kyi rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @215a * // 'di ni dus thams cad du sna tshogs kyi rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it appears as a variety of aspects at all times.

original: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo yang gcig pa nyid yin na ni thams cad rdzas gcig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo yang gcig pa nyid yin na ni thams cad rdzas gcig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the essence of a variety were one, it would follow that everything would be one substance.

original: gcig ma grub pa de bstsags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir du ma grub pa kho na gcig dang du ma don dam pa'i dngos po skye ba gang du mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gcig ma grub pa de bstsags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir du ma grub pa kho na gcig dang du ma don dam pa'i dngos po skye ba gang du mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: Since the essence of a collection is not established when the one is not established, how could the arising of one or many ultimately existent things be seen?

original: du ma las du ma skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs gzhan yang yod par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma las du ma skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs gzhan yang yod par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to maintain that many effects arise from many causes.

original: 'di ltar ji ste 'bras bu re re la rgyu thams cad kyis byed na ni de'i tshe du ma las gcig skye ba'i phyogs nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ste 'bras bu re re la rgyu thams cad kyis byed na ni de'i tshe du ma las gcig skye ba'i phyogs nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If each effect is produced by all causes, then the position that many effects arise from one cause would be untenable.

original: de la yang nyes pa smras zin to //
analyzed: de la yang nyes pa smras zin to //
translated: The faults of this position have already been explained.

original: 'on te 'bras bu gcig kho na la re res nye bar sbyor na ni de'i tshe gcig las gcig skye ba'i phyogs nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu gcig kho na la re res nye bar sbyor na ni de'i tshe gcig las gcig skye ba'i phyogs nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If each cause individually produces the effect, then the position that one effect arises from many causes would be untenable.

original: de la yang sun dbyung ba smras zin te /
analyzed: de la yang sun dbyung ba smras zin te /
translated: The refutation of this position has already been explained.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: mtha' bzhi las ma gtogs pa gang las skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyogs gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi las ma gtogs pa gang las skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyogs gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, there is no other position from which arising occurs apart from the four extremes.

original: rtag pa'i dngos po yang thams cad sngar bsal zin pas de bas na ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po yang thams cad sngar bsal zin pas de bas na ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since all permanent things have already been refuted earlier, therefore the reason is not indeterminate.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Since the reason is present in similar instances, it is not contradictory.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor gnas pa la tha snyad du gcig las du ma skye ba dang du ma las gcig skye bar ji ltar grags pa bzhin mthong ba'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba'i bye brag rtogs nas byis pa'i skye bo gzud pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba'i tshe rgyu tha dad na tha dad
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor gnas pa la tha snyad du gcig las du ma skye ba dang du ma las gcig skye bar ji ltar grags pa bzhin mthong ba'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba'i bye brag rtogs nas byis pa'i skye bo gzud pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba'i tshe rgyu tha dad na tha dad
translated: And in order to introduce childish beings to the understanding that the eye and so on are the specific causes of the arising of eye consciousness and so on, in terms of their forward and reverse sequences, when he teaches the effect reason, he says that if the cause is different, the effect will be different.

original: par 'gyur bar smras kyi /üîΩdon dam par ni ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: par 'gyur bar smras kyi / don dam par ni ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: But this is said in terms of the conventional,

original: don dam par de ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar dpyad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam par de ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar dpyad pa bzhin no //
translated: not in terms of the ultimate, because in the ultimate, as was previously analyzed, they are not established.

original: de bas na gang ji skad du gang dag rgyu gcig las 'bras bu du ma skye bar rigs pa ma yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de dag thams cad kyi lan kyang so sor btab zin to //
analyzed: de bas na gang ji skad du gang dag rgyu gcig las 'bras bu du ma skye bar rigs pa ma yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de dag thams cad kyi lan kyang so sor btab zin to //
translated: Therefore, all the responses to the question, ‚ÄúHow is it tenable that many effects arise from a single cause?‚Äù and so on have already been given.

original: gang dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni ma nges pa la sogs par smra ba de dag gi lan kyang sngar smras zin to //
analyzed: gang dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni ma nges pa la sogs par smra ba de dag gi lan kyang sngar smras zin to //
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is the reason ‚Äòbecause they are dependently arisen‚Äô uncertain?‚Äù and so on has also already been given.

original: gang yang smra ba ji ste don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe kun rdzob tu yang mi 'gyur @215b te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de dag thams cad kyi lan kyang sngar smras zin to
analyzed: gang yang smra ba ji ste don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe kun rdzob tu yang mi 'gyur @215b te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de dag thams cad kyi lan kyang sngar smras zin to
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúIf ultimately things do not have intrinsic reality, then they would not exist even conventionally,‚Äù and so on has also already been given.

original: // gang yang smra ba gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa smras pa de dag thams cad kyi lan kyang sngon gyi slob dpon gyis blan zin to //
analyzed: // gang yang smra ba gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa smras pa de dag thams cad kyi lan kyang sngon gyi slob dpon gyis blan zin to //
translated: Moreover, all the responses to the arguments that the Proponents of True Features have stated, such as ‚ÄúThe reason is not established because it is free from being one or many,‚Äù have already been given by the masters of the past.

original: 'on kyang kha cig 'di la zhe sdang pa'i phyir brdzun pa nyid du skyon brjod pa de log par rtogs pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang kha cig 'di la zhe sdang pa'i phyir brdzun pa nyid du skyon brjod pa de log par rtogs pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: However, some people, out of hostility toward this system, have said that the refutations are themselves false. We say that they have a distorted understanding.

original: de la 'dir thal bar sgrub na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar ji ste pha rol po dag gis dngos po rnams gcig dang du ma dang bral bar khas ma blangs su zin kyang /
analyzed: de la 'dir thal bar sgrub na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te / 'di ltar ji ste pha rol po dag gis dngos po rnams gcig dang du ma dang bral bar khas ma blangs su zin kyang /
translated: Here, when we prove the consequence, the reason is not not established.üîΩEven if the opponents do not accept that things are free from being one or many,

original: 'on kyang des khyab pa'i chos khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis ni de yang khas blangs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang des khyab pa'i chos khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis ni de yang khas blangs pa kho na yin te /
translated: nevertheless, because they accept the phenomenon that pervades that, they implicitly accept that things are free from being one or many.

original: de la re zhig gang gis dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid du kun brtags pa de dag gis ni de dag 'bras bu rim gyis 'byung ba la nye bar sbyor ba nyid kyi chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis na
analyzed: de la re zhig gang gis dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid du kun brtags pa de dag gis ni de dag 'bras bu rim gyis 'byung ba la nye bar sbyor ba nyid kyi chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis na
translated: Therefore, they implicitly

original: gcig gi ngo bo nyid dang bral pa yang khas blangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo nyid dang bral pa yang khas blangs pa nyid de /
translated: accept that they are devoid of a singular nature.

original: ngo bo gcig la skyed par byed pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa nyid kyis dus snga ma bzhin du dus phyis kyang skyed par byed pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig la skyed par byed pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa nyid kyis dus snga ma bzhin du dus phyis kyang skyed par byed pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not tenable that a single nature that is not different from the state of being a producer would be a producer later, just as it was previously.

original: 'on te skyed par byed pa nyid yin na ni sngon gyi gnas skabs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te skyed par byed pa nyid yin na ni sngon gyi gnas skabs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid nyams pa yin no //
translated: But if it is a producer, then because it would have a nature that is not the same as its previous state, its singularity would be undermined.

original: 'di ni yang dag par na du ma nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par na du ma nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not tenable that it is truly manifold.

original: de kho na nyid du na dus mnyam pa dang cig shos dag tu rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba med par sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na dus mnyam pa dang cig shos dag tu rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba med par sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has been proven previously that in reality, neither the self nor another can be linked to a continuum, whether simultaneously or successively.

original: gang dag gis nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas gsum po ngo bo nyid gcig pa 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba med pa nyid du khas blangs de dag gis kyang de dag shes pa rim gyis 'byung ba'i shes bya'i ngo bo nyid du khas blangs
analyzed: gang dag gis nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas gsum po ngo bo nyid gcig pa 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba med pa nyid du khas blangs de dag gis kyang de dag shes pa rim gyis 'byung ba'i shes bya'i ngo bo nyid du khas blangs
translated: Those who accept that the three unconditioned phenomena, such as space, are of the same nature and are not related to effects, also accept that they are the nature of objects of knowledge that arise in a sequence of consciousnesses.

original: pa'i phyir shugs kyis na ngo bo gcig pa dang bral pa kas blangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: pa'i phyir shugs kyis na ngo bo gcig pa dang bral pa kas blangs pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, they implicitly accept that they are devoid of a single nature.

original: de dag shes pa re re zhing de'i shes pas shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid tha dad par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag shes pa re re zhing de'i shes pas shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid tha dad par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because each consciousness of them would have a different nature as the object of that consciousness.

original: mi 'gyur na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir sngon bzhin du phyis kyang de'i shes pas shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir sngon bzhin du phyis kyang de'i shes pas shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: If it were not so, then because there would be no difference, it would not be tenable that later, as before, they are the nature of objects of knowledge of that consciousness.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gcig gi ngo bo nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gcig gi ngo bo nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that they are the nature of one.

original: du ma'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no @216a * //
analyzed: du ma'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no @216a * //
translated: They are also not the nature of many.

original: zhes sngar bsgrubs zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes sngar bsgrubs zin pa nyid do //
translated: This has already been proven above.

original: kha cig gis dus dang skyes bu dang gtso bo dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'gro ba sna tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu rtag pa dang ngo bo gcig par kun brtags pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang de dag gis rim mam /
analyzed: kha cig gis dus dang skyes bu dang gtso bo dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'gro ba sna tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu rtag pa dang ngo bo gcig par kun brtags pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang de dag gis rim mam /
translated: Some imagine that time, puru·π£a, pradhƒÅna, BrahmƒÅ, and so on are permanent and the single nature that is the cause of the arrangement of the various worlds.

original: cig car dngos po'i tshogs bden pa dang brdzun pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nye bar 'dzin pa nyid kyi chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis na gcig pa nyid dang bral ba khas blangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: cig car dngos po'i tshogs bden pa dang brdzun pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nye bar 'dzin pa nyid kyi chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis na gcig pa nyid dang bral ba khas blangs pa nyid de /
translated: However, since they accept that they are the phenomena that directly apprehend the collection of things that are either true or false in a sequential or simultaneous manner, they implicitly accept that they are free from being a single nature.

original: ngo bo nyid gcig pa dag ni de ltar 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nye bar 'dzin pa nyid du rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig pa dag ni de ltar 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nye bar 'dzin pa nyid du rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that a single nature directly apprehends the nature of various worlds.

original: de dag gcig pa nyid du ma grub na du ma nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de dag gcig pa nyid du ma grub na du ma nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: If they are not established as the same, then it is not reasonable that they are many.

original: de ni de bsags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de bsags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the nature of their collection.

original: gang dag gis gang zag ces bya ba'i dngos po rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bo dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du kun brtags par gyur pa de dag gis kyang /
analyzed: gang dag gis gang zag ces bya ba'i dngos po rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bo dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du kun brtags par gyur pa de dag gis kyang /
translated: Those who imagine that the so-called person is not described as having the nature of being permanent or impermanent

original: 'di gcig dang du ma dang bral ba nyid du dngos su khas blangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di gcig dang du ma dang bral ba nyid du dngos su khas blangs pa nyid de /
translated: in fact accept that it is devoid of being one or many.

original: gcig gi ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa yang /
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa yang /
translated: It is not reasonable to describe that which has the nature of being one

original: rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: as not being described as permanent.

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan dang gzhan du nyams su myong ba yang skad cig ma nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan dang gzhan du nyams su myong ba yang skad cig ma nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to describe that which is experienced as having a different nature as not being described as momentary.

original: mi rtag pa'i ngo bo lus dang sa dang ri la sogs pa bdag gnyid so sor yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig pa nyid du kun brtags pa gang yin pa de yang yan lag gi rdzas su yul tha dad pa du ma la khyab par byed pa nyidüîΩla sogs pa'i chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i ngo bo lus dang sa dang ri la sogs pa bdag gnyid so sor yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig pa nyid du kun brtags pa gang yin pa de yang yan lag gi rdzas su yul tha dad pa du ma la khyab par byed pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: That is also accepted as a quality that pervades many different substances, the parts.

original: gcig pa nyid dang bral bar khas blangs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang bral bar khas blangs pa kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, it is accepted as being devoid of singularity.

original: de yan lag re re la ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med na ni de la khyab par byed pa nyid du yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yan lag re re la ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med na ni de la khyab par byed pa nyid du yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If it has no different nature in each of its parts, then it is not tenable that it pervades them.

original: cha shas med pa la bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i chos 'gal ba dang ldan par yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: cha shas med pa la bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i chos 'gal ba dang ldan par yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is also not tenable that a partless thing has contradictory qualities, such as being both obscured and unobscured.

original: gang dag gi lus la sogs pa rdul phran bsags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams so so re re gcig pa nyid du kun brtags pa de dag gis kyang sbyor ba dang bstsags pa la sogs pa'i chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis na
analyzed: gang dag gi lus la sogs pa rdul phran bsags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams so so re re gcig pa nyid du kun brtags pa de dag gis kyang sbyor ba dang bstsags pa la sogs pa'i chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis na
translated: by asserting that they are phenomena that join, accumulate, and so on,

original: gcig pa nyid dang bral pa nyid kyang khas blangs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang bral pa nyid kyang khas blangs pa kho na yin te /
translated: they are in fact asserting that they are devoid of singularity.

original: cha shas med pa'i ngo bo rnams la gang @216b gis na sbyor ba la sogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba phyogs gcig ni yod pa ma yin la phyogs gcig gis sbyor ba med pa rnams dang bstsags pa med pa rnams la /
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i ngo bo rnams la gang @216b gis na sbyor ba la sogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba phyogs gcig ni yod pa ma yin la phyogs gcig gis sbyor ba med pa rnams dang bstsags pa med pa rnams la /
translated: For those that are partless, there is no one side that exists and another side that does not exist, by which joining and so on would be experienced.

original: yul rgyas par khebs par gnas par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yul rgyas par khebs par gnas par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not tenable that they are extensive objects that pervade the field.

original: yan lag rnams ngo bo nyid gcig par rigs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag rnams ngo bo nyid gcig par rigs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable for the parts to have a single entity.

original: de dag ni yan lag 'dus pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni yan lag 'dus pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mere collections of parts.

original: rdul phra rab dang yan lag can gyi rdzas 'di gnyi ga yang du ma'i ngo bo nyid du yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab dang yan lag can gyi rdzas 'di gnyi ga yang du ma'i ngo bo nyid du yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Neither of these two substances, the subtle particle and the whole, is suitable as the nature of a multiplicity.

original: de ni gcig 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma grub na /
analyzed: de ni gcig 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma grub na /
translated: Because that is the nature of the collection of the one, if the one is not established,

original: de yang de la ltos te rnam par gzhag pa yin pas mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de la ltos te rnam par gzhag pa yin pas mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is also not established, because it is posited in dependence on that.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rdzas gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral bar grub na de la brten nas nye bar brtags pa yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba rnams rab tu mi 'grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rdzas gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral bar grub na de la brten nas nye bar brtags pa yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba rnams rab tu mi 'grub pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, if the substantial cause and effect are established as devoid of the nature of one or many, then the qualities, actions, universals, particulars, and inherence that are imputed in dependence on them are not established at all.

original: de dag ni de'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are dependent on that.

original: de ltar na re zhig shugs kyis shes bya thams cad gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa kho nar khas blangs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig shugs kyis shes bya thams cad gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa kho nar khas blangs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that one accepts that all objects of knowledge are empty of the nature of one and many.

original: shes pa yang ngo bo nyid gcig par nye bar brtags mod kyi /
analyzed: shes pa yang ngo bo nyid gcig par nye bar brtags mod kyi /
translated: Although consciousness is imagined to be a single entity,

original: 'on kyang de yul ngo bor sna tshogs 'dzin pa nyid kyi chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis na ngo bo nyid gcig pa dang bral ba khas blangs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de yul ngo bor sna tshogs 'dzin pa nyid kyi chos su khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis na ngo bo nyid gcig pa dang bral ba khas blangs pa kho na ste /
translated: nevertheless, since it is accepted that it apprehends the variety of objects, it is implicitly accepted that it is devoid of a single entity.

original: 'di ltar shes pa ni gdon mi za bar rnam pa dang bcas par khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa ni gdon mi za bar rnam pa dang bcas par khas blangs dgos so //
translated: Thus, consciousness must be accepted as having aspects.

original: de lta ma yin na yul gyi rnam pas ma bsgyur ba'i lus 'di yul 'dzin par rnam par gzhag par mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yul gyi rnam pas ma bsgyur ba'i lus 'di yul 'dzin par rnam par gzhag par mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be tenable to posit that this body, not transformed by the aspects of objects, apprehends objects.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du khas len na ni 'di ngo bo nyid gcig pa dang bral ba bsal ba kho nar khas blangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du khas len na ni 'di ngo bo nyid gcig pa dang bral ba bsal ba kho nar khas blangs pa nyid de /
translated: If it is accepted that it has aspects, then it is definitely accepted that it is devoid of a single entity,

original: shes pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entity of consciousness is a variety.

original: sna tshogs dang gcig pa nyid dag kyang 'gal ba'i phyir shes pa thams cad dngos po sna tshogs kyi yul can du khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs dang gcig pa nyid dag kyang 'gal ba'i phyir shes pa thams cad dngos po sna tshogs kyi yul can du khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Because diversity and oneness are contradictory, you accept that all consciousnesses have a diverse entity as their object.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dag ni rang gi sde pa rnams bstsags pa la dmigs pa kho nar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dag ni rang gi sde pa rnams bstsags pa la dmigs pa kho nar 'dod do //
translated: Thus, the five collections of consciousness are asserted to have only a collection as their object.

original: rnam par shes pa drug pa yang sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug pa yang sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs la /
translated: The sixth consciousness also has mind and mental factors as its object.

original: ri mo brkyang pa la sogs pa la lta ba na /
analyzed: ri mo brkyang pa la sogs pa la lta ba na /
translated: When one sees an extended painting, etc.,

original: rnam par shes pa @217a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa @217a * //
translated: one experiences a consciousness

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa can nyams su myong ba'i phyir shes pa thams cad rnam pa sna tshogs can du rab tu grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa can nyams su myong ba'i phyir shes pa thams cad rnam pa sna tshogs can du rab tu grub pa kho na'o //
translated: with a diverse aspect. Therefore, it is well established that all consciousnesses have a diverse aspect.

original: de la rnam pa sna tshogs nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir shes pa du ma skye bar rtog pa yang legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa sna tshogs nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir shes pa du ma skye bar rtog pa yang legs pa ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, it is not good to imagine that many consciousnesses are produced in order to establish a diverse aspect,

original: de dag ni lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi yul la bkram pa ltar gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi yul la bkram pa ltar gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those consciousnesses, being nonphysical, do not exist in a dispersed mode.

original: de ltar mi gnas na yang rnam pa sna tshogs nyid 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mi gnas na yang rnam pa sna tshogs nyid 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If it does not abide in that way, then it is not tenable that it has various aspects.

original: yon tan dang las la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas la sogs pa yang shes pas cig car 'dzin par khas blangs pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis kyang shes pa yul sna tshogs can du khas blangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan dang las la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas la sogs pa yang shes pas cig car 'dzin par khas blangs pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis kyang shes pa yul sna tshogs can du khas blangs pa nyid do //
translated: Also, because it is accepted that substances and so on that possess qualities, actions, and so on are apprehended simultaneously by consciousness, others also accept that consciousness has various objects.

original: gang dag rdzas kyi rnam grangs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis dngos po thams cad nor bu gzi lta bur rtogs par byed pa de dag gis kyang de'i yul can gyi sems kyi yul nyid dngos po'i ngo bo du mar 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang dag rdzas kyi rnam grangs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis dngos po thams cad nor bu gzi lta bur rtogs par byed pa de dag gis kyang de'i yul can gyi sems kyi yul nyid dngos po'i ngo bo du mar 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: Those who understand all things to be like a jewel possessing various qualities, such as being a substance, and so on, also accept that the object of the mind that has that as its object is the nature of many things.

original: gang dag yul 'byung ba bzhi gnas pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin par nye bar rtog par byed pa de dag gis kyang shes pa dngos po du ma'i yul can nyid du khas blangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag yul 'byung ba bzhi gnas pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin par nye bar rtog par byed pa de dag gis kyang shes pa dngos po du ma'i yul can nyid du khas blangs pa nyid do //
translated: Those who understand the object to be the nature of the four elements also accept that consciousness has many things as its object.

original: gang dag gi yul snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i ngo bo kho na yin par khas blangs pa de dag gis kyang shes pa'i yul nyid dngos po du ma'i ngo bo yin par khas blangs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang dag gi yul snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i ngo bo kho na yin par khas blangs pa de dag gis kyang shes pa'i yul nyid dngos po du ma'i ngo bo yin par khas blangs pa kho na ste /
translated: Those who accept that the objects of the three mental activities are the natures of sattva, rajas, and tamas, respectively, must also accept that the object of consciousness is the nature of many things.

original: yul nyid dngos po gsum gyi bdag nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nyid dngos po gsum gyi bdag nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they accept that the object itself is the nature of the three things.

original: gang dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i yul can ni dmigs pa med pa kho nar smra ba de dag gi lugs kyis kyang ming gi rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam pa gcig pa de rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i yul can ni dmigs pa med pa kho nar smra ba de dag gi lugs kyis kyang ming gi rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam pa gcig pa de rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: In the system of those who say that the object of the mental consciousness is only nonexistent, it is not tenable that the mental consciousness has a single aspect because it possesses the aspect of a name.

original: yi ge'i ngo bo du mar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge'i ngo bo du mar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of a letter appears as many.
