original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa yang sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba nyid du myong ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid gcig par rigs pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa yang sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba nyid du myong ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid gcig par rigs pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Also, it is not tenable that the consciousnesses of dreams, etc., have a single nature because they are experienced as the appearance of various aspects such as blue.

original: 'gro ba rnam par shes pa tsam gyis ngo bor smra ba gang dag gis rnam par shes pa thams cad phyi rol yang dag pa'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i phyir mthar thug pa'i de kho nar khas blangs pa de dag gis kyang thog ma
analyzed: 'gro ba rnam par shes pa tsam gyis ngo bor smra ba gang dag gis rnam par shes pa thams cad phyi rol yang dag pa'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i phyir mthar thug pa'i de kho nar khas blangs pa de dag gis kyang thog ma
translated: Those who assert that the nature of migrating beings is consciousness only, because all consciousnesses are not the correct subjects of external objects, and because of reflexive awareness, accept that in the final analysis, consciousness is not of a single nature.

original: med pa nas rnam par 'khrul pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa thams cad @217b gzugs la sogs pa log pa sna tshogs su snang bar skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa ngo bo gcig pa ma yin par khasüîΩblangs pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa nas rnam par 'khrul pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa thams cad @217b gzugs la sogs pa log pa sna tshogs su snang bar skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa ngo bo gcig pa ma yin par khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Because they accept that all consciousnesses arise as various false appearances such as forms due to the ripening of the habitual propensities of error from beginningless time, they accept that consciousness is not of a single nature.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang lta ba gang la yang ngo bo nyid gcig par ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang lta ba gang la yang ngo bo nyid gcig par ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is not established as a single entity in any view.

original: de ma grub na ngo bo nyid du yang ma grub bo zhes sngar bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ma grub na ngo bo nyid du yang ma grub bo zhes sngar bshad pa nyid do //
translated: If it is not established, it is not established as an entity, as was explained earlier.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi rgyud kyis bsgrub pa la yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi rgyud kyis bsgrub pa la yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even in the proof of one‚Äôs own continuum, the reason is not unestablished.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la yang chos thams cad gcig dang du ma dang bral ba tsam du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la yang chos thams cad gcig dang du ma dang bral ba tsam du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in the manner explained, both the proponent and the opponent establish that all phenomena are merely devoid of being one or many.

original: rnam par bcad pa tsam zhig yin pa la ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos can dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa rigs pa nyid do zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa tsam zhig yin pa la ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos can dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa rigs pa nyid do zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: And it has been previously explained that, in mere exclusion, the probandum, the logical reason, and the subject that is concordant with the logical reason are not actual entities.

original: des na rang dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs la gnas pa rnams kyis nye bar brtags pa'i chos can la yang bsgrub pa'i chos rnam par bcad pa tsam gyis ji skad bshad pa gnyi ga la grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rang dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs la gnas pa rnams kyis nye bar brtags pa'i chos can la yang bsgrub pa'i chos rnam par bcad pa tsam gyis ji skad bshad pa gnyi ga la grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, in the subject that is imagined by those who abide in our own and other systems, the probandum is merely an exclusion, and it is established for both the proponent and the opponent, as explained.

original: gang yang gtan tshigs 'di ji ltar grub /
analyzed: gang yang gtan tshigs 'di ji ltar grub /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúHow is this reason established?‚Äù

original: gal te mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas yin na ni de yang mi dmigs pa gzhan las grub na thug pa med par thal ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas yin na ni de yang mi dmigs pa gzhan las grub na thug pa med par thal ba yin no //
translated: If it is by way of non-observation, and that is established from another non-observation, then there is the fallacy of an infinite regress.

original: mngon sum gyi sgo nas dmigs pa med pa grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi sgo nas dmigs pa med pa grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that non-observation is established by way of direct perception,

original: de ni de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de yang bstsal ba nyid de /
analyzed: de ni de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de yang bstsal ba nyid de /
translated: because that is not its object. That has already been refuted,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis gtan tshigs rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar re zhig bdag la sogs pa dbang pos mi sod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni des khyab pa 'bras bu rim can la sbyor ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos khas blangs pa'i phyir gcig dang du ma dang bral ba nyid kyang rab tu bsgrubs
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis gtan tshigs rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar re zhig bdag la sogs pa dbang pos mi sod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni des khyab pa 'bras bu rim can la sbyor ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos khas blangs pa'i phyir gcig dang du ma dang bral ba nyid kyang rab tu bsgrubs
translated: because the proof of the reason is as explained.

original: pa kho na'o //
analyzed: pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, first, those things such as the self that are not apprehended by the sense faculties are established as devoid of being one or many, because it is accepted that they are pervaded by the property of being applied to a sequential effect, and so on.

original: ji ste chos can de nyid ma grub na /
analyzed: ji ste chos can de nyid ma grub na /
translated: If the very subject is not established,

original: gang la de dang bral ba 'di sgrub snyam du sems na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la de dang bral ba 'di sgrub snyam du sems na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then if you think, ‚ÄúWhat is devoid of that is to be established,‚Äù that is illogical.

original: dngos po de lta bu'i dgag pa la thams cad du chos can brtags pa kho na yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po de lta bu'i dgag pa la thams cad du chos can brtags pa kho na yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because in all cases, the negation of such an entity is only the imputing of a subject,

original: de kho na'i chos mi dmigs pa yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de kho na'i chos mi dmigs pa yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: and it has already been demonstrated that the non-apprehension of a property of thatness is the negation of thatness.

original: de lta ma yin na khyed la yang de dgag pa de la gtan tshigs don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ji ltar grub ces bya ba'i klan kar ji ste mi 'gyur /üîΩpha rol po dag @218a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khyed la yang de dgag pa de la gtan tshigs don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ji ltar grub ces bya ba'i klan kar ji ste mi 'gyur / pha rol po dag @218a * //
translated: Otherwise, how could you avoid the criticism that the reason, the property of the subject, is not established in the negation of that, since it is devoid of the capacity to perform a function?üîΩBecause the opponent himself has accepted that effect in a series in that imagined subject, the property that pervades it is established.

original: gis kun brtags pa'i chos can de la 'bras bu rim can de lta bu khas blangs ba kho na'i phyir de la khyab par byed pa'i chos grub pa de'i lugs la brten pa nyid kyis na chos can de kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gis kun brtags pa'i chos can de la 'bras bu rim can de lta bu khas blangs ba kho na'i phyir de la khyab par byed pa'i chos grub pa de'i lugs la brten pa nyid kyis na chos can de kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in his system, the subject is imagined, and therefore, the reason is not established.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas rtogs kyang thug pa med par thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas rtogs kyang thug pa med par thal ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is understood by means of inference, it does not follow that there is an infinite regress,

original: de dag ni bdag nyid kyis tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid kyis tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those are valid cognitions by themselves.

original: tha snyad kyi sgo nas bsgrub par bya bas sgrub pa la khyab pa yang grub pa nyid do zhes sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi sgo nas bsgrub par bya bas sgrub pa la khyab pa yang grub pa nyid do zhes sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has already been explained that the pervasion of the probandum by the proof is established by way of convention.

original: chos can gzugs la sogs pa lkog tu ma gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ngo bo nyid gcig pa dang bral ba mngon sum kho nar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: chos can gzugs la sogs pa lkog tu ma gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ngo bo nyid gcig pa dang bral ba mngon sum kho nar gyur pa yin te /
translated: Those subjects, such as form, that are not hidden are directly perceived to be devoid of a single nature.

original: 'di dag rtag tu rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba nyid kyis bye brag med par ngo bo nyid gcig par so sor myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag rtag tu rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba nyid kyis bye brag med par ngo bo nyid gcig par so sor myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are always perceived as various aspects, and thus they are not experienced as a single, undifferentiated nature.

original: ngo bo nyid gcig dang bral ba grub na ngo bo nyid du ma dang bral ba yang mngon sum kho nar grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig dang bral ba grub na ngo bo nyid du ma dang bral ba yang mngon sum kho nar grub pa yin te /
translated: If they are established as devoid of a single nature, they are also directly established as devoid of many natures.

original: du ma nyid ni gcig tshogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma nyid ni gcig tshogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because multiplicity is the nature of a collection of singularities.

original: tha snyad kyi sgo nas mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi sgo nas mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that there are no valid cognitions such as direct perception in terms of convention.

original: 'on te yang don dam par med pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu yang med la /
analyzed: 'on te yang don dam par med pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu yang med la /
translated: But if you think that whatever does not exist ultimately does not exist even conventionally,

original: cung zad kyang myong ba yang med de /
analyzed: cung zad kyang myong ba yang med de /
translated: and that nothing at all is experienced,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
translated: like the horn of an ass,

original: mngon sum yang de dang 'dra'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: mngon sum yang de dang 'dra'o snyam du sems na /
translated: then direct perception is like that.

original: de yang 'di ltar 'brel ba med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid do zhes pas sngar lan btab zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar 'brel ba med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid do zhes pas sngar lan btab zin pa kho na'o //
translated: We have already answered this, saying that this reason is indeterminate, because it is not related to the predicate.

original: ji ste sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni de nyid du rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ji ste sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni de nyid du rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you think that the nature of the superimposed object is understood as it is,

original: yang dag par na de med par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par na de med par ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not that it does not exist in reality,

original: smig rgyu la chur shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the cognition of water in a mirage,

original: mngon sum thams cad kyang sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo kho na yin pas ji ltar des gcig dang du mas dben pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: mngon sum thams cad kyang sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo kho na yin pas ji ltar des gcig dang du mas dben pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: and that all direct perception is the nature of the superimposed object, then how could it understand the absence of singularity and plurality?

original: de ni 'dir sgyu ma mkhan gyi mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dir sgyu ma mkhan gyi mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is not ascertained by the direct perception or inferential cognition of the magician.

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyi shes pa glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par sgro btags pa can yang yang dag par na de'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med do //üîΩder mngon par zhen pa med pas yang dag par na des dben pa nyid rtogs pa nges par @218b skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis de'i yul can du rnam par gzhag go //üîΩde dang 'dra bar rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi mngon sum 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yang dag par bstsal ba sgro btags pa'i rnam pa can gzhan yang skye ba na yang dag par de'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med par nges pa'i rgyu nyid
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyi shes pa glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par sgro btags pa can yang yang dag par na de'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med do // der mngon par zhen pa med pas yang dag par na des dben pa nyid rtogs pa nges par @218b skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis de'i yul can du rnam par gzhag go // de dang 'dra bar rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi mngon sum 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yang dag par bstsal ba sgro btags pa'i rnam pa can gzhan yang skye ba na yang dag par de'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med par nges pa'i rgyu nyid
translated: Thus, the cognition of the magician, which is the superimposition of the form of an elephant, etc., does not really conceive of it as having that nature.üîΩSince it does not conceive of it as such, it is definitely generated as the realization of its emptiness of that, and it is posited as having that as its object due to the cause of generating that.

original: kyis des dben pa'i yul can du rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: kyis des dben pa'i yul can du rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //
translated: In the same way, when the direct perception of those who have conceptions is generated, having eliminated the cause of error, it is also posited as having an object that is empty of that, due to the cause of definitely not conceiving of it as having that nature.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa dngos po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par sgro btags pa can yang dngos po'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa dngos po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par sgro btags pa can yang dngos po'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i yul can yin no //
translated: Likewise, the inferential cognition, which is a superimposition in the aspect of the universal characteristic of things, is also the nature of the realization of the suchness of things as they are, and therefore it has that as its object.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma yin pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma yin pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is a valid cognition, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: gang yang de ni de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang de ni de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Also, what was said, ‚ÄúBecause it does not have that as its object,‚Äù is not correct.

original: dngos po rnams rta'i rva lta bur khas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rta'i rva lta bur khas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Things are not accepted to be like the horns of a rabbit.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid lta bur yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid lta bur yin te /
translated: They are like the nature of an illusion.

original: de dag kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum kho na'o //
translated: Those are also only direct perception, like an illusion.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar gzung mod kyi /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar gzung mod kyi /
translated: Although they are apprehended as free from the nature of one and many,

original: skye bo dam pa ma yin pa'i bstan bcos mnyan pa la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi sgro 'dogs pa nye bar skyed pa kha cig gis gtan la mi phebs kyi /
analyzed: skye bo dam pa ma yin pa'i bstan bcos mnyan pa la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi sgro 'dogs pa nye bar skyed pa kha cig gis gtan la mi phebs kyi /
translated: Some people do not understand the non-perception of the one and the many, because they have the false notion of listening to the treatises of non-noble persons and so on.

original: gzhan dag gis ni gtan la phebs na ji ltar mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas gcig dang du ma dang bral ba yang dag par grub /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni gtan la phebs na ji ltar mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas gcig dang du ma dang bral ba yang dag par grub /
translated: But if others do understand it, how is the non-perception of the one and the many established?

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sna tshogs kyi rnam pa la sogs pa'i rtags kyi sgo nas thams cad du gcig pa nyid dang bral ba grub na du ma nyid dang bral ba yang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sna tshogs kyi rnam pa la sogs pa'i rtags kyi sgo nas thams cad du gcig pa nyid dang bral ba grub na du ma nyid dang bral ba yang grub pa yin te /
translated: In one way, if the non-existence of oneness is established everywhere by the reason of the various aspects and so on, the non-existence of plurality is also established.

original: de ni de'i tshogs 'di bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshogs 'di bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the nature of the collection of those.

original: gcig dang du ma nyid dag gis ni rnam pa thams cad la khyab ste /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma nyid dag gis ni rnam pa thams cad la khyab ste /
translated: One and many pervade all aspects,

original: de dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are characterized by mutually exclusive presence.

original: 'di ltar skye bo tha snyad du bum pa la sogs pa yul la sogs pa yongs su chad pa dang 'brel pa zla med par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye bo tha snyad du bum pa la sogs pa yul la sogs pa yongs su chad pa dang 'brel pa zla med par gyur pa /
translated: Thus, when a person completely determines a conventional object such as a pot, etc., which is related to the absence of a counterpart,

original: gcig tu tha snyad gdags su rung ba yongs su gcod pa na de las bzlog pa zla dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod la /üîΩde bzhin du rdzas kyi rigs du ma'i tshogs dngos po du mar tha snyad gdags su rung ba yongs su gcod pa na yang de las bzlog pa zla med pa'i rnam par bcad nas @219a * //
analyzed: gcig tu tha snyad gdags su rung ba yongs su gcod pa na de las bzlog pa zla dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod la / de bzhin du rdzas kyi rigs du ma'i tshogs dngos po du mar tha snyad gdags su rung ba yongs su gcod pa na yang de las bzlog pa zla med pa'i rnam par bcad nas @219a * //
translated: and is suitable to be designated as one, then it is completely determined by excluding the opposite, which is the nature of having a counterpart, etc.

original: yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: yongs su gcod do //
translated: In the same way, when a collection of many types of substances is completely determined as suitable to be designated as many things, then it is completely determined by excluding the opposite, which is the absence of a counterpart.

original: gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par bcad pa med na med pa de gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par bcad pa med na med pa de gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Those two, which cannot exist without the exclusion of the other, have the characteristic of mutually excluding each other.

original: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dag ni rnam pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dag ni rnam pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa dag yin no //
translated: Those that have the characteristic of mutually excluding each other are all-pervading.

original: gang dag rnam pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa de dag ni phung po gzhan sel bar byed pa dag yin te /
analyzed: gang dag rnam pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa de dag ni phung po gzhan sel bar byed pa dag yin te /
translated: Those that pervade all aspects exclude other categories.

original: dper na lus can dang lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lus can dang lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the categories of corporeal and incorporeal.

original: gcig pa nyid dang du ma dag nyid kyang de dang 'dra la khyab par byed pa log pas kyang khyab par bya ba ldog par nges pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang du ma dag nyid kyang de dang 'dra la khyab par byed pa log pas kyang khyab par bya ba ldog par nges pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma yin te /
translated: The same is true of singularity and multiplicity. And because the pervaded is certainly excluded when the pervader is excluded, therefore there is no doubt that the reason is excluded from the discordant side,

original: phung po gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because another category is impossible.

original: des na gang la la dag na re khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po rang la ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gang la la dag na re khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po rang la ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, some say that the reason is unestablished because the relation of pervaded and pervader is not established for it.

original: de bzhin du chos can gang kho na la khyab par bya ba'i dngos po grub pa de kho na la khyab par byed pa log pas khyab par bya ba la ldog par ma grub bo zhes zer ba de dag thams cad la lan btab pa kho na yin
analyzed: de bzhin du chos can gang kho na la khyab par bya ba'i dngos po grub pa de kho na la khyab par byed pa log pas khyab par bya ba la ldog par ma grub bo zhes zer ba de dag thams cad la lan btab pa kho na yin
translated: So too, all those who say that the pervaded is not established as absent in the pervader in only that phenomenon in which the pervaded is established have been answered.

original: no // 'di ltar khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po la sogs pa thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas phyir gzhag go zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: no // 'di ltar khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po la sogs pa thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas phyir gzhag go zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Thus we have already explained that all things, such as the pervaded and the pervader, are posited in dependence on conventional truth.

original: khyab par byed pa nye na gdon mi za bar khyab par bya ba bye brag rtogs pa yang ma yin no zhes de yang sngar bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa nye na gdon mi za bar khyab par bya ba bye brag rtogs pa yang ma yin no zhes de yang sngar bstan pa nyid do //
translated: And we have already explained that when the pervader is near, it is not necessarily the case that the pervaded is known.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad kyi sgo nas gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dag gis ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa tsam la khyab mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad kyi sgo nas gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dag gis ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa tsam la khyab mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, although pervasion is possible in terms of conventions, mere existence of intrinsic reality in terms of the one and the many,

original: 'on kyang de las don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid du nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de las don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid du nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not ascertained as having ultimate intrinsic reality.

original: bum pa la sogs pa gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin can kun rdzob pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin can kun rdzob pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such things as pots, which are the relative, appear to have the nature of being one and many.

original: khyad par du na khyab par byed pa dang khyab par bya ba'i dngos po 'grub pa ni tha snyad pa'i chos can la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: khyad par du na khyab par byed pa dang khyab par bya ba'i dngos po 'grub pa ni tha snyad pa'i chos can la brten pa yin la /
translated: In particular, the establishment of the relationship of the pervader and the pervaded is based on the conventional subject,

original: khyab par byed pa ldog pa ni don dam pa la brten par rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i chos can thams cad la spyir sgrub pa'i phyir 'di gnyis chos can gcig la brten pa nyid lta ga la yin /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ldog pa ni don dam pa la brten par rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i chos can thams cad la spyir sgrub pa'i phyir 'di gnyis chos can gcig la brten pa nyid lta ga la yin /
translated: and the refutation of the pervader is based on the ultimate. Since the subject that is the basis of debate is established in general, how could these two be based on the same subject?

original: chos can gcig la brten pa nyid yin du chug na yang /
analyzed: chos can gcig la brten pa nyid yin du chug na yang /
translated: Even if it were the case that they were based on the same subject,

original: 'on kyang ltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir nyes pa med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir nyes pa med pa kho na ste /
translated: there would be no fault, because they are different in that they are based on the two truths.

original: 'di ltar khyab par byed pa dang @219b khyab par bya ba'i dngos po grub pa ni tha snyad kyi bden pa la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyab par byed pa dang @219b khyab par bya ba'i dngos po grub pa ni tha snyad kyi bden pa la brten pa yin la /
translated: The establishment of the relationship of the pervader and the pervaded is based on conventional reality,

original: khyab par byed pa ldog pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa nyid yin pas 'gal re skan /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ldog pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa nyid yin pas 'gal re skan /
translated: The reversal of the pervader is based on ultimate truth.

original: gang yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag ci med par dgag pa'i ngo bo zhig yin nam /
analyzed: gang yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag ci med par dgag pa'i ngo bo zhig yin nam /
translated: Moreover, are the probandum and the proof the nature of a non-affirming negation?

original: 'on te ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin ;
analyzed: 'on te ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin ;
translated: Or are they the nature of an affirming negation?

original: phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni de gnyis go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni de gnyis go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is the first case, then it is not tenable that those two are the object and means of understanding,

original: ngo bo med pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'thad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'thad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are without nature, because they are unrelated, and because they are untenable.

original: nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni cung zad go bar yang mi byed la /
analyzed: nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni cung zad go bar yang mi byed la /
translated: That which has the characteristic of being devoid of all expression is not understood in the least,

original: go bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: go bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: and it does not become understood.

original: dper na rta'i rva lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rta'i rva lta bu'o //
translated: It is like, for example, the horn of a donkey.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag kyang nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag kyang nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The probandum and the proof, as they have been explained, are also devoid of all expression.

original: gang dag phan tshun 'brel ba med pa de dag kyang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag phan tshun 'brel ba med pa de dag kyang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Those that are not mutually related are not the nature of the object understood and the means of understanding.

original: dper na ri gangs can dang 'bigs byed dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri gangs can dang 'bigs byed dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the Himalayas and Vindhya mountains.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag kyang phan tshun 'brel pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag kyang phan tshun 'brel pa med pa yin no //
translated: The object to be established and the means of establishment are also not mutually related.

original: gang dang gang zhig tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo dag la yang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po med de /
analyzed: gang dang gang zhig tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo dag la yang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po med de /
translated: Those that are not of the nature of being different also do not have the nature of the object understood and the means of understanding.

original: dper na shing dang shing ljon pa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing dang shing ljon pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like a tree and a forest.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag kyang tha dad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag kyang tha dad pa med pa yin no //
translated: The object to be established and the means of establishment are also not different.

original: 'on te ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni /
translated: But if the position is that they are not of the same nature,

original: de'i tshe gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba dngos po'i ngo bo don byed par rung bar khas blangs par 'gyur bas mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba dngos po'i ngo bo don byed par rung bar khas blangs par 'gyur bas mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: At that time, since one would have accepted the nature of entities, free from the nature of one and many, as able to perform a function, it is not the case that one would not accept it.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di ni gzhan gyis kun brtags pa dbang phyug la sogs pa dgag pa la yang thams cad du mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di ni gzhan gyis kun brtags pa dbang phyug la sogs pa dgag pa la yang thams cad du mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: That also is not correct. This conception is exactly the same in all cases, even in the refutation of other imagined things, such as a divine creator.

original: 'di ltar dbang phyug la sogs pa de ni gdon mi za bar khyab bar byed pa'i chos bkag pa kho nas dgag par bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang phyug la sogs pa de ni gdon mi za bar khyab bar byed pa'i chos bkag pa kho nas dgag par bya dgos te /
translated: Thus, it is necessary to refute a divine creator, etc., by refuting only the phenomenon that pervades them,

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa de mngon sum du dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa de mngon sum du dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to directly refute that which is extremely obscure.üîΩTherefore, why would not all the same objections arise there?

original: de'i phyir klan ka thams cad der yang ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir klan ka thams cad der yang ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Also,

original: gang yang / de ni gcig na yul min la //
analyzed: gang yang / de ni gcig na yul min la //
translated: If it is one, it is not an object.

original: tha dad rdul du du ma'ang min //
analyzed: tha dad rdul du du ma'ang min //
translated: If different, it is not many.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: dngos rnams gang du rnam dpyad na //
analyzed: dngos rnams gang du rnam dpyad na //
translated: When things are analyzed,

original: de yi ngo bor yang @220a * //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor yang @220a * //
translated: Their entity is not pure.

original: dag med / gang gi phyir na de dag la //
analyzed: dag med / gang gi phyir na de dag la //
translated: Because they are devoid

original: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo med //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo med //
translated: Of the entity of one and many.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas phyi'i don la sogs pa kun brtags pa 'gog pa de la yang klan ka 'di ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas phyi'i don la sogs pa kun brtags pa 'gog pa de la yang klan ka 'di ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Why does this objection not arise in regard to the refutation of the imagined, such as external objects and so on?

original: gal te yang ngo bo nyid med pa la go bar byed pa nyid med na de'i tshe rta'i rva go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyang ci ste nye bar dgod /
analyzed: gal te yang ngo bo nyid med pa la go bar byed pa nyid med na de'i tshe rta'i rva go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyang ci ste nye bar dgod /
translated: If, on the other hand, you say that if there is no intrinsic reality, there is nothing to be understood, then why do you posit the nonexistence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns as something to be understood?

original: khyod kyi nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni cung zad kyang go bar mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de nyid la yang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa dgag pa'i ngo bo dag ji ltar go bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: khyod kyi nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni cung zad kyang go bar mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de nyid la yang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa dgag pa'i ngo bo dag ji ltar go bar bya ba dang /
translated: In your own syllogism, ‚ÄúWhatever is devoid of all expression has no capacity to be understood,‚Äù how is it that the object of refutation, the probandum and the means of refutation, the probans, are things that are understood?

original: go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin /
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin /
translated: How are they things that are to be understood?

original: de lta bas na sbyor ba 'di mtshon cha'i thabs bslab pa nyes par byed pa bzhin du rang la gnod par byed pa nye bar bkod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pas sbyor ba la te por mkhas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sbyor ba 'di mtshon cha'i thabs bslab pa nyes par byed pa bzhin du rang la gnod par byed pa nye bar bkod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pas sbyor ba la te por mkhas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, this argument is like a weapon that injures only the one who uses it. Since it is only set forth to injure the opponent, it is not even clever.

original: thams cad kyi dngos po thams cad rtag tu gtan la 'bebs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtags dngos por gyur pa kho na go bar byed pa nyid du ni su yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dngos po thams cad rtag tu gtan la 'bebs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtags dngos por gyur pa kho na go bar byed pa nyid du ni su yang mi 'dod de /
translated: No one maintains that only a real reason is a means of knowledge, because it would follow, absurdly, that all things would always be ascertained.

original: gdon mi za bar gang yang rung ba la rtags gang yang rung ba bzhin go bar byed par gnas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta bas na rtags nges pa kho na mngon sum du go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar gang yang rung ba la rtags gang yang rung ba bzhin go bar byed par gnas pa'i phyir ro // de lta bas na rtags nges pa kho na mngon sum du go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: This is because it is impossible for any reason to be a means of knowledge for any person.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam pa la nges pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam pa la nges pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, only a definite reason is a means of knowledge, because it produces certainty with regard to the aspect of the probandum.

original: rtags ni nye bar 'dogs pa'i sgo kho na nas go bar byed par gzhag go zhes bya bar rig ste /
analyzed: rtags ni nye bar 'dogs pa'i sgo kho na nas go bar byed par gzhag go zhes bya bar rig ste /
translated: A reason is posited as a means of knowledge only by way of its application.

original: des na rtags ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang de'i rnam par nges pa ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam pa gtan la 'bebs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid du nye bar brtags pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: des na rtags ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang de'i rnam par nges pa ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam pa gtan la 'bebs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid du nye bar brtags pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, although the reason is essenceless, the ascertainment of its aspect is the cause of the generation of the ascertainment of the aspect of the probandum, which is to be proven. Therefore, there is no fault, since it is designated as the means of understanding.

original: thams cad du rtags dngos por gyur pa kho na dgod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du rtags dngos por gyur pa kho na dgod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that in all cases only a real reason is stated.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa dgag pa la rtags nyid brtags pa kho na yin no zhes sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa dgag pa la rtags nyid brtags pa kho na yin no zhes sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has been previously explained that in the case of the refutation of space and so on, the reason itself is a mere imputation.

original: gang yang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la yang gal te 'brel pa dngos por gyur ba zhig gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par 'dod na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la yang gal te 'brel pa dngos por gyur ba zhig gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par 'dod na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin te /
translated: As for what was said about the lack of relation, if you are asserting that a relation that is a real entity is the reason, then the reason is not indeterminate.

original: dngos po la yang la lar de lta bu'i 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la yang la lar de lta bu'i 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because even in the case of real things, such a relation is not established in some cases.

original: de ni gzhan dag gis gnyis la brten pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid @220b phan tshun 'byar ba'i rgyu can nyid du nye bar brtags pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni gzhan dag gis gnyis la brten pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid @220b phan tshun 'byar ba'i rgyu can nyid du nye bar brtags pa'i phyir la /
translated: because others imagine that it is based on the duality and that it has the nature of the mutual adherence of the two.

original: grub zin pa gnyis ni ngo bo nyid phan tshun 'byar bar 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: grub zin pa gnyis ni ngo bo nyid phan tshun 'byar bar 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not tenable that the two, which are already established, have the nature of mutual adherence,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they each exist in their own nature.

original: 'byar na ni gnyi ga gcig pu nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byar na ni gnyi ga gcig pu nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If they were to adhere, they would be a unity.

original: de ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ni 'gal lo //
translated: But that is contradictory.

original: gcig pa nyid yin na ni 'di gnyis la brten par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid yin na ni 'di gnyis la brten par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were a unity, they would not be based on the two.

original: de la 'brel pa can dag las don gzhan yin na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar 'brel ba'i ngo bo nyid yin /
analyzed: de la 'brel pa can dag las don gzhan yin na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar 'brel ba'i ngo bo nyid yin /
translated: If it were different from the relata, then, because it would exist in its own nature, how could it have the nature of a relation?

original: don gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin na ni 'brel pa can tsam du zad pa'i phyir 'brel pa brtags pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin na ni 'brel pa can tsam du zad pa'i phyir 'brel pa brtags pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were not different, then, because it would be just the relata, it would be merely imagined as a relation, but it would not be a real entity.

original: 'brel pa de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid du brjod pa gang yin pa de yang brtags pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid du brjod pa gang yin pa de yang brtags pa kho na yin te /
translated: That which is said to be the characteristic arising from that relation is also just imagined,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for cause and effect to be simultaneous.

original: mi nye ba dag la ni 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi nye ba dag la ni 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that which is not proximate does not have a relation.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe 'bras bu yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe de ltos pa med pa nyid kyis gzhan la rag ma las pa kho na yin pas gang dang yang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe 'bras bu yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe de ltos pa med pa nyid kyis gzhan la rag ma las pa kho na yin pas gang dang yang 'brel pa med do //
translated: Moreover, when the effect is the nature of something already accomplished, then, because it is independent, it is not dependent on another and therefore it does not have a relation with anything.

original: de yongs su ma grub pa nyid yin na yang rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa can yin pa'i dus na mi nye ba'i phyir de dang 'brel ba med do //
analyzed: de yongs su ma grub pa nyid yin na yang rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa can yin pa'i dus na mi nye ba'i phyir de dang 'brel ba med do //
translated: And when it is not yet accomplished, it does not have a relation with its cause, because it is not proximate at the time it has a relation with its cause.

original: de lta bas na rtog pa kho nas dngos po rnams sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtog pa kho nas dngos po rnams sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, things are connected only by imagination.

original: rang gi rgyu las grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is accomplished from its own cause,

original: 'bras bur ga las med na yang //
analyzed: 'bras bur ga las med na yang //
translated: how can the effect be nonexistent?

original: grub pa gzhan rag ma las pa'ang //
analyzed: grub pa gzhan rag ma las pa'ang //
translated: And that which is accomplished is not dependent on another.

original: 'bras bu rang gi rgyu dag las //
analyzed: 'bras bu rang gi rgyu dag las //
translated: The effect is related to its cause

original: rtog pa yis ni 'brel bar byed //
analyzed: rtog pa yis ni 'brel bar byed //
translated: by the imagination.

original: 'bras min ji ltar yang ci zhig / ces kyang bshad do //
analyzed: 'bras min ji ltar yang ci zhig / ces kyang bshad do //
translated: What is not an effect is not related in any way.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang yang dag pa ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang yang dag pa ba ma yin te /
translated: The relation of identity is not real,

original: de ni gnyis la brten pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni gnyis la brten pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is based on duality.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin na yang gnyis nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin na yang gnyis nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it were identical, duality would be impossible.

original: gnyis nyid med na yang 'brel ba can dag med pa'i phyir gang zhig gang dang 'brel ba yin /
analyzed: gnyis nyid med na yang 'brel ba can dag med pa'i phyir gang zhig gang dang 'brel ba yin /
translated: And if there is no duality, there is no relation, because there is no related thing. What is related to what?

original: de lta bas na 'brel pa thams cad rtog pas bkod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la 'jug na yang nyams pa med pa nyid pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'brel pa thams cad rtog pas bkod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la 'jug na yang nyams pa med pa nyid pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, since all relations are of the nature of imagination, there is no fault in applying the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù to things. Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'brel ba med pa kho na yin na ni ji ltar tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs gzhan smos par byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'brel ba med pa kho na yin na ni ji ltar tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs gzhan smos par byed /
translated: Moreover, if there is no relation at all, how can you state another reason, ‚Äúbecause there is no difference‚Äù?

original: tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na ni de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa @221a * //üîΩkho na bstan par gyur to //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na ni de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa @221a * // kho na bstan par gyur to //
translated: If there is no difference, then the relation of identity is taught.

original: gal te dngos po kho na la de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po kho na la de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the relation of identity is only of things and not of others,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni tha dad pa med pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni tha dad pa med pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because identity is a synonym for non-difference,

original: de ni ngo bo nyid med pa dag kyang bdag med pa nyid du mtshungs pas 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid med pa dag kyang bdag med pa nyid du mtshungs pas 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: and since those without intrinsic reality are the same in being selfless, there is no contradiction at all.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be correct to say ‚Äúbecause there is no difference.‚Äù

original: de la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di gal te don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod na ni de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di gal te don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod na ni de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If this reason ‚Äúbecause there is no difference‚Äù is stated from the ultimate point of view, then it is indeterminate.

original: byas pa dang mi rtag pa lta bu don dam par tha dad pa med pa yin yang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa dang mi rtag pa lta bu don dam par tha dad pa med pa yin yang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, although being produced and being impermanent are not ultimately different, one sees that they are the things that are the object of understanding and the means of understanding.

original: 'on te tha snyad du yang 'di la tha dad pa med do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni de ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'on te tha snyad du yang 'di la tha dad pa med do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni de ma grub ste /
translated: But if you assert that they are not different even conventionally, that is not established,

original: ldog pa'i bye brag gis nye bar brtags pa'i tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i bye brag gis nye bar brtags pa'i tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference that is imputed by the distinction of the opposite is existent.

original: 'di ltar sgra la sogs pa'i chos can byas pa ma yin pa la sogs pa las log pa nyid du nges pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra la sogs pa'i chos can byas pa ma yin pa la sogs pa las log pa nyid du nges pa na /
translated: In this way, when the subject, sound, is ascertained as the opposite of nonproduced and so on,

original: rtag pa la sogs pa las log par nges par 'gyur bas yang dag par tha dad pa med kyang ldog pa'i bye brag la ltos nas byas pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag tha dad par rnam par gzhag par nye bar brtags te go bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa las log par nges par 'gyur bas yang dag par tha dad pa med kyang ldog pa'i bye brag la ltos nas byas pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag tha dad par rnam par gzhag par nye bar brtags te go bar bya ba dang /
translated: it is ascertained as the opposite of permanent and so on. Therefore, although they are not actually different, produced and impermanent are imputed to be different in dependence on the distinction of the opposite.

original: go bar byed pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The things that are the object of understanding and the means of understanding are posited.

original: de bzhin du dngos po rnams yang dag par na gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin las ldog pa na don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid las kyang ldog par nges pas de'i phyir ldog pa'i bye brag la ltos pas byas pa'i
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po rnams yang dag par na gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin las ldog pa na don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid las kyang ldog par nges pas de'i phyir ldog pa'i bye brag la ltos pas byas pa'i
translated: So too, when things are refuted as essentially either one or many, they are definitely refuted as having an ultimate nature. Therefore, because of the difference in the negation,

original: tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang / go bar byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang / go bar byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: there is a difference in the negated objects, and so the objects of negation and the negating cognition are different.üîΩJust as a permanent thing is established as being essentially different from a functional thing because it is different from it in being unable to perform a function, so it is in other cases.

original: yang ji ltar dngos po rtag pa don byed pa'i nus pa las log pa nyid kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las log pa nyid du sgrub pa ltar gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bas 'gal ba med pa nyid do //üîΩgang yang gal te 'di gnyis kyis tha dad pa ldog pa'i bye brag gis byas pa zhig yin na de'i tshe dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang ji ltar dngos po rtag pa don byed pa'i nus pa las log pa nyid kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las log pa nyid du sgrub pa ltar gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bas 'gal ba med pa nyid do //üîΩgang yang gal te 'di gnyis kyis tha dad pa ldog pa'i bye brag gis byas pa zhig yin na de'i tshe dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: And just as a permanent thing is established as being essentially different from a functional thing because it is different from it in being unable to perform a function, so it is in other cases.üîΩAnd just as a permanent thing is established as being essentially different from a functional thing because it is different from it in being unable to perform a function, so it is in other original: sngon po dang ser po'i bdag nyid lta bu'o zhes smras pa de yang 'brel pa med de /üîΩbyas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po'i bdag nyid lta bu'o zhes smras pa de yang 'brel pa med de / byas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example of the nature of blue and yellow is also irrelevant,üîΩbecause it is not ascertained by being produced and impermanent, etc.

original: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag @221b gis tha dad pa ldog pas byas zhes te /
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag @221b gis tha dad pa ldog pas byas zhes te /
translated: By the distinction of being produced and impermanent, etc.,

original: 'di tsam gyis de gnyis dngos por ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis de gnyis dngos por ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not an entity by just that much.

original: ji ltar rtag pa'i dngos po dag la don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ldog pas byas pa'i bye brag yod kyang dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba ltar gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa'i dngos po dag la don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ldog pas byas pa'i bye brag yod kyang dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba ltar gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Just as entities that are permanent are devoid of the capacity to perform a function and are distinguished by the absence of intrinsic reality, although they exist, they are not entities. It is the same for the other. This is mere sophistry.

original: gang yang sngon po dang ser po'i bdag nyid dag lta bu'o zhes dpe de nyid du smras pa de yang don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang sngon po dang ser po'i bdag nyid dag lta bu'o zhes dpe de nyid du smras pa de yang don dam pa pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Also, the example of the nature of blue and yellow is not logical, because it is not established as the nature of an entity in the ultimate.

original: gang yang ma yin pa'i phyogs la nyes pa smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang yang ma yin pa'i phyogs la nyes pa smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: The fault that you ascribe to the position that is not anything is not correct.

original: ma yin pa'i tshul du brjod ces te /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i tshul du brjod ces te /
translated: It is said that it is not the mode of being.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni 'ga' yang gang du yang don dam pa pa'i dngos po nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni 'ga' yang gang du yang don dam pa pa'i dngos po nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: By this much, nothing at all is established as an ultimate entity anywhere.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa brtags pa lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod kyang dngos po med pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa brtags pa lus can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod kyang dngos po med pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Although space and so on are described by the words ‚Äúnonembodiment‚Äù and so on, it is not correct because they are not entities.

original: de la blo la yod pa'i chos can sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de yang ma yin pa'i tshul gyis de skad du brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: de la blo la yod pa'i chos can sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de yang ma yin pa'i tshul gyis de skad du brjod mod kyi /
translated: The phenomena that exist in the mind, which were explained previously, are also said in that way, as not being the mode of being.

original: 'on kyang 'di yang dag pa pa'i dngos po nyid du rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di yang dag pa pa'i dngos po nyid du rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: However, they are not correct as real entities.

original: dngos po yod par smra ba rnams la yang gang gis na grub pa sgrub pa nyid du 'gyur ba gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i dngos po yang dag pa de ni cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: dngos po yod par smra ba rnams la yang gang gis na grub pa sgrub pa nyid du 'gyur ba gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i dngos po yang dag pa de ni cung zad kyang med de /
translated: For those who advocate the existence of things, there is not the slightest existent thing that is devoid of the nature of one and many, by virtue of which the reason would be merely the establishment of what is already established.

original: de ni rtog pa'i yul yang ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gcig dang du ma dag gis kyang rang bzhin thams cad la khyab par sngar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtog pa'i yul yang ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gcig dang du ma dag gis kyang rang bzhin thams cad la khyab par sngar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not even the domain of thought, and because it has been proven earlier that one and many are all-pervasive with respect to nature.

original: don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa sgyu ma la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa de lta bu la yang dngos po zhes ming du 'dogs na ni cung zad kyang gnod pa med de /
analyzed: don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa sgyu ma la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa de lta bu la yang dngos po zhes ming du 'dogs na ni cung zad kyang gnod pa med de /
translated: If one designates as ‚Äúthings‚Äù those that are ultimately without entityness and are not different from illusions and so on, then there is not the slightest problem.

original: khyed gnyis la khas blangs pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i sgo nas gnod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: khyed gnyis la khas blangs pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i sgo nas gnod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: For you two, there is only the problem of the defeat of your own positions.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because reflections and so on exist in the concordant class.

original: / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i dngos po ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin don dam pa par rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i dngos po ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin don dam pa par rung ba ma yin te /
translated: A thing such as a reflection is not suitable as an ultimate nature that is either one or many.

original: de yang yang dag par na shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bo nyid du yang dag par ma grub bo zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yang yang dag par na shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bo nyid du yang dag par ma grub bo zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Moreover, it has already been demonstrated that in reality it is not established as the nature of consciousness and the object of consciousness.

original: 'di ltar gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid @222a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid @222a * //
translated: Thus, the reason that has the characteristic of being free from the nature of being one or manyüîΩis established as being selfless. Since the subject, the nonexistent thing, is similar to that, the reason is contradictory because it establishes the opposite of the subject.

original: kyi gtan tshigs bdag med par bsgrubs pa ltar chos can dngos po med pa yang de dang 'dra bas chos can las bzlog pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni gcig tu tshad mas mngon par mi shes paüîΩnyid 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: kyi gtan tshigs bdag med par bsgrubs pa ltar chos can dngos po med pa yang de dang 'dra bas chos can las bzlog pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni gcig tu tshad mas mngon par mi shes paüîΩnyid 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: Whatever is said is simply not understood by valid knowledge at all.

original: gal te chos can dngos po'i ngo bor bsgrub par 'dod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe de las ldog pa sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te chos can dngos po'i ngo bor bsgrub par 'dod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe de las ldog pa sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If you were to assert that the logical subject is established as the entity of an existent thing, then at that time, because it would be established as the opposite of that, the reason would be contradictory.

original: gang gi tshe de ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pa la sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar rgol ba'i 'dod pa grub kyang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pa la sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar rgol ba'i 'dod pa grub kyang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur /
translated: But when you establish that it is essenceless, then at that time, how could the reason be contradictory, even though the opponent‚Äôs thesis is established?

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid du sgrub pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo chos can nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid du sgrub pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo chos can nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the proof of essencelessness, the entity of an existent thing would not be the logical subject,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: because it is not similar to it. This has been explained earlier.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pas ji skad bshad pa la chos can dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa kho nar 'dod pa'i phyir 'di ltar gtan tshigs de las bzlog pa bsgrub pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pas ji skad bshad pa la chos can dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa kho nar 'dod pa'i phyir 'di ltar gtan tshigs de las bzlog pa bsgrub pa nyid yin /
translated: Therefore, because the probandum and the proof are as they have been explained, the logical subject is not an existent thing. Therefore, in this way, the reason is the opposite of what is to be proven.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub pa la ni de las bzlog pa sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub pa la ni de las bzlog pa sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to establish the entityness of things, the opposite of that is established.

original: 'di'i ji ltar gtan tshigs 'di bdag med pa sgrub par byed pa ltar chos can dngos po med pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes brjod pa 'di yang 'brel pa med pa yin te /üîΩbdag med pa dang dngos po med pa dag la ni gang gis ni chos gnyis grub par brjod pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du brjod par 'gyur pa ldog pas kyang phan tshun tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i ji ltar gtan tshigs 'di bdag med pa sgrub par byed pa ltar chos can dngos po med pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes brjod pa 'di yang 'brel pa med pa yin te / bdag med pa dang dngos po med pa dag la ni gang gis ni chos gnyis grub par brjod pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du brjod par 'gyur pa ldog pas kyang phan tshun tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the statement ‚ÄúJust as this reason proves selflessness, so too it proves the subject, the non-entity‚Äù is also incoherent.üîΩBecause selflessness and non-entityness are synonyms, the reason cannot be said to be contradictory, since it is said to establish two properties.

original: de gnyis ni rnam grangs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni rnam grangs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor are they mutually different, since they are synonyms.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar bdag med pa sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du bdag med pa sgrub par byed do zhes smras par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar bdag med pa sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du bdag med pa sgrub par byed do zhes smras par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore it would be as if you said, ‚ÄúJust as selflessness is established, so too selflessness is established.‚Äù

original: mngon par brjod pa la mkhas pa de lta bu lta su zhig la yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa la mkhas pa de lta bu lta su zhig la yod par 'gyur /
translated: Who could be more skilled in rhetoric than you?

original: de lta bas na chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are established as only ultimately natureless.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bka' stsal te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bka' stsal te /
translated: The Lord himself has stated this reason:

original: dper na me long ngos la ni //
analyzed: dper na me long ngos la ni //
translated: For example, in the surface of a mirror,

original: gcig dang gzhan nyid spangs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: gcig dang gzhan nyid spangs pa'i gzugs //
translated: A form is seen that is devoid of being one or different.

original: snang yang de na yod min ltar //
analyzed: snang yang de na yod min ltar //
translated: Although it appears, it does not exist there.

original: dngos la ngo bo nyid de bzhin //
analyzed: dngos la ngo bo nyid de bzhin //
translated: So too is the nature of things.

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is what he explained.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin med par bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs cung zad kyang med do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang lan btab @222b pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin med par bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs cung zad kyang med do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang lan btab @222b pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, we have also answered the objection that ‚Äúthere is not the slightest reason to prove intrinsic realitylessness.‚Äù

original: gang yang gal te rnam par shes pa yang chos gzhan bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa yin na de'i tshe de yang brdzun pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de las gzhan pa'i chos bzhin du spong bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang gal te rnam par shes pa yang chos gzhan bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa yin na de'i tshe de yang brdzun pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de las gzhan pa'i chos bzhin du spong bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if consciousness, like other phenomena, is natureless, then because it is false, yogins and yoginƒ´s would reject it, just as they do other phenomena.

original: de byed na ni rnal 'byor ba yang med /
analyzed: de byed na ni rnal 'byor ba yang med /
translated: If that were so, there would be no yogi,

original: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang med ;
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang med ;
translated: there would be no consciousness of the yogi,

original: des de kho na nyid rtogs pa'ang med /
analyzed: des de kho na nyid rtogs pa'ang med /
translated: there would be no realization of thatness,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang med /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang med /
translated: there would be no nonabiding nirvana of the Bhagavan Buddhas,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang med de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang med de /
translated: and there would be no gnosis of omniscience.

original: de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa thams cad zhig par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa thams cad zhig par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it would be the destruction of all presentations.

original: gal te thal ba 'di de las bden par mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i sgo nas spong ba yin par brjod pa yin na ni dga' dgur brjod la rag go //
analyzed: gal te thal ba 'di de las bden par mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i sgo nas spong ba yin par brjod pa yin na ni dga' dgur brjod la rag go //
translated: If you say that this reductio is stated in order to refute the belief that things truly exist, then you can say whatever you like.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir thal ba ni ma yin pa nyid de /üîΩde'i mtshan nyid ni mi 'dod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir thal ba ni ma yin pa nyid de /üîΩde'i mtshan nyid ni mi 'dod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not a reductio, because you accept the premise.üîΩThe definition of a reductio is that it is a form of argument that the opponent accepts but not the proponent.

original: 'on te thal ba rnam pa thams cad du yongs su 'dor ba yin par brjod na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te thal ba rnam pa thams cad du yongs su 'dor ba yin par brjod na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if you say that you completely reject the Svatantrika, then your reason is not established,

original: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid cognition that contradicts the probandum.

original: brdzun zhes te de rnam pa thams cad du spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yang med de /
analyzed: brdzun zhes te de rnam pa thams cad du spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yang med de /
translated: There is no reason at all for saying that you should completely reject the Svatantrika, calling it false.

original: sgyu ma brdzun pa nyid yin yang dgos pa'i dbang gis sgyu ma mkhan rnams bzhin du brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma brdzun pa nyid yin yang dgos pa'i dbang gis sgyu ma mkhan rnams bzhin du brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though a magician‚Äôs illusions are false, the magician uses them for a purpose, and so you should do likewise.üîΩThose who never apply themselves to the welfare of themselves or others should be rejected by yogis in every way.

original: brdzun pa gang dag nam yang rang dang gzhan gyi don du nye bar sbyor bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thams cad du yongs su dor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi spang bar brjod do zhes bya bar rigs kyi /üîΩgang dag mngon sum mam /
analyzed: brdzun pa gang dag nam yang rang dang gzhan gyi don du nye bar sbyor bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thams cad du yongs su dor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi spang bar brjod do zhes bya bar rigs kyi /üîΩgang dag mngon sum mam /
translated: But those who do apply themselves to the welfare of others should be accepted.

original: brgyud pas rang dang gzhan la dgos pa'i yon tan can de dag snying brtse ba chen po can gzhan la phan pa bskyed pa'i thabs thob pa rnams kyis ji ltar dus thams cad du yongs su spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: brgyud pas rang dang gzhan la dgos pa'i yon tan can de dag snying brtse ba chen po can gzhan la phan pa bskyed pa'i thabs thob pa rnams kyis ji ltar dus thams cad du yongs su spong bar 'gyur /
translated: How could those who have great compassion and have attained the means of generating benefit for others ever completely abandon those qualities that are necessary for themselves and others?

original: de lta bas na zhing yongs su dag pa dang gzugs kyi sku sprul pa la sogs pa gang cung zad gzhan la dgos pa nyid du 'gyur ba de thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis phyin ci log spangs pa'i sgo nas spangs kyang 'khor ba ji srid
analyzed: de lta bas na zhing yongs su dag pa dang gzugs kyi sku sprul pa la sogs pa gang cung zad gzhan la dgos pa nyid du 'gyur ba de thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis phyin ci log spangs pa'i sgo nas spangs kyang 'khor ba ji srid
translated: Thus, the Buddhas, having abandoned all errors, do not abandon anything that is necessary for others, such as the pure land and the emanation body, etc.

original: par mi ldog pa nyid de /
analyzed: par mi ldog pa nyid de /
translated: They do not abandon them for as long as sa·πÉsƒÅra lasts.

original: de dag gis sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad brdzun pa nyid du thugs su chud kyang /üîΩgzhan la phan @223a * //
analyzed: de dag gis sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad brdzun pa nyid du thugs su chud kyang / gzhan la phan @223a * //
translated: They know that everything is false, like an illusion,

original: pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi 'dor ro //
translated: but they do not abandon it because it is the means of benefiting others.

original: 'di dag la phyin ci log la chags pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'di dag la phyin ci log la chags pa yang med de /
translated: They are not attached to error,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have realized the truth just as it is.

original: de skad du 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
translated: In the noble S≈´tra of the Pile of Jewels it says,

original: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po 'ga' //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po 'ga' //
translated: For example, some magician

original: sgyu ma thar par bya phyir brtson //
analyzed: sgyu ma thar par bya phyir brtson //
translated: strives to liberate an illusory person.

original: gang phyir dpe 'di sngon shes pas //
analyzed: gang phyir dpe 'di sngon shes pas //
translated: Because he knows this example beforehand,
